reviews.review: Great place for shoping with unique design. Terminal 21 on Sukhumvit 19 in BKK is a great new place to shop and eat. I liked it's unique interior design that is like an airport terminal. On each level a famous city is represented with it's landjatks and special style. Paris, London, LA, Tokyo, Istanbul and more make a nice change to the same styled BKK shoping malls and travel around the world. Very easy to reach by Sky Train and MTR ASOKE Station. Nice range of cloths and fashion shops (international and local brands), nearly everything can be bought there + great eateries on each floor in a unique great decor.It's my favorite shoping mall in BKK!

Great mid range shopping. This is a well thought out shopping centre with a mix of medium and upper medium quality products. The sky train stops at the centre so it is easily accessible.There is also a good range of restaurants and cafes to round off the visit.

Original mall, good for shopping, eating and cinema. I had planned to have a look at Siam Paragon, but for lack of time, I went to Terminal 21, since I was nearby. Yes, it's an interesting mall, with its own character, with one different theme per floor. Paris, London, San Francisco, Hollywood ...I'm sure it's a gem for girls. There are a lot of eating options, including a branch of Michelin-starred Tim Ho Wan (a dim sum restaurant in Hong Kong where it's almost impossible to find a table ...). I had dinner at Piri Piri chicken, which was good enough before a movie at the cinema on top floor, very comfortable btw.Pleasantly surprised by the visit of this mall.

Shopping . I didn't really come to Thailand for shopping found this place by accident but this place is a Very impressive shopping centre it has 10 floors each floor has a a different theme London, Rome, Istanbul it's made to be like your in an airport terminal . It has a variety of shops including food stalls and a supermarket !
interesting mall. interesting mall with different countries decoration can be found, and convenience beside of BTS and MRT station.

Perfect place. The place was nicely built. Great theme. But...not really a place for shopping. I can't believe I didn't buy anything here. Trust me when I said the things are overpriced especially clothing. I came here for food hunt only.

Perfect place to shop!!. The place is nicely built with the floors named after cities. London, Rome, Paris, Carribean and so on. Shops are neatly laid out and you will be led easily to the anchor shops on each floor. Overall, a very nice place to shop for brands as well as local stuff. Price will be on the higher side.

Entertaining Cavern of Mysteries. In Short, what I was looking for was a computer/tech shop that was trust worthy near my hotel. i was recommended Terminal 21. Turns out they have heaps of market stall type clothes shops, fabulous restaurant range (predominately chains, but not the American ones) and some fashion areas. Tech shop was wedged on top floor behind cinema and was tiny and useless for what I wanted. All that said, it was a cool place to walk around and get easily lost in. The lifts do not go to every floor, making it entertaining and if you are not careful and get on the wrong escalator, you will end up 2 floors below/above your targeted floor... Otherwise a fun and friendly, and well lit, clean hopping mall. Also (from the outside) what looked like a very nice cinema!
Good choice. Among the many malls located next to each other this is a good choice. Great options to shop from and nice places to eat.

Loved it. Wow what an amazing place, each floor is themed with different cities around the world.The shops are pretty unique with a lot of handcrafted things all at reasonable prices.We loved wandering round, drinking coffee and eating:)Took us 2 days to fully explore, it's a must if visiting Bangkok.

cool layout. this is a great place to visit, set up like an airport terminal, which each level a different city theme. lots of great food/restaurants and shopping, and usually some type of themed vendor event on the main entrance level. conveniently located at the Asok BTS stop.

You must visit this Shopping centre. Terminal 21 sounds like a wharf where ships are, it is actually a very upmarket shopping centre, even if you have spent all your money and shopped out this shopping centre is a place you need to go and see while you are in Bangkok and take your time looking around, as every floor is in a different style, one floor has a Japanese appearance, another is like Istanbul, and another like San Francisco, and yet another is in the London style, there are so many different themes in the shopping centre from the lower ground floor all the way to the top, you should also read the signs as they are different.The lower ground floor has a very good food court as well as many shops and a lighthouse,on the next level you will find coffee shops. When they have a sale the prices are very good and worth looking around as my partner has bought some lovely brand name cloths and shoes as all are original no copies in Terminal 21.It is very easy to get to Terminal 21, if you are using the BTS Sky train then go to Asok and walk straight into the centre from the station, if you are using the MRT then go to Sukhumvit station and as you come up on the escalator you will see Terminal 21 on your right hand side and you can walk straight in.You should go to each floor as you will find something different there to take photos of and do some shopping, you will need to allow yourself plenty of time to walk around if you wish to see everything.

Terminal 21 - worldwide shopping. Terminal 21 was easy to locate and the mall is vast but clothing prices are over-rated. A good place to also see independent designs being sold. You must take a picture of the statues of the Sumo wrestlers and the Geisha oh, and the samurai warrior... fantastic. The mall is on different levels (each labelled different cities - Rome, Paris etc...)
Awesome Shopping!. Had a great day shopping here, the food court Peir 21 is amazing and super cheap although very very busy.

Everything under one roof . If you are on a quick stopover in Bangkok and your hotel is near by, Terminal 21 has it all. Let's Relax spa upstairs, one of the favs, they treat you to mango sticky rice after a massage.There's a good range of shops that's also has stalls at the Chatuchak market, useful if you are not around BKK on a weekend or it's raining. There's also a good range of restaurant and a food court. All of this next to the Asoke BTS.

Santa Fe Steak House. Had the dinner special at the Santa Fe Steakhouse which is in the basement at Terminal 21. Best chicken breast with fries and salad ever and only 70 Bht. That's about A$3.00 This place is nearly always packed because it's so cheap and good.

Must go in BKK!. My hotel is nearby so I decided to go there & shop. I must say the quality of the clothing here are so much better than other places in BKK and so are the price, clothing are mostly updated trend. Tons of shops here, can spend a couple of hours here. The good news is you can try the clothes here. Will definitely visit again.
One of the best in BKK. PES / FIFA lover ? Go straight to the highest level . PS &a XBOX available for public . 20baht for 20mins . Worth it !

Very odd indeed. Every floor has a theme which kind of doesn't quite work but it is a brave attempt at stereotyping and the uniforms worn by the doormen are very Halloween 1980's but all adds to the charm. No big chainstores here, small boutiques on each floor which adds to the charm with the odd landmark reproduced in resin to take a Theme park-ish selfie with, The Golden Gate bridge replica spans the top floor - look up :)
Modern. Innovative and supermodern with a touch of retro style. Super Big Place with everything to do, see, curiosities and shopping. Just few meters from Bts or Mrt.station.

Nice Mall with wide choice of shops and eateries. Located at Sukhumvit, this large modern mall has wide choice of brand shops and other shops. The theme of the shop is Airport Terminal and each floor is named after major cities, like Tokyo etc. The main display at the gate is designed like a airport display board and shops replacing flight information. The food court and restaurant offers choice of international as well as local cuisine. Loved the place.
Cheap Food in Bangkok. I am really surprise with the price of the food at this place!!!! and in my opinion they have the best pad thai ever.

Basically a mall with cool concept. innovative and cool to make this mall into a "terminal" even the security are dress as captain, so adorable. Each level is a different city, and it's quite interactive, like the london's phone booth etc. Aside the design, it's basically the same as other Malls with similar shops and restaurants.

Quirky Fun Mall with themed Floors... worth a visit. Located right off the Asok BTS station, its easy to get to. the floors are themed with country themes including the toilets. so its fun to look around and do your shopping. good diversity on the types of shops and good food options too. don't forget to check out the bridge .. its pretty cool

Cheapest Food Court. The first thing which struck me was the price of the food sold at the food court (Pier 21) located on the 5th floor. A plate of rice or noodles cost an average of just 300 baht to 400 baht! It was understandable why the food court was packed and finding a table during dinner was a challenge. The attraction of this mall was the different themed floors and toilets, Paris, Japan, London and etc. The mall is easily accessible via BTS.

Mall with quality heavy discounted food court!. If im close by and hungry I always stop of at BTS Aso & walk accross to Terminal 21.Worth the several floors of esculators to get to the top & there food court.Where can you get a good quality food for 35 baht & a good sized mango shake for under 40 baht? Great quality and prices!!

Nice place to visit once. As malls go...its an interesting combination of good brands and regular stuff. Restaurants are ok and have variety of cuisine to offer...the concept it simply amazing and fun...a one time must in bangkok

Probably the best food court in Bangkok; significantly cheaper than anywhere else with good taste, and varieties. The mall itself is located very ideally; linked to BTS and MRT. Not hard for parking if drive there as well. The mall design is pretty unique with the theme of an airport terminal, and different cities on every floor such as Istanbul and London with its fitting decoration.But my favorite is the food court. You can find the tasty 'Phad Thai' and 'Hoy Thod', fruit juices here at a fraction lower than even the street hawkers. Shopping wise, it has those small labels and some big names such as H&M for a decent shopping experience. If it is not enough, you can always hop on the BTS to the other malls along the BTS stations.
A mix of luxury and budget shopping. They have a city theme for each floor and even the washrooms are based on the theme. Excellent selection in terms of shopping.

Mall with varieties! Love it. The mall is connected to BTS Asoke. As name suggested, it is around the theme of an airport terminal, each floor is a city. There are varieties of shops and there are eating places and gourmet market at the basement. There is a cinema and more restaurants on 5th floor and foodcourt as well. Definitely a place not to be missed if you are shopping.

Regular Visit in Bangkok. Living just beside Robinson shopping mall it was very close and convenient to visit. Loved the internal architecture. Mentioning the departure and arrival of different countries and establishing such atmosphere made it absolutely unique.

Frequent visits. We seem to come back to this place every time we visit Bangkok. It opens at 10am so don't go before as you'll be standing out in the heat.
The place is clean and every floor has really nice themed toilets.
The food hall on 5th floor Pier 21 has a great range and really cheap.
Shoppers paradise . Each floor is designed as per a part of the world like Istanbul or Tokyo. Lots of options to look into. The art work is amazing.

One of the best malls in Bangkok. This mall has themes featuring 6 of the world's big cities. Unique mall, with foreign tourists in mind. The mall itself is not huge. It seemed to be very popular with locals, especially teenagers. The Asok BTS is just right by its doorstep.

Nice shopping mall. Shopping mall follows an airport theme. Different levels is a destination / country. Quite interesting. Good for just looking around and window shopping. Prices can vary. Some are complete rip off! One store sold a Traditional Thai Milk Candy for 50 Baht, when the packaging on the Milk Candy clearly states 15 baht only! A lot of tourists and locals go to this mall.

Just okay. Honestly, I thought I'd be mesmerized by this attraction and it was just a mall with stores. Theres a large food court and it's close to BTS. However, it was just okay. In order to buy something at a reasonable price, I had to really do some searching and that was exhausting. If you like to be in a shopping mall all day, then this is the place for you. If you're like me and you set a goal on what to buy and want to get in and get out, don't go here. Walk by. Take a picture. Keep it moving.

Not great if your looking for western brands. I was hoping in a huge shopping center there would somewhere I could buy the sorts of clothes I would buy at home. Diesel, G star, Fred a perry etc All they had was H&M. That and literally hundreds of independent shops selling tshirts with things printed on. I mean, the place is absolutely massive. But so many shops seem to sell a slight variation on the same thing. Funny tshirts. Hipster tshirts. Star Wars tshirts. Tea tshirts. Tshirts. The food hall takes up two floors and is pretty good. It's also just nice to get out the Bangkok heat and wonder around in air con. Oh, and on the London floor they have got the color of the tube lines wrong. Unforgivable.

Different countries theme at every levels. Conveniently located beside Asok BTS Station. Each floor has a different countries themes like London, San Francisco, Paris, Japan etc. Great for photo-taking at different levels.They do have a cinema & good restaurants too. A must visit mall when you are in Bangkok.

Just another shopping mall despite the hype. We thought we would visit here as we had heard about each level being associated with a different place on the globe, so thought it would be something different. In fact it's just another shopping centre but with twee decor. Good selection of restaurants but quite steep in price. Much better shopping elsewhere in Bangkok.
A different city on every floor. A great many different styles of food to choose from as each floor is modelled on a different city from around the world
Good stalls at reasonable price. I'm not in to shopping but I always enjoy Terminal 21. Each floor is loosely based on different countries. Very good for individual unique items.

Good for shopping. Each floor has a different theme. So you need to take time and visit each floor. They have good restaurants as well.
It's a bit expensive compared to other places but some shops have good offers. A must visit mall

A shopping centre with a twist!. We spent a full morning at Terminal 21 on our last day in Thailand. The shopping centre is themed on an airport and so every floor focus' on a different country. There is something for everyone in this mall, with many Western brands and also Asian options to chose from. The mall also has a huge variety of food options so there is something for everyone here.

Different concept. Nice mall,different kind of concept, varieties of shops like market street concept. Different level/floor base on different countries,also connected to a hotel and sky train,so easy to access around. Something different,reccomended!
Best theme mall. Terminal 21 is a must when you come to Bangkok. Take pictures in the mall toilets. It really wonderfull.

Great if you have time to kill.... You could easily spend all day looking around this shopping centre. Each floor is a theme and has a wide range of shops and boutiques for everybody. The shopping centre is spotlessly clean.Found the shops to be quite expensive and we it took us a while to get a taxi back to our hotel.

Bangkok's Main Shopping Centre. Terminal 21 is an average shopping mall. It has some major chains however most shops are just selling stuff you can buy on the street. They had market stalls on the ground level when I visited which was quite good. It is worth popping in if passing by but you are not missing much if you don't have time to visit. This is just round the corner from Soi Cowboy so you could visit both at the same time.

Massive shopping mall. Not much to say other than you could easily waste a day here. Amazing views from the bars and restaurants on the higher floors and loads of shops if you fancy spending some cash
Kinda cozy. Imo better than siam paragon.terminal 21 is not just an another mall.i found lots of interesting souvenirs for my loved ones.Nice restaurants as well.

Travel to London and US in the mall!. Beautiful mall with cute themes... Things aren't cheap in this mall tho... Lots of food selection here if you're afraid of street food.Asok station at the mall you won't miss it!

Absolutely fascinating. Once again you enjoy a fine shopping place and wonderful restaurants. If you do not like to spend that much money go to the food court at 5th floor and enjoy fresh mangoes with sticky rice for very little money. The freshly squeezed and very healthy drinks are inexpensive and taste of course great. Bangkok is the shopping destination number one there is no doubt anymore.

Excellent Place to be..... Excellent Place.... Each floor is designed with a specific country theme... GOod place for shopping and just beside Asok BTS makes it very easily accessible. I recommend this place.
Cool themes on different levels. Liked how each level had a different theme, and even the toilets followed the theme on the particular level!The Golden Gate at top floor looked really good also!

Nice looking & classy shopping mall. Overall is great. Things are a lil bit pricey but it's a higher class shopping mall, so it's still reasonable. The food court on the top floor is ridiculous. Counter to retrieve or to get the food purchase card is crowded and packed. Although they seems to have many choices of foods, not recommend if you're in hurry.

Great shopping for family. The mall is convenient located at Asok bts / Sukhumvit mrt. The size of the mall is decent (big enough) and it have something to cater for all ages. The clothing sold here are more unique comparison to those found at Street market or platinum mall. Pricing is reasonable too. Some shops allow bargaining too. Besides shopping, there are many food options available too. There are food court, restaurant at upper floors and quick dining stalls on the lower floor.

Great Mall!. This is a great mall, full of shops, a cinema and a foodcourt.It's a very popular mall with locals and tourists.Every floor is designed as a country, so you can see England, Turkey and so on.Very nice to be here, great shops and food!

Cool concept, cool stores, cool vibe. All storeys were named and designed after big fashion cities (and San Francisco), mainly because of the styles of the tiny stores on each one. Both global brand stores and the "same same but different" stores, so you could probably find what you are after. As it's just next to the BTS it's not even a proper walk away, so definitely worth dropping by.

A must for shoppers to buy designer/ quality goods. The best way to get to this shopping mall is via the skytrain and get off at Asok station. The mall has a Italian theme more like the Venetian casino in Las Vegas, most of the international brands have outlets in the mall and the prices are reasonable in fact I bought a shirt from H&M which was cheaper than the outlet in Madrid and the selections were also good. There was a on line market where I bought a designer watch for 2000 Bhat. Some of the British brands were on specials with around 50% off. The place is absolutely spotless including the toilets and there is a food court and a supermarket at the ground floor and if you go to the supermarket don't forget to try out the various freshly squeezed fruit juices and finally there's are places to sit until your better half finishes her shopping.

Great shopping mall and even better food court . Always enjoy visiting Terminal 21 shopping mall because they have wide range of shops which allows all shoppers to make a purchase. I also like the unusual layout of the mall. It also has a great and very cheap food court which is also very popular with the locals

Interesting airport and destination themed shopping mall. In a city full of shopping mall, this mall stands out for having a niche theme of airport and international theme. The escalators to each floors have the arch like at the airports showing the next floor theme such as London, Tokyo, Paris, Rome etc.On each themed floor, they have unique decorations identifying with the theme such as sumo wrestlers on Tokyo floor and a replica double decker bus for London floor.At the top floor, they even have the Golden Gate Bridge spanning across the entire mall. There are numerous restaurants and food outlets the top floor.Lastly, don't forget to visit their toilets on each floor as they have created the toilets in line with the theme and they are very special.

Interesting Themed hotel with a Very Good Food Court. Terminal 21 is very centrally located near a BTS station. Interesting airport themed mall, with different themes on different levels. Highlight as many other have pointed out, is an outstanding food court, with very reasonably priced food in an airconditioned environment, prices are much cheaper than at open air cafes outside the mall. Prices of shops in the malls may not be much cheaper than at other places, so good to compare prices before purchase.

Shopping malls with nice theme decoration . We had spent s while in this mall. It has some international brand shops and some local shops. Each floor they set a country as theme with corresponding decoration. Price wise is not particularly cheap but what attracting us most is the little booth selling hand made little accessories . There also plenty of restaurants inside the malls.

Good place for a bite or (expensive) shopping. It's an alright place, nothing special. Good choice of restaurants and coffee shops, but nothing remarkable. Shopping is ok with many recognizable western brands. There are more interesting places to visit in Bangkok & Sukhumvit area.

Nice shopping mall with lots of shops. This shopping mall was really very good. I would not say this is very big, but you can find your all necessary things over here. Moreover you can also find luxurious items easily. The floors are named after the cities around the world. I loved the London floor. The prices of the clothes and shoes are moderate. The food court qas awesome. I loved the TNT Bombing Squid. Thier squid fries were too much delicious.
Interesting concept but poor range of shops. This place has a great position, is well designed but is let down by a very poor range of shops and associated products

nice place. The shopping mall in next to Asoke BTS station, there are so many restaurants for you to choose from. The thing that I like most about this place is there is one very long escalator and it was really cool!

Lovely food court. The food court offers the best variety. Cheaper than MBK and tastier. The design of this mall is very cool. They offer non branded items for the most part so don't come here if you want brand names. There's another area to eat downstairs too and they sell mini eclairs that are so cute. Oh and they have Daiso. Not 100¥ but 60Baht so like double the price.
Food Gallery. If you are looking for food at a reasonable price look no further than pier 21. A lot of choices and very easy to locate
Nice place and good food court. Decorate so great !!! I love the ideaGood place to take photoFashion brands just look like another mall Food court also good and cheap. I really like it .

Worth a visit, special mall in bangkok. It features different city from the world on each floors. It really makes a different with your shopping experience.Food court was nice, also with 2 floors of restaurant with plenty of selections.Shops are in reasonable price not really high branding stuff. Suggested mall to visit.

One of the best malls ive been to!. This shopping mall is not just for locals but for tourists as well! Their concept is very interesting and unique. You cant help but take pictures every where you go.

If you are hungry and less money eat here!!!. 5 floor this restaurant on sukhumvit Terminal 21 have many Thai food you can eat here for less money than elsewhere the people are passionate about the food .and it is fresh and taste well

The Mall of Malls. In the land of malls, this would be worth a visit. Bangkok has a mall on every corner it seems. Terminal 21 is great for a rainy day or low key activity. There is plenty to explore with every floor themed after a different country. End your day with a treat at Swenson's Ice Cream. Easy to get to from the MRT or SkyTrain.

Innovative . This is a very interesting and innovative mall. This is a must visit, even if you're not into shopping. Every floor is designed as a new city. I'm not into shopping but I was there for more than 4 hours just exploring the mall and it's innovative design.There are many popular cities like London, San Francisco, Paris, Tokyo, Rome, Istanbul, Caribbean and more

Not very budget.. Many big name brands such Victoria Secrets and H&M but similar to UK prices. If you want cheaper clothes, unbranded, head to MBK.Very easy to find from the BTS.Also, I did love the themes on each floor, made it a unique shopping Center.

great place to visit n shop. even if you arent shopping, its still a nice place to visit. and the food!! so many choices!! my only regret.. i only had 1 stomach haha. Then theres the shops, so many unique shops on every floor, you can enjoy a whole morning or afternoon jus walking n browsing each floor. with the bts connected to terminal21, its easy to travel there and wouldnt get lost looking for the place

Shopping on steroids . This place blew me away! 7 levels of shopping. I think every brand name store was here. The food was also incredible. The sushi train restaurant was the best. Come here on a rainy day to people watch, watch a movie, or grab a meal. Prepare to be amazed!
Great food hall.. The shopping centre is the same as every other shopping centre, easy to get to, the food hall on the top floor is great value for money.

Why it call terminal 21. Every floor represent different places in the world. My favorite was Tokyo. Beside all the stores, this is an unusual mall. You need to enjoy the decoration every floor has offered. It brings you to different country. From French, Japan, US to Middle East very well represent. Easy to reach by sky train.
Not too shabby. Had a nice visit to the mall, very clean and spacious, good array of shops. Loved the toilets very space age!! Would recommend a visit to the mall
Nice!!. Great mall!! Affordable food for sure. A place to hang out with friends and family. Prices for stuff are reasonable.

8 levels of wonder!. The shopping arcade has 8 levels starting from the lower ground to the 6th, with each level offering a different shopping experience. From affordable brands to some of the more exclusive ones, this mall caters to everybody. There is also a small section of each level dedicated to more localised brands and gives you the feeling of a street shopping area (in a nice way) and you also get to find some of the local products in sale. There are coffee shops and eateries on each level however it is 2 of the last three levels that have all the food options you can want all mashed up together. One could easily spend an entire day without getting bored. A nice experience for the shopping folk.

Such a differnt mall. Very good idea and very nice place to enter while walking around the area. As every mall you can find everything but Terminal 21 can make you fell like traveling. Try to take the big stair that takes you up in the 5th floor at once!

Very Well Done!!!. WE only went here for a look but it was really well done, loved the themes on each floor. Lots of shops and some really amazing looking restaurants. We wished we had gone back to try some of the restaurants as the food look awesome and pricing was good. Some of the shops were definitely more upmarket and we didn't but anything. Can catch the sky train directly to here.

So much to shop n eat. Lovely mall close to both BTS and MRT. No bargaining pls, but reasonably priced goods if it's a Thai brand. Out of the 6 floors, lower ones have branded shops and as you go up you find floors dedicated to female clothes n male clothes by Thai designers. Prices usually starts from 300 BHT. Food court is big enough with a lot of variety but I loved the gourmet market in the basement floor.. Loved Thai ice tea n street food counters there.
2nd time visiting Terminal 21. I like the stuff the mall is selling. The mall sell more unique design as compare to the other mall. However, the items will be much pricey,

Loved this place, especially the food court . Talk about a big busy mall, you've got it here. This mall has many stores selling everything from designer clothing, electronics, toys, etc.... They even have a market on the ground floor too. Each floor/level of this mall has a theme to it from major cities around the world, for example Rome, Istanbul, San Francisco, etc. There's also a ton of places where you can take pics to show how you traveled around at Terminal 21. The best part about it was their awesome food court, they have so many choices of food that you can choose from, its overwhelming lol. And the best thing is that it's so incredibly cheap, not only that every dish that I had from each vendor was incredibly orgasmically delicious. Most plates run anywhere from $1 - $2. That's so unfathomable!!! Now one thing for sure, their food court system is different what you do is you first have to go buy a gift card type thing from a kiosk in whatever amount you want & then you just go get your food & pay with your card. And each food vendor will give you a receipt telling you how much you have left. Now one thing for sure is that card is only good for one day, but the great thing is that if you still have a balance on that card you can take it right back & receive the remaining balance back in cash. So I think it's a pretty awesome system. This mall also has a movie theater on the top floor that plays the latest movie hits in English too. So this mall is pretty awesome if you ask me, it's also very easy to get to it by the BTS train (since the train stops directly in front of the mall).

Unique mall. The mall full with unique design. And the shops sells nice item as most of them are designer not the whole seller, though the price not so cheap but we will get the quality.The food court is amazingly cheap but delicious. Range around thb 30-60 for average daily food and in my opinion it was more delicious compare to other mall.This food court using their special card for payment method, so please make sure to make any refund within same day

Anniversary . Great shopping centre - themed so a variety of goods plus a food court- some of the food wasn't great- food got cold by the time I wanted to eat and drinks were good but had no tray to carry them and a local got annoyed with me which was unfair as I was a tourist so not familiar with the process - got some good bargains on clothes/ watches

Not interesting. Terminal 21 is located at the junction of Ask and Sukmvit, also connected to BTS Asok station. All the shops are expensive, compared to other department store. However, food court is nice with reasonable price. I don't feel like visiting again.
Nice mall . Nice mall with big food court. Muslim friendly washrooms was a plus for me. Unfortunately, I did not come across any halal food options at the 6th floor food court.

Good for Locals but maybe not what you want to see as a Tourist. Terminal 21 is a nice modern mall in probably the best location in Bangkok, in Asok, where MRT and BTS Sukhumvit meet.It gets quite crowded on weekends but not that busy in the daytime on a weekday.You can find all you need from hair stylists to grocery stores, from cinema to clothes (from little designers to big brands). There is also a good food court for dining on budget as well as a good mix of restaurants and coffee shops. However, there is nothing really unique about terminal 21. It is not the most modern nor biggest mall, there are malls/markets with more designers, there is a better choice of restaurants elsewhere...Some tourists like taking photos with symbols of other metropoleis which are the themes of each floor. But that's not really impressive nor what you would go to Bangkok for.

the nicest shopping mall. Perhaps not the biggest (names/brands or sq KM's) but by far the nicest, well thought over mall of Bangkok. larger stores and small nice boutiques. Easy to reach by BTS and MRT (Sukhumvit station)

Good mix of shops across the various floors/continents. This is worth a visit just to see the different floors, which have different country themes such as Istanbul, Japan and the United Kingdom. There are some nice shops, including the jewellery stalls which feature special designs. On the upper floors, there are a two floors of restaurants, including a foodcourt. While there, take a look at the Golden Gate Bridge. There are also a slew of cafes across the different floors, and we liked the dessert stall on the 3rd floor, where the huge Japanese happy cat is and which overlooks the lighthouse.There is a Daiso, as well as Boots pharmacy on the bottom floor, and the mall is connected to the BTS.

Terminal 21, Bangkok. Large well decorated shopping mall with high street prices. Coffee shops are clean and well priced. The overall experience was good, but the high prices left me with an empty bag. The layout and decor were great and I enjoyed the London stop most. It is a nice place to wander around looking with a partner. I would not suggest a kids place as there is little to entertain them.

Good food. Nice mall, you can spend easily half a day. It's also good for eating, you can try a lot of different foods and they are really cheap. The brand clothes are not cheap, same price is in europe.
Fun concept mall. Fun concept for a mall; different levels with different decor dependant on the city that the level is modelled off. High end shops; fun for a look.

More varieties to see. A modern shopping complex in the center of Sukumvit. They decorated each floor to resemble a big city terminal namely Paris, Istonbul, London, Sanfrancisco, Tokyo. Most of the shops are clothing, food, and a variety of products for use in everyday life. Worth exploring if you want to see more varieties.

Interesting concept. I liked this mall due to its unique setup of small shops. Don't forget to bargin / ask for discounts. Small shops selling variety of stuff. Though could not find children clothing. Pier 21 is also good concept. However being muslim I struggled to find Halal food. There is only one restaurant in Pier 21 which serves Halal food. I found it out from other reviews on trip advisor. However, to my surprise, the restaurant didn't mention halal as restaurant generally do. Based on my inquiries from other different persons I was referred to the same shop.

Extremely cool mall. This is one of the coolest malls in the world. At first, I thought it was a stop at the Airport Rail link, because the mall is set up with a lot of airport-themed decorations. And it reminds me of KLIA in Malaysia. But, you can't actually get to the airport from here. They have a lot of unique, interesting stores. For example, they have a section with about 30 specialty tshirt stores.

Average mall. The mall is not as big as siam and they have lesser brands. It is not a bad mall but considering how easy Paragorn is to acces from sukhumvit by BTS you are better to go there than here.

Shopping Central, good food court!!. Terminal 21 was a great location located on the central of Bangkok, shopping place for people and earing place for me. The food court here is clean, tidy and especiall cheaper but yummier than the food court at Platinum mall. The location is easy to access by taxi( of course), Buses and Train. The Asok right in front. On the way go to the terminal 21, we caught a bus number 2 in front of Big C and its a free bus, old but still nice to go by bus.

Interesting Shopping by different themes based on countries. Alight from Asok station, less than a minute of walk, wil be Terminal 21 shopping mall. Rather interesting place with different levels reflecting different countries in terms of design, culture and so on. Many cafes, restaurants beside shops, shoppers are spoilt with choices. The quality of clothing here is definitely better than those in Chatuchak.

A medium sized mall. This is a medium sized mall located next to the Asok and Sukhumvit train station.The mall has a lot of small shops selling clothes and accessories produced locally.There are a lot of restaurants and a nice food court, so you have a lot of choices for food.There is a supermarket at the basement and cinema on the top floor.

Amazing food court on 5th floor - highly, highly recommended. We were recommended Terminal 21 food court and were so happy we made the effort to go. It is very convenient on the Skytrain and the shopping is quirky. But we would go back again just for the food. You purchase a card with which you buy the food from the numerous food stalls. If you don't use all your credit, you get it refunded and you can always top up. So it means the stall holders don't need to worry about handling cash etc, so service is nice and quick. The variety and quality of the food was amazing. We just kept eating & eating. Plenty for the kids as well. Will definitely be returning.
Shopping . Well what else to say that hasn't been said. A big shopping centre with lots of things to see n buy.

Themed floors are mind blowing. Being that I am from India, there was not much of great wonderous malls from where I came i.e. Chennai. So obviously when I stepped into Terminal 21 I was lown from inside - out. Each and every floor has been given lot os thought for designing. These are one of the things taht I loved about Thailand esp. Bangkok, Eventhough function and being economical is important, the fact that they spared no cost in spending for stylish architecture is awesome and inspiring. Magizhchi
Best public toilets in Bangkok. Great shopping and food.A chance to eat at a Michelin star restaurant for very little cost.If needed the best public toilets in Bangkok !!
Lovely Surprise. A new addition to the many Bangkok shopping malls. It's worth just walking around, trying some restaurants and checking the themed toilets.

Similar shops to other malls with themed floors, food choice is good. Everyone raves about it but we didn't see what was so amazing about it. Same as other malls in terms of similar shops, cinema, food court though the choice or food and the gourmet market was impressive. Some good photo opportunities if that is your thing . There was a small live music concert going on in there when we there which was nice . It's not a wow but it's a good mall set up differently with themed floors . If you are in Bangkok to shop and have done Paragon and the others it's worth a visit.

Fun place . Terminal 21 is a fun place to shop with a lots of options, categorized by the different things they are selling. You have many different areas, each a different city in the world, selling everything from home decor to men's fashion. There are some pretty good restaurants and a very good food court for cheap eats

A popular destination. Terminal 21 combines excellent shopping, even though it does not align many TOP foreign brands, with entertainment for the entire family. Terminal 21 has so many restaurants, sculptures, giant statues, replicas, avenue and level names to keep you going for a while. You will selfie non stop. But the most popular venue remains the food court where for about 40B ( less than USA $2 ) you can taste authentic Thai food at your leisure. Go ahead try few different dishes you won t go broke. Warning this place is jam packed at meal times. All food preparation done in front of the public. They regularly vary the offering. This week i tried the black sasame noddles with rosted pork. OUTSTANDING.

Popular mid end mall. This is a very popular, multi-level, mid end shopping mall. The general theme for the mall is based on an airport terminal. Every level has it's own city theme e.g. Paris, London, Tokyo, San Francisco, etc. Shops are mid-end but quite original and somewhat connected to the theme. The top levels are reserved for some nice restaurants, food court style.

Excellent food court w/Thai food selections. On the 5th floor one can find good cheap Thai food selections. 1. Walk around and note the prices. 2.Go to Cashier, called Coupon, and purchase a card for your desired amount. Best to buy one card per person unless you are all getting food from same stand. The cashier will refund unused amount. 3. Go get your food 4. Find a table and utensil station. I enjoyed a large mango sticky rice and coconut ice cream (separate stand) for under 100 bht. This food court was better and less expensive than the food court at the Phrom Phong Mall.

Best food court . We spend quite some time in this mall since it was close to our hotel. You can find everything you need to reasonable prices. They also have a good souvenir section. The best part about Terminal 21 is the food court on the 5th floor. Most dishes cost between 30-50 bath, so you can try lots of different things. I'd also recommend the cinema showing the newest movies in English for 100 per ticket.
Nice concept. All the floors are dedicated to famous cities and themed accordingly.It's a nice concept and I tried 2 floors food was gud

Wolrd Tour. This Mall is just crazy, each floor represent a different country in little ways. On the top floor you got the Movie theater witch is the best I've been to in a long time. Food court is just mind blowing with all this deferent types of cuisine that make your nose have an orgasm. Shopping it can be a little pricy but its ok, I would rather go to the mall down the street but this one is pretty cool and close by.

New cool mall. This is a new mall that wasnt here last time I visited BKK a few years ago. Its nice to see a mall that has a unique design and lots of cool independent retailers, not only the same normal boring brand stuff as in most malls.
best food. multinational branded cloth shopping a must very lovely place i have ever seen even in europe or hongkong,Singapore campare, this is the best shopping Mall

Best Shopping Mall. Here you will probably find the best shopping experience you could anywhere in the world, from major brands to local ones, with excellent and diverse dining options.Conveniently communicated to the Asok BTS station.
Small retail shops but many of them. A huge shopping centre that is very easily to get lost in not for men unless you like to shop .The cinema is on the highest level

Well worth a visit.. Really liked the mix of boutique and chain stores, with the little alleyways making our visit not so much about shopping as entertainment. Went there regularly just to browse.
It was busy, but the set-up of the mall meant we were never crowded either.

Good pitstop. Good place for a quick bite (food court), bathroom break or an A/C break from the weather. The mall is decorated like an airport terminal (hence its name). Each floor has an international city theme - e.g. Paris, London, Tokyo, etc.

Not so retail therapy . Stopped off on the way home for Christmas, went to do shopping, prices very different from rest of shopping centres around Bangkok.
Food places also expensive for normal menu's, so went for specials board, good choice at most places and good value for money.
Stopped close to this centre in hotel, so used some restaurants for lunch.

Amazing Terminal 21. This is the biggest Mall I have ever been in. It was amazing. So much to do, and see. I really loved the food court upstairs. So many different varieties of foods you don't know were to start first.

Multitude of shops. Located next to Asok BTS you will enter into a world of different shops located at many different floors. Every floor is named, like Paris or London or Istanbul etc. and the idea would probably be that French shops would be at the Paris floor etc. Cannot quite say that this is the case.However, you can buy all kinds of goods here. If you cannot find it here, you will have a hard time finding it in other centres. Not exactly cheap, I would say.Do checkout the top level floors that host a variety of food possibilities.
Great shopping mall. This is a great shopping mall. Every floor represents a different country which is cool. Huge food floor, as well as lots and lots of shop choices!

Amazing place. This shopping Centre is a great place to shop in Bangkok. There are plenty of good quality local and international brands.It is massive and I liked the theme. The eating area was good and we dined there 2 times. Some good restaurants.The only thing missing for a family is a proper kids play area like Emporium or Siam Paragon

Dull. For a complex of this magnitude there should be some measure of differenciation but that is sadly lacking. Terminal 21 is massive but that is all. It lacks charm and the only thing that would draw me back is the food variety.

Terminal 21 shopping mall. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall representing different cultures on different floors . You will find London ,San Francisco,turkey & etc . On top floor you will find very good in fact excellent super cinemas .

Cool, Hip and Creative. We missed this mall during our first trip to BKK in favor of MBK and Chatuchak. That was a BIG mistake! If you're going to BKK for some cool finds then this is the place to go! Lots of great bargains when we went. The whole mall is brimming with creativity and up & coming designers so you'll definitely see a lot of cool things you won't find elsewhere. Take the time to explore it because there's a variety of stuff you can shop for regardless of your budget. The mall itself is also a sightseeing spot. There are so many great details to appreciate. Each floor is themed as a different city: London, Rome, Istanbul, Tokyo, etc. I've traveled all over the world and this is the first mall I saw that really has this creative spin! It's a MUST stop in BKK!

Unique shopping mall . Terminal 21 is the unique shopping mall at Asok , comfortable to go by Metro. In the shopping mall , it has various products for selling in the reasonable price. You can go to different floor for photo in different theme as London , Tokyo , Paris
Airport theme shopping mall . It is a airport theme shopping mall just next to BTS Asoke. Different floor has different country theme like Tokyo, London. The food court has many choices of food.

Fantastic Shopping Centre and Food Experience. If you want a shopping centre where you can actually afford to buy items, as well as eat at some great restaurants or a food hall, then Terminal 21 is a great place to visit. As well, it is right on the BTS/MRT. It also has a really great supermarket as well. This is one of the best all in one malls you will come across and it has a quirky theme with each floor dedicated and decorated like a major world city. Go have a look, you won't be disappointed.

Quirky mall with difference. Great place to visit for something different. Each level is a different city layouts are modelled from that place . Ie a Turkish bazaar in Istanbul .. The streets of Tokyo and market places in London. Worth the visit for toilets alone!Tourists also can sign up and get free wifi and a welcome kit

Interesting concept and design. This was a good shopping mall with a balance between international brands and local boutique stores. Good options for dining. Each level of the mall has a different theme - worth a visit!
Best mall experience. I went to hangout at the mall with friends and it's pretty great, i did go there twice and also the foodcourt and the different stores at ground level are awesome.

Fantastic shopping mall. From bargain stores to high end labels such as Victoria's Secret there is plenty to keep even the seasoned shoppers on their toes. Each level see's a different city theme, which is neat. The centre is laid out well and on my two visits wasn't overly busy and never felt crowded. It's easy to access via the BTS and is located near the Sukhumvit area where many hotels are located.
Interesting stalls. Fantastic variety of shops that caters to youngsters. Interesting concept and tons of food choices available. Conveniently linked to Asoke BTS.

Terminal 21 ( shopping Mall ). Very big and nice shopping mall and from my view it's the best , many choices for shopping and also last two floors you can find a great mixed of restaurants and food shops.

Must visit. My colleague recommended this mall to me.Location: next to Asok BTS station. Upon arrival, I saw signages that made me feel like I was in airport. Little details that made me smile.The toilets are a must visit! Not only each floor has a different country theme, their toilets are made to that country's theme too. Their toilet bowls has a bidet! Do read the instruction on the back of the toilet door carefully so as not to press the wrong button. For example, the Tokyo floor toilet has bamboo pipes for their taps. The London floor toilet has a subway train and signages. Loved it! While you are there, do check out their food court at level 5. After a sumptuous meal, you might wanna head over to Instagram worthy cafe such as "After You" or "Mr Jones Orphanage". If you feel like having Thai Iced Tea, head over to the basement where their supermarket is. Right outside the supermarket check out counter is a Thai Iced Tea shop where they sell both Thai Iced tea drink and the leaves, which comes in little tins. My Favourite is Thai Iced Green Tea. Jasmine tea with milk. It's less sweet than the normal Thai iced tea. I think it cost around 40 baht for a large drink. There's only one size. If you enjoy taking selfies or even regular photos, do check out this mall! Here are some photos!
Regular haunt..... T21 is great for shopping.... mid price... dining options varied.... movies.... payning phone bill.... near to Hemmingways and Asok. Lot going for it. 20 minutes from home helps.

Shopping center w/different themes. A shopping center with different theme on every level, including its toilet. Offers lots (and I mean really a lot) of options of restaurants, cafes, food court. Things sold here is slightly more exp than places like Platinum mall. You can find some of the global retail line here like H&M, Adidas, and also the local brands.
Uninspired shopping mall! . Too many students in the afternoon. Food is the only good thing here! Do read the reviews of individual restaurant before you sit down!

airport theme mall. Nice themed mall. Supermarket is available inside. Better to buy rabbit card. If you buy single trip ticket at the bts, need wait long queue, about 20people in each queue. went there in the morning, not much people.

Different Mall. If you want to have a great world shopping experience this it's the place where you have to go. On each floor you will find a different city from where you can shopp. London style, Paris style, Istanbul and other cities all in one place : Terminal 21. There are prices for all pokets, and you cand find a lot of great things, a lot of souvenirs and presents for the loved ones.

Another Large shopping Centre. If you like shopping I am sure you will find plenty to spend your money on here. It is typical of a large modern shopping centre. It is well located in the middle of a busy shopping precinct with railways stations on the spot. don't be confused and think it is located at the airport.

Really unique mall . This mall is easily accessible by BTS sky train at the Asoke station. It has everything from restaurants, a food court, cafes and shops that are affordable. Each floor has its own city theme including Rome, Istanbul, San Francisco, and many others.

My favorite mall on Bangkok . I like this place for not being too high so, every one can find something for himself or herself. Quite a lot of clothes to sell (mainly local brands), quite a few good dining options and well established cinema along with well stocked supermarket make this place my primary stop for shopping & entertainment when visiting Bangkok.

Great & Unique. A nice and interesting shopping mall, a lot of different shops here for all the pockets, from high end brands to a cheap souvenir, you can easily spend the whole day here with your entire family and there is always something to do, worth a visit
Best place for shopping and dinning. Love this mall. Great concept. Every level have different theme. Lots of nice restaurant. The food court pricing is very cheap.

A mall for all. This mall has everything for everyone with all budgets. The food courts are amazing with a great selection of traditional thai food all at great prices! The shops are great (we were lucky as the sale was on!) It's very easy to get to from the BTS and to find you way around!

Beautiful design but not so good for shopping. I found this mall very beautiful and original in decor and design. Lots of small boutiques but didn't not find anything exciting in terms of shopping and food!There is a food court on level 5 (you need to get a food court card to eat there) and a few other small restaurants here and there. The food halls at Siam Paragon are way better

shop, eat & play. is a huge and fashion mall.love the variety design of toilet love the variety food explore over therepersonally went to two day.Most of the famous cafe and restaurant also there.Be ready to spend more !!!

Very interesting mall. Definitely one of the best malls in Bangkok. English signs and menus everywhere, most of the staff here speak English as well. I noticed that there were more tourists than locals when I visited.Each floor is named after a different place, such as Tokyo and Istanbul. Very interesting concept, and each floor is decorated with the specific "attractions" as well, such as statues of Sumo and Geisha on the Tokyo floor, creating lots of photo ops!Big international brand names such as H&M are available here. Local brands can also be found. However, do not expect to find bargains here, as this is a big mall.Incredible choice of food available here. The 5th floor is home to most of these restaurants and a large food court serving both Thai and international cuisine. You can probably spend half day exploring this mall and just window shopping due to the size of this mall.The toilets are also very clean, and the cleaners remind you (in English) to make sure that you do not leave any belongings when you leave the washrooms. A nice touch!

a unique shopping center - must go at least once. terminal 21 is a great shopping center, its beside asoke station, from the greeting you receive when you enter to the shops to the cafes to the food court on the 5th floor it is very unique. its so clean has different decorations on each floor, escalators a great - go visit you will enjoy you shopping / dining experience !!!!!
Great Location & Good Food Court. Food court on 5th level has a wide variety of tasty food and at very good prices (compared to many other food courts)
Shopping, shopping, shopping..... This shopping center has all you need, from well-known to small local brands. Good layout with alot of small stalls to make the exprience more interesting.

Shop till you drop and eat till you can't anymore. Big shopping mall decorated like an airport. Visite the capitals of the world and make pictures of the tourist attractions. Everyone has it's own floor.The upper floor has a cinema and there are 2 floors with a foodcourt.I love to shop there when we are in Bangkok.

Around the Globe. For easy access, Take the BTS Sukhumvit Line to Asok. the station is beside Terminal 21. The mall is a feast for the eyes. Everywhere you look there's something new & beautiful. Each floor has different theme, like one floor would be Turkish & another would be Japanese (Traditional & New Tokyo). The food on the 5th floor are very diverse. You won't know what to eat because everything's smells and looks good.

Great mall. Very convienent and great food selection. I think this mall is 4/6 resteraunts honestly.
The MRT is just outside and I find the escalator from M to 4th floor just fun

Have to See to Believe!. Terminal 21 is super unique, every floor is given a country and then decorated to match that country. The owner's have taken the themes so far that even the bathrooms are different. I particularly love the bathrooms in Paris and Tokyo. I would recommend going just to admire the theming even if you are not interested in shopping. Additionally, the food court is amazing! It has the largest selection of the major bangkok malls and is also priced the best. Don't be shy, go up to the counter put 175 baht on a card and walk around to the different vendors. It's okay if you do not speak Thai as it is not necessary, you can simply point to what you would like and then hand over the card. If you don't use the full amount on your card you can then return to the card sales people and they will refund the remaining amount on your card.

Cheapest food in Bangkok. I have been here a few times. I love the shopping centre its not as mainstream as some with interesting local items. The food court on level 5 is called terminal 21 lots of different food mostly thai. You need to buy a card as all the outlets are cash free. Great value, pissibly the cheapest in Bangkok, spotlessly clean and air cond. Several other mainstream outlets on the perimeter.

Great shopping centre!! . After a long day of work, I and my friends, who have never been there before, decided to go to Terminal 21 in order to shop and dine. I thought it was just another ordinary shopping centre.It turned to be an amazing place and could be called a melting pot. We had dinner at the food court, it has reasonable prices. We did really had a good time there.

Wow!. Hands down this shopping centre beats any shopping centre in the UK!It's lively decor (depicting numerous locations around the world) is fascinating to view! Food options are numerous and also cater to any budget, which is great! Shops are boutique and original, which is lovely to see - rather than the numerous commercial shops you see worldwide!

Unique shopping center . Go here if you like to take lots of photos and selfies. Each floor has a different theme bathroom. If you fancy a bite there are lots of options from all the world cuisine. Price is slightly higher than MBK. Look out for sale at the basement level. Nothing to shout about. Outside of the mall look for Pala Italian restaurant for yummy delicious authentic food. Try the pizzas!!

A funky mall with some different offerings than the typical mall. I like this mall. Yes, upon entry, you see the typical mall stores (H&M, Espirit, etc.) and you think you're in any old US mall. However, starting with the Tokyo level, you start getting some really cool local businesses with cool, hip stores selling unique items you'll be hard-pressed to find elsewhere. It's definitely a step up from JJ Mall or MBK Center. It reminds me a bit of the old Suan Lum Night Bazaar, a place with low rental rates where young, creative designers and artists could sell their wares part time, leading to some really unique items.
Convenient. Connect to the sky strain line so supper easy to navigate. Good option for cheap price clothes. Like it

Promises a lot, delivers little. Alongside Asok BTS station, there's a mall that takes you, level by level to the cities of the world - Tokyo, Paris, London, Istanbul, San Francisco. There are appropriately themed landmarks, signs and symbols of each place. And then there are alleys of not particularly interesting clothes, jewellery etc, not unlike any other market in the city. Yes, it's fun, the stall are better presented and it is more expensive than shopping elsewhere. However, at Pier 21 and on other floors, there are familiar and not so familiar restaurants and cafes that are good for lunch or dinner. We particularly enjoyed ThaiThyme - Italian cuisine with an Asian twist.

Your gateway to a world of some familiar international brands and quirky local designs.... Terminal 21 has been 1 of my favourite suburban mall in Bangkok. Besides housing some of familiar international brands, i really like many of the local designer stores that are here.Some of my favourite places that i love shopping at in the weekend Chatuchak have expanded their business over here. So i can shop in better comfort over here if i ever missed the weekend craziness at Chatuchak.There are lots to see here with the different themes on every floor. i am really impressed by how they took the whole travel theme to so many levels - created many photo opp spots for shoppers, many interesting looking shop fronts, even the toilets are beautifully done up.The basement level and the upper floors have a wide range of F&B choices. i really like the food court upstairs that has a good choice of local food if i want to grab a quick bite before continuing my shopping spree. The only trouble is you have to get a stored value card in order to buy anything here.

Great shopping. Very clean, easy mapped mall where you can find quality shops (not faked) with fair prices . We found a lot of discounts so bought pretty many things.
Recommended by us indeed.
impressive decorations. a shopping mall with different theme at each floor. tasty affordable food available at the food court.

One of the best place to go shopping!. Very nice and different shopping center. Very modern style and lot of shops. The London floor is amazing. You have to look at the security staff and also try the underground toilet ;-)

I like it!. It's such a special
Mall, I visited all the toilets in different floors, it has Japanese style, US style, Roman style and England style. it's a small world! I really recommend it to friends who will take tourist to Bangkok!

Terminal 21. This is probably the best shopping mall that i have seen recently!! Different floors named after international cities, cinemas, food court, lovely small shops, fantastic design and hostesses and host reminding us that we could be in an airport!!
Definitely my type of Mall!!

Just another shopping mall. A massive shopping center with high end products. Food is nothing special, except pricey, which is easy to understand. Focused on decor and nice view which is great to check in. That's all
fantastic shopping mall. a place for food and photo,must bring your camera.a fantastic shopping mall that you really don't want to miss

unique decoration in this mall. what an unique decoration in this mall. it's like you visited a lot of country just by visiting this mall. :)
the mall is big, u can get everything here.

Massive shopping center. Mind blowing place, it is huge.. the selection is incredible, so many shops and and the choice of food courts is incredible, this is really one of the must see places in Bangkok if you like shopping.

One more place to tick off the list in Bangkok. On my previous trips to Bangkok, I had refrained from going into Terminal 21 assuming its only about high end fashion. The mall has direct entry from BTS Ashoke and the food court is big. But it was crowded and I didn't want to deal with prepaid food court cards and was not in the mood to que up for food, so went next door to El Gaucho Argentinian steak house for lunch.
What you need you get. Clean and price is okay.You can get what you like.beside i like shopping in the super market cause near to my hotel.Same like other shopping center.

Interesting design. The mall was made famous by the interesting design concept, but asides from that, there are many pros.The mall has many good restaurants and a decent food court. It is also accessible via Asok BTS Station or Sukhumvit MRT Station, and is right next to Robinson Department Store and the Westin.The toilets are extremely clean and area equipped with the Japanese kind of toilet, the one with warmed seats that shoots water up your bum.Walking around the shops is also pretty enjoyable, the sales in the "festivals" (when we went there it was a "shoes and bags festival") offer great prices.Definitely worth a stop by.

Terminal 21 Food Court. The food court has so much choices, you wont know where to start! Everything looks delicious. I tried the hot and spicy noodles. It was ok. Then, on the next day, I went back to try the tom yum noodles from the last stall. It was delicious. But I was very thirsty that night!! The food court closes at 10pm. So, make sure you get the refund from your card before 10pm.
It Has Everything You Need. I like the airport like feel of the main lobby and that every floor has a theme. Very accessible to the train system. A haven to satisfy your gastronomic indulgence.
Food court visit. Great place to visit when in Bangkok - country themed floors with the pier 21 food court on the top floor, very low prices for pretty much any Asian dish you want!! Amazing!

Love to take a day of walking and shopping. Beautiful place, many selfie opportunities, great food a a lot of deals if you search very very very hard. Not much bargaining here but there is some. Just a lot to see and catch a movie at the top to finish the day of before a Nad and let dinner. Recommend this place for novice and expert shopping.

Airport theme, very nice. The view is very nice, different floor have different theme which each time we move to another floor, we can experience different country such as floor 6 has Hollywood theme etc. Its all like airport even when we came in, the security officer wear clothes like the pilot.

Shopping center with more reasonable prices. Terminal 21 has a lot of famous brands like the other big shopping malls. The main difference is on the higher levels you will find smaller boots where you can find brand replicas with higher quality than the markets. You will also find a lot of great eating places here with amazing prices. Especially the food marked on the 5th floor. Just walk all the way to the end of the floor and you will find a busy restaurant. You can eat as cheap as 50 bath, maybe less.

High End Shopping. My hubby and I went here as he wanted to eat at Tony Roma's. The shopping centre is very modern and each level has a different city theme. Mostly higher end brands but fun to look around.

Nail shop inside . Nail salon inside of Terminal provides excellent service with very affordable price. Got gel nail with art for 900 baht. Stopped bangkok on the way to Philippines from Myanmar for 13hrs and I definitely would like to recommend to get ur fingers bling during stop over

Large choice of shops and restaurants worth visiting.. The mall can get very busy, however I went there twice and had good shopping experiences and possibly better dining experiences. The shops are interesting, the choice of brands fairly large and well represented, the prices looked fair. The choice of restaurants and eating places definitely good with something for nearly every taste.Food was appetizing and the service attentive and with a smile. Prices were affordable and to suit most pockets.All in all a good experience and a notch above other shopping malls in Bangkok.

Must go for local shopping. Of all the shopping malls I have been to in Bangkok, this is the one I like best for local Thai fashion. What I mean is that they have local brands (their thai equivalent to H&M for example) and they also have small local shops where you can find cool vintage like clothes as well as urban style fashion. They also have a food court on the last two floors if you get hungry.
Nice shopping mall + check out the bathrooms. Nice shopping mall. To walk around and eat. Many eateries to choose from. Check out the bathrooms. They look really interesting.
Great Experience. The mall has many brands and a fabulous food court. Each floor is themed differently and has bathrooms decorated as per the theme. Overall a good place!

Go To At Least See the Bathrooms. This mall has a fun concept and it's worth checking out even just to see the neat little themes on every floor, even if you don't care about shopping here. The bathrooms on each floor complete the theme too, although I didn't go to every bathroom on every floor (they all have nice, Japanese-style toilets though, complete with seat warmers). There are lots of recognizable clothing (and shoe) brands here - like H&M or whatnot, along with a lot of interesting local stuff. On the floor with menswear, there are a few shops that have some really nice, unique t-shirts I haven't really seen anywhere else in Thailand (I might have seen some knock-offs of the one store in MBK though). My boyfriend bought a whole bunch of shirts from a few different shops. It seems to be a lot of artist-type t-shirt shops where they're printing and designing their own shirts.I bought a really nice Thai silk dress from a boutique for about $60CAD. I can't remember the name of the shop, but literally every shop we went into the staff were incredibly helpful. I was trying a dress on in another shop, but I would have needed it altered; the guy working did everything in his power to try to get it altered the same day for me (we were leaving the next morning) but it didn't work out. One of the floors sells tons of gorgeous dresses, another floor is more just typical (but stylish) womenswear. One of the top floors (I think just below the food court) is mostly accessories, jewelry and cosmetics. There's an It's Skin store here if you're into K-beauty. The jewelry shops are all quite different, some are selling funky, cheaper stuff like you'd find in a store like Claire's, other stuff is more designer and higher end (but not like a Tiffany's high end, just more elegant stuff). Also lots of different bags and purses and stuff, and some more unique shoe stores.The food court didn't really win me over, I guess I'm kinda spoiled because I've been to a lot of different food courts in malls in large Asian cities and this one didn't seem any different or special. I like the Food Republic in Siam Center better as far as food courts in Bangkok go. Though we did end up trying the pizza cone place because it looked like something different and it ended up being really good.This is a really neat mall, but it does start closing up kinda early (some shops started closing as early as 8PM), so be aware of that if you want to spend a lot of time shopping. The food court isn't worth it alone though, but it is worth just seeing the unique themes (and bathrooms) on each floor.

Awesome experience . Food court is great. Level 5. It's called Pier 21 and dishes up cheap thai food cooked before your eyes. It's great for families with young children. The juice Bar is fantastic with fresh smoothies readily available. Basically you can get your family fed for 100 baht. No exaggeration either. David cafe on level 2 has the best coffee too. Please enjoy one and all

Interesting concept for a mall. Even if there are no plans for any shopping, the mall is worth visiting at least once if you are in Bangkok just for the concept of it. There are nice small shops about worth looking into though not too sure about the comparative prices. As usual for any mall, brands stores are around as well.

Disappointing. Although the concept sounds good, it is not developed fully and some of the country themes don't work. Don't expect to find French shops in Paris, etc. You really have to look out for the theme. Also the shop selection and mix is not great. Overall, not worth the hype.

Excellent Mall. A interesting mall that has a different country's theme on every level. The staffs are even dressed to the theme. For eg, security guards are dressed like pilots and saluting you as you enter the mall.I especially love the toilets, v clean and dry, a staff is always around to maintain the toilet's standard.Good place to shop the usual mid tier retail such as H&M. Visit this place if u are in bangkok!

Nice. I liked the whole concept of the mall. Each level takes you to another country. It's really great. When you get into the mall, you have to pass through a fake metal detector first.Some women that work there wear flight attendant uniforms.

Everything you need easy access to transportation!. I stepped right off the train at Asok-Station from the BTS and walked right into Central 21. I had an amazing and unique Thai lunch with a good friend. We had coffee at Starbucks after and saw stores and brands I have only been in the states! There were even airport signs all over the shopping center. The bathrooms were worth the trip! It's a very busy place. Lots of hustle and bustle but so easy to get in and out. Take the BTS. So simple! This is a spend the day place until your to tired to shop and eat!

Great food court and theme mall. IMHO can't bet the choices and prices in the food court in other malls. Love MK, fruit smoothies, and sticky rice and mangoes. Can't bet the convenience (asok) and great diversity of retailers. Come to think of it, I'll be back tomorrow !

Awesome themed mall, in the city center. I totally loved the theme that Terminal 21 is built on. Each and every floor has a city's theme. Like London, paris, Istanbul, Carribean, Tokyo etc. It is just like any other mall, but what sets it apart and makes it worth a visit is the idea of having different types of city themed designs on different floors. Great for photo ops
A shopping complex with airport terminal theme. shopping complex with airport terminal themeNice with many shops selling clothes .quite a number of restaurants too. A bit pricey though.

Complete enjoyment. This particular mall has everything, starting from good shops and restaurants that caters to people from different countries and varying socio economic backgrounds. The atmosphere is very lively and the mall itself is very beautifully designed with each floors having a different theme.

Best overall mall in Bangkok!. If you're looking for Gucci and Dior, this is not the mall for you. After a 5 day stay in Bangkok, this was the mall we liked the best. It has these little countrythemes on each floor, which was very cozy. The stores were placed in streets on some of the floors, and it was like walking in a small alley. This mall does not offer all the big brand stores, but definetely worth the visit!

Not as expected. Looking at the pictures before we went, we were expecting a huge mall. However, when we visited, it's not that big, just average. Just spent 30 minutes, then off we went back around Siam and Chidlom malls.

My favourite mall in Bangkok. Just a 10 minute walk from where I was staying. A really nice mall, with a theme for every floor. Food court was crowded every time I was there. The cinema was my favourite in Bangkok. Got a great pair of shoes on sale and tourist knick knacks to take back home. You can find some great buys here.

Interesting Place. Called in here for the first time. Just up the road from my hotel the Grand Swiss and is very easy to get to, Catch the BTS to Asoke and you can walk in straight from the staton. Many different shops, just like many other shopping centres, with a theme on every floor. Some interesting statues and other iconic things from different cities around the world. They have a good food court and as with all shopping malls it is air conditioned. Work a visit.

When you want to shop for non big brand in a more comfortable place. I enjoyed visiting Terminal 21, they have a lot of small brands fashion store which are affordable in a comfortable place, this place can be busy after office hour in the evening as it is near BTS station. The foodcourt foods are delicious too.
Tight spaces stores are small.. Nice to go but only once! Just to see the themes on each floor...otherwise other Malls in bangkok are much better

Good place to spend time & money. Steps away from BTS sky train Asoke station and MRT Sukhumvit station. Plenty of famous chain restaurants, the best food court in Bangkok! Mango with sticky rice here is value your money.
its ok. not that impressed besides the big duble decker bus sitting on the london floor. its ok but not that impressive.

Anything and Everything. Visited on our last two days of our most recent trip and I can honestly say I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. There are so many different stores, different things to buy - not to mention each floor has its own theme!Terminal 21 is extremely easy to get to as it joins on to the Asoke BTS station. I would definitely recommend coming here to shop. Not as cheap as MBK but most of what you buy here is handmade, and is of superior quality.
Beautiful decor. Terminal 21 is a good place to explore as the mall has lots of shops but the most interesting part is that it is themed to various countries/cities on each floor.
Visit to admire the decor. In comparison to other malls in Bkk, T21 is considered small but has its own charm. Just right beside the Asok BTS station.

Good Mall with great food court and photo ops !. Liked the mall for the decor and the photo ops that are there.Not very huge, so easy to cover.Special mention of the food court, which serves great inexpensive food.Worth visiting if you are in the area.

Great themed mall. At least the owners took the trouble to conceptualize to differentiate it from a mall infested city. The different floors representing different 'countries' offerings is refreshing and makes shopping more interesting. A highly viable alternative to Central World and Emporium.

Special landmark . The shopping mall is designed like a airport. There are many kind of goods and foods. Make me pay attention is some hand make arts and crafts. The goods are suitable for young people. The selling souvenir is very unique.

Cheap food and great design inside !. Terminal 21 is a new mall with very innovative design. Each floor will feature different city with the remarkable landmark of that destination. You can find Tokyo, San Francisco, London,.. The food court will be at Terminal Pier. Food in here is cheaper than those in Siam Malls, MBK,..etc but still very tasty. I came here just for food and I am very satisfied.

Good place to spend time while in Transit. - Good place to spend time while in Transit
- Has movie hall to kill some time.
- Have Starbucks and other coffee shops to spend time with Free WiFi in the Shopping mall
- Shopping wise, price may not be cheaper to your home country or may be on higher side
Food paradise. There are so many restaurants to enjoy many foreign countries including Thai cusine.in Pier 21, food court, various food is provided at price you can afford.

Food poising from the food court. My family really enjoyed the mall here.
