The airport concept was really neat and the different cities from around the world made it appealing for my young daughter.What made me give this place two stars was the food court. Although it was insanely cheap, clean looking, and really delicious, we all came down with a bad case of food poising the next day. Imagine being on a full day tour that started at 7AM, in a bus full of strangers for 1.5 hours one way, and your child all of a sudden crying for the toilet with bad stomach cramps and no place to pull over. Then it hits you... Then your husband...DISASTER. Eat at the food court with caution.

unique. located just beside Asoke BTS, it is very accessible. Each floor has different country theme, had a number of photo opportunities, eapecially on London and Istanbul floors. Most of the shops are in mid range price. And there are basically everything; supermarkets, cinema, etc. But there are a lot of shops sell at lower prices than platinum fashion mall at much better location, better quality; especially for guy clothes. Bought 1 tee for 150 baht by local designer. Highlight for me is the food court (pier21). I dont understand why the food price over there can b cheaper than street food, at better quality....amazing
Mall with city themes. Actually i feel like its just ordinary mall with many standard tenants. This mall provided moderat prices stuff with city themes around the world.Istanbul,SF,London,Tokyo...
Occupational pickpocket at Terminal 21. There are professional pickpocket gang hanging in the shopping mall. Likely to steal from tourists. Watch out.
Great visuals!. Splendid looking mall thats worth the trip just to see the different stores. Didnt buy Michael but its a great memory and worth a few hours.

Pretty!. Great floor themes, good variety. One downer was that the prices were not far off the domestic Canadian prices, if at all. Makes it kind of pointless, except for the food court, and that will only stay special if it stays predominantly Thai, as Dairy Queen, BK, etc., are all there too.

Nice one specially the small shops seeling clothes. It is a nice mall right next to the BTS and convenient living around the touristic SOI areai however found the same stuff at lower prices in MBK or similar prices at Central world and central mbk and paragon are all next to each othe making life simpler

Lovely. Terminal 21 located at corner of Sukhumvit road and Soi 19,it's very close to Asoke BTS station. Location is very close to major shopping area, hotels,restaurants,night clubs.It's nice place for shopping and dinning.Interior design there is lovely.

Excellent shopping meca. This was a great place to shop more upmarket - lots to choose from
lots of food courts and restaurants to pick from as well (the one we did pick was abit average so take your time to pick) - id suggest the food court

Nice place to shop and eat. This is a nicely decorated shopping mall with various city themes on different floors. There are lots of options for shopping and dining. The Pier 21 (food court) on top sells nice food and the price is rather cheap. One person only need to spend around 100+Baht for food.

Floors of shopping. Good place to shop with levels of escalators going up. Had a nice farmers market with good stuff to buy!
Had a meal twice in here . Was cheap but good! Loads of shops with different sections like different areas of the world.

Middle to high end but affordable Shopping complex. This is a very unusual shopping centre on several floors designed like arrivals and departures at an airport. Each floor has its own theme and country/cityThe products range from clothing to a Cinemark on the top floor and a great food and craft works in the basement.Terminal 21 is very close to the Asok skytrain station in Sukhumvit. Highly recommend taking the time to explore. Register when you first arrive with the reception desk and they will give you a code for free Wi-Fi. You need either a drivers license or passport

all the right things going for it. As others have said this mall is connected to the BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit stations. The food court is terrific, which don't forget you need to get a card loaded with cash before you get food in the food court. The outside restaurants don't require a cash card, just your cash. If you want to go straight to the food, go up the largest escalator first and then one more floor up and you are in the food court. The series of escalator takes a while and the elevators are slow, plus the disabled/elderly need them more. The shopping here ranges from a variety of handmade goods to modern clothes and jewelry. This mall is popular for random exhibits, I've personally seen a sneaker show, motorcycle exhibit, and a condo exhibit. The themes don't match the goods so don't be fooled by them. They are just names of areas to help organie the mall. Good idea, but misleading. Hope this info helps. Its a great place to shop, eat, and people watch. It's always busy.

Amazing vibe. Might be the most favorite shopping mall in Bangkok , with all the good brands with different range. Lot of restaurant , and not only having big brands, they also having small business store.

This place is huge!. This shopping mall has several floors and provides a range of international shops and many eateries including western fast food chains along with Thai restaurants. The building is clean and modern with a good atmosphere. There is also a cinema at the top and a hotel connecting to it.

Food Court = Excellent Value & Great Food. We nearly always stay at Hotels close to Terminal 21, so that we get to go there to Eat out. The Food Court ( level 5 ) is a fantastic place to meet up with friends and enjoy value eating. The array of varied food to order is vast and there will be something for everyone. Never a bad meal here and always pleasant staff. At busy peak eating times it can be hard to find a free and clean table. Eat and enjoy!

Easy to access Mall. This mall is easy to access from MRT Shukumvit or BTS Asok. The mall is using airport themes. The toilet also have different themes at each floor. The rest is just the other mall.
Global food and fashion under one roof.. All great brands over one roof with varieties of food chain. Cineplex also spectacular. Its worthy to spend one afternoon there.

Fabulous design . Terminal 21 as the name suggests is designed with an airport terminal as its inspiration.
Each level is represented by an area such as Paris, San Francisco, Istanbul etc.
As luck would have it we found the one star Michelin restaurant Tim Wo Han on the 4th level and enjoyed a delicious lunch!!

AMazing shopping center theme like an airport. I'm not big into shopping but I really enjoyed my time here. Each floor is designed like a different international city with all the stores and shops following suit. They have Athens, Tokyo, Istanbul, London just to name a few. The mall is several stories high and offers high end fashion boutiques with amazing décor. The top floor contains Pier 21 which is the amazing food court with many, many options to choose from, as well as many sit down style restaurants; including hibachi. If you like to shop, this is the place for you as there are many international designers. If you don't like to shop this is still a great place to experience as the are many sight to see and many places to eat. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Bangkok!

Go for the food and not the shopping!. An innovative shopping complex right next to Asok BTS station. Every floor has a different theme based on large cities around the world. As I don't really like shopping, I went there to check out the food court I heard so much about. It's a modern venue that's clean. If you don't want to eat Thai food, you'll find all types of western food from different franchises. Worth a visit if you want to get away from the center of the Siam area.

Beautiful Mall and must visit. Having heard about theme based floors visited the mall.It's just lovely. Each floor is based on a city or activity.We throughly enjoyed our visit.Even the restrooms are based on the floor theme.Sanfransisco and Hollywood based theme floors are just great.Variety of shops and eating outlet.
Great movie theater . The movie theater here is great. Movies are in English with Thai subtitles. Only runs about $4 and reserved seating too. Great way to escape the Bangkok heat for a few hrs.

Global experience under 1 roof. Every floor has a theme of a different country and fashion house. Best brands and trendz available. amazing food options. we ate at the Terrace on the 6th floor. Interesting menu and great food.
Decent mall. Didn't end up buying anything here. There was a fairly good selection of shops, and the mall was a reasonable size, but the shops were not quite as interesting as in some other malls.

Huge Shopping Mall. Big shopping mall to see. When you get tired visiting tourists spot - it will be nice to relax and hang out in an airconditioned mall. Each floor has its own theme - London, Istanbul, Tokyo and San Francisco. Next to Asok BTS station and very easy to find. Enjoy shopping! :)

Fun for a mooch. This place has everything. Great themed floors styled for global destinations - hence the 'terminal' concept. Brands were every bit as pricey as at home but they are here if you want them. There are also lots of quirky outfits which I wouldn't see back in the UK - felt Japanese modern but I could be wrong. We couldn't do it all in one visit and will be going back - given I don't like shopping that's quite a recommendation.

Great location-at Asok bts. Next to Asok bts, has anything a tourist need, foodcourt for casual eating, you need a cashcard though. Interesting themed floors of different countries/continent. Also has a supermarket in the basement for groceries. Excellent shelter from Bangkok sun/heat.

great experience. I was looking for plus size clothes not expecting to find much in Thailand but there it was in a small boutique in this MEGA shopping mall - prices were also affordable. The highlight of our shopping experience - the toilet with heating seats and washing and drying service ! We loved it !

Best Mall for casual clothing. Country based theme on every floor makes it interesting . Right next to ASOK BTS station . Must go for shopping for some cool T-shirts and casual clothes . They have small shops which have all the things you would want. Food court is decent. Must go when in Bangkok

Loved the themed floors. Beautiful and interesting place. I definitely consider this one of the highlights of Bangkok, and it's very themed: each level has a different place theme, such as Paris or Rome or San Francisco, and the restaurants are pretty varied. However, eating at a restaurant, they charge you 16-17% on VAT and "foreign taxes"...which should just be included in the VAT. Thus, they overcharge you quite a bit. My enjoyment of the mall took a pretty big hit when it become obvious how much of a moneygrab their stuff is. The taco place we ate at didn't even list on their menus that they did this.Other than that, though, if you're considering going here for the scenery or to see a very reasonably-priced 180-baht movie on the sixth floor, I absolutely recommend it. You can also get free wifi that lasts for a year if you go to the service desk on the Paris or Rome floor and show them your passport/driver's license. :)

Great shopping and dining for tourists. Conveniently located just in front of Asok BTS interchange with MRT. Since we were staying at Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit, we went there a few times as the hotel and Terminal 21 is connected by overhead bridge.The lower floors have the usual international chains. My favorite is 3F Istanbul Floor which has Thai brands such as Merimies bag, Kiss Me Doll scarf, a cosmetic shop near escalator selling a few shelves of Mistine products alongside with other brands, Beauty Cottage and Jelly Bunny.At the basement Caribbean floor, there is Taokaenoi Land, where I got my Pocky souvenir, Green Day crispy fruits, Tao Kae Noi seaweed and some other Thai snacks. Sometimes the pricing can be cheaper than Big C. There is also gourmet market and some other food stalls as well. Boots and Watson is a bit small so I prefer the ones at Times Square nearby.The higher floors are mostly restaurants and food court. Wide selection of food to suit the needs of all ages. Tourists can register at customer service at Paris floor at BTS level to get tourist card and a Tao Kae Noi seaweed. But do note that some privileges in the tourist card like free flipflop at Merimies and free cotton bag at Taokaenoi Land are not honored which can be quite frustrating especially when I faced the cashier who is quite rude at Taokaenoi Land on 21 Jun ard 1pm. Can also show passport for a free wifi ID and password that is valid for one year. Tourist spending above 3000 baht can get a Naraya pouch with Terminal 21 label. 1 pc per day.It's definitely a great mall for tourist and family!

Cool shopping centre with decent food court . Yet another Bangkok mega shopping centre where you'd easily spend hours. More high end than MBK but bargains can be found. Every level has country theme, cute idea. Great supermarket in basement level for thai foods.
Nice mall. Small but had a few good places to shop.. Interesting concept of having each different floor representative of a different city/country. Best shopping to be found in Istanbul ;)

Great shopping experience!. I lover Terminal 21! It's a great shopping Centre with a range of goods from international and local designers. Easily accessed from Asok BTS station, it also has an excellent food hall on the top level using pre purchased cards. Economical & delicious! I never miss out on at least one trip to Terminal 21 when visiting Bangkok.

Found everything I was looking for. Great place to shop, eat and attend a movie. This was our second visit to the city and we went to the shopping area many time. We ate dinner twice at the Taco cafe and went to a new release movie. We love going here and will go again before we leave the area. Food types from around the world.

Shopping mall over about 6 floors. Convenient near to BTS and the hotel I was staying at so ventured in, it has a few western shops. The rest all seem to be individual sellers like market traders where you can pick up something different Didn't venture into the food court so can't comment but did visit the cinema which was good although the trailers are so long before the film starts

A great variety of restaurant choice. This mall is just like a huge food court, you can find a lot of restaurant here, but with very few choice for shopping, at least not for my type. I will only recommend traveler to go there for food rather than shopping. The shops there are mainly for teenagers.

Brilliant place to shop, eat and cool down!. We never anticipated to spend much if any time in malls but they are a sanctuary from the heat. Terminal 21 is worth a visit even if it's just to use the toilets. Each escalator is like you are departing to different city and each floor is themed, Tokyo, London, Rome and so on. Head to the food hall on the 2nd floor to the top for authentic Thai food. You get a card and top it up then scan as you buy your meal. If you have credit left take it to the desk and they will refund you.

Interesting mall!. The mall has different themes for each floor which was really interesting. It's right next to the Asok BTS station and had the money exchange office just right outside the entrance, which made everything even more convenient. Restrooms were clean and had nice decoration. Oh, don't forget the foodcourt. It would be a shame if you missed its foodcourt. Inexpensive, yummy and offer all kinds of Thai cuisine.
Be Careful - This Place is Huge. A lovely mall with some nice shops and very well set out. If you love shopping then this is the place to visit in Bangkok!

Inexpensive foodcourt. This is a nice shopping mall right next to the Asok BTS station.I was surprised to find out that they had an inexpensive foodcourt ,similar to MBK foodcourt, on the fifth floor. I had trouble finding the foodcourt because I had to pass by many expensive restaurants on the same floor. It is situated right at the end after the escalators. It is modern and air-conditioned and inexpensive because it's situated in a tourist area.You have to pay by coupon and I bought my oysters omelette for around 50 baht. What a steal.
Georgeus mall.. Really good mall. Each floor have different theme. And their toilet also attracting in each floor. Food lover also love their food court. Even my friend eat 5 plate here. Amazing.

HUGE Mall. The biggest mall I as an Australian have ever seen! It was probably about 8 levels high with 20 different elevators. It is easy to get to on the BTS Sky Train, 2 mins from Asok station. Easy to get lost here however, we shopped for 4-5 hours! There are themes for most levels; men's, women's, jewelry, food etc!
Fun shopping . Near by BTS asok, many other shops and food vendors around. Food court in terminal 21 is various and price reasonable. County hopping design very interesting.
Shopping mall with nice themes. Each floor has its own theme. Themed after popular cities all over the world like Tokyo, London, etc.

Another new BKK concept mall - with a country theme for each floor. Visitors by now would know Bangkok is great for food and shopping. Terminal 21 just added to that! Many shops occupy the floors and eateries are strategically scattered as well to cater to hungry tummies and tired feet. There is a food court available for those who prefer variety. And of course, the Thais are just great cooks, to say nothing of their most palatable cuisine! Enjoy the mall.

Sadly disappointed . All the photos and the hype made this place look and sound amazing unfortunately in person it does not live up to its reputation. Yes it does have some fantastic little Thai designer shops on some floors but I also found these shops else where at a much more reasonable price. The draw card is supposed to be going to a different country each floor but it just does not do it justice in person ! The only highlight ( for my husband anyway) was having to read how to use the toilet?

Average mall. I really like the concept of the mall where every floor has a different theme e.g. London, Tokyo etc. However the stores on every floor is not really related to its theme, rather disappointing. Things being sold are meh with mid range to slightly expensive prices. Nothing unique

Superb interesting concept mall. It is an unique concept mall with the design of country city each floor, London, Japan, Istanbul, San Francisco etc. I was surprise that they even design the toiler to match with the country theme each floor.
Fancy, classy, modern. Very fancy with theme for each floor. Good variety of shops with reasonable price. Close to a lot of good accommodations. Have a nice food court on top floor.

Mall And more. Another Mall but very big and so many shops and food places. But what is interesting is every floor is set up wit things from a different country. So there are plenty of storage things to see as well as shop and eat .
Interesting Idea

Shopping is fun. we loved the mall. lots of various items on every shop. price is also reasonable. good place for hangout. The mall interior is based on terminals which makes this place more interesting. It's near to the Asok station and also sky train is just attached with this mall.
great for last min shopping. variety of shops to buy gifts and books for your loved ones back home even for yourself. loved to bookshop and the Japanese 60baht store.

Good shopping mall. Cheap food court and great selection of independent stores. Well thought out location of shops - mainly grouped together by a common theme (eg. Men's, women's, electronic, chain stores, etc). Connected to Asok BTS station.

Shopping galore!!!. If you are in need of shopping therapy, Terminal 21 is the place to be.It has most of all shops, shops, shops and you can get almost anything between them.Terminal 21 also has an endless selection of restaurants, food court type stalls and cafes so you won't go hungry anytime soon.Great place to be if you need shopping therapy.

Cool as mall to get away from the heat. Liked the theme too. I hate citys but coming here was actually ok. Cool themed floors and the clothes etc were actually pretty cheap compared to all the other malls nearby, I was impressed. Food court is pretty choice too with lots of cheap food, but good luck finding a table. Some cool breakdancing was happening on the weekend and more events as well. Cinema upstairs has good movies too. Spent a bit of time here :)

Fascinating to explore - unique shopping experience . Located at the intersection of Asok BTS station stop and Sukhumvit Metro station. An interesting concept mall - an 'airport terminal' that has a different country theme on each floor. We went crazy exploting the toilets on each floor as we heard so much from friends about how it matches the country theme. We were not disappointed. My favourite was the traditional Japan toilet and London underground. Seriously. It looks like the train has arrived and you have to 'mind the gap'. Plenty to eat and shop. We hardly shopped. Just exploring the mall decor (and toilets!) was enough. We squeezed in a heavenly royal foot massage from an shop on the 6th floor (same floor as the movie theatre) and it was worth every baht. The whole family fell into restful snooze during the massage. The recliners we were sitting on was so soft and comfy it was like sleeping on a puffy cloud. Remember to schedule it in. They are busy but they take in reservations up to 10pm everyday. So don't miss out. We also caught a movie while at the mall. We were staying at the hotel next door so we took in a late movie. Everyone stood up to the Thai National Anthem before the start of each movie showing - a really unique Thai experience. There was a food fare at the main entrance of the mall the week we were there. So much macaroons & pies & desserts from small businesses was on show for purchase - too many to choose from - and Yakun (from Singapore) also had a booth there. The mall also boasted the tallest / longest escalator. The mall is a must do stop if you are at Bangkok.
Price. Clothes compare to pauitium mall a bit higher. But crowd seems to be lesser and shop also lesser than pauitium mall.

An interesting place to see a little of every famous places in the world. Terminal 21 is one of my favourite mall to hang out in Thailand as there is good AC and the items sold are in good price with good quality. The price is not as low as in MBK but the quality of the items sold are higher than those in MBK. Also, the AC is great plus the bathroom. A lot of choices in food court as well. Nice to spend 3-4 hours here.
Food court is awesome. Go up to san fran level food court. Food is cheap. Mango shakes only 30 baht....try gyoza for 30 baht also its the best

Food stopage. If you ever be in bangkok , please arrive in this place as it is the ultimate stop for foods . This mall have a food court and every floor represents symbols for a respective country . You get every thing of a respective country in that particular floor .

Good food court!. The food court is the best about this mall! Several levels only with food!The selection of clothing brands was not particularly good, but quite okay. Easy access with subway and Skytrain stations in adjecent to the mall.
Nice Mall with Cinema. Each floor is uniquely designed and themed.Has a cinema.Has a connecting bridge to BTS station.Lots of food and a food court.International and local designer brands.

Gimmicky mall with an identity crisis. Each of the several floors in this mall is themed to a different city around the globe, a nice unique approach to a mall, however the shop brands within the cities just don't match the city they're in, which makes it a bit random for me. London, for example, has a few objects placed around the mall floor to symbolise London, such as old fashioned red phone boxes or so called queens guards.However the actual stores are not British, nor are they selling things you buy specific to London.There are some international brands, mostly on the ground entry level but otherwise mostly small thai clothing shops within their randomly placed citiy streets.I estimate upto half of this mall is either food outlets or electronics and cinema. While it was the only mall i visited in bkk, i cannot imagine it represents the best place to shop, theyre surely must be better malls without the gimmicky theme in close proximity.It should be said the mall was very clean and tidy, it also had a tourist information map point which is useful.
Good but hip hop band on. Real Shame cos so nice usually, Saturday just too noisy from band on the lower grand floor, which you could hear loudly everywhere

Excellent shopping, sensory overload in a great way. Very cool, very big building full of neat stuff. Spend an afternoon and make it to the top to get a feel for all of the "countries". Tons of dining throughout but we found several places we liked on the higher floors.

Nice mall!. Typical Asian mall which is built skyward not outward...six stories with each level being a different world location, lots if neat shoppes and stores, many places to eat and drink. Nice to rest and relax in the a/c away from the exhausting Bangkok heat.

Interesting mall, not too huge but sufficient to shop. located just beside Asoke BTS, the mall is not huge but every floor have it own themes(istanbul, tokyo, san francisco, london..). concept of airport, all the staffs are wearing as pilot or air stewardess. there are plenty of small shops and certain floor which quite interesting.at the 5th floor, the flood court is full of peoples. the pricing is very reasonable and some even lower than those selling at street. And the food is taste and good too! There are many restaurant at the same floor.Highly recommended for visit!

Lots of places but not too big. This is an average mall. It has lots of shops and a small supermarket on the basement floor.Its not too big so you can navigate it easily enough. Lots of brand name shops so you pay a little extra but you know you arent getting a copyAttached to the BTS and Subway system via Asok station.If you want to get money exchanged go outside the mall to Asok station and they have better rates but also long queues.

Every floor is an adventure. Terminal 21 made each floor a destination such as istanbul, london, tokyo and etc. each floor toilet is also themed. they have many shops and some unique ones but the prices are almost like what you get in Malaysia shopping mall.

It has everything. Great place if it's a hot day or even raining for shopping and also eating has 2 floors of all kinds of places to eat, some fantastic Japanese food and ice creams shops plus the rest of the place is a giant shopping centre, well worth a visit and easy to get to from Ashok BTS station or Sukhumvit MRT station

Reasonable Price for Lunch. Food court of here is such a paradise for office workers at Asoke since the price is very very low but the quality is great. It would be better if the department store has counter cosmetic brands provided and more big clothes shops other than H&M.

Travel around the world in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is a travel theme retail mall with each floor being dedicated to a city.Divided into 9 Cities in 9 floors.Terminal 21 links BTS Skytrain and Bangkok Metro with skywalk, at Asok Station and Sukhumvit Station making it a very convenient destination. Don't forget to visit the food court Pier 21.The best place to try Thai food.

Nice med to high end mall. Located at the BTS terminal, this is a nice mall to shop. The 3 storey elevator is not commonly seen and the various themes on each floor (London, Istanbul etc.) add to some good shopping exp. Try out the loo on the Istanbul level :)
Shopping Mall. It's a shopping mall that offer the usual essentials and eateries. Terminal 21, therefore the interiors are designed like a airport terminal.

A well structured mall. Terminal 21 is one of those malls that is built around a theme and here the theme is the famous tourist countries in the world. Each floor represents the shops and cuisine of that place be it Rome, Istanbul, France, London etc. There is even a gourmet market on the ground floor which is excellent. At least visit to experience the feel and vibe of the mall.
Another Airport?. My first time here. Delightfully surprised. Airport terminal themed is wonderful. Surely the top dog in terms of WC Management for a Mall.

Shopping heaven. Terminal 21 is easily accessed by the sky train or on foot. Fantastic multi level shopping arcade each level themed to a different city. Excellent facilities, both up market and cheaper shopping options and an amazing choice of food outlets. A must see!

A stylish mall with some very good food outlets. This mall has many, many retail outlets on its several floors. There really is something for everyone. It also has some excellent food outlets. Well worth a visit for retail therapy, people watching, some food - or simply a cool down from the Bangkok humidity.

Expensive. Well this mall is our pick up and drop point of our hotel shuttle. The mall consists of 6 floors with each floor representing different countries. We only visited their food court on 5 floor in which KFC offers Halal food and their cinema at 6 floor. On ground floor their are a lots of small eateries offering delicious cakes, muffins, ice creams and shakes. Overall a good mall to kill some spare time.

City Themed Mall. Location: just off Asok BTSLayout: each floor is based on a city/country theme with shop layouts/designs as the city/country. Lots of small shops in each floorTop floor has cinema hallGood place to hangout/shop/chillNegative - no shops for maternity/infants/toddlers etc.

So what's the hype about?. So what's the hype about? There is nothing new or jaw dropping here - another shopping centre. The service staff at the information counter was not helpful at all, in fact, rude!

I can't stop visiting here. Everything travelling to Bangkok sure will spend sometime in this shopping centre. everything is available here foods, cloths, local product and so on .. great location and easy access by BTS and Taxi.

Just another shopping mall with airport theme.. The only speciality is none other than their toilet. High tech, with various city themes.Branded and international brands which is nothing really special to me.
huge complex mall. Wish i had more time to explore around. One thing for sure it's a big place, movie cinema at top level. Lots of eateries options to choose from.

Favorite mall. Terminal 21 is a very huge mall right in the center of Bangkok. A great spot with country themes for each floor. Modern, very clean and well organized. A good place to get away from the street chaos. 5th floor features many cheap food options! (Weekends very busy)
Good food court at Terminal 21. We had lunch at Terminal 21 and the food was cheap and yummy. Terminal 21 is a good mall next to Asok Metro Station.
Coolest Mall!. A huge mall with themes for each floor. Great modern spot to get away from the street hustle. still busy but many food options!

Wow. This place is amazing! I was surprised by how big it was and how many different shops and restaurants there were. we had been told to go here by my dad and sister. we decided to go for a look as it was too hot outside. It was lovely and cool. Definitely recommend going here, even if just for a look around and some air-con

A very entertaining shopping experience for a discerning value seeker. No, it is not mutually exclusive that you yearn for quality yet wish for a bargain! If you like my family desire good value but higher quality goods ranging from emporium presents, designer T shirts, this that and every thing, nicely presented in an interesting environment than Terminal 21 is a must visit. The mall has a nice concept where each of six seven floors each have an international feel - so for example, ground would be Italian, and second floor British and so on. But once the missus heads to the shopping I head straight to the food court in the basement, and partake exotic variety of snacks from sushi to rice puddings to all kinds of global cuisine. What a blast of nice experience.

One of the nice Shopping Mall in Bangkok. Mall has many options of Local Brand's shops which have nice products with reasonable prices.. Food court for everyone's taste and than you can enjoy Cinema Complex on the Top Floor..

Great for a raindy or an incredibly HOT day in Bangkonm. Full sevice shopping and entertainment Mall from LHMH group----the mall has diverse food options from tacos to local delights. Good food court with low prices too.And a Cinema on the top floor.

Interesting centre. The design of this building is very interesting. It is easy to see different countries' styles on each floor. I had much fun taking selfie in the WC because the design is so unique. You can also enjoy savoury food at very affordable price on the 6th floor (the food court is called "Pier 21") and the taste of fresh fruits there is so amazing. But shopping there is not a good choice. There are many designers but not much impressive and too pricey. You can hardly see internationally popular brands there but H&M, Nike, Adidas,... Overall, it is a good experience at Terminal 21 if you visit Bangkok.

Interesting Design. Each level are of a different country. Looks and feel of a international terminal. Toilet design are different for each level. Lots of shopping but not for those looking for cheap buys. Pier 21 which is the food court is packed with people.

Great Food Court. Excellent food court with lots of choices. Great portions with very fair prices. Must try their coconut ice-cream. "Tom Yam Kung" also very nice. Better go there before or after office lunch time to avoid time consuming on finding seats.

high end shopping. if you want to shop for branded stuff this is the place to be. Large H&M store. prices are good. MAC store is awesome and Victoria Secret. Picked up lovely guess bags at very good prices at guess store.
Impressive. . Great location, centrally located in downtown Bangkok. Good shopping opportunities, great food court.

Nice shopping malls with not only branded shops but also Thailand based local stores and shops. That's the first shopping mall I visited during my travel in Thailand. It is pretty fun with different themes on every single floors! Such as Japan / San Fransisco / Istanbul / London... With different themes there are different kind of stores and shops. I strongly recommend people to go there if u fancy some local products and there are lots of bargains. Even tho it is a shopping mall, you can still bargain with them. There is a floor with many men's clothing so I am sure gentelmen won't get too bored there. :) There are also food court with many different kinds of restaurants!

Great food court. I got a recommendation for the food court here from an expat living in the area. I went to the food court on the lower level where it is mostly street food options (apparently a lot of the food vendors formerly at Chatachuk have relocated here). There were so many choices - it really was a feast for the eyes (and stomach!) - and the food was soooo good! The shopping center itself has a quirky design with each floor themed in line wiht an an international city (London, Instanbul, San Francisco...) and there is a very nice movie theater on the top floor that shows Hollywood (English language) movies if you are looking for a break from the city. I wasn't really there for the shopping but there seemed to be a decent selection of shops - mostly local fashion stores - with prices in the mid-range.
Lovely design. Great location. Adorable world wide inspired design. ♡ the food & beauty salons. Cinema also available.

Best price for Quality Shopping. The Sales are on, but better than those at Emporio. This place is middle range fashion. Great selection and prices.It's also got Tops Market if you need Western food for you to take home.

Good location and convenient!!. Terminal 21 is good for indoor shopping, price was average range low to high !!! I like the concept n decor !!! Food court of terminal 21 is cheaper price n good potions compare to others shopping mall food court !!! Is link to asok station , how convenient was it !!! Do hav lots of hotels around !!! Highly recommend!!!

Nice mall with trendy shops and affordable food court. This is a surprise. For families with young children, ie need to breast feed or change diapers, the toilet is spacious and clean.Different floors have a specific theme and the merchandise are more trendy than what you can find in Platinum Mall or Chatuchak Market. Prices are also not much higher. Local Thai designers showcasing their ware.According to a local, the owner wants authentic Thai street food in the food court (level 5), hence he charged low rental to the hawkers which translates into low food price. You can have chicken rice for 30 to 40 Baht.Cheap doesn't mean it is not good, the food is better than what we had in the food courts of Siam Paragon, Platinum Mall and street hawker. We tried 6 dishes.Their mango sticky rice is a must.The mall is next to BTS Asok. We will revisit if we return to Bangkok.
Varieties of shops. This mall is conveniently located next to BTS station and have wide range of shops. I particularly enjoyed buying essential oils of good quality at reasonable price.

Fabulous scenery, movie theatre and food court!. Try the gyoza and lemon sauce in the food court!!! Super affordable and amazing. Clothes shopping here is comparable to usa or canada no deals to be found but very cool place! Themed floors and movies and yummy gyoza and other treats make it a great adventure!

Mall of everything :). Basically you can get anything here from the stall outside the road.Price will be slightly higher. But what we dislike - the shop is close around 9.15pm already, be prepare to shop before that timing

Interesting Centre. Great range of different shops on the upper retail floors. Lots of little quirky shops. Overall prices and quality seemed good.Top floor has a large food court where you buy a coupon then go and select your choice. Great value and huge choices available

Surprisingly good. Not being a shopper, my wife and I actually went inside to get some ac and a coffee and I must admit, the place was very impressive. It has 8 floors (I think) and each floor represents a different country. It was reminiscent of a Las Vegas hotel., which is to say lavish, over the top, but done with one of a kind style. Good prices, plenty of selection and good food. Place is spotless.

cool concept but some shops selling same things. This is a nice spacious shopping mall. I liked that each floor was themed. The food court was very busy so we ended up eating at one of the restaurants that were on the same floor instead.The only issue for me was that the 2 floors of "designer" shops were no more cheaper than back in the UK. Also, some of the shops were just selling the same stuff as each other. We did manage to buy a couple things as there were some unique shops too.If you went to the cinema complex here you could easily spend all day here!

Loved the concept. Escalators taking you up to flights leaving for - Paris, Tokyo, San Fransisco, London. Each floor has a theme depending on the City that we arrive at. The bathrooms are totally unique depending again on the City. Good branded stores, and affordable clothes available from small stores lining the "streets" of the city. Good fun.

foodcourt is still cheap , clean, great!. Mango smoothie, duck with rice, and two ice cream cones...90 THB! A little too much luxury stores, which aren't useful to me since it's all cheaper in the US.

Big Shopping Mall with Famous Destinations Touch. Visited this mall in 2014. You will not feel boring in this shopping mall. Airport like setting and miniatures of world famous destinations. You can shop, eat and kill your time.
Shopping centre. Interesting shopping centre, very large with many floors. Restaurants on each floor. Each floor is country or city themed. Worth a visit of you want to do some shopping.

Our Favorite for Lunch. My wife and I spent several weeks in Bangkok and we would go to Terminal 21 at least three times a week for lunch and just browsing around. There are many restaurants to choose from and we were not disappointed. Since I am a tourist, I found the phone shops on the 6th floor very helpful in obtaining a sim card and wireless service.The design is quite unique as compared to other shopping malls as you can see from the internet photos. I would recommend Terminal 21 for anyone visiting Bangkok.

My favorite Shopping Mall in Bangkok. Amazing shopping mall with fantastic prices! You can buy whatever your wish or eat anything! You could also watch a movie on the top floor! Adding different city names is a nice touch with different things hanging from the roof all of the time! From gigantic Hot Air balloons to The Golden Gate Bridge! As I said! My favorite shopping mall in Bangkok!

The world in one place!. One of the most unusual mall I've seen.. Huge place with an airport like setting, with each floor as a different city.. Istanbul, Tokyo, London.. Various restaurants and shops to bid time with.

Favourite place to shop for local designer goods . This is the best place to shop for mid-market Thai designer clothes and leather goods. Rather than buying fakes at Silom, get authentic Thai designs that are of good quality here. The only problem buying clothes in Thailand is getting anything plus-size. And if you're hungry, there is a wide variety of food on offer to replenish your energy for more shopping.

My Favourite Shopping Centre Bangkok. This is my favourite Shopping Centre in all of Bangkok. It is in a good area and has so much to choose from. The food there is always great and prices are not too bad either.

Street food prices, highest quality, great variety. In the top floor, air conditioned, well lit and clean, this food court offers a change to taset--again and again--a wide variety of fersh cooked foods at street food prices. the setting, decor, atmosphere are very welcoming and with clean rest rooms and no rush, this centrally located to rapid transit is a great spot to relax.

10/10 coolest mall ever. Terminal 21 is a shopping experience. It's has your general run-of-the-mill stores, but they're all organized into different themes from different countries an travel destinations. As well as major brands, they have boutique local brands and handmade wares, as well as some really unique products. The food court is extensive and the shopping is a delight. I've never genuinely enjoyed going to a shopping Centre as much as Terminal 21.

Different themes for different levels . Will make it a point to visit this mall since its near Healthland Spa. Always enjoy the pharmacies at the basement as we can easily compare prices between Boots and Watson. You can easily get medication for acne over the counter. This mall is filled with their local designer shops eg: Geraffee @ level 1. You can also get the famous Number 1 Thai milk tea from a stall inside the supermarket.

Best overall mall for everything.....perfect location.. It's a huge mall..like 6 or 7 levels. The best thing I enjoy as a tourist is two sectors of the mall. The 5th floor food court (opens at 10AM) is the best deal for clean local style food. There are many stalls/vendors selling everything from fruit smoothies to Chinese soups to Thai dishes. Expect this food court to be always busy. You go to the cashier counter first and pre-load your card with whatever amount of money you wish. I found that 200 baht was more than enough for each person. Just go to whatever food stall that interest you and order. Present your card and the amount will be deducted from your pre-loaded card. I think they even have a KFC up there for those that are not inclined to eat Asian food. When finished with your meal/meals, just go back to the cashier counter and get back whatever amount that wasn't used. The other place I like is the 'Gourmet Market' in the basement. Here you will find quality items for sale from Thai Curry mixes to Thai candies/snacks for you to bring back as gifts from your trip to Bangkok. Everything is just a little pricey but the quality is tops. They even have a small deli/fresh fruit section for those that wish to take out a lunch. The location for Terminal 21 is at the crossroads of two public transportation systems. Asoke station on the BTS (elevated trains) or Sukhumvit station on the MRT (subways).

Good cheap food. Great mall to visit with the best deals for food. You need to get a terminal 21 card at one of the kiosk up on the top floor and put money into it. Then go and enjoy the cuisine there. Give your card and they swipe it to take credit off. Fast, efficient way of getting food. Cheap food and drinks and very clean. We enjoyed the rice and cashew platter 30 bahts and along with a banana and mango smoothie 37 bahts. It sure filled you up for less than $3 Canadian dollars. You can't beat the prices at all. Also, the mall itself is a great place to see with every level as a different major city. Great place to cool off (AC) and relax and also shop if you want too. I highly recommend.

Nice layout . I loved the themes of each level, the male greeters dressed as pilots and the ladies dressed as flight attendants. Good facilities and a good food hall, I spent a few hours here browsing the multitude of shops
Good !. Always nice....walking around and looking after what can we find who's not nearby european....also very good to escape for a while of the heat! You should go and have a look !
Nice mall for young people. Shop are quite difference with some large and grand shopping center in town, sperate the section by difference major cities, really can spend some time in T21.
Funny . Very funny shopping mall, it's made as a airport terminal. It's possible to find big and famous shops but also smaller and typical one

Wow Great place for locals and tourists . At first I thought this was touristy gimmick again composing of non Thai food aka international food but if you go up to the food court in the 5th floor there is some authentic stuff for really cheap! I've eaten all over Bangkok and actually notice that mall food is actually pretty darn good in the court! It has ac and is cleaner than the street area. They use cash cards to dine for sanitary reasons. This one is special because it actually has napkins and a nice area for drinking water... Just Bring your own bottle! Tip go early at 10am because it is 11am now and the court is filling up. Don't buy at the other floors because those are pricier international food/ fusion Thai

Great food court!. The shopping experience was interesting as there were several floors and each floor was dedicated to a world city: London, Tokyo, Istanbul etc. The shopping itself was mediocre if you've already been to those countries. However the thing I loved about this mall is the 5th floor food court! Oh my there is plenty of food stalls to choose from and they are so cheap! It's like eating Thai street food but in a hygienic environment! The food is so cheap like $1-2 USD per plate. The portions are quite small but it's great so you can try different food stalls. I highly the clam deep fried omelette, coconut ice cream, fruit smoothie, chinese roast duck stall, pork and egg stew dish, anything and everything! You pay at the cash counter and top up a card with any amount then give your card to the vendors as "payment". You can refund the full amount when you're done, no deposits or handling fees etc.There is also a Michelin star award winning dim sum called Tim Ho Wan and the food is delicious! Great way to try the award winning restaurant for an affordable price.The mall has free wifi when you show your passport to the information desk. It is also conveniently connected to Asoke BTS sky train.

Shopping, Eating and Entertainment. Terminal 21 is attached to Asok BTS station. That is, one of entry/exit gate of Asok station leads to Terminal 21 entry/exit with just 10 steps. As I stayed very close to this mall, visited the mall few times. The speciality of the mall is in each floor you will find one country/region specific food stalls plus shopping stores. Apart from this most items are sold and the prices are almost of the outside markets. Bargaining is available especially for mobile phones that are sold in open areas. In top of the mall, cinemas are there for entertainment.

Impressive concept . The idea of turning a mall into different level with different concept is my major reason of returning. There are Hollywood in the top floor, Tokyo in 2nd level, Paris in 3rd level and etc. Aside of the decoration around the shops, the deco inside toilet matches the theme and it amazed me. Kudos to the mall designers.

Very good. Each level has got its own theme I like the idea . It's a very busy mall as well good for picture opportunities . Don't miss out the Istanbul area lots of nice souvenir items and accessories for women . Only down side in some part is very noisy because some shops are using microphone and those ladies been talking so loudly like we are on the street market. Hope the mall manager stop this as its not really comfortable for the people who are shopping.
Shopping mall center . In the city close the area hangout nd bts (skyline) also mrt (metro) easy connect to other places. Upstairs have cinema and many restaurants here.

Thematic mall; fun afternoon!. New(-looking) mall with a good variety of international & local brands; every floor has a different theme (Rome, London, Istanbul,...) => many photo opportunities (think red double-deck buses in London, the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco,...); nice detail: the toilets on each floor follow the floor's decoration; conveniently connected to both a metro and Skytrain station; a fun afternoon indeed!

Treat for the taste buds. What a spread!!! Variety of Asian, Oriental and Continental flavors to choose from. Spend your time with family in a relaxed mood. Take your time and eat at your leisure. Keep the food coming

SHOP TILL YOU DROP!. We are staying near by to the shopping centre so we popped in and i must say I was surprised I could be wowed by a shopping centre/mall I love how they've done the floors for different country's worth a visit is ya near by!

the foodcourt at the topfloor is the best & cheapest. we were shopping here, next to the BTS train station, we saw many people going to the top floor so we followed them, the whole floor is a food court, everything is so cheap there. the food we have is amazing, its basically street food put in a shopping mall with the cheapest price. everything there is clean and quality. its hard to find some street food in Bangkok these days. I think this mall have a very good concept how to keep it.

great pictures. A fun place to go when you want to beat the heat. It has some ok shops. The main reason most people go is for photos, each floor is themed in a different city. I did find some fun T shirt shops on the Japan level. A nice way to relax and stay out of the heat. Good for a couple hours of walking around, close to metro.
The creative department store. Every floors have a different country's culture decoration.We took a lot of photo,and spent whole day to shopping!
Suprise. Every floor has different theme. I was very impress by Japan floor. These are a lot of local brand, the price is reasonable. Food court in 5 floor was cheap with very good quality.
Very nice new place. Love the different level concept! It's a place for the young, hip and trendy. There is a very nice cineplex and we love the sound system in the theatre.

How was Terminal 21?. Hello guys, my name is MJ. I'm gonna review for that. Okay, first, the Terminal 21 is on sukhumvit street, actually near The Asok station. There is a theater on top of floors, and there are a lot of shops like bag or clothes. And there is lots of foods on B1 floor and you can see other country's foods but those things are expensive. And Terminal 21 is very cleanly and it has a lot of cleanly restaurants. It has a lot of services like a telegraph operators. You can buy a new phone because there are Samsung and Apple. So it's good for tourisms bye *MJ

Awesome mall!. This place is awesome for shopping with 2 young kids in tow. Spacious and every level selling different range of stuff. My husband and I were actually pushing both kids in 2 strollers while shopping there. We used to go Pratunum area for shopping but now after shopping here, although more pricy, quality is better too. Worth it. And can shop in comfort with 2 young kids. What more can I ask for?Also, highest level of T21 has a big food court and can dine in comfort with a great range of food. Have high chairs for kids too. All in all, is an awesome experience in this awesome mall!
Great concept. I loved this mall. Every floor have a different theme. The shops were interesting. Take lots of photos. Check out the food court. This mall is connected to Asoke BTS.

Amazing eateries. This is one of Bangkok's newer shopping malls, it is worthwhile just to go in and see thethemed floors and they stylish designs. There is a cinema which has the latest movies in english and a supermarket on the lower floor where I managed to get peanut butter ( addict can't have toast without it). Thee were a lot of brand shops and boutique dress shops. Had a nice time looking around

Nice mall with great restaurants. It is a nice mall to walk around. The best are the restaurants that are in it. If you don't find a restaurant in the area, go to the Terminal 21, there are all sort of cuisine and you feel safe with the hygien.

Shopping Mall with Skylink Access. New Mall in Bangkok with a lot of small shops /stores. Young designers and a lot of handcrafts. The architectural concept to install in each floor a different Terminal (airport designs) is great.Facit: a well accomplished design and concept

Not really special. This mall isn't as special as it is made up to be. Yes they have different themes for every floor but it's not that they sell those country products for that floor. It's just designed/styled that way but the products are mostly segregated by the floors (i.e. Clothing on first few floors, accessory on 4th floor, food on 5th & 6th floor etc).Not much branded products here but plenty of small stores at the corners if you want cheap products (but quality is usually not good).

Great food court at Terminal 21. Near Asoke Bts station, Terminal 21 offers great eating options apart from being a full fledged shopping mall. Many branded stores are housed. Nike have a good outlet. The main lobby at the Bts level has easy entry and exit with BTS Asoke station. There is an escalator which takes you to level 6-7 directly and is a great photo option. But be careful while taking selfies. The floors are marked like airport arrival zones giving the journey a different feel. The food court on the 2nd last floor on top has great options where you charge money on cards and then choose from numerous choices including Indian ones. One floor further up houses a cineplex which hosts new English movies. Hindi options are not there. There are many speciality restaurants also. A grocery store and wine store is hosted at the basement. Try it. Will not be disappointed. Overall

Another big mall for shoppers and close to major sky train junction Asok.. Its another mall with all kind of shops and food. The most tiring part is going to each & every part of mall as they are huge in structure.
A lof of creators. Our favorite mall. Not much big names but a lot of creators for good prices.Worth an exhaustive visit.The food court Pier 21 is a must for street Thai food.Highly recommended

Must visit. Unique and amusing mall.Your friends on snapchat will love you snaps from the mall.Each level is a visit to a country.Make sure to visit ech toilet on each floor. Not jocking you will be surprised and will syart taking more photos.Even the cleaners uniform is themedbased on the country level you are in.Must visit all levels ending with cinema.

Interesting Place. Definitely a must-visit when in Bangkok. The mall has been creatively made for tourists. It's a great place for tourists to visit and take pictures. The mall gives you a feel of what it's like to be in Japan, London, New York, Paris, Rome and more as each represents a different country and is designed accordingly.To get here, alight at Asok station from the BTS skytrain.

Different concept with many shopping options . This mall is right next to ashk BTS sky train and opp to soi cowboy . So full marks for location .If you want to shop and wants additional discount do this yet at the ground level for terminal tourist card for free.This mall has lot is shopping outlets and bargain deals

Quirky Shops & Affordable Food. Terminal 21 is known as the place with quirky decor and nice little shops selling thai designer fashion and with plenty to eat at affordable prices. Located at Asoke BTS, it's also known as the travel "themed" shopping mall where each floor is a destination and the escalators are your transporters moving you from place to place. Each floor is named after Rome, Paris, London, Istanbul, Tokyo, San Francisco .. it's all there .. not in that particular order.

Theme mall. Every level is a different place. Thought it was cute that the security guard salutes you as you walk in. Food court was decent. The papaya salad stand was always busy. I wanted to see more bargain stores but this is not the place. I would check it out if I was close but I wouldn't go out of my way.

City theme based Mall!. Terminal-21 is a City based theme Mall. Every floor has it's name i.e. London, SFO, Rome, Paris etc.This Mall is well connected through the BTS. The interior of the Mall is good and pleasant. There are shops, Food court, Theater.I visited this place 2-3 times in 4 Days. Overall a good place for shopping and food.
An interesting shopping center. Every level has a different theme from a country. An amazing shopping center to go visit for a look around.

Terminal 21 Mall. Terminal 21 Mall next of Asok BTS
Every thing you are looking is there.
Great food court at good price and quality!

Good mall in the city. This place is right at the BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit., very convenient.
It's great for food lovers and movies.
There are nice shops as well for shopping.
The best is toilets. They are clean and decorated different on each floors according to the theme of each floor.

Fun . I am no a fan of malls but I do love the concept of Terminal 21. Every floor is a particular destination (my fave is Istanbul) and I appreciate the attention to details given to its facade. The place is huge and clean, and strangely enough, I particularly enjoy each floor's themed toilets!

Wacky concept, fantastic stores. Ever wanted to visit Istanbul, Tokyo, Paris, Rome, London, San Fran, Hollywood and the Caribbean all in one day? This themed shopping mall is an absolute delight. As well as photo opps at every corner it also has an amazing escalator that jumps about four floors at once and loads of funky little boutiques. Best shopping mall ever.

Nothing Impressive. Right beside Asok BTS.
Apart from the 'international' theme decorations and customer service staffs dressed as air crew, there is nothing special here.
Clothes are not that cheap too.
Only interesting shop is Tao Kae Noi at basement 1.

Big, Bold, Beautiful... Someone has really applied their mind while building this beauty. Its a fabulous mall. You can practically find everything here in the comfort of air conditioning.Every floor is built upin a certain theme and the theme is based upon a city..You start with the Caribbean theme at the basement, move on to Rome, Paris,London, Japan, San Francisco etc etc. They have spent the top dollar while recreating the ambiance of the cities...Must visit. Just for the experience
Nothing to buy. I like a nice but expensive supermarket at the basement floor. That all. The rest of the mall is very crowded, overpriced shops, nothing to buy.

Cheap food court. We really enjoyed the food court and the themed mall. Every floor is a different city with little representations such as a mini Golden Gate Bridge and an oscars award. Great way to avoid the heat

Interesting shop with a great food hall. This is a little different to the normal malls as each floor is themed to a different location.There is a floor containing clothes shops themed as London with a red bus, underground station and street signs. Another floor has Roman statues for Italy and another has a light house for the Caribbean. The top 2 floors are themed as San Francisco complete with a mock up of the golden gate bridge and these contain the restaurants. We went to the top floor where there is a food court. First you go to the prepaid card counter where you decide how much you think you will spend and load the card with this amount. You then use this card at any of the various stalls selling mainly Thai and Chinese food. All the stalls looked clean and hygienic and most prepared the food freshly as you ordered. You then sit at any available table to eat your meal. Any money you do not spend is refunded when you return your card as you exit. You will struggle to spend £10.00 here on meals for 2 people including deserts and coffees or soft drinks. Probably not the best food available in Bangkok but the meals we had were very tasty and good quality/value for the cost. We would recommend the food court if you are in the area. The Mall is worth a quick look around for the themed areas but the shopping was similar to many other malls.

Thematic Mall near BTS &MRT. I stayed jus behind Terminal 21 mall, it's a vibrant mall with free Wi-Fi.. and well connected by BTS Asoke and MTS Sukumvit train station. The malls each is well designed with well known city theme..London,Paris,Tokyo,San Francisco..etc..there are plenty of Street foods available at the surrounding Streets of the mall. The mall has cineplex In it..at night it glitters with colourful screen and Decorative lights...and it's a nice to hangout at evening , I went twice to the mall jus to relax at the evening after tiring exhausted day trip...I would suggest that accommodation is cheaper around Sukumvit area...and is well connected with transportation system.

Unique shops . Each floor has their own theme (in terms of decoration and type of shops). It also seems that an apparel you see in one store does not appear in other stores there. This is my favorite mall, my second favorite is Siam Paragon. B2- supermarket, snack stores local dry food stores B1 - mainstream apparel stores1 - mainstream apparel stores 2 - local female apparel stores 3 - local male apparel stores 4 - restaurants5 - food court and restaurants

Nice shopping mall, the fod court is terrible.. It was a pleasant day at terminal 21, the shopping mall itself is nice and got many shops with different price ranges, the only really negative thing is the food court, I was expecting a lot from it because of the quality of this kind of restaurants in Thailand but, unfortunately the one a T21 is really really bad, I get a Fried rice with shrimp past and it was the worst in Thailand, and paid a terrible Thai Ice Tea over 30 THB. I'll go again at T21 but I'll never be again in this place for get some food at the food court.

Nice shopping mall. A mix of elegant and a boutique mall. Large range of shops and restaurants are available. The Terminal 21 has a superior location in the center of Bangkok city attractions with very easy access.

Sweet Meetings @ Sweet Recipe Terminal 21 Mall. It felt like one is taking off to various destinations around the world at Terminal 21, next to BTS Asoke. Pier 21 for everyday Thai aharn; Istanbul for shopping plus movies and of course Sweet Recipe for business meetings! One can station oneself there and arrange back to back appointments complete with great cakes, brownies and coffees. Truly a gem of a place as Kon Thai partners all share the same sweet tooth as many Singaporeans too! Such a happy ambience makes good business sense and here's the best part, prices are accessible. Great value for money and good for productive work for the busy business executive on the more and who needs great breakfast and coffee to perk up! Sweet deals are in at Sweet Recipe!

if your young. Terminal 21 focus is for the young market in pretty much all its retailing and they dont seem to offer much in way of cheaply priced goods. the shops are all the big mid low market brands with a few small specialty guys.I dont think its that interesting a mall and the food court queue for buying and cashing in coupons is always a mess
Fantastic department store. Good for shopping with cheap price. Recommend . I like this shopping mall. So near from my hotel. It's easy to find. It's connect with MRT and BTS train.

Nice cool respite with lots of food. We used the Terminal 21 mall as an escape from the heat, and a place to eat. There are TWO FLOORS of restaurants, with a "street food" area that is tough to beat! All in blessed air conditioning in the April heat (the hottest month in Bangkok).

Something Differnent. Above busy Sukhumvit Road and easy to get to as at the Asoke BTS Terminal and also Underground Station. This unusual mall is made up of floors each representing different international city. You need to go down the little lane ways on each level to discover artisans trying out their wares, many new designers or stall holders that have new and interesting products. More expensive than a market but you are in air conditioned comfort. Try out the food court which is clean and works on the pre purchased ticket system, cheap and good food.

Very nicely done. Very relaxing shopping center well laid out. A nice mixture of shops and restaurants. Even state of the art toilets with built in electronics loads of buttons... You have to go to understand what I mean. Very nice way to avoid getting noise and buzzle of Bangkok.

Interesting mall. This was a unique mall with each floor depicting a city and nice way to describe the elevators like an airport terminal. The floor itself was made similar culture of the city it is representing . There are some food outlets and good for window shopping
Go Shopping Around The World. Great Place Every Floor is Based on A Different Country. Definately worth a visit completely different to you're normal shopping centre.

Terminal 21 like no other terminal...so unique . My visit Thailand in 2015 I missed Terminal 21 but when I revisited Bangkok 2016; nope I make it a point be it riots or bomb explosion. I never gonna missed it tis time. I heard from a friend T21 very interesting concept mall awesome place to shop with amazingly different themes at different storeys. Remember to check out the toilets follow the country's theme so exciting. Definitely worth my visit spending whole day from 10am to 5pm wandering in a maze of shops.Unlike Platimum Mall or Platimum Fashion Mall so overcrowded, here at T21 unclattered not just your regular Mahboonkrong; rather a creative mall like travelling thru' major city of the world Rome, Paris, London, Istanbul, San Francisco and Hollywood L.A. So accessible take a BTS to Asoke as you stepped out next to the station right before your eyes a massive mall with a unique theme awaiting to delight you with a great shopping experience. I'd rather let you see for yourself -seeing is believing explore a diversity of shops in a make believe city where in reality no way you can do it in a day. So enjoy also the longest escalator ride.

Well Designed. I like the way they made this shopping mall looks like a airport terminal, and it does bring shoppers a new sensation. I like to have lunch here on the B1 and purchase some Thailand snacks home.
Amazing . Cinema shopping restaurants who could ask for more? Great and convenient location and close to the night life! Excellent!
Best for lunch !!!. Of course, this is a big shopping center. But, I usually visit here for lunch and dessert (Mango juice). Shops are not competitive, I think.If you are hungry, visit here !

Interesting concept mall. Interesting concept mall. Love the different themes at different levels and even the toilets have its own country theme. I think is better to shop here compare to other recommended BKK malls as it wasn't that crowded when we visited and product prices are affordable.
cool mall. Had a yummy meal in zeeds, interesting fun shopping mall, different country every level. Food court top level, all sorts of thai dishes very cheap.

Great Themed Mall and Great Food. Terminal 21 isn't exactly the cheapest mall you can visit in Bangkok but definitely worth a visit even if it was to see the amazing infrastructure of the center. Each level transports you into another part of the world London, Istanbul, Tokyo, Rome. It is unique and worth a visit. The shops themselves are not anything different from any other mall and are a little on the expensive side but overall it was a great experience. It is not as crowded as some of the other centers so it gives you a chance to have a look at things without being knocked around by the crowds. The food is another of the features of the mall. There is a vast number of great foods to chose from. Definite must see.
Trendy mall. Easy to access via BTS and you will find a lot of local fashion shop in each level with different theme. Must visit their food court at the top floor for cheaper and delicious food.
Check out the food court here!. Great food court with a variety of cuisines. Quality is similar to "street-food" without paying a whole lot more. Tasty pad-thai, mango sticky rice, and curries.
Great mall and cool themes!. Highly recommended if a few modern conveniences such as lattes and branded clothing items are needed while in the sukhumvit area!

Lots of food choices. This mall has lots of food. From food court to restaurants to cafes to booths with local Thai, Chinese, Western fare almost everything can be found here. I like that at the basement, there's a supermarket where you can get foodstuff & drinks (as I was staying near to Terminal 21 mall).

Nice Theme Mall Near Sukhumvit. We were staying at Ambassador Hotel and on a evening stroll we saw this imposing mall and ventured in.As a mall it was Ok with a mixture of local and international brands but what I loved about this mall was every floor had a different personality and based on a different city theme.The food courts were good and not too pricey and there's a BTS connect to it directly.

Food, Shopping, Cinema, AC....worth a visit. If you are staying in the Sukhumvit road area of Bangkok jump on the BTS to Asok and head into terminal 21. It is a big modern shopping maul with a large food court towards the top floors. The food court is very well priced and has a large selection of food options.On a side note if you are after real high end shops (D&G, Versace ECT) head one BTS stop further to Phrom Phong.

New mall with lots of food options. New tall mall with lots of food options at upper floors. Buzzing with people. Lively. great luxe supermarket at lower level. near the MRT and BTS stations, so a convenient place to get to.

Great foodcourt, amazing infrastructure!. Terminal 21 may not exactly boast the cheapest prices in Thailand and but it is definitely worth going only to see the amazing interior infrastructure of the mall. Each floor transports you to another region of the world and you travel while being in a mall. A very innovative concept indeed. Furthermore, Terminal 21 has hands down, one of he best foodcourts that I have ever been to- extremely cheap food (AMAZING noodle soup for only 30 Baht!) as well as a great variety of food to choose from! And the fact that it is literally next to a BTS is definitely an added advantage especially for tourists and it is very easy to catch a Tuk-Tuk nearby! A walk outside Terminal 21 and you can find great massage parlours.

Just another shopping center. We expected more from this experience and if you are tentative, I'd suggest you rather go to Siam Paragon as I think you'll have a better experience over all and have more stores to choose from The decor is interesting, but isn't worth making the trip just to see the "themed" levels. The other shops are so-so and many don't allow you to try clothes on before purchasing and you can get better service and bargains elsewhere.
good foodcourt!. good foodcourt!decent shops, but not as cheap as i would have expected in bangkok considering that half the world's things are manufactures in thailand and neighbouring countries

amazing concept and design, great food. Of the many malls in Bangkok, this one is certainly worth a visit, be it only for its unique layout that features characteristics of famous cities such as London, Tokyo, San Francisco and Rome on each floor. Not to mention the wide range of eateries.

good foodcourt. there are several foodcourt in this mall base on diffrent culturesyou can find japanese restaurants , english foods and etc ,you can find fast foodsbut if you are lookinng for thai food with cheap price , you also can find a food court in this mall for that toilets are clean.the variety of brands is not much here , there is a good cinema in the last floor

Best coffee for the price in Bangkok!. We enjoyed the best coffee we had in Bangkok at Coffee Corner - located on the 5th floor food court at Terminal 21. Americano coffee was just 25 baht (70 cents) and Iced Mocha was just 35 baht (1 dollar). Coffee was much better than Starbucks, Amazon, Coffee, Tea, and Leaf, or any other coffee place we went to in Bangkok! We went there everyday while we stayed near at Terminal 21- the coffee was so good and so cheap!!!

The best Mall . Really loved Terminal 21 the most out of all the Bangkok malls I went to. It's a lot less cluttered than MBK. All the different themes really add to the atmosphere. Istanbul level was the best for me but Paris was also beautiful I went back to this mall 3 times in 3 days just because it was calmer. Really do recommend it

Cheapest food court. This place has amazing food court ! I put 300 baht on the prepaid card for 4 people and I literally had to buy way too much food and had a problem how to spend it all. A main dish only cost 20 to 50 baht. I had a really good pad Thai for 30 baht. Beware because it's cheap, the lines are long. Worth it though if you are in a tight budget.

Highly recommended shopping centre . This shopping centre was quite close to our hotel so we decided to visit (after we had been to Siam Paragon, Siam Centre and Bangkok fashion outlet); this turned out to be a much better shopping experience than all the rest. Others were very high/low end where either you are priced out or don't like much on offer. Here the mix of stores and the layout is unique. Besides the usual suspects (branded) there is a host of local non branded but high quality and attractive design at reasonable prices. Plenty of food options too and next to Asok Sky train for getting there conveniently. As well some really great restaurants within walking distance outside.

Unique Toilets, Delicious and Cheap Foods. Everytime I've been to Bangkok I always went here. The foods at Pier 21 on 6th level are good and cheap. I always order pad thai, mango sticky rice, and vegetable omelette rice. Out of malls in Bangkok it's the cheapest and delicious foods.And I love it's toilet! Each level has different theme and it's clean.

Interesting Concept Mall. This mall is interesting as it make it feel like you are in the airport. Each level will show which country you are at and there are different theme.Came here more than 6 times when i was in bbk for business trip. This place is near the LRT station and I always enjoy finding some quality restaurant food here. Last trip at March I tried the chabuton ramen here too.All in all, a nice place to shop where there are many international brand wears.

accidentally found the place, pretty sweet mall. It was a great mall, nice shops, a big food court, the whole thing looks great. It's nice if you have some time to spend or if it's raining. There are enough taxi's to take you home

Very interesting. A unique shopping mall with a nice and different design. A lot of small stores with cheap options as well, hundreds of T-shirts made in Thailand plus some known brands.I found an external hard drive in a good price in a discount area downstairs but i was informed that there is no tax refund cause of discounted price (!).Recommended for a visit for those who enjoy shopping centers. Easy access (connected to the train station).

Lots of shops, good food court. Not being much of a shopper, I do like the food court on the 5th floor, which offers a lot of options for under 40baht. At that price one can experiment often and the cost if you do not like something is low.

interesting place to viste. shopping mall with 7 levels with each level a differnt city / rome, paris, istanbul london, tokio,san franciso... a verry good and cheap goodcoart at the 5 th floor. lot of locals eating there

Lots of local designer shops. Quite different from other ordinary shopping malls. Have the theme of airport terminal and travel around the world . Best part of it is that there are a lot of local thai designers shops -outfit that you can't get from other shopping malls.
crazy but beauty. nice superstore one moment u in london next sanfrancisco or turkey busy place expensive and non expensive material

Airport Themed Mall. At the Junction of two Train Station lines, this is one of the busiest if not the busiest mall in Bangkok. It is smaller horizontally than most of our malls in the Philippines, but it is taller by a couple of floors. What I liked about it is that it has a unique “Airport Theme” to it, with each floor being labeled like an Airport Gateway to a city in other countries, like Paris, or London, or Istanbul, for example. They even show their promos on a screen made to look like a Flight Display Board. I also like the fact that they encourage people to sit around the mall with various benches and seats all around outside of the Food Court or Restaurants, unlike in our Malls. Overall it is a good mall with a lot of nice things, but if you are used to malls the size of Robinson’s Galleria, or the SM Megamall, or SM Mall of Asia, you will find this mall to be a bit small, and a bit dim also, with not a lot of natural lighting. The mall is located along the Sukhumvit Road in between the Sukhumvit Subway MRT Station and the Asok BTS Skytrain Station, so it is very easy to go to, a no-brainer.

Fun Place. We walked through mainly to see the shopping around the world themes. The set up is as if you were at an airport and traveling to different countries. As you used the longest elevators in Thailand to reach another floor, you were also entering another world shopping. So the colors,decor and shops reflected Paris,SanFrancisco...a novel and entertaining concept. Great for selfies.The food area was massive with every food imaginable.
Terminal Mall BTS MRT Connection. BTS Asok station and MRT Sukhumvit station is few steps away. very elegant comfort rooms, enough selection for dinning and shopping..
