Lovely Mall!. This mall has many small shops with local Thailand brands and lot of well-known brands too! Its a unique decoration with a city theme on each floor. Good time spent at the mall which is also very conveniently located.

Great Location at Asok BTS station. This is a lovely mall, with many small shops. The decorations are unique- it's a theme mall, imitating an Airport. Each floor is a different city from around the globe. I love the structure of San Francisco's Golden Gate. The self-service food court is a real find!!! So cheap and so tasty. There are also many restaurants to choose from.
Local brands. If you want to shop for local brands similar like the ones in Asiatique, you may enjoy Terminal 21. So many to see to shop.

Great Concept. Terminal 21 really came out top and out-off-the-box in their concept. The developer saw the new trend of photo-craze with their cellphones. Why not create a venue where the visitors can enjoy themselves as well as promote the place through free social media? Great idea and very trendy indeed.
Interesting. Interesting place to go visit. Different concept of shopping centre out there as opposed to the others. Highly recommended to go visit.

Interesting shopping centre: good food court. Very conveniently located right by Asok station.Well-known brands on the ground floor but more interesting and local shops higher up. Plenty of food outlets and a good food court on the top floor. The downside of the food court (for visitors) is that it runs on a prepaid card system so you either have to go round all the stands to work out what you want, add it up and then buy a card for the exact amount and go back to the stands to buy your food and drink, or you just buy a card for some safe, round sum amount and likely have to leave unused credit on the card.

Great Shopping Experience. Of all the malls we visited in Bangkok (and we did visit a few), this was one of the most practical in terms of navigating and affordability. A lot of malls in Bangkok were high-end (with stores like Prada, Gucci, Chanel, Versace, etc) but Terminal 21 had stores more suited to the everyday shopper. Not only was Terminal 21 practical, it was also an experience in itself; every level had a theme based on popular worldwide cities (i.e. the San Francisco level incorporated the Golden Gate Bridge and featured a cable car / tram that was used for restaurant seating etc). Each level was made to feel as if you were boarding / disembarking through travel gates at an airport through their clever use of signage. It was a lot of fun, and actually quite spectacular. My husband's not a big shopper - but even he wanted to hang around longer than usual, just to take it all in and see everything twice.
Nice mall, many, rather expensive shops, air conditioned. Nice mall with many, rather expensive shops. The food court and restaurants provide good to excellent food for all pockets.

Interesting concept. Nice shopping mall with all the usual brands available. There is a floor for Thai brands which is worth exploring. There is the obligatory supermarket where you can get plenty of local and imported delights.
Great mall!. Each level takes you to different location.. even the rest rooms included. Great mall concept.. probably one of the best! :)

An interesting concept!. This shopping mall is themed: every floor is a different country! The execution is magnificent, from the escalators informing you that you're departing to another country to the clean, themed toilets! If you like malls, this is a must visit!

I thought it was an airport at first. Love the concept. It was an amazing trip going up the escalators. I felt like i was at the airport. It is super clean and the bathroom are really fancy. Love the bidet. The food court is were I had a great eat. Kindee is the place to go for a nice rice and pad thai.

Best new mega theatre in town, in a great part of town!. This is a newer mall that offers the usual bargain basement type goods as well as high end designer shops, and is located opposite the Ashok skytrain station. But the best part of this mall is the movie halls on the 6th floor and the food on the 5th floor, which is fantastic. Great projection and tooth rattling sound systems - great for the latest blockbuster. In addition, on the 5th floor there is a small bar (mix) that serves fried fish and belgium beer, perfect for that dinner and a show date.

Terminal 21: Too many places, too little time!. Located close to the hotels we normally frequent on Suhkumvit is the Terminal 21 Mall. This is not a normal mall as some might suggest as it has been broken down by floor to represent departure areas for destinations around the world.Now each floors stores and shops may not always represent the theme they are on but there does seem to be an effort to at least try to be consistent with the types of shops in general. Unlike many nice malls, the items that can be purchased here can be had a pretty decent prices not unlike some of the cheaper tourist malls. Many of the items do have prices on them but on occasion we have been able to haggle the price down just a tad, particularly if we but more than one item at a particular store front.It is true that this mall does have a number of picture taking opportunities. There are cute little statues and other “scenes” scattered about the mall. This is a clean mall. It is well taken care of. The mall does have security guards at the entrances. There are multiple entrances and exits on multiple levels to include access to the BTS skytram. The point along the BTS route you would disembark to access this mall is the Asoke station.This mall does feature a very nice selection of restaurants and cafes from the somewhat high end all the way down to local fare for the store workers at a bargain price. The types of food served are US, all types of European, Thai, and Japanese sushi and curry such as Coco’s. Coco’s rocks! We have eaten at a number of venues here but will save these for another review.

Just a normal shopping mall. Went to this mall based on people review. But found out that there is nothing much except for photo taking & admiring their toilets. If you are not there to shop, this place can be done in 2 hours. Take the BTS Asok to easily reach here.

Check the Gourmet Food Section on LG. While this centre has all the usual suspects for fashion, I was looking for Thai produce and found the LG floor was stocked with goodies. There is a Thai section in the Gourmet Market and another specialist shop nearby selling an unbelievable range of snacks and noodles.
Massive. I'm no lover of shopping but this is a must see place if in the area, loads of eating places mainly in basement and upper floors with variant prices. Floors are named after different cities

My favorite mall in BKK!. Liked this mall over Siam Paragon, Central World, and MBK. Very modern and lots of boutique shops. Plus the food court upstairs is an experience in itself.
Highly recommend!!

Shoppers delight. Fantastic shopping mall in the heart of Sukhumvit. Modern and clean with more shops than you can throw a stick at ! A lot of "top endish" price wise but a must place to visit.If you are a hardened shopper you could spend hours in this one place alone. Food courts on top two floors

Food Galore. FOOD:Yes, the food court "the Pier" was a great place to have some dinner after a long day. They had various restaurants all lined up on the top two floors. It had a cute theme of an airport style as the escalators had signs above them with "departing/arriving" to a themed floor like "Hollywood" "Paris" etc..You do need to get a food court card like every other mall, but this one you deposited money which you will get full refund for what's left over ^^ enjoy! My friend and I ordered Pad-see-ew, korean dish, and some smoothies.I also came to this place to try the gelato place called "stick house" it was really delicious and I saw reviews so~SHOP: I found a cute sunglasses stand about level 4 near the escalators, and I fell in love with some of the designs. So I bought 3 cute sunglasses for about 10$ each (Buy 2 get 1 free). I wanted some for the summer, and I was planning to buy them in korea (head in about 2 weeks) but I remembered that the stores/streets sold them a bit pricey if they looked good. And, these in Terminal 21 were pretty good quality, so I'd rather spend here than searching out for some in Korea.I also went to the phone/tech area and added glass screen on my iphone with my friend for 7$ each. * we bargained by getting two, lowering the cost. I also wanted a power bank for my iphone and nothing too big with a good deal for 11$ on a slim small one and it didn't look cheap. *again bartered lower by going around~ Different stalls had different kinds, so best to look more.I decided not to buy clothes here although there are some great bargains for 150 baht range. And, the BTS station was connected to Terminal 21, but instead we walked the street to see the street market for tourist souvenirs which were cheaper than at Terminal 21.

A must visit!. This mall is so artistic! Each floor is designed after a country. It is worth it to explore all floors. I loved this mall so much and would fly back to Bangkok for it! It is also beside the train station. (Sky train if I'm not mistaken) so it is very accessible.

Great place of visual entertainment and hawker's priced foods. This is one of my most frequented place. The toilets are themed differently on every floor. The food is at hawker's price at Pier 21 at Level 5 - unbelievable.Just take a walk around the place and observes the shops' signboards - that's entertainment enough!Walk outside to next building and you will be at Robinson and Big C supermarket. Next to it is the El Gaucho Restaurant - super nice steaks!

Great place to shop and eat. Anything you need for shopping in Bangkok. The interior is great with the different themes on each level and you find major retailers and also little boutique shops too. After spending time in the heat outside, this is a very nice place to cool down. At the ground level there are always different activities or sales going on. The restaurants on level 5 are plenty and good variety too. The Terminal 21 food court is fantastic - great food and drinks and the selection is amazing. The card system is easy and makes ordering fun. And if you are up for a new movie or want to go to the gym this is all on level 6.

Another mall. Because there are so many shopping malls in Bangkok, they're all competing to be different. It was a lot smaller then I expected and the only thing I enjoyed was the food. The 'fashion' side of the department store sold tacky clothing and I got the impression that most shopkeepers didn't want to be there. Started mentally counting the number of people i saw staring into space or playing on their phones ignoring people walking by. Tried to exchange money from various counters and all were rude and not very welcoming. Basically I wouldn't recommend this place if you just wanted to take a photo of the golden gate bridge.

Something for everyone. A great retreat to escape the humidity. Easy to access. Great variety of food as well as a great range of new quality established local Asian brands that I'd never seen before.

Great shopping and food. Great for shopping but also the food courts on level 4 and 5 are great. Average prices. It's a hotel with each floor reflecting different theme ( different city on each hotel).

Nice mall. Another nice mall, smaller that the others. The place is designed where every floor is like another city and its a nice concept.
Use the sky train to arrive and return as the street is very crowded

Surprisingly awesome. I'm not someone who spends a lot of time in shopping malls when I travel....but this one was worth a visit. It had amazing food on the bottom floor and an "international theme" being that every level was themed a different country around the world. Even if you're not looking to spend money or shop on your trip, it's a cool place to walk around.

Worth a visit to this shopping centre. There are lots of shops some world wide like H&M as well as lots of boutiques style shops. The centre offers lots of eating place as well. We ate really good and cheap local Thaii food in the food court.From memory we spent less than $15 Aud on 4 dishes as well as fresh fruit smoothies
Terminal 21. Near asoke road on sukhumvit by the skytrain station. It is a spectacular mall with a great food store on the basement floor
Nice. The ride to this mall by taxi is just hell. You have to come by sky train.Its just another mall, nothing special if you have just two days in this city like us you should skip it

Themes for everyone. Terminal 21 shopping centre is easily access by met and sky train. We were tired after morning walk at Chinatown and thus looking for foot massage parlor. Just behind T21 there was a street which many massage parlors. We got an hour good foot massage at reasonable price. There after, a shopping spree at T21. Different level has it country theme. We managed to buy stuff at good bargain price too. Will definitely visit again.

A Must See Shopping Mall. This mall is awesome. Love the layout. Love the airport/destination theme. Bathroom on each level is pretty neat. Always nice and clean but it can get really crowd as it's located in the major intersection with many hotels and transportations. Shopping here is grat as well. It offers variety of goods that isn't all about big brand names. I just love shopping here. Wish I had more time and more budget!And don't let me start with places to eat here. You could spend a three days here and still wouldn't get to try everything.

Great mall in the city of malls - and an even better food court!. I visited a LOT of shopping malls in Bangkok and this one and Siam Center were my favorites. Terminal 21 is about the quirkiest mall I've ever seen - each floor has a theme that represents a different city in the world and the decorations are really well done. The best part is the food court (Pier 21) where for less than 100 Thb per person (around $3.00), you can have an amazing meal - including dessert - and get change back from your pre-paid card! Lots of fun and an experience not to be missed!

Nice shopping mall. Modern, clean and a large variety of stores.
You will find a lot of options for eating, chain restaurants, food court, local food.
Always coming for eating and cooling down at Terminal 21.

Unique mall. One of the places I love going to when I'm in Bangkok because of the unique themes they have every floor.I really love their comfort rooms as well because of the design, altho shopping wise, I still go for JJ Market or Platinum because it seems like it's more expensive here and most of the stuff they sell can be found there but cheaper. If you are planning to go to Yaowarat Chinatown and is taking the MRT, you can drop by this mall before going there. Take the BTS to Asok and spend a couple of minutes here to take photos or just stroll around before going to the MRT to Chinatown.

Food & More food !. At 5th floor is a good food court, plently of choices & the prices are quite reasonable. So skip those fancy resturant try to eat like the localsOnce you are done go to the basement supermart grab some of the quality local products like mango, durian... there even a small Japanese limited ediction snack like kit kat, pokey etc..
Lovely place lovely guy . I'm so happy to dinner here with lovely guy , here is a nice place to dinner and please don't feed a pigeon will lose a finger .. Lol

Meh.. I visited this mall because of the pictures I saw on Instagram, but pictures are not worth 1000 words, in this case. The maze of shops off to the sides are so confusing to stroll through. I couldn't remember which shops I already visited.

All in one Mall, and amazing food court !. The first thing one notices entering this mall is the guard saluting you with a warm hello and this already tells you that this mall is different that the others. Every floor is dedicated to one famous city from the world and that tells you about the mood of the floor also. My favorite are the basement with the amazing food stalls and the 5th floor with the pier 21 food court. The food is AMAZING, cheaper than outside on the streets and very good quality. Please don't miss the best coconut ice cream at 28bh and the mango with sticky rice at 30bh. So cheap and so good !
Good department store. We stayed at sukhumvit10 last trip. It was near terminal21, it's very convenience for me to go yo shopphing with cheap price but high qualitt.

Interesting Mall - local designer environment - check out their toilets. One of the more interesting malls in Bangkok, lots of "local" offerings, but check out their toilets. Every floor is a different theme (by location, ie UK, Japan, Middle-east, etc). The toilets on each floor is done up accordingly to the "country" theme, Thus on the UK floor, the toilet is theme against the London Tube, On the Japan floor, it's very zen like, etc. etc. really amazing.

Interesting Mall. We were attracted by Golden Gate. This mall is right on a BTS stop and it's fun to see the different floors but for the most part it is a selection of restaurants. We were lucky enough to be here for Chineese New Year so watched a display from walkway from BTS to mall We experienced a very good meal and I'm sure that any of the restaurants offer a great selection

Visit 9 countries in the one shopping centre !. Terminal 21 is a surprise, especially those who don't know what to expect....so I wont tell you a lot about it...except, if you're in the Sukhumvit are (BTS/Skytrain - Asoke station....walk straight into Terminal 21 from train station platform), or from MRT/Underground - Sukhumvit train station....need to exit (look for 'Asoke BTS' exit), and you can walk directly across the busy street with mermerising traffic, or up the stairs and across the overpass ...towards BTS Asoke train Station, and access Terminal 21 that way. Tip - check out the toilets each level - themed according to the country (different country every floor). Food court and eateries on Floors 4 & 5. Also floor below 'Italian level', underground....supermarket, great French bakery, icecream, food, chemists, etc etc. Lovely cinema on 6th floor. 180Baht and cheap Wednesday only 100Baht. Enjoy :)

Place for you to visit cities around the world. It is a good location for you to find food from cheap to expensive.Good court here start at THB25 , it would be many people during lunch and dinner. You will enjoy the decorations for each floor that will set for each country. You will go to London, Tokyo, Italy and San Francisco in 1 day .Let's visit here.

Great place to stay out of the heat. Very nice mall, situated in the heart of Asoke and Sukhumvit. Accessible via the BTS or MTR. Food court has an array of foods and desserts. Many restaurants also with in the mall.

Trendy Themed Mall. A thoroughly well thought out theme mall which is based on a airport terminal and then each floor represents a different country....from London to Japan and Turkey to San Fransisco. At the very top is a movie theatre and there is even a "Let's relax" to have a pretty decent massage. Make sure you bring your passport and head to the information counter to get the free wifi and a book of coupons.The BTS stop Asoke is right next to the mall so super easy to get there.Pier 21 (food court) is at the top of the mall and is great for cheap thai eats, but there are numerous restaurants scattered through the mall.Oh and the toilets are numerous on each floor and super clean.

shopping pit stop. Terminal is a convenient shopping centre adjacent to both Westin and Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit hotels. It is served by a BTS station. Essential amenities - there are 2 money changers onsite - the one on the ground floor by SCB offers better rates. There are the usual boutiques on each floor and the top level houses a cinema. At the basement, there are a variety of pastry shops plus a supermarket. One outlet that drew my attention as a tourist specialises in local packaged snacks - dried mango, durian and strawberries - at reasonable prices!
Best Food Mall on Sukhumvit. I really don't know what this mall has other than a great selection of restaurants and one of the best and least expensive food courts in the area.

Shopping Food Movie. My regular hotel is rather close to Terminal 21 so I visit often when in Bangkok. There is a nice Cineplex on the top level and I have seen all the newest movies there. To tell the truth, I don't do much shopping there as I have a few other places I go. The food options are great at T21. I always visit Mr. Donut, Dairy Queen, and one of the many food shops for dinner. The entire mall is theme based around cities of the world. San Francisco is the most obvious with the large Golden Gate Bridge.

Love this place... A must do. Each time I'm in the Thai capital city, I do enjoy to spend few hours there. Plenty of shall shops and boutiques made in Thai from young designers by theme to enjoy and for the pleasure of our eyes and of our credit cards!!Nice food court on the top, cool and yummy choice of restaurants as well a nice supermarket to enjoy!Well done Thai people!

passport required for free wifi. Bangkok has to be the most stingy wifi city in SE Asia. the only mall l encountered on the BTS Silom line which offers 'free' wifi. the catch is you must present a passport (or ID for locals) to obtain a username & password, which ia good for 1 year. as well, the wifi system resets itself every 2 hours for 'security measures'. hmm.all the malls in Bangkok pretty much sell the same merchandise. this mall has a few independently owned shops selling what one might find on a vendor's cart on the street. malls are good for bathrooms and temporary relief from the heat and air pollution. this mall has hard benches and high traffic bathrooms. l say suck it up and walk over to Central Embassy for the Japanese toilet seats.

Food is Good at terminal 21. There is a huge variety of restaurants & cafes in Terminal 21. Food from all parts of the world is available. There are some very unusual shops to look in after you have finished your meal too.

Funky mall. I love this mall. Many of the floors have boutique cool little shops selling different clothes you'll find in other mall. Cool trendy tshirts, shoes smd sneakers. Plus some great food either in the food court or the restaurants. We had the Japanese BBQ buffet

Shopping mall what is worthwhile for the husband. A place that is much more attractive than all the large shopping malls in Bangkok .
The architecture is off a great style the shops are attractive with modern product and well prized.
The food shops/restaurants are attractive .

Great Concept for a mall. You can only take a picture in this mall without shopping!
Nice concept for a shopping mall :)
You can get many fast food in this mall, try the ice cream!

Nice Boutiques and Food. Really accessible as it is right outside the BTS! The mall has really a good theme. Wide array of food choices too.
Did some shopping here as well. I would say the choices are of better quality and more variety than Platinum but the price is a tad higher too. No regrets tho

Take a rest and some food here. Even if you are not a shopping maniac and don't buy anything here, still, you can get an excellent ICE-cream or excellent food at the top, in the 5th floor. Otherwise good choice of clothes shops everywhere. Easy acces from Asok BTS station, just take the pedestrian bridge up to the street, and then you arrive directly to the mall. As you could read from others , it is one of the newest mall in Bangkok, if you are tired and too hot in outside, here you can have a rest.
A great mall for shopping!. A great mall for shopping, and the 5th and 6th floors are a vast food hall with loads of stalls for great food.
good afternoon at terminal 21. they've great brands in d mall, nice book fare, great food selection, well equipped cinema and it's just by the bts skytrain, asok terminal. had nice time

Good food!. Great food selection. Good place to buy souvenirs if you don't like the markets. I love the supermarket. Interesting design, supposed to look like airport terminals. Located by the BTS/MRT station.

Great Experience!. Loved the themed floors concept! All the decorations consistent with the theme of that city, with the particular shops contents matching what that city is famous for! Even the restrooms were delightfully decorating according to each floors setting. Not bad prices, great selection of international food options.

Terminal 21 BKK. This latest addition to the incredible shopping experience on Sukhumvit in downtown BKK, consists of 5 levels, each themed in the style of a famous city in the world, including London, Rome, San Francisco. Istanbul et al. Shops abound on every level with a cine complex on the top floor, with a massive variety of incredibly inexpensive eateries on the floor below. An absolute must on visiting Bangkok !
Very nice . Love the food court that features street food in a comfortable environment. BTS station Asok will drop you there directly.

Great options for food. We enjoy Terminal 21 for the food options on the 4th Floor (San Francisco level). Lots of different types of food (Japanese, Thai, Chinese, Western) and although not fine dining, the value is good if you need something just more up-market than the usual fast food outlets.Of course, there are also the usual brand name shops too, and it was pleasing to see a new Onitsuka Tiger outlet open in this mall too with a good range of sizes and colors.
Big mall with San Francisco theme. Read about this new mall here. The mall is had airport theme and use San Francisco as their main theme. This mall has a lot to offer for food and shopping.

Fantastic Mall which is beside Terminal 21 Grande Point Hotel!. A centralised Mall in the heart of Sukhumvit area which has everything a tourist/visitor needs. A mall with attached hotel and BTS right at your door step. Fantasic.

Well worth a visit just to see interior designs. Must visit just to see the design concepts here. Each floor is different and great to just walk around and look at. Massive amount of money spent building and fitting out this place. Cinemas on top level with 2 floors of restaurants below selling every type and level of food. Shops specialise in area side men's ,ladies etc.Definately worth a visit.

Try the food court . The food court at the top has some really great value food. Its also very good quality. Plenty of typical Thai dishes to choose from.The rest of the shopping centre has a lot of western brands and is very modern and clean.

I love shopping. Our hotel is 3 minutes away from Terminal 21. The mall is connected to the BTS Asok Station. It is huge about 6 floors (I think the top floor is for members only or something like that). You can find the grocery store in the lower ground floor and there are lot of shops like Esprit, Kipling, H&M, Guess, Kenneth Cole etc.. in the ground floor to the 3rd floor. You will find different dining places in the 4th and 5th floor. The food court is located in the 5th floor where they serve food you will find in the streets :) This is a shopping haven for me especially when we went there, there are shops that offer big discounts and good finds. You can also find a couple of foreign exchange places inside the mall. I would love to go back to Bangkok. I had so much fun!

Streetfood. At 5 floor you can have great cheap food at the foodcourt. Try the sticky rice with mango. IT is like streetfood but the place are clean and the food are safe. You pay in advance - then go around and pick what you want.

Dislike most shopping centres...Love this one.. Each level has a major city theme...London,Paris, Tokyo, San Francisco etc and there is a myriad of food outlets. There's lots of little owner-operated boutique stores offering a wide range of Euro/Asian fashion and a great collection of offbeat giftware.Quite a refreshing change from the run of the mill shopping centre.
good eating. The food court has a large variety of food to satisfy a wide variety of taste. Try the mango, durian or jackfruit with sticky rice, they were delicious. Price is reasonable.

Special Shopping Mall With Airport Theme. It was my first time visiting Terminal 21 back in October 2015. This shopping mall is located at Sukhumvit, you can go by BTS get down on Asoke Station (Exit 1) direct access via the skywalk. OR by MRT get down on Sukhumvit (Exit 3). This Shopping mall come with a airport theme and they have different theme on each floor: LG - CaribbeanG Floor - Rome M Floor - Paris 1st Floor - Tokyo2nd Floor - London3rd Floor - Istanbul4th Floor - San Francisco (City) 5th Floor - San Francisco (Pier)6th Floor - Hollywood Lastly, highly recommend for their food court, the food is delicious and cheap.

Great Food Court!!!. This humongous mall has it all. Shopping is not my thing and especially not mall shopping, but has almost every type of store imaginable. Plus a nice movie theater and many bank branches. My favorite part of Terminal 21 is the Food Court on the 5th floor. Almost every type of food at unbelievably inexpensive prices...including a vegetarian stall. Sadly not vegan, but offers mostly vegan dishes and brown rice. No meat, but some items contain egg. YUCK! Cheap and good and very clean! Brown rice and 2 side items runs 45 baht ($1.25) and rice + 3 sides, 55 baht ($1.50). Located at Asoke Skytrain Station between Sois 19 & 21 on Sukhumvit Road. Entrance can be accessed directly from the Skytrain exit platform.
Nice local stuff . The mall is contains a good stuff of local brands but of medium and high quality with a reasonable prices, they only accept Buhat current ,

Each floor with a theme.. Perfectly located with great accessibility, Terminal 21 is a very nice mall with each floor having themes to each floor/section. The Japanese section was terrific with Line characters, Japanese snacks , restaurants and Japanese souvenirs. Many styles with many stores are featured in the mall. Great place for lunch or dinner, shopping and to rest from the outside heat. Also, good place for money exchange to Bhat.

Ok, not overwhelming. Good products. . At the end of the day - it's a mall. They did everything right, they have all you widh for, well presented, clean, easy to find stuff. Not cheap for thailand, but good quality.

Nice clean fresh look mall. The mall has hundreds of shops with all different themed floors. Lots of nice souvenir shop as well as clothes food courts and pharmacies. We went during February so the sales where on for the Chinese New Year and Valentine's Day. We had some good bargains. The place itself is amazing with lots of photo opportunities. Nice clean and cool mall.

A fun place to shop. As others have said, terminal 21 is a very funky little mall with each floor dedicated to a different international city. The toilets on each floor are also themed to match the city, so it's fun to go and check them out. It doesn't hurt that they are spotlessly clean and have all the comforts you need in a loo :)There are plenty of cool little boutiques showcasing some young Thai designers, and it's not that expensive. I've bought t-shirts, jewellery, shoes, belts and scarves here at reasonable prices. It's way cheaper than the bigger malls, and it's also a lot more people friendly as you can chat to the designers/ store owners.There's a small gourmet mart in the basement, along with some amazing little food stalls. There's a whole range of restaurants upstairs, along with a cheap food court. You'll find coffee shops dotted around, but these tend to fill with people who bring their laptops and sit on them for hours on end.It's easy to get to T21, being accessible to both the Asok BTS and the Sukhumvit MRT stations. As with most malls in Bangkok, there is a cinema upstairs if you feel like catching a movie. It's a lot cheaper to see a movie here than it is back home.

Great mall with lots of smaller boutiques and an amazing food court.. We were only in BKK for one day and were recovering from a very long trip so just popped in to Terminal 21 as it was very close to our hotel! It was our first experience of a SE Asian mall and it was fabulous. Only one or 2 recognizable big western stores here, the mall is split with a different theme on each floor, each named after a popular international destination. It is easy to spend a good couple of hours having a mooch around without getting bored. The top 2 floor are occupied by food halls and there is a staggering choice of good looking establishments to choose from.

Lovely shopping mall with themes in each floor. Quite a nice shopping mall. Specially since it was next to my hotel, Westin ! Each floor has a city theme and its like an airport, for departures and arrival. Istanbul, San Francisco, London and so on. Some really good eating places on the 4th floor as well as numerous shops abound

Place full of eye candy. For a solo traveller on a budget this place is still a must see! Shops are a lot more upmarket at western prices. Buts that's not the main appeal of this place. Each level is its own city of the Caribbean, London, Istanbul, Paris and San Fransisco. The layout and architecture of this place is truly fascinating and heaven for the eyes. I was also truly amazed by the toilets as seen by the photo - you can choose seat temperature, stay and dry for your business. It's a great escape from the usually craziness of Thai shopping and an awesome experience even if you have no money! Also some really cool handmade jewellery in Istanbul level.

Prepare to spend…... This place is a massive shopping centre. There is a mixture of what I would call chain shops with some levels dedicated to little independent stalls and small boutiques. The goods appeared slightly more expensive here than on the street stalls outside but then you are paying for the A/C. The food court was manically busy with locals but there was plenty of places to eat. Bring money and a decent pair of shoes because you’re going to need both.

Well worth a visit. Great escape from the noise, heat & pollution of Bangkok. You can lose hours in here exploring each themed floor. Many photo opportunities and the toilets are spotless & clean. Make sure you go to the food hall on the 5th floor. It’s the cheapest, tastiest food I had in Bangkok. Gets very crowded with locals and well worth it. I ate here every day with dishes that blew my head off for a couple of dollars.

Food, food, food.. This is a quirky 'theamed' shopping centre, the theme, Airports of different countries, complete with its fake metal detector on entry, the real ones are just around the corner for the subway. BUT I went for the FOOD On the 5th floor you will find a food court like no other. The stall owners don't pay rent so the prices are LOW and the quality is constantly monitored by the establishment. I had a fantastic meal for 25 TB. And my other 5 dining companions, two of which are locals and pointed us in the right direction, also had scrumptious very inexpensive meals. Just load the food courts payment card with say 200 TB on entry, spend what you can, and cash in the card before you leave for the remaining balance as it's only good for the day.Enjoy

Another shopping mall!. Another mall. Not as 'hiso' as the Centrals and Siam so more useful for the ordinary ferang. A manageable size so you don't get lost. Good foodcourt, very cheap plus plenty of restaurants. Free wifi but take your passport to sign up. A Superich on the concourse outside usually offering top exchange rates. Located next to Asok BTS station.
Shopping. Unique ToiletsNice foodsLove the themesMost clothes expensiveLove the environments Great for touristLove the foodso

Massive themed mall in Sukhumvit with a terrific food court. This massive mall was located near our hotel in Sukhumvit. We went in primarily for the food court, which was cheap and excellent! The mall itself is large and clean with a variety of what appear to be brand based and fairly pricey stores. Of note is the themed aspect of the place, with each floor acting as a major city. Gimmicky but fun! Well worth a visit, at least for the food court!

Great Mall, not just a run of the mill. Its a great shopping mall, quite innovative in terms of setup, all floors have been designed to represent a city destination, i.e. London, NY, Egypt etc. The location is very convenient as well, merged with a skytrain station, on the Sukumvit main strip.The shops in the mall are quite interesting, especially the one for Egypt. It a shoppers paradise, excellent for window shopping as well.Don't bring your wife/gf here, otherwise you will be spending all your money and all your time, lol.Right next door to Robinson and far far better than that. There is food court as well, where you can tuck in to whatever you like!

Good shopping experience. As compared to pratunam, terminal 21 has better fashion choices, but slightly costly (average 50baht more). Has a good selection of food as well on the lowest level and 4th floor.

One of the most beautiful malls I have recently seen. This place is great from the first step you make into it. It has a lot of light and consists of several floors each called "terminal" and named after a large city destination. This makes you curious to explore all terminals and their names. Thanks to numerous restaurants with all kinds of foods it is easy to spend many hours and there is also a stylish supermarket in the basement. I was a bit in a rush as I discovered by coincidence when leaving the MRT station but will definitely return when I have more time

If you like malls this is a decent one. As malls go, this is fine. It is easy to get to with the sky train and metro nearby. It has lots of chic boutiques. And lots of (mainly Japanese restaurants) and a supermarket in the basement.But why not venture into the city, shop far more cheaply and taste some real Thai cuisine ?

Nice mall for a wander.. I enjoyed the theme of each floor. Like a geek, I also visited every toilet to see each one. Rome was my favourite. It's inevitable that whilst in Bangkok you will end up in a shopping mall, you can DJ a lot worse that terminal 21. Great value food court too.

One of the newest malls in Bangkok . Terminal 21 is a very new mall in the Asoke area on Sukhumvit. A beautiful mall with a multiplex,restaurants and food court. A nice place to hangout with family or friends.

Easy access with various shopping and food . If you are the one who's love a good food and shopping with style. This place is your destination in Bangkok. A lot of Brands for shopping with some Thai designers shops. Every floors have a different decoration by the theme of Cities around the world even the rest rooms. There also have many restaurants for your appetite.
best shopping mall at bangkok. its my favorite mall at bangkok because almost evrything is there from budget to branded stuff from different countries!

Good place to shop. Thos shopping centre is just beside the bts station ashok. A good place for shopping and for food. There is also a cinema inside the shopping centre on the top level. You can spend at least 2-3 hours there

Interesting mall. We stopped by this mall as we explore along Suhkumit line on BTS. Good mix of local and foreign eating places in this mall. The toilet is a must visit even if you do not have a need. Each level's toilets follows the theme of the floor, be it London or Japan.

worth buying men's collection:Cheap! Easy! No bargaining problem. its a shopping heaven for me here... wow it fantastically design with each level has its uniqueness. Surprisingly, each floor the toilet cleaner or the staff dresses based on the country (London, Japan, USA..etc) Check out!

Awesome Mall. This is an awesome mall. It has everything. Its a little pricey but it is Bangkok. It has street vendors at street vendor pricing on the top floor at Pier 21. Just purchase a card and pay for your food. What ever you have left on the card they will reimburse you the baht. or keep and use for next time.

Good place to go to spend time. It was nearby our hotel so we went here to have a lunch. The shopping center has interesting layouts with an airport concept. We dined at Cafe Meal, which was very good Thai food restaurant. A lot of dessert places but not many good selections of brands for shopping. They have some ok brands but too many street/market clothes. Wifi connection is tricky.

Amazing Mall. Terminal 21 is a must see while in Bangkok, especially if you are from the U.S. You have never seen a shopping mall as interesting and unique as this. Every floor has a different theme and is designed to look like a unique country including Rome, China, and the U.S. There are many interesting places to shop and some amazing food choices. Even the bathrooms are all designed to fit the theme of the floor.
Great place. It's a great place for families to shop.The design is great and the toilet is very clean too.I will definitely will come back again.

Tourists faverite. Smoetimes i see people asking me or other locals about Terminal 21 . I noticed that most costumers of this plaza ar from Arab countries , Japan , China , Korea and Europe and locals . It has nice modern decorations .

good design. They made the design very nice! Thoughtful idea to make the shopping mall like an airport. you could see things from France, UK, Japan, USA and so on. The deco is very impressive.
However, I didn't shop as much as I expected. Maybe the style isn't really mine. It is good for window shopping anyway.

you can eat easily at the food court. If you don't have enough time for searching restaurant. Then go to the 5F food court. You can eat some foods at cheap price and comfortable place. But u can't find a seat easily at dinner and lunch time.

Mall with global focus . A mall with a different country theme ikon each level including the toilets
Not really sure who this is aimed at other than the middle and upper class Thai
It's a mall - that's it

Pier 21 is a lifesaver! Cheap food and options for everyone!. Go up to the 5th floor to find the food court with amazing options. Also check out the basement Gourmet Market - they have the best quality fruit in the city!

Love Fashion Shopping At Terminal 21. The shopping complex itself has a great concept, with each floor given a particular city theme eg Paris, London, Tokyo, Rome, Istanbul etc. While it has some international brands however the main attraction for me is the boutiques that carries fashion from across Asia. Easy to get to via BTS Skytrain Asok Station.
Cryptic shoppin center. I have visited two times and both times somehow seemed dis organized. I found all of my desired shops. The reason why i came again, was Swensen's ice-cream restaurant.

upscale mall for the regular guy. In Bangkok, there's UPscale and there's upscale, and this shopping mall falls into the latter category. This means your wife will be more than happy to shop and eat there, but it won't break your wallet. It's well designed and decorated, with tons of restaurants, a movie theatre (on the 6th floor), and lots of stores and shops.

Unique mall. Highly original design with each floor having a major city theme e.g. London, SanFranci sco etc. Worth a visit just to look around. The food court is very good, something Thailand usually does very well - so good is it, with most dishes under 100 baht, that it's often difficult to find a seat.Many of the shops are unique selling products unseen elsewhere and there is less emphasis on all the usual international brands you find in most malls.Situated next to Asoke BTS station.

One of the best. First of all the location is great. Direct access from BTS Asoke and Soi Cowboy is basically right around the corner. All floors have different designs and styles, very beautiful. A range of very nice shops. Last but not least many very good restaurants.

Great Mall !. Caters to everyone, all ages & gender.
Every floor has it's own theme.
Very clean toilets and handy location inside the mall.
Different shops that caters to different budgets.
Great restaurants too

Favorite mall. This is my favorite shopping mall in Bangkok. It still feels new and clean with a cool design with super long elevator. All the floors have different themes, I especially like London floor. The food court is cheap with lots of good choices too.

Interesting place for yuppies. Easy acess, located next to Asoke BTS station. You can many local and international highstreet brands here. Local craft are also available here. I love the gourmet supermarket at the lower ground level and the foodcourt - selling high quality gourmet/organic food. Dont really like how some of the shops are set at back alleys...you have to make few rounds at one level to finish visiting the shops there.
Godo place to hang out for the day. The cinema SF21 at the top floor is top notch for the price you pay. Also, the Pier Food Court is the best place in Sukhumvit to get clean, respectable Thai eats.

Good Shopping, Good Food. A huge mall with city themed floors, just next to Asoke BTS station. There is the London floor catering to western style clothing, a Japanese floor for Japan-inspired fashion, and the Istanbul floor for all the accessories you need. Plenty of good restaurants for any kind of palate, and a massive foodcourt too. If you're looking for some great shopping, then set aside a full day for exploring this wonderful Bangkok mall.

Good foodcourt. Been there a few times, love the foodcourt.You can get good dishes drom 35 to 80 baht, just buy a card, you pay with it at the different stalls and at the end you return the card and they return the unused amount on your card. Love the concept, works great!! Cheap as well and big variety of dishes.
Awesome. Some really cool shops here which we don't have back in the UK.The food market is great and really cheap & authentic. We would return

cool modern mall. its a cool mall just to walk around and explore the various cities and themes. I wouldnt go there for the shopping, the food mall on the top floor is very cheap with a great variety of foods.

Sports World Store - Prejudiced Service. Went to the Sports World Store and we were looking at Converse shoes on Saturday evening. First we waited near the shelves looking for someone to help us with sizes for my daughter for 10 minutes. There were at least 3 attendants milling about who avoided us. I approached one of them eventually and asked for them to bring out the correct sized shoe to which he stared back at me and did not respond. Eventually some other sales attendant came around and stated there was 10 minutes to closing time and when I told him that I would like my daughter to try a pair he simply stated no, "10 minutes closing, no show shoes..." There were at least 4 other customers being shown shoes (2 white, 2 thai). Taking this up with the manager was equally useless because the response was "ok take shoes you want" as if they were doing us a favour but still not prepared to apologize or show us correct shoe sizes. The store is RACIST and PREJUDICED! I will take my money elsewhere, no shortage of shops in Bangkok. I would not even give them the 1 star lowest rating.
shoping mall - same same. department store with lots of food choises. soma us stayed symbols are also there. not worth a visit if you are not around.

For all and for Everyone . a small town with everything you need packed into 6/7 floors !!! located in the perfect city center with easy access to central stops Asok sky train and subway SUKHUMVIT !! built like an airport with gates, escalators and elevators to floors various destinations (Rome London Tokyo etc represented by mega reproductions of their attractions) ... this mall offers restaurant bar caffee supermarkets bakeries pharmacies clothing accessories film gyms etc etc all that you want and you want find in Thailand but also international fashion or other !! all with high quality and good prices variety and uniqueness .... a place for all hours ... almost you can live there !!!

One of the Coolest Malls in Thailand. I love the feel of this mall. Such a cool theme. Each floor is a different area of the world and the idea is you are entering each level through an airport gate. I got a kick out of the fact that each bathroom on each floor is a different theme that matches the rest of the floor as well. And those bathrooms are NICE and CLEAN. Double-bonus in Thailand ;) Also, this is a GREAT place to get Thai food. Upstairs at the Pier 21 food court you can get authentic Thai food for waaaaaay cheap.
Luxurious Mall. Really fantastic luxurious mall with many brand names and excellent shops. Also food corner is perfect with many choices.
Mall, shopping, eating. I accidentally ended up here and found that it made me smile. On each floor there is a kiosk telling you what is there. Plenty of places to eat and buy clothes.

Huge Mall. Terminal 21, they have given the look to this mall as a Airport, and they have given every floor a city name, like Paris, Rome, etc. The concept is very unique and good. This mall is always full with people and have variety for shopping from kids to old people. They food at top floor is the main attraction of this mall they have all type of food with very reasonable price.
The world wonder places in one shopping mall. I've been there before for visiting with my friends and have a looked around the place for 1-2 hours. The price is quite high as well.
Awesome Concept Mall. A few conceptual design into one mall. Designers should go and feel the difference. They have everything you need inside from fashion to food and etc.
Terminal 21. Pretty much the place I spend most of my time in bangkok. Best location, great shopping mall, great place to meet .......

Entertaining. You can enter Terminal 21 from the sky train , it is door to door and as you enter that's when the fun begins. The only way to do this is start from the bottom and work your way up. We did this because it was getting on for lunch time and we knew the food court was at the top. Each floor has its own theme ,and the theme being a different country on each floor, I wont give to much away as it might spoil it for you if you go. Terminal 21 was also where we had lunch at Fuji restaurant as we had sushi in mind. Each floor was very entertaining with shops relating to that specific floor, there was a lot to take in, but on the whole a very interesting place to go and shop. Highly recommended for the interest value alone.

World-Wide-Design. I often visit this mall for dining at my favorite restaurant -Tony Roma- on 4th floor for its very delicious ribs!The mall itself has nice decoration of several countries in each floor.

Best mall in Bangkok. This place, even it's a mall, is probably one of our favourite spots in Bangkok. Why is it great? Signs and maps are every where, it's very easy to navigate. Each floor has a theme and they really did a fine job decorating each floor to give you the feeling of the city (like Tokyo, San Francisco...). The bathrooms are very cool, too. I have to mention that.Also, as a mall, it has popular brands and stores you might need.The top floor is the food section where you can get different dishes for a cheap price.

Product and food. I love a Terminal21 because of design, price and food here.... They design it to be like the Airport. You can take a photo in here... There are many SME store here so you can shop with low price and important thing...mostly products here is hand making... The big important here is food!!! Food court is very very cheap ...you can visit here for eating too

Good idea but the supply isn't good. The idea of different cities is nice but the shops here isn't good. Really few european marks and a lot of asian fashion. Easy to go to with skytrain. It was nice to visit there but don't think I'm going there again.

Culturally fun mall!. It was great to get the passport to all the different countries on each floor. We enjoyed shopping and eating in the mall along with attending two great movies. Food was outstanding.

Ho-hum!. Very ordinary. No real unique selling point as much of what they have is available elsewhere. The only saving grace is the Tim Ho Wan, Michelin starred restaurant that is located here. But it isn't a fine dining experience. More like fast food. But much of what they serve involves pork so great if you like that.

Shop in Bangkok . I rather liked T21 because it's a great mall to visit on a hot sunny day. Got lot of cheap nice clothes for both male/female. Not to forget to the fooood. Bangkok never disappointed me when it comes to food. :)) you could spend half a day at the mall and you will be out with lot of loots in your hand.

Enjoiable mall wirh very good local brands. Il you are looking for bespoken brands like Prada or LVMH don't come here! Instead if you want to find out some local middle class cloths shops where you can do some bargains too it's your place. You will also find many interesting restaurant and some international brands too

Good for getting a SIM-card. Trendy, spotless and good looking shoppingmall in the Sukhumvit area. On the 6th floor we bought a SIM-card for our time in Thailand with friendly staff. There's heaps of good restaurants, outdoor clothing, sportswear and other modern shopping to do so if you want some quality this should be the place to go.

Large, awesome, and besides shopping .... There is the top floor with so much food - cheap and so many types of food. You just buy credit on a chip card and can go anywhere, buy it, pay with your credit, eat it, and repeat again until you are done. :) Located at Sukhumvit and near the MRT, so good location as well.

Themed mall with awesome ladies wear at medium ranged prices!. Great for good quality chanel and bvlgari counterfeit jewellery on top floor. Has a H&M and Victoria Secret but the real gems are upstairs! Lots of mid to high quality clothes and shoes. Also has dress tailors selling high quality evening gowns for prices upwards of 5000 baht but the quality looks great unlike female tailors at MBK. Great jewellery and heel selection at affordable prices. The mall is themed which carries on even into the toilets which are pristine. Also has a good selection of restaurants we enjoyed food and cocktails at tony roma's and a mexican eatery. Excited to revisit and re-explore! A must for female shoppers looking for chic mid range clothing and copy jewellery!!!

HUGE and impressive!!!. One of the best malls I have visited, Terminal 21 is huge - 6 floors, swanky and clean. Lots of options here - from big name brands to small shops. Good eating options too - KFC, Starbucks, also some fine dine restaurants. Even if you don't want to buy anything, this is a highly recommended place if you're in Sukhumvit around BTS Asoke (it is opposite to the BTS station). Just wander the entire mall and you'll definitely be impressed. There's also a multiplex on the top floor.

Not bad for shopping and different experience . It's clean and cool, but basically it's a shopping mall that's themed on different levels. Lots of escalators or take the lifts. They had a bike event on when we went which was good. Food options on the top couple of levels and some good independent shops and some bigger shops too. If you're hot and passing it's a good place to stop for a drink and cool off. Not sure if trek across town for it though

Interesting Terminal 21 Mall. Terminal 21 is easily accessible through Metro Train to Sukhumvit Station. On exit of Metro station, go towards your right to walk through the bridge that connect right into the mall.Very interesting concept. Every floor is designed of a particular country's flavour.Make sure you visit every floor's Rest Room ! :)Ah.. another highlight of Terminal 21 is their FoodCourt at the highest floor. You can sample many Thai food in a nice, air cond & clean environment at a price that is cheaper than the street price. Many locals frequent here,too. Need to be early to find a table for seats.
Great shopping mall. Great mall with a lot of stuff. You can find anything and they have very trendy clothing. It's worth a visit!

Good shopping mall. We visited this mall as it was right across the hotel we were staying. It was a good mall with different levels modeled on different international cities. The mall is connected to the Asok Skytrain station. This was the only shopping mall we visited, so cant compare with the others.

Favourite Mall in Bangkok. After visiting a few of the malls in Bangkok, would definitely call this my favourite. The lower floors have a good selection of brand stores such as H and M, Victoria's Secret etc. The higher floors have some really great independent shops with very reasonable prices. Think clothing, bags and shoes.Each floor is themed and while it sounds kinda strange it's actually done really well. Even the bathrooms have different themes on each floor!Great food court at Pier 21, must visit for cheap and cheerful Thai food. On the LG floor there is also a good bakery selection including crepes, cupcakes and eclairs.

If you like to shop go here. Over 8 levels we were inundated for choices of shops to go into, spread over levels it seems each level has a theme, although we didn't come to Bangkok for shopping on our first afternoon /evening we took a stroll down and had a wander around.

Fantastic mall. Our hotel had a free tuktuk to Terminal 21 so we visited often. Some of our favourites:- Amazing foodcourt level 5, 35-70baht per full meal so it's amazingly cheap (and delicious). You can't pay with cash you have to get a card you load up with cash at the 'cashier' and get a refund for the balance remaining after you've eaten- Fantastic spa on level 6 - Let's Relax. Had an amazing back massage. It's a bit pricey, but the spa ambience and quality is what you pay for.- Good mix of shops mid-range (something for each price range) but if you want luxury goods, you're better off going to Siam ParagonYou can also catch the BTS to Asok Station, which is joined by skybridge to Terminal 21. We didn't do very much shopping there, stores are quite Western. Mostly just to look around, and go back to the amazing foodcourt for lunch everyday.

Loved this place! . Close to our accommodation we chose this mall over the others to visit because of its quirkiness. It's based on an airport terminal and the levels are different destinations - our favourite was UK... Some quality items here and some as cheap as you can get at the markets! Nice little food outlets and a cinema. Clean and easy to work our around. Toilets were fascinating !!!

A Modern Escape, Nothing New. I heard this place was fantastic but it didn't seem unique to me particularly, I will be visiting Thailand again soon, maybe I will go alone this time and get a more thorough look at the place!

Decent mall.. Not among the best. Stayed closed to Terminal 21 on this stay in Bangkok. The mall is located above the MRT sukhumvit station and across the road from the Asok BTS station. Hence, easy to access wherever you are in Bangkok.The mall is a good place to go for eating with many good restaurants. There is also a specific section on 5th floor called the mobile terminal for people to buy/repair phones and SIMs.Not among the flashy as blitzy like Central mall, Terminal 21 is good for ambing around.

Excellent Location. This hotel located just above MRT Sukhumvit Station and next to the BTS Asok Station. At the lower level of the hotel, there is a shopping mall, which is separated from the hotel lobby but you can go there through the hotel. If you like bar hopping and nightlife, Soi Cowboy is just opposite to the hotel, it is within five minutes walk. The room is spacious and the service is very good. It has a gym. and swimming pool, I think it is good enough for those who likes swimming,
Great stylish mall. A great stylish mall with a very central location. A great selection to choose from here and each level is themed by a different city.Loads of food selection too
Cheap food!. Head down to the food court at level 5 for cheap and nice food. Cheaper than street stalls! Other than that nothing much to rave about this mall.
New Chic Mall. Nice mall which you can find some cool local design or cute accessories! Decent food court at the top floors. Each floor named after a city like London, Paris...etc.

Good mall & decent food court. Terminal 21 has something for everyone and it's a good place to shop, eat, catch a movie or just to get away from the heat outside.Food court has many options as well as a number of restaurants on a few of the different floors.Was staying close by so popped in here a number of occasions during my trip.

Lovely concept. The mall is themed. Not what I expected but nice, very interesting. Not cheap - there are a few stores where you can score bargains but for the most part it is expensive. Good food options. Easy access by MRT

Go here for the Food court. This is your typical big mall, with one twist. Hidden away on the second restaurant floor, behind all the big chain restaurants, is a genuine Thai food court - with western hygiene and Thai prices!We had 6 people eat a full dinner plus desert and it clocked in at less than 350 THB.

Lots of fun.. We came here twice. Secondly because we do not normally bring cameras to shopping centres BUT this place is an exception. Each and every floor is themed. Starting at the top 3 floors are American. Top floor is Hollywood, then 2 floors of San Francisco.Then you have London, Paris, Istanbul & Tokyo (which really was the only disappointment. Nothing Japanese except Sumo statues.)

Love the food court in the mall. This mall is very big and well connected for easy transport. They have a big asian food court with variety of foods and dishes for as low as 30 bhat each. I miss the durian and mango rice..:-)

Great mall on Sukhumvit. Spent an evening here for dinner and a movie. Many dining options available - something for everyone. Movie theatre is awesome and prices are very reasonable. Plenty of shopping too!

Love it!. Fabulous mall with so many quirky one off shops on top floors. Lots of made in Thailand brands. Look out for Flow jewellers absolutely beautiful. Lovely leather bags and shoe shops and cheap. We lived in Dubai for 35 years and I think this is way better than Dubai Mall. It's a long way up on the escalators and quite dizzying! Bathrooms are sone thing else.

Theme mall with decent shopping . The mall is quite a piece to look at ... Very different from the usual boring mall .. The theme of the mall is the airport terminal of few big cities of the world and products and brands from that countries . The food is amazing too !

Shopping . Good place for shopping ! Make sure you go all the way to the top and then go down floor by floor Nice little shop in superior floors where you can reasonably bargain :)The inferior floors are less interesting big boring brands like h&m and mango Enjoy!

Uniquely beautiful. I love how each floor is themed...including the toilets. So many items to choose from but a little expensive. The mall is very accesible because it is right on the bts line. This shopping centre is highly frequented by tourists so it ia crowded most of the time.

Great (Tokio, London). We went there twice during our stay in bangkok.Really good stores, especially on higher levels- london all for men and tokjo lovely designs for women. Further there is a level with bags and accessories (dont remember the associated city; maybe istanbul?)I did not try the food court.

Expensive . This shopping centre has a lot of shops, with lots of well known brands. There is no play area or activities for children of any age. There is a good food area where prices aren't to bad. No cheap shopping here.

Maybe best shopping center in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is nice shopping center. At the top floor are cheap restaurants. All what you are looking for on the streets líke soups or mango rice can buy there for the same prices.
pleasant shopping experience. generally quieter than Platinum Mall and prices are a little higher. different levels representing different countries. each shop is unique and pleasant to visit.

Great Cheap Food. The food court at terminal 21 is very cheap. It's one of the cheapest food court in Bangkok. Beside, the food in the food court is very good. Nearly every times I go there I had food from the food court.
Perfect for food, shopping and grocery. Try the food court- cheap and delicious. Shopping area has a great collection. If you arrive during the dec to jan. You will great discounts!

Travel the world in this Shopping Mall. The biggest attraction must be the different themed toilets on each floor. Prices are not low and quality of the local brands are about average only. Although there are a variety of products available, there seems to be more shops selling shoes. Imported labels are pricey. Food court is also passable but not the best. I was there for lunch at the "Take a zeed" Thai restaurant - the food is yummy!

Definitely different from everything else!. Although it is another shopping centre, I would highly recommend terminal 21! As every floor is custom designed for a different city, I had alot of fun hunting bathrooms as each one was also unique! A small but worthy treasure hunt!

One huge mall. If you like mall shopping you'll love this. As far as cheap , well if you want cheaper you have to shop somewhere other than a mall. Street food is always going to be the cheapest on the streets, And not in the tourist areas. But it is a great thing to see.

Explore the world in a day. This mall is amazing, it's a themed mall to be exact.Toilets are designed according the section's theme (each floor has a different theme)entering this mall is like we're entering an airport.offers free WiFi and Tourist Discount Card.Connects to the BTS Asok and MRT Phetchburi station.Food Court on the fifth floor offers cheap and very good meal.Bring a camera with you as this place filled with amazing things.

Cheapest Food Court Offering Street Food Prices. Airport theme shopping centre. Just as busy. Pier 21 is the cheapest foodcourt we came across throughout Bangkok. Yummy yet cheap. Trust me. You can't go wrong.

Airport terminal theme shopping mall. We were here by Dec 2015. This is a big shopping mall. I feel I had enter an airport terminal because every interior design looked similar to it. Very creative and special design. The building looked new and clean. Must come if you are at Bangkok.

Shopping. Went there on several occassions during my stay in bangkok and its a great shopping center. From the ground floors till the 6th floor then the gym at the top services i received were top class. My only issue is locals are still adjusting to speaking english so when you buy if you do not speak thai then you need google translate to help you out and its pretty useful. Once they understand what you need they are very swift to assist. Bought from samsung ate at several restauraunts there and even got groceries every few days from the supermarket. The muffins are amazing and amazingly cheap. Was told the chocolate muffins in the bakery are ranked 3rd in the entire world not sure if its true but they are amazing.

Affordable Chic and Quality Clothes!. This is a fascinating shopping mall for clothes and accessories - it's not high luxury nor is it bargain basement shopping. It's chic fashion, quality, affordable and mid-to-upper range of goods for young adults.There is the regular spread of international labels on the first two floors - ESPRIT, CAMPER, KIPLING, ESPADA, to name a few. You will find clothes and accessories by local designers on the next three floors. The thing that makes this mall stands out is the country theme for each floor. Imaging you leave San Francisco to shop at Istanbul before proceeding to Tokyo.Don't expect to find cheap goods at rock bottom prices here - so you won't be disappointed. If you are looking for quality local-label clothes and accessories, this mall hits the sweet spot. Be sure to bargain, you will normally be given a further discount. Yes, the price here is mid-range but affordable. And you get good designs and quality (and changing rooms). As the adage goes "you really get what you pay for".Need a break from shopping? There are ample food options to explore - fast food at the basement; a food court with local food and restaurants catering to different tastes (Japanese, Korean, Western, Italian, Thai) on the fifth floor.

Around the World in a Day!. It has everything you need from ice cream to clothing. The theme was unique because each floor represents a certain destination in the world ( e.g. 1st floor, Tokyo, Japan ).

Comprehensive Shopping Centre. Big shopping centre connected with Asoke BTS station. Unique mall design whereby every floor is labelled as different countries, whereby the toilets are designed according to the "country". Mall sells everything, both international and local brands. No lack of restaurants and a food court that sells plenty of nice local foods.

Good shopping, great food court. Terminal 21 is a nice shopping mall situated very conveniently by the Skytrain station. It is set on various levels each of which is themed to a different country. The shops vary in price, quality and uniqueness but most of the levels are worth a browse. What you must not miss, is the food court on level five. Various people told us that this is the most economical food court in Bangkok and we can well believe it. We had a Thai green curry and rice for 35 Bhat (the equivalent of about 70p). The choice is excellent and the food almost universally very good. There is a really relaxed atmosphere and a convenient payment system, whereby you load money onto a prepaid card which you then use in all of the different outlets to purchase your food and drink. The money is then refundable when you hand in your card if you haven't spent the entire balance. The different stalls all have pictures of their different dishes and the pictures are numbered for easy ordering. The food is either pre-prepared and ready or takes seconds to make whilst you wait. This is also a really good place to try the Thai national dessert of sticky rice and mango – delicious!

next to Asoke station.. Different level of the building is named as different places as Tokyo, Paris, London etc and the highest level is for the movie theatre. Several restaurants are present at the place. Mixed of stors from designer to normal clothing.

Shopping Mall with interesting theme. The mall has lots of international fashion chains. If you are from a European country, you will find the prices are a lot higher here than back home.Each floor is designated a different city, so they have miniature landmarks from the city. Also the security guards/information clerks are dressed in some fashion as if they do come from that city.Even the toilets are designed based on what is typical in that city. The Japanese ones are amusing.

Cute shopping plaza with different themed floors. Very cute shopping plaza - has different themed floors such as Tokyo inspired, London, Istanbul, Paris, San Fran and Hollywood. Shops do not correspond to each location theme though, but cool concept!Loved the gift stalls at the bottom floor!

Huge Mall with Great Shops . Terminal 21 is connected with BTS Asoke and Sukhumvit MRT. A nice and huge themed mall with different levels representing different countries. There is a nice and huge food court on the 5th level with reasonable pricing. The place is clean but can be very crowded during lunch time. You have to buy a meal card to purchase the meals from the individual stores and get a refund of the used credit when you are leaving. There is a cinema on the 6th floor, nice and comfortable and pricing are reasonable. English movies are with Thai subtitles. Basement is a supermarket to get all your necessities. Many branded shops such as Kenneth Cole, H&M, Nike etc. There is also a money changer at the entrance. Exchange rate is good. Much better than airport. Please note that they will either need your passport or photo ID for recording purpose. A good place to shop and rest your feet to have a cup of coffee.

Unique mall and good food court. As a mall this is great fun to visit. The different floors have been created to look like different cities so bring a camera. Downstairs are some nice eateries especially the Japanese hot plates. Food court is also very good but expect to search for a table during lunch times as it gets very busy. Also, some 1st time visitors don't realise you need to buy a card and top up money to purchase food. You can do this at the stations situated by the seating areas.
So much things to see and buy!. Just a short walk from Asok BTS. The interior design of the mall itself amazes me! Each floor has their own theme of a certain city, go explore it yourself !
New Shopping Mall at Asoke. It is mainly aimed at the younger set. Lots of local designer clothes. Has a gourmet supermarket in the basement. Lots of Restuarants on the upper floors.

High end fashion Mall. I got curious about this place after reading in a blog about Terminal 21. It is located at the heart of BKK. The place is really and every level is divided on what fashion destination you wish to "visit". Food court is located on the top most floor. Some food are cheaper even compared to the street prices for foreigners.

Good shopping mall in central area. Unlike MBK, this mall seems to be pretty decent and less crowded. Some shops had good deal as well. Christmas decorations were fantastic. The food court was awesome - with many options to choose from - you will be spoilt for choices. Overall had a nice family evening outing.

Superb Shopping Experience. Terminal 21 is a true delight to experience with each floor layed out like a famous streets from several cities including London and with each floor separated in a fashion similar to an airport, the lower floor is home many eateries and a food court where you can purchase authentic Thai food and drink of note is the stall that sells milk green tea an excellent purchase for anyone looking for something special in Bangkok.

Great Food Court. Visited this place by chance. Very clean modern inside with lots of designer shops and great layout with lots of esculators to high floors. Can be daunting if your afraid of hights I'd imagine! Amazing food court on top floors with plenty of resturants also. Worth a visit if you're in the area, even if it's to get out of the Bangkok heat and go into a nice air conditioned building!

Great Food Variety. I think this mall is made mainly for tourists, there is a variety of thai + Jap + Korean + Western resturants here so you will find what you want to explore + safe choices easily. Was here for work and it's near to our office, near the BTS too so it's convenient for you to get here. For those looking for cheap wholesale clothings though, this is not the place as it's more of a mid-upper range shopping mall.

A nice concept shopping centre. The shopping centre was differentiate by a different country on every level. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Don't expect cheap buys here as the price is much higher than those in platinum mall.. Check out their toilets on every level, interesting theme awaits you.. A nice concept store to spend your afternoon away!
Couldnt fault this hotel. This hotel is right in the middle so easy to get to good public transport via the trains, the hotel was spotless and teh staff so attentive.

Still the best choice. Every year since terminal 21 was first open, we had never fail to visit. This year still the best choice of shopping. We celebrate our Christmas and new year here by enjoying shopping and good choices of food. Like the ambient, convenient location, good quality of goods. Love to come again and again.

Amazing Mall. It is very near to Asoke MRT and BTS.Robinson Departmental store is nearby.Its design is not same like other malls,the floor are separate by popular City in the World like Paris,London,Tokyo etc as its disguise as Airport Terminal.Most of the shop are not big except in the 1st floor..But as for the selling product nearly the same as other malls.

All the world in one place. Visited Terminal 21 gor a second time and was not disappointed. The layout and theme is unique with floors identified by country. The whole the theme gives you the feeling that you are on an airport and arriving at different floors for each country. Plenty to eat on the top two floors and a gourmet food hall in the basement.

Something for everyone . There has too be something for everyone in the shopping centre we went on a saturday crazy busy but still managed to enjoy the centre. Ladys you will love it lots off small shops with many different style off clothes was heaven for me. Only problem would be finding room in your case to take it all home. Every floor is different country london, new york ect.

Bring your camera! . Bring your camera. Tons of great photo ops. Shopping galore. Each level takes you to a different country. Direct access off BTS Asoke. Make a day of it and end it with a movie in sofa seating. High end brand names and local goods in the kiosks. Family friendly but no younger kid play areas like Central World and Paragon.

Modern designed mall. Really cool mall.. The way to designed is great... The names given to the levels are by the name of destination as like the Airport.. Apart from that, there is lots to shop!!! :) A must visit!! :)

Cool Mall . Terminal 21 at soi 21 Sukhumvit Road Bangkok is a pretty cool place with its design in having each floor themed as a international destination. Just wandering around there are a variety of intetesting and curious statues dedicated to each destination. A pretty good food hall is available along with a host of restaurants, shops (of course) and a comfotable cinema. Some places can be more expensive than in and around Bangkok but overall a fun place to shop, eat and enjoy.

Cool concept . Fun place to visit many small shops with local products. Located just a step away from the bts and mrt it's a good place to stop and shop between trains. Not nearly and luxurious or large as some of the other malls in Bangkok but the concept of different floors being different cities makes it worth a look.

Interesting world cities floor design, awesome and really cheap food court. Terminal 21 was located less than a 15 min walk from our hotel. I wanted to check out the various world cities (London, Istanbul, Rome, and several California cities) concepts on each floor and their restrooms. The London floor has the Underground and Red Bus, Istanbul had the hanging lights, Rome had the fountain restrooms, California had ‘Oscar’, Movie scenes, Walk of Fame and San Francisco had their cable car, Golden Gate Bridge and more.All of these scenes depicted on the floors with many high-end shops and food establishments. Our first visit we had some food on the lowest level and it was not until a few days later we found ourselves on the top level at the back and found a huge food court. Mostly locals and fewer western visitors here. We were surprised at how cheap the food selections were at this food court. Most items were about 1/3 the cost of meals we had at the Siam Paragon. The selections of eateries, drinks and snack shops were most watering. Purchase your dining card (good for several months) and head to your desired eatery.
