We sampled several Thai dishes and mango & sticky rice and they were delicious and cheap! This mall is a fun location to see how they set up the city floor designs (arrivals and departures) and a really delicious food court. Not to be missed!

Awesome place for.. ... You can find anything at terminal 21. Terminal 21 is easily accessible using BTS. Once you get there...explore the area. Each floor is a theme and it is a great place to kill time before a movie. The top floor offers a knowledgeable staff if you need a sim card while you visit. The bottom floor offers a bunch of food vendors...one in particular is the street food vendor. He offers most of Thailand's street food in a cleaner and safer setting. There is also a fried squid vendor that offers fried squid with three different flavors. Grab one and a tea slushie, sit at the fountain and watch people before you leave. Makes a great relaxing lazy day.

everything under one roof. It has everything you need, though not at budget prices. Food court is great, serving food at small portions and prices are cheap. Imagine chicken rice at S$1.20.Free WiFi, make sure you bring yr passport to register at the information counter at level 1.Toilets are worth many visits, as they have different theme at different toilets.

Amazing place. This place is amazingly built, It's huge and has a lot to offer. We mainly stuck to the basement where food places are (only to realise there's more on the top floor!).I'd be wary as some places did have cockroaches but it's hard where they thrive in such a warm country.There are plenty of shops, there was a special denim event when we went so there was even more pop stalls everywhere.There are also currency exchanges, I'd avoid the dour faced one on ground level.Even the information desk ladies were dressed like air stewardesses which is a fantastic touch.

Good Ambience, worth enough. Remember to visit each of the floor with different theme. Especially for the washroom design, each level will be different, so creative! Let's go exploring the washroom xD

An awesome place to shop! Especially for men who are quite lean and have trouble finding clothes.. My partner and I went earlier today on our last afternoon in Bangkok. It was so awesome! We found began shoes, great cheap tees and shirts and even a few presents along the way. We have been to MBK which we hated and Central Embassy which was amazing for high end fashion- very high end. Terminal 21 is super easy to get to by sky rail and you get off at Asok station and walk inside from tents. Soooooo easy and the ambience is fabulous inside this shopping centre. Every level is set out as a different city of the world and the clothing and stuff to buy is all set according to that city style. Really clever!

Shopping Mall in the Heart of Sukhumvit Bangkok. An interesting mall showcasing many independent small shops owned by locals selling shirts and other articles of clothing. These shops for are on the higher floors and arranged by the types of goods sold. There are some international brand names on the lower floors. The food court offers great food at affordable prices. The food court uses a prepaid card system. The cards can be returned after having your meal. The highest floor has a cinema hall. The mall is easily accessible by the BTS and MRT systems.

Food Paradise on the top level. Located at Sukhumvit MRT or Asoke BTSFor shopping, is not bad, if you after local brands, not so many international brandsin this mallFor food, it was amazing!!! go to up level, food court , buy the card for the payment U will never regret, food every where !!! nice and not expensive !!

The best food court at the top level. I probably had the best experience tasting different kinds of food at the top level food court. The prices were much cheaper than other food courts, e.g. MBK, and the place was well lit. The portions were smaller, so that you can try a lot more different variety of food.Other than that, Terminal 21 is also a good place for shopping, and is conveniently located next to Ashok BTS station
shopping at terminal 21. I went shopping for some clothing at the Terminal 21 in Asoke Bangkok.and found the experience quite enriching and pleasurable.
Unique concept of shopping mall. I really enjoy shopping here not only because of the unique style and good for taking pictures but also for its cheaper products and foods.Very entertaining for us.

brand new shopping mall - expensive stuff. just browsing only...ha2 ! many shops are up market laa.. expensive stuff imported from Europe etc. Even the food court is quite pricey ....limited food . at dining table - long table , many flies coz no & don't see any cleaners to clear away dining tables. grilled pork skewers were quite expensive ...

Nice place to walk around. Every floor of this mall.has different theme. The whole place has designed like an airport. At the entrance there is a staff wearing something like a pilot and salute to anyone who goes into the mall. This makes us feel welcomed.There are many small.shops selling fashion and accessories. Many restaurants too. Quite a nice place to shop n eat.

Unique concept to brand the shopping mall. Visited this mall twice over the years.Love how they have various themes in various levels. The toilets are uniquely designed too.The shops on upper level sell things which are more affordable..If you do not have deep pocket, you can visit here.It is easily reached by BTS, Asoke station.

Big, but nothing too special. I visited this mall due to having a late flight out that day. I thought I'd do some shopping and have some lunch. The mall is large, with 6 floors- all named somewhere different around the world. There is plenty to eat with a vast range. However the shopping was pretty average.

Beautiful Shopping mall. This is a big shopping mall with different themes from many countries. England (London), Japan, Morocco, USA. Love the toilets for the different levels, Beautiful!. Check it out! Cinema, foodcourt selling nice food (reasonable price) and many stores in this shopping mall.

Great themed shopping mall in the heart of Bangkok. I have been here many times and always have a fun and unique shopping experience. The mall is quite large with lots of shopping and eating to be had. I love that each floor is themed in a unique city. One thing I particularly love about this mall is that you will find lots of smaller, sole owner shops here. I thought that was really cool and when you are buying something like clothes, you are often buying them from the person who designed and created them. When was the last time you walked into a clothes store and had that happen???The San Francisco Golden Gate Bridge going across the top floor is an awesome touch. (I might be a little biased as I am from the Bay Area) :)Overall.. one of my top two favorite malls when visiting Bangkok.

Very accessible. This shopping center is very to get to. Both the MRT and BTS arrives at this location.The shops there are a little pricey, but the themes are very nice for every level.there are many food stores around for all different kinds of food you would want to eat.

Cool shopping centre. Well designed with a different famous city landmark on each floor, went to the movies on the top floor, get a sofa seat if you're a couple very comfortable!! Western priced shops just like most big shopping centres around Bangkok

Our favourite mall in Bangkok!. After visiting MBK, Siam Paragon, CentralWorld and Terminal 21, it was definitely the latter that stood out for us. Yes there are the normal stores like H&M and Gap, but if you go up to the higher floors there are loads of little boutique and independent shops selling really unique things at good prices. We particularly liked the London and Istanbul floors. It also doesn't feel too big - CentralWorld is almost too big to manage, as you feel like you are missing so much of it. Terminal 21 isn't small by any standards, but it definitely feels like you get more out of a visit, particularly if you only have an afternoon or few hours spare. The design is also fun with the different themed levels, which helps it stands out a bit from some of the other, more bland malls in Bangkok!
Incredible mall. We really enjoyed this mall. It's enormous and the themed floors are really amazing. It's definitely not cheap though!

Typical mall. It is a typical mall that has a level with the usual brands like H&M, Adidas, Espirit and more. Another level with mainly man fashion and another level with woman fashion which is much more pricy than pratunam mall. There are some shop with unique design at the woman fashion collection. However, i will recommend a shop if you want to get wedding dresses as it cost about SGD500 to get a very decent, well design and pretty dress.The mall also have a food court at the top level and you are required to purchase a card at the counter before buying food. You can refund the excess money in the card from the same counter. The food at the food court is mediocre but cheap. A plate of pad thai cost only 50baht (SGD: $2). There are many restaurant to choose from if you are not eating from the food court. There is a small supermarket at the lowest level the mall as well as a cinema.A place that I will visit only if my hotel is nearby.

Convenient services and great food court. Visited the 6th floor to get a local sim and prepaid service. Happened upon the food court on the 5th floor with an abundance of options. Purchased a food card (apply as much as you intend to spend) which has a validity of 30 days. For shopping it has a few big chain stores in the center but also a lot of more "funky" /trendy shops similar to asiatique.

One of Thailand"s better malls. The mall is centrally located in the heart of the Sukhumvit area and can be easily reach by subway or sky train. Here you will find a large variety of place to shop but it can be somewhat pricey. With large walking areas an aircon making it another way to stay out of the Bangkok heat while shopping.

A BIG mall to spend time. We checked in to our hotel in afternoon & before exploring the Bangkok's nightlife we headed to Terminal 21 to spend some time. Its big mall with lot of Branded shopping options for a genuine shopper as well as window shopper. Will recommend to spend some good time.

Interesting Shopping Centre. Dont expect to shop alot unless you are here with a slightly higher budget. There are still some small fashionable ones in the higher levels though. Interesting place with cool designs every level. Especially in the toilets! Loved the Japan theme.

Terminal 21 in Bangkok. This fascinating shopping experience opened only recently, has 5 levels all themed to different parts of the world, such as London, San Francisco, Istanbul. There is a plethora of shops at every level with excellent inexpensive eating on the 5th floor, frequented by hosts of Thais themselves, which is always a good indicator !

New shopping mall, right on Sukhumvit, down town Bangkok, near Asoke intersection. Everything is there. Perfect, when you have some business about your mobile phone, Internet, banking, everything is there. Just want to go to see a movie? Some 600 shops are awaiting you, including a very nice hotel. Reachable and direct access to BTS (Sky train) and MRT (Subway). Right on the Asoke intersection. If you feel like a beer, across the road the famous Soi Cowboy. Everything is there for a interesting day and or evening!

It's a shopping centre....... OK, this is a weakness of TripAdvisor, a separate category for shopping centres might help, but are there really only 18 things more interesting/worth doing in the whole of Bangkok?It's clean, bright and full of, well, the same shops you find all over the world. It's handy for the BTS and has some OK snack bars, a couple of good restaurants and a reasonable supermarket.

I love it. Great shopping mall and very near to Asok bts station. Each floor have different themes eg. Hollywood, london, tokyo etc.. if you are a muslim, there is only one food stall at the food court which is providing halal food. But the food is not very appetizing.

Nice affordable mall. I went there with my teen daughters and they enjoyed it very much and it was so good that I bought gifts for the whole family back home in very good prices but still very good quality!You can eat as well in many cafes and restaurants around and each floor represent a major capital of the world! Like one floor is London the other is Tokyo...Istsnbul and so on..really fun and nice!

Shopping at its Best. This is located on Sukhumvit 21 (Asoke) and easily accessible by BTS (Shukumvit station). This is shopping paradise. Different floors have different theme based on different country (i.e. Italy, Great Britain, USA etc.). Lots of Great shops. You can easily spend 4/6 hours here just by window shopping. Great food in the bottom floor.

An interesting place to visit. At first I was a little confused with the decor, I thought it was some sort of transit depo. But I figured out that each level has its own "theme", let's say Tokyo, San Fran for example. Shops were cool. Plenty of food options. We had lunch in the Tokyo section, it was fairly priced and delicious. Would definitely go back with more time up my sleeve to look at things.

OMG - the Disney of shopping malls!. Went here last week having read previous TA reviews. Great mix of mid range shops and boutiques. Particularly loved the TOKYO level boutique shops - good if you're European and looking for some clothes with a unique style but remember that Eastern sizes are generally a lot smaller than European. Also loved the way each floor has been themed - our fav's for style/design/photo op's were Tokyo, San Fran, and London - took advice of other reviewers and visited the loo's on Rome floor - not many places where you can say you've washed your hands in the Trevi fountain but you can here! Also, don't miss the Caribbean floor - easily overlooked but worth a visit as the food stalls here are just stunning!
lots of restaurants. recommend to stay for 3-4 hours here, you can go for shopping mainly at H&M, then pick a restaurant for a meal

Great modern mall!. The mall is connected directly with the station, its very modern with many big name brands you’d know, which I don’t think its special. There are a few nice/special shops, probably retailers from Thailand or SE Asia(?). There were a few clothing shops that does promotion sales, I am not sure was it because of the season or occasionally there were. However, at the bottom level, there was the Gourmet Market which I feel is probably one of the more attractive and worthwhile because it sold a variety of foods from different countries at a reasonable price, especially the Thai food. There was also one or two shops that sells books where you can buy postcards and stamp. I have to admit tho, I did not venture all levels of the shopping mall, just mainly the bottom level. Definitely worth a visit should you have nothing to do or in the summer want to get some air conditioning.
Trendy. A good trendy shopping mall. Many interesting stuffs. Toilet facilities were surprising hygienic then a hospital in Bangkok. Food court is well known a good place to taste Thai food.
Mall with wide variety of shops. Our 15 year old son loves coming here. The food court is really nice with a wide variety of choices. The fancy movie theatre here is a bit on the expensive side.

best mall. for me this is the best mall at BKK...........awesome location.......go by MRT n enter straight into the mall............variety of shops n stuff dat you would'nt find elsewhere. simply superb

Cheap court at fifth floor . Internationally themed shopping mall with many familiar global fashion and food franchises . There was also a cinema at the top floor if you need to catch some shows.
The air conditioned food court,sky 21, at fifth floor was also an awesome place to settle for a quick meal . Affordable pricing with excellent hygiene. Highly recommended.

Designs and colors . Amazing mall. The designs of every floor varies and interesting. I really enjoyed taking pictures while going around every floor.I loved the food at the food court- vegetarian and meat lover friendly.. Worth visiting.. and don't forget to check every toilet in every floor, it makes you smile when you enter coz it's really amazing. Visit even if you're not gonna use it.. ☺☺
It's fascinating.. You can buy the clothes coming into fashion in Bangkok here. The name such as Tokyo, Paris and Istanbul is put on each floor, and it's fascinating.

Interesting shopping mall. Interesting idea for a shopping mall. Fabulous decoration. Excellent food court. Amazing restroom!!!! I came back to Thailand after 6 years and they have done better with this mall. Definitely visit this than the Siam center. Those have grow old and boring.

Worth a Visit. This is a very unique shopping mall so definitely worth a visit if you're in the area. Each floor has a theme so offers something for everyone. The food court is also really good, we had some delicious food here. Pop in and take advantage of the air conditioning.
A must see mall (!). One of the unique malls in Bangkok. Highly designed, it has 7 floors, each floor with a different city in the world. Very recommend (!)

Really cool mall!. The most unique mall I have ever been to. Its floors are named after cities/ destinations hence, the name of the mall. There is a wide range of stores and restaurants with different cuisines, and the bathrooms are really cute, too!It is located on BTS Asok station and the Metro station via a walk way, making it very accessible.

Interesting Idea . Shopping mall with an airport theme. Each floor is a different country and the escalators etc are made to look like different airports - fun for taking photos , I didn't get time to visit all the floors. There is free WiFi if you ask at the service counter and a discount tourist card is available with coupons too. The shops can be found anywhere like Victoria's Secrets etc. The real highlight are toilets well worth visiting every single one on each floor.

Unique Shopping Centre with fabulous food court. I love the themed levels - really reminded us of the quirkiness of Tokyo. Great little boutiques combined with chain stores. Nice mix of shops. Best of all there is a great food court on the top level. Yummy coconut ice cream.

My new favourite mall!. This place was perfect for shopping! I loved the little boutiques and that they were not big brands. You can really find unique things here and it is quite affordable too. Not the cheapest but not too expencive either. Loved the themes in different floors! Location was good since it is directly connected to Asok sky train station.

wow the design of this place is awesome!. What to say when you can experience a different city from around the world depending on what level you are on. The shopping and restaurants are superb. Easy to take sky train to here.

interesting department store. They have different theme for every story. And the ground floor is the one you can't miss!They have market, foods, and pocky store there!Thailand -only limited flavor pocky have ideal price in the shop there.We bought lots of them, and get 3 free pocky bag for handing more easily. XDNice department store.

Great theme mall to shop & take photos. We spent a full day at this mall. Connected to both the BTS & MRT, this is a mall with a difference. It has an interesting one floor one theme concept. From the lower ground Caribbean through Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco & Hollywood. It resembles a 21st century airport. It's a shoppers paradise as it has brands & smaller independent shops. Great food available too besides a cineplex.
all country is here. the style of this department store is very nice, they try to divided each country in to floor. Such as if you go g. fl it is london, then second fl is another country.
Nice local mall. The layout of Terminal 21 is lovely and very few tourists as mostly middle class Thais visit it. The food court has some very good restaurants mostly serving Thai and Japanese food.
Shopping. Great place for shopping and to grab something to eat. Prices are normal and food is ok. Plenty of different shops

interesting toilets. The toilets at every floor has their own theme, good for photo taking. Each of the floors also have their own themes, differentiated by countries. Interesting malls with both local and overseas brands. Nearby Asok for massage as well.

Great shopping Complex right next to a MTR train stop. Terminal 21 is a very popular shopping complex with all the essential brand name shops and boutiques plus multiple levels of eating places including a large food court with very well priced Asian cuisine. There is a good gourmet supermarket on the lower ground floor with all the essentials. Take in a movie at the modern cinemas on the top floor.
Thai designers. I went looking for clothes from local designers and wasn't disappointed. It was not as low price as I imagined. Got a couple of good things. Worth the visit.

My feel of 21. This shopping center falls under the middle class category. There were many levels categorized by different cities. Each level has its own taste. There were many shops, mainly for ladies, less of men. There is a food court on the fifth level. Known as Pier 21. You need to buy credit purchase card in order to make purchases.There is a Cinema here. Not a bad theatre. However, expect to watch 20 mins of advertisement before the show starts.Location is near to Sukhumvit MRT and Asok BTS.
okay. cheaper than siam paragon. every level has different 'city' theme. just decorative nothing more than that. foods there were okay-priced.

Epic! A must go.. This mall is awesome, each floor is designed like a different city and caters to a specific genre. We went here our last night in Thailand and absolutely loved it, both my girlfriend and I ended up buying a bunch of clothes and items on each floor. Close to the top they have an amazing food court with authentic Asian food. A must go if you have a free hour or two to explore.

Good for lunches, not sure about shopping. Terminal 21 is a pleasant mall for strolling around as it is very spacious and extremely well designed. On each floor, the decoration for each theme is excellent and high-quality (the toilets are a must visit and are very successful, for photos & selfies as much as for their initial purpose!). I am not a huge fan of the myriads of shopping outlets on the higher floors as really aimed at a very young clientele but there is a good choice of restaurants on the top floor, as well as a handy Gourmet Market on the basement.

A different experience. Unlike ordinary malls, this one has a theme to every floor. Each floor, even the toilets, are designed as per some world city or the other. So, you have London, Istanbul, Paris, San Fransico.....etc at different floors. The experience is good and enjoyable. You can shop at stores like H&M or at local designers. The apparel is not so cheap but you can get a good bargain or two if you explore well. The food court offers all kind of cuisine and is surely recommended.

Pointless. Thought this would be cool to see because it's designed like different major cities. It's underwhelming at best. All the stores are expensive European imports and everything closes at 9:30 even though it's supposed to be open till 10. Bought a food court card 10 minutes before closing and nothing was servings anything. Don't know why they even sold me a card knowing that everything was closed. Wouldn't bother with this place again. Just look at my pics below and you'll get the jist of it.

Wonderful mall. I keep coming back to this mall, it has such a nice atmosphere with the different themes on each floor. Haven't bought anything there yet, only walked around the small shops. There are all kinds of different stores, from H&M to local designers. I suggested walking around the smaller ones because it is just really a feast for the eyes. Also a visit to the toilets is a great experience! Found a tiny coffee shop called Coffee Today around the men's section that served great iced Thai tea really cheap. Only two tables right at a big window, really calm. If you need to unwind this is the place to go!And if you need wifi just go to the reception on ground floor and show your passport/Thai ID and you will get 2 hours for free!

Great Idea Marred By A Needlessly Convoluted Food System. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall with themed floors based on counties. There is a French floor, a Caribbean floor, 2 American floors, a Japanese floor, an Italian floor and of course: A London floor. For our non English readers I need to let you know something, there is no England outside of London, it's a myth, we all wear paddy hats and drive around in big red busses saying "G'day Guvna', 'ows the missus?" whilst slurping from our tea Thermos. It's jolly good fun.After wandering aimlessly like a travelling couple on a budget trying to kill time we got hungry. The only food in our price range was a simulated food highstreet in the top floor with THE MOST NEEDLESSLY CONVOLUTED PAYMENT SYSTEM IN THE WHOLE WORLD! We ordered 2 rice meals with pork and duck which was uninspired to say the very very least, it is the blandest dinner which wasn't helped by the fact that it was cold by the time we ate it due to all of the running around, they wouldn't let us pay with cash as we were supposed to have coupon cards from a reception terminal at the other side of the floor, we gave them cash and they gave us a card which we took back to them and they had to wait a minute to register the payment, all the while our poor excuse for a meal was just sitting there.If you have money to waste go to the mall and eat the expensive food, the cheap food benefits nobody.

Waste of time in such a great city. Maybe if all you want to do is be indoors and see shops NOT from Thailand then you will enjoy this place. It just seemed pointless to me and was devoid of people so soulless.

Best shopping in the area. After walking through mall after mall in BKK, I didn't expect to see anything new - until I hit Terminal 21.Each floor is themed like a different country, with a vibe to match (definitely don't miss the market-style "Tokyo" floor). The clothing is often locally made, and the wares are completely different from what you'll find in similar malls down the street.The food court is HUGE (San Francisco level) and there's even a grocery store with a fresh salad bar should you want to meet your healthy-food cravings - what else can a traveler ask for?Definitely a place I'll return to again and again.
Best food court. They are selling the best price food in the food court.Delicious meal, affordable price and variety choice. The toilets are international build

Interesting and amazing Mall. We were several times in that Shopping Mall and not only because of the shops, but of all the details and different decoration of cities of around the world. E.g. one floor is called london and everything is decorated in a british blue and red style and a typical british Phone booth can be found just in between the shopping mall. Very Impressing is the miniature Golden Gate Bridge of San Fransisco.The mall does not offer World Brands clothing but more of no-name clothing. Be careful Terminal 21 is famous for getting fake goods there. But in the shops they tell you that everything is real, but it´s not.

Interesting shopping mall to visit. This is the second time we visited this place, fascinating concept attracts us the most.. Impressed by their each floor different theme and toilet's theme. One of the toilet theme is bakery theme concept!

Interesting Mall to Visit. I'm the type of person who doesn't go shopping, however, I visited this mall almost 5 times during my one week stay, (although I did stay at the hotel above the mall). You don't even need to buy anything here, it's worth it to just come and take pictures. Every floor as a theme of a country, and I'm from the San Francisco area, so I have to say they did an amazing job of the San Francisco floor of the mall. Even all the restrooms have themes, and there is a restroom on every floor. The 5th floor behind the Golden Gate bridge had a great food court with street food prices. The bottom floor also has a grocery store. However there is no cinema or bar here. Terminal 21 is located next to the train station as well. Sukhumvit for MRT, Asoke for BTS.

Sushi Den at LG of Terminal 21. Japanese food at affordable price. Chance upon this sushi joint at LG of Terminal 21. The sushi is freshly make upon ordering and the raw salmon is fresh and thick. There is no need to go to the expensive restaurants at Terminal 21. We will definitely dine here again when we are back in Bangkok.
Not as good as expected. Lots of expensive shops nothing really special many of these shops on the high street in England h and m, boots and Victoria's Secret etc and cheaper in england

Good. Huge shopping Centre next to Asoke BTS station in Sukhumvit.Floors are based on various Capital cities and as the name refers it is themed throughout as an airport.Top two floors are covered with a huge range of restaurants and well worth a visit.
cheap food, great themes. Food at the food court is so affordable that we always come here for our meals...with vegan options too! Comfort rooms (WC) are large and goes with the theme too...so cute.

Must visit in Bangkok town . Excellent shopping experience in Bangkok town! Good location, it's located beside the Asok BTS station. Beautiful decoration and interior with different theme at each floor.. Pay a visit to the food court for cheap and different variety of food.
Nice place for shopping. Nice place for shopping, even the place is not to big, and the item that they sell also not to expensive, so we still can buy the souvenir with good quality.

Great place. This shopping experience at Terminal 21 is best one you will ever have, excellent shops, excellent layout, with all the different countries you visit on each level is so fantastic. The food is wonderful. A great to just visit without even shopping, that's how great it is. Also it's right near the BTS skytrain.
Cheap food, desserts and drinks. You can eat here with ease cause some dishes are cheaper than 1 USD. They also provide free dringking water and disposable tissue paper.

Another big mall . These no shortages of big malls here and this in no exception. The slight difference with this one is that there is a cinema and arcade near the top floor and each floor has a theme. Plus it has one of the cheapest and best food courts around, it's as cheap as a lot of the street food, so well worth taking a look.

Huge place & cool concept. Nothing special besides it having a very cool concept of theme floors, food court have good selection of Thai food too. Well I am not much a shopper but for those who love shopping this place might be paradise for you.

interesting concept. if you haven't been here, it's rather cool. conveniently located beside Asok BTS, it's definitely worth a trip! it's a mix of mid-range brands to small indie shops, you may just find some random stuff here! there's a supermarket, food court and some restaurants here... toilets are clean and themed.

The land of smiles, could be the land of MALLS... So Bangkok does not have a shortage of places to shop, and that includes big malls. On Sukhumvit Road, there are a number of major malls with in walking distance of each other.One of the these malls is Terminal 21. The mall in multi-leveled with each floor having a different theme, and the escalators has signs resembling different airport terminals. One floors is San Francisco themed with a scaled version of the Golden Gate bridge. It's worth checking out, and there's a lot of small shops to find things. The food court at Terminal 21 is one of the better ones I've been to in Thailand. Good selection of food from western, Indian, Asian, etc. Prices are decent, but some are also a little high if you compare it to buying Bangkok street food.This malls stays packed with shoppers so if you don't like big crowds try to get there early, but don't expect it to stay quiet long.

Large impressive thematic shopping centre. Large impressive shopping centre with a clear theme for each floor like a airport terminal. Easy to locate the stores and it is connected to the BTS train station. Like the local design floor shopping. I skipped all the MNC brand shopping and go straight to the level 3rd floor. I picked up a few local designer dresses and blouse at very reasonable price. One of them is Graffe. I also ventured to the jewelery and bags floor. Love the brand - Flow founded by Thai designer Ms Valaipan Chupan. If you are looking for evening gowns, this is also a place you can find a couple of shop specialised in these. Designs can be simple with details or complicated with sequins, crystals and beads. I think they do alterations for those who are willing to wait. Some of them are made of quality Thai silks gown with striking royal colours like purple and gold. A must go for those who like to look at local design. It is a young and trendy mall to be as i saw students in uniform, locals as well as tourists visiting this mall. The other part that is impressive is the variety of cafe and restaurants. I went round the 2 floors 2 times before deciding which one to settle down for dinner.

Great Place to Visit and eat. There are plenty of variety of food and desserts to chose from. The prices are very reasonable. You don't need to go to an upper class restaurant to enjoy Thai food. The are has also plenty to offer for shopping.

A shopping mall that's worth checking out. This shopping mall offers expensive brand items mostly, but its main attraction is the mall itself. Its floors are themed around different cities around the world. Its really well made, worth checking out.

Malls. This is just like another malls but with a unique concept. Every floor has different theme of some big city from different nation. As I said, this is just a mall and nothing you can do unless shopping. Not priority to be visited in Bangkok.How to get there:1. Going by MRT and take off at Sukhumvit Station and exit 3. Go to the right and you will find the mall directly on your side.2. Going by BTS and take off at Asok Station. I am not sure where the exit because I went there by MRT. The officer and the sign may help you.
Nice not in center on Asok BTS station. Nice mall at Asok BTS station.Used to have better prices before.Today quiet expensive.Remember to take turist discount card at first floor info desk.

Cool mall. This is the coolest mall I've ever been into. Each floor represents a different nation with no expense spared to detail. The restaurants in here are largely expensive, but the main food hall is really cheap, as is the excellent cinema...

Worth a visit-quite different from most malls!. As others have said, this is a travel themed mall,each floor is decorated differently than the others-cool to see, and lots of places to eat on the top 2 levels. For real shopping, this is a good place to go, especially for men. For women, it seems like there are more boutique type shops, but there are some regular places, H&M, Esprit, etc.

One to take the Kids. Terminal 21 is a themed shopping centre with all the areas named after airports or bridges or notable destinations. I have been there a couple of times to go to the movies on the top floor, it has a range of restaurants and fast food outlets and is close to both the skytrain and the underground rail. So I would suggest that if you are in Bangkok with children and wondering where to take them this place would entertain them for most of the day, and you can have a look at some of the fashion stores as well.
Nice shpping center. It’s a quite big shopping center with a lot of levels, each one has a name of a big city.A lot of small boutique shops. Easy to reach with BST (ASOK)

Super Mall. One of the cleanest and best shopping malls I hv visited.Different floors hv themes from various cities in the world.The multiplex is also very good to watch movies with cushy seats and large leg room!

Impressive Place to Visit - Shopping or Not. Other reviewers have already praised this place, but I'll add my perspective - as a guy just walking around looking for a new place to explore, with no desire for shopping, and not fond of inside mall environments. The location is walkable from much of Sukhumvit and right off the platform of the Asoke BTS stop.My first impression walking inside was Wow! This place is really impressive. The complex is built around a large atrium that's 7 floors open. Inside this open area are numerous escalators shuttling people around like a future sci-fi city movie. Really, the long one from the bottom is truely the neatest escalator I've ever seen. Riding up, I was looking around like a country boy visiting the city for the first time, gawking at the immensity of the place.Each floor has glass walls and low rails protecting the atrium edge, but still allowing one to lean over, look down, and be equally scared and impressed with the exposure and open view. Besides the numerous international stores, local table shops, floor themes, art decor, and nice bathrooms on each floor, there's a multitude of outdoor cafe/eating/sitting areas that offer atrium edge views. Whether people watching or web surfing, a person could really spend a lot of time in these areas. There's free wifi throughout the mall, but one has to register with an email address the first time logging on - at a desk somewhere I didn't investigate.It took me awhile to understand the airport gate, country destination, floor setup. But once figured out, I'll admit that it's unique and clever. There's logic in grouping similar types of stores on each floor - ie, tec all on one floor. Since I wasn't intentionaly shopping, I can't detail the pattern except to say that the movie theatre was on the top (7th floor). I'm sure it's first class.With diverse shopping, numerous places to eat, and a cool (entertaining) environment, I'd recommend a visit to this place as a great recreational activity for most anyone - even a guy who doesn't care much for malls or shopping.
Interesting shopping mall. This travel-themed shopping mall is an excellent idea executed brilliantly. It's quite fun to travel to London to Paris to Istanbul to Tokyo and so on.

Phenomenal experience - shopping, food, or simply sight-seeing. By far the best shopping mall i've ever been to. The primary reason for you to go is none other than the clever designs of different landmarks or designs of a particular city, which varies on every different floor. As you can see from the photo, the famous Sans Francisco Bridge (no idea what's the actual name..sorry!). There's designs from cities like London (even the guards on that floor dressed in the British royal guards uniform), China, Japan, Istanbul and Rome. Being a vegetarian, i find this mall very helpful as the food court on the 4th or 5th floor called the Pier 21 offers a wide range of food, including a vegetarian rice/noodle stall. 40 Baht for 3 dishes if not mistaken, was indeed a great value judging by the price and the portion of rice and dishes the staff gave us.Bottomline, don't hesitate to visit Terminal 21 as it is easily accessible by taking the BTS to Asok station, which is pretty convenient to most of us.***P.S. I am posting this to every review i make for ThailandDO NOT, i repeat DO NOT go for UNMETERED-TAXI. They will tell you 'cannot...traffic jammmm' in their Thai accent and will persuade you to pay a certain amount of Baht instead of going by the meter, which will cause you more than it should be. The first night upon reaching the Don Mueang Airport we paid 300 Baht to the taxi driver outside of the airport (The ones inside the airport would cost even more) and on the last day we paid only 97 Baht by hiring a METERED-TAXI from the hotel lobby.
Mr David . Amazing shopping centre in Bangkok! So many floors. So many food choices! So much variety of shops. A great place to relax, eat and shop.

Best food court in the city.. I hate shopping malls. Really, I can't stand them... but I enjoy coming to T21 every time in BKK. The food court on the 4th floor is amazing and very inexpensive, the cinema on the 5th floor is great showing English movies in a high quality setting, and the people watching is fun. Best mall in BKK easy.

A different shopping experience. We stumbled across this mall walking down the unlovely Sukhimvit Rd when we popped in to escape the heat. What a surprise! My husband (a man who is NOT a keen shopper) actually declared it one of the best shopping centres he's seen.Well laid out, the centre is themed around an airport with each floor a different "destination" (London, Paris, Rome, Tokyo, Istanbul etc) and each floor has similar stores so all menswear specialists are together, accessories, etc. while this probably isn't the home of the cheapest shops in Bangkok we enjoyed the variety and the fact that there were lots of small individual quirky boutiques, so not the same old thing. Worth a visit if you're in the area & make sure you check out the themed bathrooms as well!
A little bit of home in Thailand. Each floor of this mega mall represented a city or country! I loved it here, great food all around and a movie theater on the top floor!

Trendy. A very modern and trendy shopping mall with all varieties of shops based on theme. You want to go to London and ride double Decker, it is there, go to Sanfrancisco, it is there. The very good food restaurants are there. Good cinema hall. Enjoyed great films. Very spacious and comfortable verandah to move around. Posh, chic boutiques, eatery and salons were tempting.

Mid-Range Fashion Mall. They have numerous small boutique with indie brands. Price was around twice comparing to Platinum, but seems have better quality. The toilet near cinema was like japanese toilet, with many buttons same like japanese, minus music and seat warmer.

So Many Malls so little Time. I reviewed Central World awhile ago then came across Terminal 21 a unique international themed mall.Central seemed to host higher end stores and restaurants while Terminal 21 was focused more for local people. The food court had an interesting setup where one buys a food debit card in any amount and you buy your food using the card. Food stalls never handle money. On the perimeter of the court are higher end restaurants that take credit cards. Interesting was a couple of food stalls representing a couple of Michelin starred restaurants.Terminal 21 has a mix of small gift vendors and larger chains like H&M.
This is THE PLACE. If you want to spend all day shopping with your family at the most convenient location this is the right place, the food court is the best

Re-visited Twice within a month ( visited bangkok twice within a month ). Items in boutiques overpriced thats how I feel . Went to the food court on the top level ordered from one of the stall . Food turn out to be not-nice . Maybe will try other stall next time ?? Not sure . Still a bit afraid that it will turn out not nice again .  Food stalls in the basement are much nicer .

Pricey plaza . The mall is very modern,not much different than north America . But staffs are not too friendly, with this much of tourists enter the country every year, why can't they speak a better English.

Amazing to see, but very expensive!. You will never see a shopping mall like this! It is designed like a terminal in an airport, every floor is a different country.. Paris, Tokyo, San Francisco etc! It is HUGE...BUT it is very expensive compared to prices in England. The brands are expensive and we didn't find any bargains. Good for a rainy day and good to see.

Fancy. This is so fascinating!!! Fantastic!!! Amazing!!!
Since I temporary stayed here I visited at least twice a day, just love the display and interior management of the sections. There are many fancy restaurants regarding to the floors; sanfrancisco, london, japanese and so on. Fancy shopping mall

Summarize a shopping mall? can't.. Ok, this mall is not what must tourists are looking for, this one is a bit expansive for what its offering.
But, it had 6 floors of almost everything you are looking for.
From stores to a great verity of food. Cinema in the 6th floor. PS4 shop and even a movie's miniatures shop.
A great mall to wander at!
Nice mall to visit with different themes. It's a nice mall to visit with different themes for each floor like Istanbul, Italy, San Francisco. Good to sho for kids.

Very Cool & Interesting Shopping Centre. The Terminal 21 shopping centre is very well laid out, with each floor interestingly themed around a different city of the world.
There are local & international stores on offer and some of them are quite pricey, so it's not a cheap place to visit, but it is good fun and worth a visit.

Halal food on 5 floor. Halal food located on 5 floor of lifestyle mall. The restaurant served themselves with various food such as yellow steam rice with chicken/fish, fried rice with shrimp pasted, and curry

Quirky Shopping Mall with Great Independent Shops. Terminal 21 is a unique shopping mall for BKK. Unlike the other malls which have 98% chain stores, T21 has multiple floors with independent shops offering unique variety.There is an entire floor for women and the same for men, with a outstanding selection of unique clothing and shoes. Also it is nice to have the ability to negotiate the price with the independents which would never happen in the chain stores.Each floor has a "city" theme which is kind of cute. The decor of the floor is designed to mimic the city. Great selection of restaurants located on the upper floors. Conveniently located a skywalk from Asoke BTS we always find something unique to buy on every visit.

Excellent shopping complex. This was my third visit, and I still like it. I like the way they set up the escalators, which means you can visit the floors as you which without walking around on a floor you are not interested in. The only thing I don't understand is the escalator which lands in the H&M shop !? If you going for clothes, many choices over many levels. The third floor is interesting with boutiques which overs many products. Fourth and fifth floor for food. The foodcenter is excellent and very busy. At the basement more food and the Gourment department. Worth the visit, even if you don't like shopping.
Ridiculously cool shopping mall.. Each floor is themed as a country and/or a famous city. Plenty of branded shops and lots of little stalls selling nice bits and bobs.

Unique shopping experience. Love this shopping mall. Every floor is a differences city. So you can buy fashion styles from all around the world in different floors. It's such an amazing experience any tourist must come. Even if it's to experience the different toilets in each floor!!

Cool shopping center, a bit pricey. You can take the BTS and stop at Asok station, where you can find a direct access to the mall. The mall is unique, with lots of themes. For shopping, it's considered a bit pricey compare to other places like MBK or Platinum. But the food court is relatively cheap compare to food courts at Siam Paragon. Our visit to BKK is all about egg noodle soup with pork/beef, to die for.

Everything at one place. Luckily we were staying at the Westin Grande Hotel which was just a 2 min walk to the mall, during our 3 day stay in Bangkok we we there every day. The mall just does not offer a great shopping experience but also has some of the best food. The boutique shops were contemporary style selling trendy shoes to high end brands. Will definitely like to be back for some more shopping and tasty Thai food.
Young people shopping mall. This shopping mall is suitable for 90s as all products and shops are very modern and cute. All young ppl stuff can be found here.

Shopping haven...err...heaven. In the many times that I have visited Bangkok, what puzzles me is why I never got to visit this shopping haven for shopping mavens. Finally, I was able to set foot on its themed floors in my past Bangkok trip.The first thing one would observe is the destination-themed floors, i.e., San Francisco for the 4th floor/ restaurants, etc. I appreciate that a concept was incorporated for the whole mall. It is well organised that gives a shopper focus when one has some items in mind to buy. A lot of the Thai designers have converged here so one ends up with unique Thai finds one won't find in other shopping places.I stayed for about 3 hours and told myself to leave before I get buried under the shopping bags I'm bewildered to have with me then.Happy shopping!

Around the World! In a few floors!. Super centre to visit when in Bangkok. Absolutely stunning design and clever styling as each floor represents a different country. The Golden Gate Bridge, complete with little cars crossing. Great food on offer! Mexican! Italian! Continental! You name it. They there. Food court also available for quick dining. One of the longest escalators I've ever seen. Just a really cool centre in which to stroll around and explore. Well worth a visit! Always a stop for us when we visit Bangkok!
Shopping destination for decent brands. very conviniently located next to Asoka BTS.. Plenty of great brands available.. Many quality restaurants also present.. Overall a big thumbs up!

Really good . This is a really good shopping centre, it has all your high street stores, plus high end, plus boutique style stores and independent all under one roof! The airport design and floor themes are fab! I love the San Francisco floor with the tram and bridge! Loads of food places in here too! Thoroughly recommend a visit

Didn't live up to expectations . My husband and I were very excited about visiting Terminal 21 on this our 3rd trip to Bangkok. We were sad to say that we were bitterly disappointed in the experience. While the centre is stunning with each floor being decorated to look like a specific city; we found the shop owners to be quite rude and disinterested in customers. This was not a a specific shop, but rather a general attitude. We hope were also very pricey when compared to other places in Bangkok selling the exact same items. We had been at Asiatique Riverfront the previous night and saw many, many of the same items at much better prices- the experience there was also much better. We needed up leaving Terminal 21 and taking the train to MBK instead.

Great place for shoping and eating. Great place to shop and eat. Every floor designed as different city, London,Tokyo, San Francisco and etc'.There is food court on the top floor, you need to preload card with money, that you can pay with it in the food stands. Balance can be cashed at the end of your visit.

GOT IT ALL. This place is directly accessible from the Asok BTS station and the Sukumwit MRT station. It has several floors of shopping in addition to dozen of restaurants and bars.The restaurants come in a huge varieties of styles and prices. There is a GOURMET supermarket in the basement. The food court has many food island serving Thai specialities. Pretty good at a super reasonable price for Bngkok. The food court is always very crouded, lively and bit noisy. Terminal 21 is really popular get ready to wait at your favorite eating joint for lunch or dinner.

Plenty of shops!. This is a very large shopping mall with a wide variety of shops and many places to eat. Quality varies, but is generally good. The theme is interesting given the many floor and shops on different levels. It's a modern mall and prices are generally fixed. There are many street vendors in the area where bargaining is much more the norm.
Shopping . Can come here by bts asok or mrt sukhumvit.have clothes shop and restaurant and cinema.have many restaurant here for dinner or chilling.
Theme Shopping Mall. Every Floor in different Theme, toilets also in different theme. Really interesting. Lots of food, drink, cafe & restaurants can be found in there.

Huge Mall, Scary Escalators!. Warning to anyone afraid of heights. There are huge (take 3 stories up instead of one) escalators that I thought I was fine taking up, but quickly became really scared on.. Otherwise this mall is fantastic, great shops and views and at the entrance there are men saluting you like sailors. The food court was great. As mentioned in other reviews of malls in bangkok, Vegetarian food stall was obvious and vegan food was available by simply looking at which dishes did not contain eggs. Terminal 21 is a must visit... and a tip for any vegetarians in bangkok, all the major malls have veg food stalls in their food courts. It's a blessing!

Weird!. Well located on Sukhumvit Road at Asoke Station...A relatively new Shopping Centre featuring many local brands at high end prices... For some reason each floor is named and decorated after different cities... Paris, London, Istanbul... Makes very little sense considering the shops.A small branch of the Gourmet World grocery store is on the bottom floor.

Great to have a look, but overpriced. I went here recently with some friends on my first trip to Bangkok. It's very close the train and buses, and only cost 15 baht one way from where we were staying (one stop away). The whole building is designed to look like an airport, with huge escalators connecting the floors. It was really fun to walk around and see the different levels decked out as different destinations around the world. There is security at the entrance that you have to go through but they were okay. The food court was great, you can get yummy mango sticky rice there and there is a great view through the huge windows of BKK. I wouldn't really shop there, as when we had a look around all of the items were way overpriced. I would definitely go and check it out, take some photos, but I would go elsewhere (like anywhere else) to actually shop.

Good for eating and spending time if you're staying nearby. I'm rating it 5 stars on the assumption that you're staying near this place and don't need to take extra transportation/time to get there. It is a very nice mall because it has the "Travel the world theme". First of all, when you enter, you go through a security gate like the ones in the airport. The elevators and escalators also make you feel you are at the airport.Each floor has a country/main city as theme, for example Paris, Istanbul, Japan, or SF. The decoration, the toilets, and even the security/cleaning personnel have different uniforms depending on the floor!There's also a good foodcourt, where we ate the cheapest food in Thailand (we didn't try street food as the hygiene is very questionable there). We went with a local and he told us that no other mall had such cheap foodcourt.In all, if you are living nearby (Asok Station) and have some time to spare, you can amuse yourself here. There's even a small treasure hunt available. You get an information paper at the information desks and collect 3 stamps on the back of this paper in different floors, and then return it to get a souvenir. Sadly, the souvenir was a snack, and it was a seaweed... which I didn't appreciate. I thought it would be something related to the terminal 21 mall.

Worth a visit. Can visit if you have not been to the mall.... Every floor is decorated with different themes and surprisingly there are some shops selling shirts and dresses at reasonable price. The huge food court, Pier 21 (level 5) offers good variety of local food at very reasonable prices.

Extremely Overrated Shopping Centre. This place is an extremely overrated shopping centre. Each level is named after a different global city like Tokyo, London, San Francisco... When you change levels, you 'depart' one city and 'arrive' in another. You will see a lot of people taking selfies in front on the city name signs - perhaps that is as close as they'll ever get to that city? Also, the same type of shops aren't really located together like in most shopping centres which can mean a lot of level changing to look for similar items. One last thing, some friends took us for 'Dim Sum' at a place on one of the higher levels - I can't remember the restaurant's name - but there was a cockroach under one of the food items. The staff did not charge us for that particular dish. Whilst a lot of people seem to like this place, I really dislike it and try to avoid it at all costs. The best part of Terminal 21 is the departure...

Very good mall to wonder around, and to have photos, but Not to shop...... Every floor is designed to represent a city, Paris, London, Tokyo, .....etc... get your camera ready, you can have fabulous photos, A good food court is available at the top floor. But if you are intending to do shopping, please try another mall. Any how I think, you will have a lovely time in this mall...

The Longest Escalator I stepped on :). This was our final destination before heading back to Manila.
I was so overwhelmed but the different themes in every floors of the mall...
There bathrooms also was very unique :)
I love to go back here soon ;)

Great Place to Shop. This themed mall was built like an airport. Each level is a different "city." There is London, Tokyo, San Francisco and several other popular destination cities. The food court is great-lots of variety and prices are not high like at some high end mall food courts. It's a great place to find unique and interesting clothing and accessories. Lots of small shops selling all sorts of items.

Everything you need is here. Free wifi throughout, linked to the bts, restaurants, clothes, shoes, bags, make up etc. good to spend half a day in or so. It's in a good location with Robinsons walking distance away. Shops are more westernised but you can find boutiques as well.

shopping and Eating . I love terminal 21 because a lot of store and many kind of restaurant are there and the food center very big and a lot of restaurant many kind of food and dessert my favorite is kho nue ma moung

Worth a stop. Interesting shopping mall near a main transportation hub. Kind of interesting, the upper floors are restaurants decorated in the theme of different cities around the world. did not find the food to be anything great, but worth a stop. There's also a Citi-Bank located here with a security guard and so I used this location for atm stops

Good food at good prices. Everyone knows that Terminal is a good shopping centre directly connected to the BTS station Asoke. It conveniently located and a lot of fun working your way through the myriad of little stalls on the upper floors.However, my favourite part was the food court next to the obligatory supermarket. There was a good variety of food selections including Japanese, Thai and Viet. My favourite was the Thai crispy pork and duck. Delicious duck and pork served either on rice or with noodles...it was yum. For those with a sweet tooth, ther are a variety of bakeries as one would expect but there were two that caught the eye. One serving beautiful eclairs and cakes, whilst another served a variety of mini-pies. Of course there were the usual Japanese / French bakeries to fill the void.Have a wander and enjoy. It isn't as massive or glitzy as Paragon but that was a good thing.

Fabulous shopping mall with different stuff!. Dropped in based on google search on good shopping mall options plus easy to get to with the BTS from our hotel. Should have come here sooner!! Loved the different levels with different retail items for sale. My fave would have been Istanbul level 3 - so many gorgeous small shops filled with jewellery & accessories - unique compared to the offerings see. At other malls. Both costume & with real stones & precious metal. Will definitely return to spend a bit more time exploring! The mens fashion level (forget which that was now) also had excellent quality & unusual t shirts & shirts.

surprisingly ordinary. I chose this place even though it was out of our way because I thought the concept was interesting,... but to tell the truth, there wasn't anything phenomenal about it,... just visit if you are already in the area,...

Great Place!. Well, it is the heart of Sukhumvit, as everyone crosses or looks forward to get into this mall as, tired from a touristic day, catching up with a local friend, business meetings, lunches, family dinners. From great movie experience to great variety of Multi cuisine especially Asiatic cuisine with a mix of western world, prepare yourself for some great high quality great dinning experience. Even the choices in caffe and desert are great.Offcourse great shopping experience also awaits, with all international and local friends, from money exchange counter to books, to groceries, one can find everything. Also the location is great, where it has great hotels around and BTS sky train as well. Worth visiting.

Must drop by for first time tourists. This is a unique mall at Asok BTS, right next to it and most convenient. Possibly my 2nd or 3rd time coming by and it probably has all you need less the crowds. Interestingly themed like an airport with various major cities on each floor of the mall and even info counter gals like air-stewardesses! This time round, I again came to a must drop by shop of local Thai snacks at the basement. Some of you may know Tow Kae Noi, the famous seaweed shop set up by a young local guy with even a film of him to boot. Plus, myself and a friend had a really cute popsicle each of plentiful flavours available, we had a hard time making up our minds! Finally, there's a really good Thai tea shop at the basement food counters. It has a prominent thumbs up for its brand logo and you couldn't go wrong with it. Oh yes, not forgetting the plethora of popcorn at a food counter with the weirdest and most novel flavours one could imagine. Durian popcorn anyone?

Great place . This a great located shopping centre. Youncan sit here all day within the soo many cafes and just people watch within an air conditioned setting. Every floor is differently decorated even the toilets :)

Best Food Court in BKK, Great (& low price) Cinema + shopping+ Japanese toilet seats. Love this place. The Food court is the best in BKK - huge variety =Pad Thai, SomTam=Papaya Salad, Omlet over rice, Fried Oysters, DimSum are outstanding. I eat hear 3-4 times a week. Loads of other low & mid-range restaurants, plus even a Tony Roma's. Wednesday as THB100 movie day at the cinema, and M-F movies are 90THB if you have the over-60 \yo discount card. Theaters are gorgeous & carpeted. Most floors have Japanese toilet seats = a real treat.

New mall at Asok. Attached to Asok BTS Terminal 21 is a fairly nrw mall. It is quite accessible by BTS and other means. Once you are you will appreciate its nice design. A very high atrium in the centre as you walk in. A multistorey mall. Great for dining and shopping

Fantastic mall for shopping . This mall is located right under my hotel so I had to check it out.I loved it's concept and found a lot of cool shops that you will never find anywhere else.The food court on the ground floor and on the fourth and fifth floors offers anything you can imagine.But the best thing about it - it is not expensive and you will find great deals and sales.Women should explore the Tokyo floor and man should explore the London floor.There is also a great movie theater with all the latest movies. I wish I had a mall like that back home!!!
Easy access Shopping mall. Terminal 21, Asoke Bangkok. Easy access Shopping mall. Quite big and new shopping center at Asoke. Good shopping place, have many restaurants also.

1 mall with international famous places!. General : big mall with of affordable stores and good food!Tips :1. Shopping : price may not be negotiable but I would say is affordable.2. Food : do try food court Pier 21, plenty of choices.3. Tourist : register yourself at the reception counter for FREE WiFi. Valid 1 year!!!!!! You must show your passport for validity.
Nice Mall. If you are in Bangkok do visit Terminal 21. This mall has many good food and beverage venues on 4th and 5th floors. They have many local and international varieties to choose from.

A unique shopping center in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is the shopping center that I personally most recommended in Bangkok. Different from other luxury ones along the BTS, Terminal 21 offers reasonably priced and local styled shops which sell male and female clothes and accessories, design items and make ups. There are also a lot of restaurants and a food court for you to have your meals during your shopping time. On the basement level, there is a supermarket. Take a look at the design of each floor too as they are themed in different cities like Tokyo and San Francisco. Even the washrooms are different.

great mall. we were lucky enough to be staying across the road so I went here quite a bit. I loved the supermarket serving fresh fruit and veg in the basement. Each floor had a unique theme and was just crying out for photos and some poses! It is well laid out with lots of boutiques and chain stores. The food court on the top 2 floors is great - loads of choice from sit down meals to snacks suitable for any time of day. Well worth a visit

Great all round Mall with lots to do.. Its a great place to spend a few hours, maybe even more if u want to catch a movie. Terminal 21 is easy to get to by BTS & is located at Asoke Station. Each level is themed as a different city/ location with various attractions like San Francisco with the bridge or London with the big red bus etc. so there r lots of great photo opportunities. Plenty of shops, & what an array of restaurants, cafes, food courts to choose from. It's simply mind boggling. And when u have had enough , you can go to the top level & catch a movie & rest those feet for a while. The best way to start is to take the lift to the top. That way u can check movie timings. And then use the escalator down to each level & explore all the way down to the basement where there are more restaurants & a big supermarket.

A great mall. Designed to resemble an airport, this mall is well thought out, contains lots of funky decoration ( the Golden Gate Bridge, a London bus, even a lighthouse) all the usual big brands and a fantastic food court! Great for a rainy day out.

Well worth the train trip. Well worth the train trip out of the centre to visit. Shopping galore from big stores to some interesting boutiques. Each floor has a different world city theme, including Rome London Istanbul and the food level in San Francisco.
Wonderful mall. One of the wonderful mall in Bangkok, each floor design of the one country. Many brand shop , restaurants.. The mall you can reach it by metro Asok station

Food Court was great!. A shopping mall easily accessed with BTS/ MRT.What impressed me is the food varieties provided there. The food offering at foodcourt was good and price is quite cheap.Not much special to shop in this place but if you are looking for food, you can always find a good one here.

Great if u stay near sukumvit. its different from other shopping centre.... its more like shopping station or airport but nothing exciting i found....still it has everything you expect and close to the train station...

Interesting Mall. Interesting mall concept of a different country on each floor. More of a 'market' atmosphere than huge mall but nice for a change to the normal chain stores you always see. The food hall is quiet extensive and the groceries shop in the basement is quite interesting. Very easy to access via Siam Metro Station

New concept of mall. So in love! 😍. This is one of my favourite mall in Bangkok. You can get free WiFi in the receptionist and then take your passport guide to travel around this mall. Each floor have different theme based on their cities. Go to Japan floor and shop till you drop. All price not so expensive. But the most favourite is the food court. Many food stall sell delicious and traditional of Thailand food. Cheap and yummy. The most favourite mall and sure I'll be back!

Just like any of the other shopping malls in Bangkok. Nothing all that extraordinary here. Some name brands, but most everything can be found at other malls across town. Nice grocery store in the basement and easily reached by public transportation. Maybe give it a visit to escape the rain or heat, but don't go out of your way.

Country theme shopping center. Every floor of the shopping center has its theme from different countries around the world. They will display a set of icon representing the countries. Quite creative of them but it is just a normal shopping center but plenty of shops to shop and might spend a little more time inside.

Just another shopping mall. Were there Friday afternoon. Not too many people. Just a mall with city themes on different floors. There were no street type stalls.
Not a fan of mall. Have plenty of malls at home. After going up and down the escalators, we left.
Take BTS, get off at Asoke station, exit 1.
Shop til you drop. We visited here and what an experience it was, each floor is based on various cities including the toilets. It was a good experience and easily accessible from the sky train.

New Concept Plaza. Terminal 21 accessible by BTS system. It consists of 5 floor having different themes based on cities (paris, london, san franciso, istanbul). Food court is on upper most floor with many foreign chain outlets also. Service in plaza is amazing and excellent.

A awesome shopping mall. Shopping, food, service...is so nice. food court have a lot of Thai food. "happy house" is really clean, beautiful, different design with friendly staffs. they always say welcome and thanks.

Good concept. This is a mall with each floor in the theme of a city (Paris, Rome, London, Istanbul, Tokyo and San Francisco). It is not a very large mall and has variety of shopping and eating options. The shopping options go from large retail brands to single budget shops. Again it is easily accessible through the sky-train and one can easily spend 1-2 hours of spare time here!

Great Shopping and Eatery. This shopping mall is more on the upper class. Plenty of shops to see. There are also a lot of restaurants in here. They also have a huge food court where you can get almost all of Thai local delicacies. There is also a supermarket located at the lowest floor. Great place to shop and eat.

Amazing !!!. I have been to Tokyo, Osaka, KL,Jakarta,Hochimin City and Oslo but never seen such a so nice and amazing decorated departmental store. It's not only the design and building but also salute to services,particularly for toilets and creative thinking of decorators. It'll be one of the Pride of Thailand soon. Cheers to developer !!!

Really Over The Top Touristy. This was a very strange mall. I liked it, but it was very odd. Each level has a different theme for a country. The prices for the most part were pretty good. You'll find alot of unique items.

interesting shopping mall.. Big shopping mall just next to asok skytrain station.All the floors are themed to differant cities, like london, paris Rome,san fransisco, Istanbull.plenty of gift places.Also a lot of places to eat and drink.about 6 floors high but its easy to find your way around.

Interesting Mall with different theme at each level. Every level has a different theme. Every level is theme after a country or a city. Many international brand chinese restaurants like Ding Tai Feng, Tim Ho Wan can be found there.
Good Foodcourt. Terminal 21 is cool mall in term of decoration, it is not too big or too small. The restrooms are clean. One high light is the food court, the food here is good and cheap .

Cute mall next to train station. It is convenient going here as it is right next to the train station. Every floor of the mall has a theme: Paris, London, etc. and there is a whole range of shops here. I went here after going to Platinum Fashion mall so the excitement of seeing clothing shops has gone but it is still a nice place to go to for food (at the top floors). They have a supermarket as well and that is where I got food souvenirs to bring home.

One of the best malls to go. One of the best malls to go in bangkok. Convenient location, Lots of shopping options and food options. One can enjoy sort of street shopping in the mall apart from the regular stores. When thirsty take a glass of nice lemon tea and sit next to the toy bridge in the mall.

Original human size mall. Lots of food option and a Cinema!. Original Mall with a theme turning around " Travels around the World" , where each floor is a dedicated famous country/city ( Los Angeles, Istanbul, etc...).Good place for having a lunch and for avoiding the humid outside weather. Please note that the last floor is dedicated to a Cinema screening the last international and local production. A pleasant moment.

Good mall with Thai restaurants and small shops selling souvenirs. Our hotel is close by and we walked to Terminal 21 on foot. A shopping mall with good Thai restaurants and small shops selling souvenirs.

Pleasant... Radiant... Posh. Great shopping mall to hang out! Lots of stores and restaurants. Every floor has a different country theme!The shopping mall is conveniently located and easy access by Sukumvit MRT.You have to visit this mall when in Bangkok!
very nice and has big verity of stores. many shops and big verity. the mall is new and clean. it was easy to get to the mall.i highly recommend
my visit. i have been here several times great shopping mall and entertaining birthday dinner and love the theme levals in mall
Huge shopping centre with big selection. It is located right on the train route of BTS and you can walk out of the terminal and straight into the third level of the big shopping centre.

Average mall. Terminal 21 has a little bit of everything. Like everyone else mentioned here, it has a travelling-airport kind of theme. Supermarkets and sundries on the basement, big name brands on the lower floors, smaller shops in the middle tiers restaurants on the upper floors and cinema/gym at the top. Close to both BTS and MRT. Not sure why you would come here though, if you have already been to Siam Square and Chatuchak.
So many dining choices. A huge eating extravaganza, many cuisines to choose from, lovely outside garden area. Well worth the visit.

My favourite big shopping centre. This shopping centre is the usual big city, luxury shopping centre, with the usual range of food, clothing and other consumer items. But it seems to have a nice blend of market style smaller shops on some of the levels that makes it a bit like browsing street markets in air conditioned comfort.

Clever Marketing @ Terminal 21. This mall has each floor named after various Travel destination. It's uniqueness makes it worth a visit. I call that clever marketing when you're throwing up yet another "MALL". The shops are not all over priced American or UK stores, yet more unique and unusual shops with local artist, tailors, and stuff you don't find in all the Americanized malls. I got a duster from one designer that was a bit pricy but the kind of thing I will do only if I know I'm going to get some good use out of it and the quality is good. Love it! Many other shops are very reasonable. Good place for unique items for yourself, gifts, jewelry, and do visit the Pier 21 food court. ( I think 5th floor) . You can buy a card where you put money on it, shop at any food stand and they refund you the difference when you leave. Or just keep it for your next visit. The food here is all super reasonable, good and fresh. Also a vegetarian stand, drink stand, smoothie stand,etc. Just go. Great place to hang out when it's raining. You don't even get wet getting off the Sky train.

Interesting mall.. As it is theme based on travel, the floors are named after popular destinations. The lower flors have some known outlets and brands, the 4th and 5th floors, named after San Francisco, have the food outlets. Some are quite reasonable and this shows by the waiting time during peak meal times.

Unique . I have to start of by saying I don't like shopping but I've never been to a shopping centre like this one! Each floor is themed on a different international city, right down to the toilets! It's a great place to explore for an hour and there's a very reasonably priced food hall on the second to top level, 50p for a meal. There's a cinema where you can see a film, buy popcorn, drinks etc all for about £4 a person. I'd hate to be stuck in here for hours but it's certainly worth a quick visit as it's full of character (for a shopping centre).

Unusual and interesting. Everyone says about its interior but I want to say that even though this mall's not that big on some of the floors there are very good and not expensive clothes compared to other malls in Bangkok (I visited most of them with my wife). I liked London most of them - a lot of unusual stuff of good quality. Of course sometimes they don't have your size of clothes and shoes but still - compared to price/quality it's 5 stars. On Tokyo floor you can even find a shop of really old clothes - old school, baby!

Nice mall. It is a nice shopping mall with a cheap food court and plenty of nice restaurants. I like to come here every three weeks to have lunch or dinner with friends. It is a good place to hang out.
Wonderful place to watch. An amazing idea .and a very good place to spend your time. Concept is great as well as treatment of the idea

Big multistorey shopping centre. Fun airport theme. Each floor has a destination city theme - e.g. Rome, San Francisco. Lots of restaurant / food court options on the upper floors, as well as a cinema complex. A lot of the rest seems geared toward ladies' fashions, shoes as per usual. It is between Emporium to the east, and Siam to the west, so might be convenient if you are staying nearby.

Around the world in less than 2 hours. If you want to glimpses of around the world, Terminal 21 is a must see attraction in Thailand. As you move on different levels, you will feel the aura of being transported in that country. As a travel bug, get your cameras ready as you wouldn't want to miss having selfies with its beautiful stylized edifices. Be prepared to walk for at least 1 hour to enjoy the place.

Unique concept. Terminal 21 has a unique concept - each floor bears a different city theme, down to the washrooms. A good mix of international retailers and food chains, to smaller, local ones. Check it out if you're nearby just to have a look.

A MUST SEE in Bangkok. This place Isolde seeing the whole world in 1-2 hours. Each floor is decorated like Rome, Tokyo, London, San Fransico etc. done very nice and the shops are lokal
Designers so you might end up finding a hidden gem! For sure better than the huge expensive shopping malls, which all has the same shops.

Nice mall, great food court. I go here just for the food court, It is very convenient since you can reach here either via BTS (Asok St) or Metro (Sukhumvit St). The mall itself is very modern and very well decorated. Each floor has its own theme, country or city mainly.

Very accessible by train. This huge complex has some really good and very well priced food outlets. Food court or small restaurants are well worth the visit. As a middle age shopper I found Terminal 21 to be definitely aimed more toward the younger people. Small boutiques cater well to this market.
