The lower ground floor has some lovely small restaurants for quick fresh meals as well as gourmet supermarket. Very modern.
Love the Place. Super extensive foodcourt.The dessert section in the basement is quiet extensive .awesome variety of cakes/icecreams/cupcakes. Best combo for ppl for want to shop and dine.

Nice lunch stop when you're traveling by subway or skytrain.. Fun place to visit because it is adjacent to skytrain and subway. The themed architecture is fun. I also like the clean, high quality food court on the upper floor. I didn't come here to shop, though, since it is just a lot of high-price luxury good shops, really pretty useless, but the interior design has a quality not found in other Bangkok tower malls. And it's great to get out of the heat! Bottom floor has a supermarket and some shops with an abundance of Asian snack foods.

Unique shopping mall in Bangkok. A great shopping mall next to Asok BTS station. Themed floors in an airport style setting with different boutique type shops on each fllor eg London, Istanbul, San Francisco etc. Also some brand fashion outlets and good food choices. Excellent cinema on top floor.
Best shopping center I've been.. I love this shopping center! I went back so many times and I can find something new every time. Even bathrooms on each level have different theme.

Shopping Center in Asoke. Terminal 21 has varieties that cater to different shoppers. There are food courts as well as nice restaurants .It's walking distance from Asoke & Sukhumvit Stations so it's easy

So much going on... I've been in a few times.. and there is always more to find. I like that there are a lot of small shops as well as those that are well known. Movies, food, shopping... and it's close to many other things and easy to get to!

Amazing and modern shopping center. One of the most splendid and marvelous shopping center in Bkk with an unique muiltinational complex. It is saparated in each floor a name of a city comprising of the typical artful architecture kiosks in that nation whereas Istabul, Paris, San Fransisco, London...In the very spacious embiance is well-appointed stores in which you would have the feeling of getting immerged in another strange world and make sense of shopping damand bu yourself. All in all, this is one of the must highlight for traver come and explore.

A taste of London in Bangkok. London themed mall in Bangkok. Lots of places where you can find known and not so known brands of clothes and accessories. My wife had a gala time shopping for earrings there!

Great Shopping Experiance. In the middle of the main shopping street in Bangkok (Sukhumvit Rd), has got a unique way of presenting a shopping mall, with different culture from all over the world, and you will feel your self that you are in an Air Port, and some times in Turkey, and may be in London or you are in Las Vigas, it is great and gives you a nice feeling of travailing all over the world. and for shopping, there are many shops and the prices are good and reasonable and the restaurants are located in the 4th floor and there is a Cinema as well and in the middle of the first and ground floor there are nice cafe, it is safe for foreigners , I highly recommend it for all :)

Good decor and best food court in Bangkok. The food court is away packed with tourists as it offers delicious and very cheap food about USD 1.50 per dish. The department store itself is beautifully decorated and has the most clean toilets. Recommend to buy home essential oil at a shop at the corner on 2nd or 3rd. A bit more expensive but high quality if you want to use it at your home.

Massive shopping centre. Came here for a quick look around. It's set up as an "airport" with the escalators taking you to different cities and departure lounges. There's Sam Francisco with the bridge, Paris, London with brick lane & the guards, carribean etc.It's many floors, with at least 5 floors with 2 dedicated to food. Many food outlets including restaurants, street food and fast food. Lots of shops including high street brands such as h&m and Nike.Is mainly for locals, not tourists.

Every floor is different. Each floor is beautifully designed, and each escalator greets you with arrival, departure sign, whether you are San Francisco, London etc.. its makes shopping exciting. It is a big mall too. It is modern. You get upmarket stuff here.there is also movie theater on the top floor. I noticed there is more Japanese food. Yummy.... Western food also available..Directly opposite the shopping center is the MRT. Enjoy shopping there.

Best place to shopping. After a few search in Bangkok I found out this was the best place to shop in Bangkok. Huge amount of original and designers stores different from the common designers we are used to. If you want to buy different clothes you must go there. If you want known brands you must go to Siam Paragon.

Interesting Concept. We see too many shopping centres that look exactly the same these days, so kudos to these guys for trying to make it unique. Each floor is themed around a different city - particularly liked London. They had a Bonchon Chicken, so extra points for that! Didn't buy anything, but it's worth a visit.

Great mall. Excellent mall, one of the bests I've ever seen. Each floor represents a city, you are in Tokyo and suddenly in San Francisco or Rome. London, Istanbul, Barbados and Paris are also represented. Toilets are amazing, each toilet is according to each city, I've never seen toilets as clean as those in any western country, there is always a woman cleaning after you use the toilet or wash your hands.At the tope you can see a model of the San Francisco bridge, amazing. Furthermore, there is a food court, Peer 21 (see my review) which is quite good, but if you don't like food it's plenty of restaurants and fast food as well.

Impressive architecture, focused on premium brands. Big shoutout to the architect of this shopping mall which looks like an airport, even the ladies at the information desk are dressed like flight attendants. The range of brands is not very broad, mostly focused on upper-level and premium brands. It's a good shopping contrast to the cheaper stalls on the streets and the cheaper stores found everywhere on Sukhumvit road. Food court is ok, nothing great. We also saw a couple of cockroaches.. The rest of the mall was impressively clean, especially toilets.

Super sized airport themed mall. An impressive building, Each floor is themed with a location i.e. London, tokyo etc. there are top branded shops as well as small boutiques with beautiful and unique displays. Definitely worth a visit with easy access from the BTS skytrain.

Best food court in Bangkok. I'm not very impressed with their shopping shops but I love their food court.
Delicious food, really valuable, well organized.

Terminal 21 still the most original mall. The design of this mall is unique: he thematic areas and the floors reminding of famous cities around the world: Paris, London, Rome, Istanbul and the space organization are the major features of Terminal 21. Also Thai designers have their own areas where they show their genius. The gourmet supermarket is great, though not too large to visit for a quick food shopping.The food court provides a variety of foods from around Asia and the prices are reasonable. Vegetarian options are also good.Latest movies available on floor 6.

shopping center each floor represent airport terminal. It is a big shopping center' you visit London, Tokyo, Paris, etc. each floor has the atmosphere of the city, small fashion/accessories shops walk alone these unique shops enjoy being in cities round the world, don't miss the food floor.

Cheap meals @ Pier 21.. Cool place . The mall is massive and I like how they've made it like a airport with their escalators departing to and arriving at ....The food at pier 21 was very cheap I brought 2 meals and a smoothies for 100 baht which is $4 AUD .. BARGAIN
A place to shop. Its a good mall to shop. It's a very new modem and it has all the popular brand. Good and big food court.

Amazing mega mall must see. 4 years young and undoubtedly one of the top malls in the world. 9 floors of shopping and dining in an easily navigated layout.Architecture, themes and quality of finish on par the best anywhere and foot traffic proves its a popular venue.

A Mall with Lots of Attractions. It was very enjoyable, going to each floor and seeing different themes on them. Get your cameras ready coz you can take lots of photos there. I would really recommend eating at the food court. Really good variety, quality of authentic Thai food, and reasonably priced.
Welcome to the airport mall. love the concept, the theme, every floor is about a big city in the world, all the staff is wearing planes uniform and it is very clean.

Big shopping mall with many internation theme each floor and free internet. Nice place to visit if you want to escape the heat from outdoor. Many things to look around and restaurants for food. Free Wi-Fi within the malls is a plus.

The best mall I visited in Thailand. This is a very unique mall. It is made to look like an airport with each floor based on a popular tourist destination (Tokyo, London, etc.). The staff uniforms are all based on those of airport workers. Each floor has a particular theme; men's fashion, women's fashion, food, for example. The items are reasonably priced and there is a lot of choice. The bathrooms are incredibly clean with around 20 Japanese toilets in each. I'd highly recommend this mall

Something Different . Terminal 21 was a walking distance from our hotel. The mall is themed mall with different levels representing different countries.The shopping is good. Expensive at the lower levels and then a bit cheaper as you move up. Good food choices on upper 2 levels. You will find simple Thai food to pizzas, streak and so on.Highly recommend a visit.

Been there & will be back for gourmet market. Shopping - Bought things at beauty buffet, h&m, Victoria secret.Have lunch at food court - so so. Coffee is nice. Mangosteen, mango sticky rice and salad from gourmet market very fresh & yummy. Spa - 165 mins spa treat at let's relax spa 1400 baht among all the things , most happy with gourmet market :)

Themed mall. Nine floors of shopping in a themed mall with branded stores, fashion outlets, supermarket, restaurants, cineplex, food court, banks and bookstores. This is part of the same building of Grande Centre Point Sukhumvit, and resembles an airport terminal. Appeals to the younger generation of shoppers.

nice shop for little surprise. Beside the big brand, you can find some interesting product here. Like t-shirt by thai design. the quality is good and the design of the mall was cute. And the foodcourt was valuable and you can buy a value card to enjoy everything you want. The best thing is can be refund for the money not used.i brought some t-shirt, card and leather here. is a young and nice place. if you go with teenager, they must like it.

From designers brands to cheap goodies. its an interesting mall, they got some designer brands at lower floors and the staff get cheaper when u go higher up. on higher floors each floor is divided by a few streets with a mixture of different shops. Can easily spend a few hours here.
Mid-range shopping mall. Airport gates help stop you getting lost in this mid-range mall (between MBK and Paragon). Designed for BKK 'office girl' shopper. But still packs in the brand names.

Nice mall to send the day . This is a really nice mall I actually decided that in my next trip to bangkok I would stay close to this mall The mall has everything you need movie theaters nice shops and restaurants

A very nice, shopping centre, lots of unique clothes, shoes, items.. This is a nice well organised centre set out along the lines of different countries with different goods on each floor. It has western prices but the items are good and original. I would go back again and will next time I am in Bangkok.

Mall with a quirky theme. We like the mall particularly for the quirky theme of travel. There's a faux metal detector & a smiling passenger service officer at the entrance to welcome shoppers. Small shops litter along a myriad of passageways but you don't get a repeat of shops selling duplicate goods; instead most of them showcase interesting & unique items which made the walking/window shopping a refreshing experience.

Themed Mall. This is a very unique mall. Each floor has a different city theme. Tokyo, Istanbul, Paris, London, etc. goods in shops are quite affordable as well. Their foodcourt, pier 21 has cheap but delicious food. You need to get a loadable card which you shall use in buying food. The SF cinema has a promo every Wednesday, movie tickets on Wed costs only 100Baht.

interesting shopping center!. a fun and interesting themed shopping center. just like how its named, they have all different city terminals on every level. u have London, Tokyo etc.great mix of shops selling local brands and also international ones.great variety of food at one of the top level food court. name it, u can get desserts, thai food, fruit juices.

Great Mall. Placed very well done up.Was pretty impressed by the amount of efforts put in for the design. There is a different country theme at every floor so u feel like you at travelling the world...toilet themes are also very interesting.Will definitely go again if we return to BKK in future.

Great themed shopping mall. We visited T21 last year and this year too. Its an amazing mall that has everything. Its a nice place to hangout,shop and eat. They have evrything for all ages. The theme is interesting so are the toilets! I like how they have decorated and arranged the mall. The price of things are moderate. Its worth a visit

A unique mall. Each floor of this mall has a different location theme like Tokyo, London, Paris etc. Provides good photo opportunities. But not great for shopping. Found the shops on the expensive side.

Best shopping experiences in Bangkok!. I spent 6 days for shopping in Bangkok and this is the best one in my opinion compare to Siam Paragon, Central World, Platinum, Siam Center, MBK,....The goods here is high quality with reasonable price, i spent over 4000baht along this center.Also the decoration is gorgeous, every floor have its own style even the toilet is piece of art.
Great mall. We actually found this by mistake and it was great. The food courts are great (ground level and 5th floor). Affordable and clean. Great shops too...

Themed shopping centre. . I really liked the idea of this place, with each floor having a different country based theme but I found the stalls to be a bit repetitive and I didn't find anything unique about the place. We stopped for food, which was tasty but over priced for what we had. It's worth a visit on a dull day but I wouldn't rush back!

themes around the world, the toilet too!. there are many shopping malls in Bangkok but non like this one. each floor is a different theme of one of the world's destination. even the toilet too. after shopping, why not take a massage session at the upper floor? Also, there is a market at the basement floor, i always bought their salad. 400g for 100 baths. the food court(pier 21) has great food too.stone throw away from asok BTS.

The best Mall in Bangkok. Finally a mall with a concept, that make you feel good and cosy. Each floor represents a city, and the shops arent the same as in all other malls (Cartier, Chanel,...) but shops handled by independent, sometime the seller is the same persone that designs. Good quality, raisonable price and unique designs. I love it!

Not sure about the theme. I don't know whether I liked the airport theme featuring different destinations on each floor. Does it work? I guess if it makes the place different and attracts more tourist customers, then it does.There's no shortage of shops of massive variety, restaurants etc and the decor is very western. The prices are very western too. If you're looking for someplace traditionally Thai and Asian, then this isn't the one. If you're after a mall just like back home, then you'll be happy.
Shop eat enjoy. This shopping mall have a lot of things to see, I love the panda shop and also the clinic.. The sea food they have.. I love the interior. Also you can find the metro station the mall

Disappointing. Based on the raving reviews, we made a point to visit this shopping center. Although the mall has a great theme (each floor represents a city or country), it's not enough to write home about. The mall is not large. We should have taken it as a hint when the taxi driver asked us if we were going to Terminal 21 because we were looking for something specific. The mall was very nice (cool restrooms, nice construction) and the stores sold higher quality items. But this felt like a typical United States mall except with a theme. Not a unique experience.

Fake taxi with fake meter at Terminal 21 taxi stand. The security guard at the taxi stand near main entrance helped us to flag down a taxi. He even talked to the taxi driver through the front passenger window. We went into the yellow and green taxi with fake meter. The meter started at 162.4 and never move during the journey. He said there is peak hour charge. When we reached destination opposite Platinum Fashion Mall, he pressed meter and it showed 540 baht. We said we did not have enough money as we knew it was a scam. We tried to open the doors but both back doors were locked. One of us forced open the lock and we escaped. We paid him 300 baht after running out. Can Terminal 21 try to find this fake taxi? 8 Aug 2015 and time is 6.10 pm to 6.20 pm. The security guard may have worked with this taxi driver to cheat tourists. I saw him recording every tourist destination. He may have taken down the number plate, starting with 6611.
Great place to shop . Many brands that you will need you can get it there , lovely coffee shops , restaurants, movie theater and supermarket . The theme is very nice as if in airport .
Good shopping mall. Good shopping mall, many nice restaurants, suitable bring kids, take many photos in the shopping mall.

Unique shopping mall . This mall is very unique with its themes; every floor has its own city-theme. Not a cheap place to shop, probably more for those people who want to shop more brands and a little bit of more luxurious stuff. For me the food court is the highlight of this place, I absolutely love it! So much to choose from for a good price, wish I could eat there everyday...Also, I love their cinema! The best cinema I have ever been to, so comfy seats. Go on Wednesday and only pay for 100bath/ticket, total bargain!

Good food, good price! Nice shopping experience!. It is suggested that you pay for your meal there, as the food is well cooked and the price was even cheaper than that in Big C. Nice place with accepted sanitary quality. Besides, you can find many things in and even out of your shopping list in this place. The price is ok, if you are able to spend time wandering around and bargain. We got some T-shirts at 17:09, which is on the 4th floor, Melon T-shirts, bags... the price was okay.The decorations are impressive. Ornaments are around, and the restrooms are well designed with different themes for EACH one. You should visit them ;)You can take BTS, drop down at Asok station to reach this place.

A very different shopping experience !. We went here during August 2015 along with my 2 daughters. Although it's not the cheapest shopping in Bangkok it is unique and has a lot of things you won't find anywhere else. Each floor is themed ie: London, San Fran , Tokyo ect. Go figure ! It does add interest though and lots of really cool photo opportunities. There is a massive amount of good restaurants on the higher floors and I also found each time I visited it wasn't over crowded which is rare in this great city !!!
Good. This is one of the new malls in Bangkok. A good mall.Good shopping. There is a good choice of food outlets.
Great place. Concept is really nice with wide range of food to choice from. My daughters enjoyed so much! Trallevers must go. Surely!

Another Super mall from bangkok. many food and shopping options. Product for all range price available here.
Had purchased many of giddies from here. one of fav mall to kill the time.
Okayish. Shopped around the mall but didnt buy any clothes and just went there for eating. The basement has lots of japanese food stalls

Very Good Mall in Sukhumvit!. They have done and excellent kind of zoning in the mall. Unique and attractive concept.. Good brand mix and full of choices food court. Must go place if you are anywhere near sukhumvit.
Great food court. This review is solely for the food court. The food variety, price, and cleanness is great. It was one of favorite places to eat. Highly recommended

Fun Mall!. We had one day in Bangkok and decided to come to the new Terminal 21 mall. Easily accessible off the MRT (Sukhimvit Station), and a very fun mall!The theme of this mall is like an airport. And each floor is a country. The elevators have fun signage that says "Arrivals" and "Departures" when you leave or come to a floor.We went for the food. The food court on the 5th floor is great. They also have a movie theater on the 6th floor with a Hollywood Theme.Very fun mall. Recommended if you like interesting malls.

Some really quirky shops and very cheap food!. We went to terminal 21 on our 3rd day in Thailand and LOVED it! There were so many interesting shops (more expensive than the markets in MBK but better quality). I especially loved 'Bang Bang' selling art and t-shirts with prints of Tim Burton and other cool celebs and characters.On the top floor there are lots of street food stalls - I recommend eating here to ease your way into eating street food when you're out and about. It was a good place to find out what you like and dislike.
Unique shopping mall. The concept is really unique. You can find many kind of restaurants here. Mid range brand shopping mall. You can find local sellers upstairs.

asoke shopping mall. good mail in asoke on sukhumvit with bts and mrt right outside great variety of shops and plenty of food options also the movie theatre shows english movies with thai subtitles so a good option on a hot or wet day

Place for all!. Its a shopping destination where everyone can enjoy. From clothes to food,you get all the good stuff here. Kids can have fun as well! The food is good and price is reasonable. Its a nicely decorated and organized mall. Worth a visit!

Didn't want to spend much time here. Not worth it. The hype of the airport concept is just overrated. Things are cheap but in my personal opinion, low quality. Luckily it's connected directly to the BTS (Asok stop), so if you wanna cut your trip short, can just hop back on the train to somewhere much more worthy of your time - like Paragon or Central World.

Fair priced and wide range of goods. Love the mall very much. I don't like bargaining and this place is perfect for me. Good variety of clothing for both ladies and men. Top floor and find entertainment. Great place for families.

As shopping malls go this is a good one. I know some people seem to be whining about this and that regarding Terminal 21, but it's a huge shopping centre and like any mall in the UK you'll find familiar names amongst those you've never seen and probably won't ever again. The airport concept is great with themed floors and certainly makes things a bit more interesting above anonymous floors found in other shopping centres around the world. There's a really good food court with loads of choice up towards the top of the centre and you're pretty spoilt for choice for things to try. Location-wise, let's face it, you're probably gonna be probably passing by this area so it's worth spending 30 minutes having a wander round, even if it's just to ride the massive escalator. If you don't like commercial shopping centres though as some of the other reviewers appear not to, I'm unsure why you would come here.

Likely to Have Some Unique Souviners. This is as close to a tourist mall as you can get. The floors are themed by geographic locations such as England, Turkey, or San Francisco. There are numerous boutique(non-chain) vendors where someone could find a unique gift. Terminal 21 is also full of wonderful choices for eating. This is probably it's second best feature. Altogether the mall is unique and has some incredible decoration including a large model Golden Gate bridge and one of the highest escalators I have seen in this city.
Boring If You're Alone But Loved The Coffee ;). Being On A Work Tour, It Wasn't As Delightful As I Thought But Still Loved The Atmosphere Got Bit Bored But Definitely Shopped Alot .

Shopping, Food, Coffee, Crowd... it goes and goes..... Good Shopping experience. It is a bit crowded but when you are really here to enjoy, nothing bothers you. They have lots of eateries and coffee shops. The staffs in the enquiry are dressed as flight attenders. as the name says it’s a terminal

Try Out Pier 21 Food Terminal. If you are visiting this mall, plan ahead for a meal at Pier 21 Food Terminal. A must try for local delicacies and desserts. Very reasonable prices. Street food at street pricing!

Good and organized mall with pricee goods. The place looks simply well organized and creates a pleasant feeling to be there. The floors have been themed with different cities (in different countries around the globe). The decorations and interior looks super which make the ambient exuberant.The stuff we catchy but was a little more than the normal prices. But the stuff's quality seems purely high.

The Food Court is a Must Visit!. I visited this place a few days ago after my friend recommend it to me..This shopping mall have a unique concept related to travel. It's used theme like Caribbean, Tokyo etc.Do get your FREE wifi access by showing your passport to the girl at information counter. The Wifi provides was it high speed as I can upload 6 pictures with each 4 MB in sized in less than a minutes :-)Don't miss the toilet as it have an unique concept too. It's equipped with the high tech bidet where you can control the bidet water temperature, pressure etc...I think this is common for toilet in Japan. I found out that their Pier 21 Food Court sold in a very reasonable price & value for money. It's more cheaper to eat here than at the street vendor. You got to buy a cash card before purchasing any food there. So don't missed the Pier 21 Food Court

Disappointment. So before my trip, there was all this talk about Terminal 21 now being the best mall in Bangkok. It was a thorough disappointment. There was the usual brands on the lower floors. But if you want them all under one roof, you're much better off going to Central World or Siam Paragon. The upper floors were small boutiques. I left my wife there, and she returned empty handed many hours later, pretty bummed at how useless the upper levels proved to be.On the food front, there's plenty to choose from. But that's no reason to waste the day in Terminal 21 instead of Central World.(Only reason we might visit again is because we usually stay on Soi 15, and you pretty much have to enter/leave via Soi 19.)

A beautiful shopping complex. A great fun experience with awesome shopping, every floor with it's own unique design (even the toilets are remarkable!). See five countries in one day and take pictures with some of the worlds most famous landmarks.

Take the train . Terminal 21 sells mainly clothes and accessories designed and produced in Thailand. The prices are in the mid range. The place is less crowded as compared to MBK or Platinum Mall.Terminal 21 is located on one of the busiest intersections in Bangkok. People going to/from Sukhumvit, or Ratchada or Thonburi will cross this intersection, so traffic is very heavy due to the high volume of traffic. The traffic light at the intersection makes the situation worse.If you plan to get there by car or taxi, high chance you will be stuck in the traffic jam at this intersection. After you have finished shopping, it is difficult to get a taxi or the taxi drivers will be asking for a higher price, due to the traffic and high amount of tourist.Fortunately, Terminal 21 is next to both Asok and Sukhumvit train station. The most efficient way to get in/out is to take the MRT or BTS Skytrain.

Best mall food court in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is large shopping mall situated right in the heart of Bangkok on Sukhumvit road. The decor is interesting, but the food court is my objective during any visit. Yes, the mall has all the high end shops as well as the bargain floor, but it is the inexpensive food that keeps me coming back. The food court has a wide selection of fresh cooked food as well as desserts and drinks. Come early to get a table because this is the local's favorite also.

Impressed with the Architecture @ Deco!. Wow! The Architecture & Decoration on the different levels of this shopping mall, that makes this place stand out and special! The mall is themes differently, such as; Caribbean, London, Istanbul, Paris, Rome, Japan, San Francisco & Hollywood which houses branded clothes and locally designer stuffs. The other attraction is the Fantastic (Good, clean and cheap) food court on the fifth floor.Definitely a must visit in Bangkok.

Huge mass market mall. Retuned here after several years as friends wanted to have a simple dinner hereLocated along sukhumvit area above Asoke BTS station, this mall is huge and named after a famous city on all its 6-7 floorsIt's mass market, so it's neither expensive ( no Prada or Gucci etc here) nor cheap like the roadside stallsSame for the food, there are 2 floors of restaurants to cater to each mass market taste, plus a food court

Place where you can shopping around the world. I like the concept of this shopping mall that have different things in each floor depend on the country . feel like you entering the airport with the security check and stuff. 3 hours there...... Like you visit many country around the world hahahha
Great Mall. Loved the food court and the different themed floors. Beautiful mall with lots to look at! Easily accessible from our hotel, clean and easy to get around.

Just a few minutes from home. This place is very close to my BKK home. It's full of proper restaurants likes Japanese, Thai, Chinese, Korean and American. Also a lots of stalls in food court. The local designers brand is also here. SF CINEMAS which is best theater here for me. Gourmet supermarket on the ground floor, Watson, boots, Starbucks, sports shops and many more.

Family oasis!. Me and my husband and our 17 year old twins girl and boy! Hows that for challenging choices, stayed at terminal 21 for 3 nights and 4 days . This was after a week at koh samui where we had booked a villa in an isolated place. My husband was in an ankle cast so we were not looking fir a very active holiday but the kids needed their entertainment. And i needed to SHOP !. So this place was so ideal for us we had connecting rooms , which were more than well equipped , a very interesting view of bangkok streets lit colourfully at night. The hotel is in the sukhumvit area near ashoka station so one can walk just out into the streets and ur in middle of the action . Shops restaurants malls the works. The best part is that Terminal 21 is hotel on oneside attached to a huge amazing mall which one can access straight from the lobby !! Its a 6 storey mall with 2 big food courts aside from restaurants. Each floor is dedicated to country like turkey london and so on . The whole atmosphere is very festive and happy . Thetes entertainment for all ages so my husband was chilling in the room without a care while me and kids were alll over t mall. As we were rite inside the hotel building he wasnt worried bout us getting lost. The kids went off by themselves everywhere as tge hotel had provided us cards to reenter from mall. Evenings would find the 4 of us walking to nearby restaurants. I would definitely refer people to stay here as our check in and checkout was carried very efficiently and pleasantly by the hotel staff. All in all a very happy experience.

Everything you want or need including a beautiful grocery store. I had a business meeting at a cafe here with 2 colleagues. This place is beautifully laid out. It is busy with multi-levels of stores but spacious enough not to feel crowded by people. Amazing Mexican at a Taco place. I needed groceries and found the closest thing to a Whole Foods in Bangkok only Thai style. I got all my favorite foods and yahoo!! - the produce section was the best!!! There is a lower level parking garage with security on all levels. We were on bikes and they had an area marked off just for bicycles. Get everything done here. Even the bathrooms are lovely!

Fun, trendy and good deals. Terminal 21 has different levels that are set up to look like you're in different countries. We saw the Japanese floor, British floor, San Francisco floor and the Parisian floor. The clothing is representative of what Thai people wear. The prices are good and the quality is on point. They have a large food court that ranges from Thai food to Kentucky fried chicken. This is a must visit in Bangkok.
Shopping.. Not the cheapest, but a very nice shoppingmall. After Shopping you must visit the foodcourt, a good variety of different types of food.

My place around the corner. Great shopping center with all you need. There is a food market below with a wide selection of continental products and all Thai favourites. The food court on the top floor is great and very price competitive.

Terminal 21 - Must visit. When in Bangkok this is a must visit place if not for shopping but for the food - this houses the cheapest and aircon food court in Bangkok. When you visit Terminal 21, you must patronize the rest rooms on every floor as it is uniquely designed to follow the theme on each floor. The shopping mall has all the local Thai designers and if you love shopping this is a place to find local designer stuff. Also must try the coconut ice cream sold in the food court on the uppermost floor.

Unique experience. Wonderful place, was like at an airport terminal but every level had a different destination with goods from that country, also had good selection of restaurants with bars with happy hour also on the top floor a cinema complex, absolutely loved it !!

Have you been to a mall and entered every toilet?. That's what I did, given Terminal 21's theme of different country each level. I went to every floor's toilets to take a look but I did not take pictures. Really interesting to see the designs on every floor. Some shops sell interesting things and there are good bargains in this mall too. I particularly love the food court - Pier 21. Selling many types of food at affordable prices. We enjoyed our lunch here!

Find out why Pier 21 is the best foodcourt in Bangkok. Pier 21 is no ordinary foodcourt. Located on the 5th floor, the prices , variety and taste is so amazing, it seems as if the whole of Bangkok is going there just to eat.With egg omelette rice meals starting from just 20 baht, the clean and comfortable dining experience is something you should try at least once .

Nice shopping mall. I loved this shopping mall, each floor is named after a city, it has the usual well known brands but also smaller thai shops. Some shops also allow you to bargain, but the prices are acceptable anyway. It's a lot smaller than the MBK but it's still worth visiting

Worth to visit. There are different themes for each floor in Terminal 21, even for their restroom. It's special!LG Floor - CaribbeanG Floor - RomeM Floor - Paris1st Floor - Tokyo2nd Floor - London3rd Floor - Istanbul4th Floor - San Francisco (City)5th Floor - San Francisco (Pier)6th Floor - Hollywood

a new type of mall - worth to visit. if you bored with expensive type of mall...or cheap wholesale mall..you should visit this one..they have several floors which dedicated for local designer / indi designer..but still they also have several big brand shops, and a large food court with many options.

Unique shopping experience . This mall is extremely unique in both design and function. First, it differs from other large shopping malls in the fact that it has both brand name stores you can find in the U.S. as well as private shops for people who want something special from Thailand. Also, each of the 6 floors is designed after a different place in the world-my favorite was the replica of the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco on the 5th floor! (See pictures). Another thing I loved about terminal 21 was the food court, everything was extremely cheap! For 150 baht my family got 2 ice cream cones, a bowl of traditional Thai dessert, a plate of thai noodles with vegetables, and an order of tom yum noodles. If you're in the area, it's worth a visit-you don't have to spend any money and you'll get some very cool pictures out of the trip.

Top quality shopping mall. When I first went in here I was lost straight away I think there's 7 floors it is massive selling top quality merchandise priced as they should be nice to walk around to get out the heat of bangkok street aircon works well allover the mall great food court on 5th floor very cheap and very clean highly recommend ground floor entrance on street or entrance on bts worth a visit

Attractive Pricing & Efficient Checkout. Terminal 21 is a shopping center which we ate at. It has a very large variety of food to choose from, and the prices are very low, at least for ice cream. I got one scoop of ice cream for 10 Baht, which is approximately 30 cents. Terminal 21 uses a system where you put money into a voucher-type card, then use the card to purchase food items. After you are done, you are reimbursed in cash. I originally thought the system was unusual, but it makes sense because checkout is a lot faster. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall with a popular, low-price food court.

Strategically located and a shopper's dream!. A pleasant surprise, hubs and I didn't expect to visit here but out of curiosity we popped in as we were on our way to the BTS. Saw some cool stuff, priced as it should, but as it was the sale period, there were lots of discounts in almost every store. Definitely like any mall in a major city with all the major brands like Esprit, promod, H&M, levis, puma, mt sapola (for spa stuff) etc. Restrooms were awesome! Warm seats anyone?

A Suprised Modern Designed Shopping Mall. Terminal 21 is one of the must go places in Bangkok. I love their creative interior designed of the mall. Each floor represents a country and customers can find some interesting shops based on its cultural background. For example, one of the floors is Japan which means you will find some cute tokyo girl fashion accessory shops. If you are craving for some sweets, you can also find a teatime places on first floor, very girly and cute. In terminal 21, you will not find high-end shops or brands such as Chanel or LV, but you will find some creative designed goods with fair prices and also friendly shop owners.

Beautifully designed mall & one of a kind clothing. Love the design of this mall. Good place to buy unique one of a kind clothing. Price are not "bargain-able" tho. But i still think it's cheap for those "one of a kind" clothing.

Very Big, Must See in Bangkok. This place is huge! I lost count as to how many floors there are. But I do always think it's a waste of time for westerners to come to places like Bangkok to shop in malls for the exact same things they can buy back home? I came here just for the experience but shopping here if you are a westerner is a bit silly to me.

'Check-in' to Terminal 21. Extremely easy access to this place, either take the BTS skytrain – Asoke station or via Sukhumvit subway station. Take the BTS and get out at Exit 1, it is directly connected to the mall. Take your time here, loads of photo opportunities. this is a travel theme retail mall. It is divided into 9 stories and 9 cities:LG Floor – Caribbean,G Floor – Rome,M Floor – Paris,1st Floor – Tokyo,2nd Floor – London,3rd Floor – Istanbul,4th Floor – San Francisco (City)5th Floor – San Francisco (Pier)6th Floor – HollywoodRestrooms here are a must visit, absolutely hands down best and cleanest toilets

Its just a mall. After reading the reviews on TA ,I was expecting to see something totally different but what I saw was a regular mall with just a bit of difference in the sense that you would see a miniature of golden gate on one floor n something else on another one.Nothing exceptional.If you are in that area then probably you could have a look but if you are living somewhere far off n commuting especially to see this, then you will end up being disappointed.
This place is EPIC. Coolest mall I've ever been too. Had H&M, Starbucks, and so much more. Each of the 7+ floors had a theme. So cute, unique, and busy. Many food options as well on the bottom floor.

Themed Shopping Centre with Value Food Court. We visited Terminal 21 a few times during our week visit to Bangkok. Reason behind this is because we had to transfer from the Sukhumvit MRT with the Asoke BTS. On the first visit, we found it to be an interesting themed shopping centre based on various cities in the world as well as terminal gates at the entrance/exit to the escalators. However the problem with fixed theme attractions are it will only interest most during the 1st visit. The reason we went back was because of the food court at the top level. The food is delicious with good value. Some are even marginally cheaper than the street side vendors. Most food courts in Thailand works on a pre-paid card system and Terminal 21 is no different. Do not be worried of over budgeting your card as you are entitled to a refund on the remaining value of the card once you're done. Shopping wise, there are some international chains such as H&M and also some local designers. Price wise it is definitely more expensive than the usual suspects (i.e: MBK, Pratunam, etc..)

Around the world in one mall. Terminal 21 is different than any shopping mall. It gives you the opportunity to travel around the world as every floor represent different country with different decoration that reflect the culture of that country. Also it has a very nice selection of food outlets so you don’t feel hungry. There is also a big cinema on the 6th floor that shows the latest movies.

It's a mall, people.. The bad reviews of this mall dismay me. What do people expect? It is a mall, plain and simple. It has all the usual high street shops but also houses local designers and sole traders. Yes, it's expensive but everything is in Bangkok now. It's not Chatuchak market or some street vendor selling pork balls on a stick. It's clean and well-maintained. It's bright and airy. The differing themes on each floor are a nice distraction when you elight the escalators but really, what were people expecting? Don't go to a mall expecting culture, go for the shopping and spend. The food court at the top is the best. Cheap, local great food. And yes, like other reviewers have said, check out the toilets.

Very nice mall in the heart of Sukhumvit. Excellent food court with plenty of choices. Many restaurants also available as well as as a market on the bottom floor. Good shopping as well with a mix of Thai and Western brands. Very close to BTS station.

Quite interesting for a shopping mall. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall which shouldn't be that interesting. What makes this one different is that each floor is themed on a foreign city with the escalators serving as 'flights' with 'arrivals' and 'departures' between the floors. The shops on the lower floors are larger international brands. On the higher floors there are more interesting smaller stalls, particularly on the 'London' floor. At the top is a cinema multiplex. Catching a movie was a cheap and cool way of whiling away an afternoon.

Good place to shop.. There is lots of shops inside terminal 21 and has plenty of floors. The food quarter is on the top 2 floors. The centre is set out in different countries and cities which is quite cool. It is good to go if have some spare time or it is raining. There is lots of food and plenty of shops to look around. I was staying 5 minute walk from it so was convenient for me. From the opposite side of the road it is easiest to enter by going up the steps and past the sky train section and enter that way, this helps to avoid traffic.

experience several countries in just one roof. the mall is designed to be like an airport with each floor corresponding to a famous destination. you will find the famous landmark/s each city is known for (e.g. golden gate bridge in san francisco, bocca de la verita in rome, red double decker bus in london, etc.). interesting and unique mall. however, brands are limited and most products sold are thai made which are also very nice and of good quality. the food court is also a foodies' haven. cheap but good eats! easy access to the bts skytrain (asok station).

A terminal theme shopping mall. a very interesting shopping mall just next to BTS station. With a theme of terminal, every floor corresponds to a diffferent city around the world such as San Francisco, Tokyo, London, etc. Even the washrooms have special deocorations matching with the cities. my kids love this mall very much.

An average mall with a unique theme. Not an outstanding shopping place as compared to other places in Bangkok. A bit inconvenient with the traffic around sukhumvit area. Nevertheless it is a unique mall with an airport theme throughout

Underwhelming if you're looking for more than clothing. Terminal 21 Mall boasts an interesting concept, yet is a bit underwhelming if one is looking for more than fashion. Floor after floor of cute shops, albeit mostly expensive shops, and nothing more than fashion to be found. Fine if one is looking for this but I was looking for more. Easy access from the BTS, great air conditioning to escape the Bangkok oppressing heat and unique bathrooms on each themed floor but not much else. Don't get your hopes up if you're looking for an amazing mall experience.

Great shopping mail within reach of BTS and MRT. Visited this mall Many times, but mainly for the restaurants on the 4th and 5th floor.
Best restaurant on 5th floor at your right hand:
Moom Muum Park restaurant.
Outstanding food, Great service, Great views at Sukhumvit!
Be sure to visit this place, you will not regret!

Great food Great cinema Great shopping experience. This shopping centre is so massive they have the longest escalator I have ever seen in my life! Every escalator have a sign departing or arrival from and to which ever terminal (level). They have six floors exactly. All named after a city. Makes you feel like you're going on a trip! During the weekends and some weekdays they will have a function in their main level (Paris). When we went there it was all about confectionery and street food. They showcased lots of mini stalls offering different sweet delights! Of course, a sweet tooth like me went nuts for it! There were also plenty of cuisine to choose from on 4th and 5th floor which were both named San Francisco. If you love Japanese food, they have plenty here. Also the Istanbul level offers a different shopping experience. instead of brands it was like a small market stalls where you can buy stuff that can also be seen on night markets. Prices are more expensive than the actual ones in the markets of course. Also, they have the best public toilets as some floors offer Japanese toilets for your comfort. The top level which was Hollywood is where the cinema is. Cinema was a great experience as well. big spacious reclining seats on standard movie tickets was a plus. All in all, terminal 21 was a great shopping destination, tourist friendly and great location as it is connected to Asok BTS and MRT station.
Unique concept. The concept of the mall is unique with every floor has different theme according to the country floor. Other than that it was basically just like other malls with lots of shops.
Terminal 21. Go there to the top level and try the food. MMMM nice. Lots and lots of restaurants for every one. Lovely shops. Accessed with the sky train

Fun & Easy: Perfect for families with children. This is a must-visit department store if you like shopping, and specially if you are a family with children.Take the BTS to Asok, here you will have direct access to the mall. If you need a babystroller, go to information/customer service (available on every floor). Here you can borrow a stroller for free until 9pm.Shopping is fun for everyone, where you can explore and see popular attraction from many cities, such as Rome, Paris, London, Tokyo. Tokyo was our favourite floor with many boutiques with unique women clothing. Try the Tokyo toilet/restroom also with water wash :)On the ground / Carrabean floor you will find lots of great food. On top floor you will find movies and restaurants. Between these floors you will find loads of shopping opportunities, from brand name clothes to interior shops.Tokyo with lots for women. London with most goods for men.Go here for chilling down (aircondition works well), shopping and seightseiing. Try the food court with street food on the ground floor! Prices are good and so are the food.Currency rate was also higher here than outside in street or the bank.

Hip and trendy. Its a super hype shopping center, target at young adults and teens, with almost 10 floors of shopping/eating sites to behold. go early as you need alomost 6hrs to visit all the wonders and shops. just remember the eating area/food court is on top 2 levels

Interesting Fashion Finds in this Concept Mall. Terminal 21 offers a fresh concept of having dedicated floor for every known fashion capitals in the world - Paris, Rome, Istanbul, London, Tokyo, etc. Aside from a few branded shops like Jaspal, Promod, Victoria's Secret, etc located at the ground floor of the mall, the succeeding levels house independent blog shops offering unique pieces you can easily mix and match to get your fashion game on. There's a foodcourt on Level 5 where you can get decent local other Asian dishes for a cheaper price. There are coffeeshops and a few restaurant choices as well. If you find yourself exhausted from walking around, you can even get a massage at let's Relax located at the cinema level. Or better yet, catch a good movie if you are so inclined. There is free internet but you need to get the access codes from the information counter at the ground floor level. If you are a tourist, make sure you have your passport or your resident ID to present to the information officers. All in all, Terminal 21 is not such a bad place to spend some time in - but do know that you are in Bangkok, and here, they take the mall culture to a whole new level. Meaning, if it's mall that you like, you can easily find grander and more opulent destinations for your expensive tastes. Happy shopping!

Shopping at the Airport. You feel like shopping at the International Airport around the world . From Japan to Paris to UK to Istanbul etc. It was a pretty neat concept. Each floor has different type of apparel , accessories , decorative stuffs from different country. The price are quite reasonable . I prefer this than MBK, not too aggressive (I mean the seller) and the layout are much more neater and non congested.

Beautiful shopping center and Nightlife nearby. Terminal 21 is one of the two or three best shopping malls in Bangkok because it combines nice shops of all kinds with some good values. It's not as outrageously expensive as Siam Paragon or the new Embassy , nor is a bargain basement hunter's "garage sale" kind of place either like MBK. Terminal 21 strikes just the right balance between quality and price. That's why so many local Thais go shopping there.

great location for photographers. Not only is this a really interesting shopping centre with different themed levels, but it is one of the very few shopping centres in the world that actually encourages photography. There are signs on the front doors that welcome cameras, what a great idea.

Massive modern mall. Located directly beside the ASOK station on the Skytrain, this massive modern air conditioned shopping mall provides welcome relief from the outside temperature and surely would provide even the most ardent shopaholic a serious challenge. Located on 8 ?? Different levels this mall caters for all tastes and should allow most shoppers to find suitable outlets for their passion.

What a great place for shopping. Lovely place. Good location: BTS will get you there...I think it is Chit Lom station. Each floor is named after a city and the decoration goes along. Medium-sized supermarket on the ground floor and some events take place there too (I got a Gourmet Market that was nice). On the top floor is the food court (as usual in BKK shopping malls). Good prices. Each of the top floors (third to sixth) has an independent designer/store section with VERY good prices and great/different/crazy stuff....These areas kinda resemble real market feel. Lower floors have international brand stores (but not that many). A must!

Good Shopping. Fair prices at the shops. Each level is for one country, so you have level 1 Paris with Paris themed shopping. We loved Level 4 Istanbul and bought a lot of little trinkets to take home. Level 5-6 are the food courts. Wonderful Thai street food style on Level 6 without the questionable sanitary conditions of actual street food-and air conditioning too. Very low prices at food courts. Basement level has a grocery store and fresh fruit market with incredible fruits & veggies.

We go here every trip. We always stay around this area so we end up eating most of our meals there.The kids like to look at the few toy stores on third floor.I look at handbags and clothes, but do find it quite expensive. I don't normally buy, but I window shop. Still I like to take photos there and the toilets are very clean, the staff do a great job at cleaning.

A nice walk. We visited Terminal 21 as it was very near our hotel. Each floor of the centre is a theme from another city around the world. It was nice to walk through the floors and see the decorations, however, I can't say that it was something breathtaking. We enjoyed our walk but I wouldn't go out of my way to go and see Terminal 21.

Modern with International Travel Theme. So, rather than simply numbering each level you travel upwards to another city which is interesting and in each city you can do some different shopping. All of the prices are fixed so haggling is a waste of time but you can still get "discount" when bulk buying.Most of the label stores are available but you can still do souvenir and t-shirt shopping - it just costs a bit more than outside market prices.There is also food available and toilet(s) on each level. The Plaza is a/c which is a nice relief from the heat and humidity outside.Good experience and we had a bonus - a local production company was shooting a movie in and around the building which was entertaining!Great plaza and worth the walk from hotel.

Thematic shopping mall. This mall have different country theme in every floor.The pricing is mid.Must try the food court.its so cheap where you can afford food for only 30 - 40 bath with so many range of food

Another great outing at Terminal 21. You have got to love this place! Each floor is a dofferent palce form around the world and has the decor to match, what you can't buy here in the way of clothes, you probably don't want to buy! Love wandering through all the different levels- plenty to buy and an enormous range of foods on sale. This place is so worth a visit.

Left feeling slightly disappointed . Visited the shopping centre one evening during our short stay in Bangkok June 2015 after reading many good reviews. Hoped to kill a few hours window shopping and then grab a bite to eat. The set up of the mall was very interesting and innovative, however I struggled to find any shops that was of much interest to myself and similarly all the restaurants were expensive (which was of no surprise). Settled for an ice cream and wandered down the road for some cheaper and probably equally as tasty Thai street food.

Fun, young, hip mall. My partner and I found this fun mall to be a nice break from the generic Thai ones with all the same stores and blandness. Each level had a different country theme and some felt like a Turkish bazaar. Some really interesting fun small shops. Check this place out, right of the Skytrain stop.

No need to buy anything - just enjoy the visual treat. Yes it is a shopping Mall, but it is also worth having a wander round just to absorb the atmosphere of the different levels - very interesting and quite photogenic too!

Best Mango & Sticky Rice. Terminal 21 is a great shopping mall to check out, it's huge & the food court is great & so cheap. The crispy pork stand yummo & there is a little dessert bar in the middle of all the other food stalls that serves Mango & Sticky rice, the best I've had throughout the whole of Thailand. The salty with the sweet is what makes it so light & scrumptious. Must try.
Interesting Mall. This is an interesting mall setup like an airport terminal. The selection of shops are great too. We enjoyed our shopping here and bought many things at this mall. Will be back!!!

Innovative concept. Located adjacent to the sky train station, it is very easy to be reached,this mall has a great concept, each of the floors are named after and based on leading cities across the world like San Francisco, Tokyo etc, great place to spend time and shop. It has got a great food court ont he top floor.

Great Thai food, great atmosphere!!. Great place, great variety, fast friendly service!! Very clean!! Go to the service desk on "San Francisco" level, then pre load (any amount you like) on a (free)terminal 21 card- then buy food- great system- no money required at food outlets means really fast service!! A must to visit if your in Bangkok- meals from approx $3 Australian! Even less for vegetarian meals!!
European inspired mall!. I had so much fun on my first day in Bangkok. I found it on a walk up the road and got really excited about the little laneways in the mall. Happy shopping, everyone!
uniq. located at Sukhumvit area, very easy to go to this mall. I love the theme in each floor, and i love the food variety at food court area

Better than average shopping mall. Very good location on the train line so easy to get to since parking at shopping malls in cities like this is often a nightmare. Better than average selection of restaurants and all the usual shops.

Best mall food court in Bangkok. This is the best mall food court in Bangkok for the price and quality. The food is amazing and priced better than some of the other malls. I highly recommend the papaya salad, fried chicken salad, and fried oysters. All of the food is fresh and cooked to order. Really you can't go wrong at this food court. Make sure you try a fresh fruit/vegi smoothy and the mango sticky rice. The coconut ice cream is just as good as the stuff they sell at the JJ weekend market but cheaper. I also recommend trying the Milo and Lime ice creams if you have a sweet tooth.

Uniqueness. Not your everyday mall. And the theme for each level is different, and each toilet (verified by the ladies in our group) is individually designed and even the two toilets on the same floor has different design and theme. Free wifi password given if you show info counter your passport. Awesome food court that has cheap and good eats.

Modern Mall. This charming place to visit, why? Apart from being a modern mall, the mall is able to become one of the favorite places to shop in Bangkok. They provide a theme for each floor, according to the market that they manage. Besides, it also has a variety of facilities, good food and restaurants, as well as lodging facility with a view of the beautiful city of Bangkok.

One of the nicest shopping mall in Bangkok. It is a very impressive shopping mall with different theme on different levels, even the toilets of each level are with different theme. You can find most of the common brands for clothing, shoe, beauty products, accessories...etc. Lots of restaurants with different cuisine. Basically you can get almost everything under one roof. However, you won't be able to get the price that similar to chatuchak market. I am not sure all price are fixed or you still can haggle. You can try if you want to but I didn't do that. It is a shopping mall that you will go back again and again.

A must see in Bangkok!. This is a very unique mall. Not your ordinary kind of mall. I strongly suggest that you go to this mall to experience the fun in every floor which represents a different country. Food is delicious too! But if you are looking for expensive brands such as Louis Vuitton, Gucci and the like, unfortunately you cannot find it here.
great food court. great food court that was extremely cheap!! close to train station so easy access from other places.

loved the themes per floor. The different themes over floor was cool. They give you a free wifi password if you show them your passport or ID. Food in the food hall was edible, not that I'd be back. Daiso, Boots at the bottom floor!

Paradise for Shoppers!. One of Bangkok's biggest shopping areas. Terminal 21 is great as a night time attraction to relax, shop, wine and dine. Very well set our building. Looks good. Shops great. Clever layout, each floor is named after a city.

Delicious food,nice design. Terminal 21 is a place with nice indoor building design,the toilet are special,every floor has different country design.The food court on top have delicious food and it is cheap. Especially the fruits juices nice and cheap too.Don't forget to try.

Best mall in bangkok. I was so surprise by visiting this mall it was so clean and they have a wonderful food court with delicious food to almost no money. There is a stand that makes ice tea perfectly never tasted such a good ice tea. The mall have different stages called different cities around the world and the sell so cheap clothes it was a paradise for my girlfriend and me. The most wonderful with this mall is their toilets they are so clean and design so nice for the shoppers you almost can't leave it :)

Visit the Food Court. Terminal 21 might just be my favorite mall in Bangkok! Visiting this mall is truly an experience. The entire place is themed like an airport with each level themed around a different city. It's worth walking around each level just to see the amount of effort put into the decoration. The shops are small and full of funky clothing and jewelry, so it's really fun to peruse and window shop. If you visit this mall you absolutely must visit the food court, Pier 21. You'll have to take the escalators all the way to the very top of the mall, but it is worth the trek. The food court has loads of tasty options for very affordable prices. The vendors don't take cash though. You have to buy a pre-loaded dining card at the desk which you can then use to pay for your meals. The food court can get pretty busy though. We went once on a Friday night and it was so busy we almost couldn't find a table.

A Cool Shopping Mall. This was my first time to visit Terminal 21, I knew this place because I have watched a travel TV program talking about the Terminal 21 Mall in Bangkok few years ago. I think it is pretty cool with the theme of airport, guests arrive and depart different places. Pretty nice to spend some hours walking around in a spacious and interesting mall! :)

Excellent food court!. I live very near to this shopping mall and I have eaten very nice every time I go! The food court has so much variety in food and prices! it is very low budget but excellent food alternative! The shops do not know them so much but is always full though!

Funky mall. One of my favorite malls in bangkok.
The mall is well organized, easy to find your way there.
It doesn't have everything you need, but it's great if you look for funky and vintage stuff.
The mall has mainly fashion shops and is quiet expensive. It's not the "thailand cheap" kind of mall.

Cool place. This shopping centre was a lot of fun to explore. Enjoyed the different cities of the world and the toilets are a must visit on each floor. Some interesting local designers on the higher floors. Ate at the food court which we really didn't enjoy.

Original. This mall have all the famous western stores abut also a huge collection of small boutiques with self designed clothes, bags and accessories. The food court is crazy cheap (1,5 USD for a dinner) and really fresh thai food. Yeas, one and a half dollars!

Hipster shops and nice food!. Hipster shops and nice food! You find plenty of cheap shirts, dresses, shorts, jeans on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Ground floor is the more expensive chain stores. Food court is great, low prices and many options. Cinema is also on the top floor and good value for money.

Worth a visit and good for shoppers. This mall is themed to various destinations. for instance there is a Paris floor, aLondon floor, and an Istanbul floor. The mall has lots of quirky features and would be easy and enjoyable for the avid shopper to get lost in.it has great variety in terms of shop size, selection, and prices.

A trip around the world.... While in Bangkok I spent a lot of time in Terminal 21. Tons of shops to go to as well as international cuisine, it was great. stroll through the shops where you can find almost anything.....A must to see......
worldly experience. Everyone reports great adventure in this shopping mall, different Country theme on each floor, loads of quality low priced restaurants and the toilets are a must do .. lol

fantastic mall. The mall I like the most during the recent trip in Bangkok. Not only the mall concept that is attracting but the food. We have ended having dinner everyday here at the Pier 21. The food is not only delicious but cheaper than street food. Though the food hall is packed with people at anytime, but to get the food ordered & ready is very fasf. It is highly recommended. The shops at the mall are also rather unique compared to the other mall, with it's own local brand. W

Interesting mall. The each-floor-is-a-city concept is pretty interesting! Also, I really like the arcade machines at the top floor. The pork leg stew rice at the food court here is surprisingly tasty!

Per my budget I could actually window stop without cringing!. Not as high end, per my budget I could actually window stop without cringing. It's between MBK and centralworld/emporium. I didn't buy anything though, as brands and prices are comparable to whats avai in HK. So.. I managed to walk away with my shopping urge!!

Interesting mall concept. Each level of the mall links you to a location on earth. So you feel like you have travelled to another country just by going up a level. The mall has numerous stores. Each level stays true to its country-theme and has decorations that are aligned to the country. Even the washrooms are decorated to match the theme of that country. There's a lot of food choices at the top few levels. Supermarket at the basement levesl.

Only highlight at Terminal 21 is H&M. - Good strategic location. Next to Asok station.- Always manage to find the sizes i want from H&M. Not sure why though, it is not very crowded in H&M.- Surprisingly, other clothing sold at other shops are more expensive than the clothes in H&M.- If you want cheao and pretty asian clothing, go up to level 3.If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

Modern Themed Mall with Local Designers. I recently visited this Mall again on my recent trip, and I'm still impressed by the large variety of shops and services that it offers. It is very conveniently located adjacent to the Asok BTS station (sky train) and the Sukhumvit MRT station. Every floor has a international theme like Japan, Istanbul and San Francisco, and the decor (including the toilet) is unique to each destination. It is a modern and clean mall, so do not expect cheap bargains, and neither does it offer high-end brands. In the basement there is a gourmet supermarket (you can make your own salad), a couple of pharmacies (Boots and Watsons) and bookstores, as well as lots of take out food. The lower floors are devoted to international High Street brands (Promod, H&M, Adidas), which I ignored since I can find them in Singapore. But the upper floors are full of local designers which are much more interesting. The Japan floor caters to women's clothing, London more to hip male clothing, Istanbul has lots of accessories (shoes, bags, scarves, jewellery), Hollywood at the top has a movie theatre, video games, a spa (Let's Relax Spa - clean, professional and very popular). San Francisco is two floors of food, one with restaurants and cafes, and the other a food court offering a variety of local foods (noodles/rice/dessert/juices) at reasonable prices. There really is something for everyone here, and one could spend a whole day here.

Best Toilets in Bangkok. OK, the mall is pretty good with lots of unique shops spread across the floors which are themed after cities all over the world. There's some good restaurants on the top two floors too. The best thing about this place is actually the toilets. Each floor has a fairly large set of toilets which are also interestingly themed and kept immaculately clean. The cubicles all have those futuristic Japanese toilets with heated seats and electrical bidet. Every one! If you want to do some shopping and have a dodgy stomach, this is the place to be!
Didn't impress me that much. Mega store, ok if you like shopping, very hectic but top floor has loads of local food store which is good, not many bargains though

Cute & Fun. - a youthful and fresh modern shopping mall for men, women & children.. If you like the mid-way (not looking for high end brands, nor looking for the super cheap), but like independent local designers or small boutiques with bits and bobs for both men, women, children and all others (...ha!) - pay Terminal 21 a visit! You also have UPS and PostOffice at the very ground floor (take two stairs down from the main entrance on Sukhumvit Soi 19 side). It is rather cute even in it's grand size (it does not feel 'that' big). Great spacious clean public toilets with very funky modern toilet seats (you have to try them out! Haha). I personally love contemporary designers with some edge. I found a new fav brand in Black Sugar ! - mix of Japanese and Thai. LOVE ! Would never come across them if not walked past the small shop (learned they are also at Centralworld). I did find the Info board on each floor quite tricky to use (too technical for me maybe, not clear enough), however there is a live desk to ask for help if needed ;). It is a big place, lots of stores; clothing, cinema, technique, TeleCom, food, post office, supermarket, cafe's...feels modern and youthful. Even if I am more into high quality brands and high quality independent designers, I actually liked my visit - and will pay a visit as often I can. I do feel I like to really take time and browse carefully...as there are some gems to find. It is also nice to see there are shops for men only..and not only focus on female clothing or accessories. I have still lots to explore inside Terminal21ASOK BTS and SUKHUMVIT MRT outside the door.

Interesting Theme Mall. The mall is a theme mall - each floor represents a different country/location which is quite interesting and most people seem to really enjoy it. There isn't much to buy there. Mainly there is clothes and some food places. From what I've seen all of the clothing is quite expensive. In terms of food, there is some expensive food, but also some cheaper food. The food is quite good. They have restaurants such as Tony Roma's and a lot of Asian food as well. The cinema is no cheaper than the other unread at other malls. The cinema always has a lot of movies playing.

A airport style shopping center . This shopping is nice with lots of things to see, buy and eat.The things here is not cheap but there is lots of things to see as they are nicely display.The food court is a must to visit and eat there as the food there is cheap and nice.

It has character. The fact that they tried to be different has paid off handsomely. Every floor has a theme and the food court on the top is surely Bangkok's best. Arguably the best located mall in town and the easiest to navigate. Its open, accessible and well thought out whatever your budget. Can only see this place going from strength to strength

overrated themed shopping mall. Has different themed at different floor of the shopping mall. But a bit overrated because besides this, not much to look about. Upside is the food court above was good and cheap. Food is really delicious and average priced.

A place for great and cheap food!!!. Nice concept. Every level has its own theme. Goods are expensive here. Not worth to shop here. However, there are varieties of food at the food court and the price is even cheaper than the street market. Worth to visit the food court for great and cheap food. Further, there is a must try Thai Tea kiosk located at the Lower Ground of the mall.

Airport theme based Mall. The mall has themes of various countries but I found that the decor was not to great. The bathrooms of each floor are a must visit. Shops are expensive filled with some brands and local designers. Clothes are expensive but food court is good and pricing is also ok.

說要把全世界的特色都融入在其中的商場，它也的確做到了. There's a surprise when you come into the mall, a captain and a metal gate is waiting for you!Every floor has it theme, I can't describe how excite to me when I see the mini Golden Bridge again , it very touched.
wonderfull. i like it u can go shopping there brand name and thai designer. last floor u can eat have many restaurant and one good food court
Funky shopping precinct!. Really funky and cool place to visit, very clean!! Lots to see around the place, i wouldn't suggest you can find a cheap bargain but good to go have a look.

You'll just want to visit every toilet in every floor!. Terminal 21 is not as big as Central World or Siam Paragon but the theme of the Shopping Mall is certainly based on different countries such as Japan, Rome, San Francisco, London and so on.As such every toilets (even on the same floor) has unique design and decor just to suit the theme of that specific floor! Even the floor personnel or janitors are in uniform that suits the theme!Terminal 21 has many nice snacks, sweets and ice creams stall! Terminal 21 is by the BTS and you can visit Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit for "Dine in the Dark" which I did for awesome experience!
Food trip galore!. Great food in a very convenient setting! The only challenge was looking for available seats. Other than that, the visit was worth it! Happy tummy!

Attractive mall. This mar be relatively small compared to other amous malls of bangkok! But the theme of each floor giving a feel of different cities of the world is interesting. Good shops and eating joints. Looks bit premium compared to other malls. Very close to BTS. Along with brands you can get good local soveniers.

Best local food and great price!. Terminal 21 is a lot of fun for taking in a big city mall complete with world themes like London, San Francisco and Rome. We made quite a few visits there simply because of the Food Court. There is a huge variety of foods and the entrees are around 25 baht (less than a US $1). We chose mangoes and sticky rice and iced Thai tea with milk every time and then our entrees would vary. The shops are fun, but a bit pricey. Transit to it is easy and the vendors outside sell some traditional Thai souvenirs. Fun outing!

Nice mall. Expensive shopping. Seems like shopping in Bangkok Terminal 21 is not like the other malls. Clothes are priced at $60 and above easily. Be prepared to pay for shopping there.
Overall a nice mall with a great food court.

Theme mall!. This mall is pretty cool, closed to BTS Station and easy to walk through,
different floors got different characteristics. Nice. Next to elevator, it has a "terminal" signal which gives a feeling of "departure" and "travel" atmosphere.

ok not ideal for bargain shopping. The theme of the mall is lovely, designed to look like a different shopping destination on every floor. Each floor has a destination theme, example London, San Francisco, etc. If you are looking for bargain shopping this is not the place. It's filled more with boutiques and local artisans.

One of the best malls in Bangkok . The mall is situated on Sukhumvit road close to Asok station. It is beautiful and very well organized. Unlike Paragon, you can find there price variety of items. The interior design is nice. It looks like airport terminal where each floor represents a different major city. It really gives you a great feeling doing shopping there.

A mall with a fun theme!. This is a small mall compared to the others in Bangkok, but still good. Lots of high end shops and small cafes and bakery's. Every floor has a different world-theme with flight attenders at the entrees welcoming you! It's a great place to spend an afternoon at.

Average shopping mall . It's nice to see a shopping mall with different theme on each floor but seriously, there isn't much to look at, nothing seemed interesting but somehow it's very busy in the food court. The food there was okay.

Well worth a visit when in Bangkok. This is a large mall with a theme of worldwide travel, so areas have place names such as Rome , Tokyo etc. Customer services wear eye catching flight attendant uniforms. Overall a great shopping experience.

Good place for shopping . The Terminal 21 is a nice and modern Shopping mall in Japanese style. Lovely small shops and restaurants there. My friends from Europe felt amazed when I took them there. So much different from all other malls in Europe. Give it a try.

Cool concept. This mall is set up as a "world tour" of different cities around the globe. You can seamlessly walk from Paris to Rome and take an escalator up to Tokyo. It's pretty neat, reminiscent of Disneyland. The top floors are San Francisco, fully equipped with a small replica of the Golden Gate Bridge. I recommend going for the AC :), and to see if you can guess where you are before reading the welcome signs!
Amazing place. Was there in 2013, and this mall has lots of small shops. Every floor has its own city theme, and you really should check the toilets! It'll absolutely be worth your while.

everything under 1 roof. huge mall with everything from supermarket, cafes, shopping both international and local brands and small shops, resturants, food court and cinema under 1 roof. as with the major malls in bkk, this is just outside the asok bts and mrt stations so very convenient for everything you need to buy and eat.

Not much shopping but great foodcourt. Having been to Platinum Mall, Siam Paragon, I would say Terminal 21 pale in comparison. However, they have a great foodcourt (Pier 21) on the 5th floor that is fairly priced and great choices in terms of variety.

Cool themed mall but no MBK.
