Another mall in Bangkok to add to the many but this one's a little different - It's an airport themed mall with each level representing a different country.It has some good high st brand stores along with boutiques offering some really nice designers not found elsewhere.As tourists we found the staff in some of the brand shops e.g in the Levi's store to be pretentious and rude which slightly ruins the cool vibe of the mall. This being said it's worth a visit to this quirky mall.

LOOKS LIKE DEPARTURE TERMINAL. Its really a cool shopping mall located close to asoke BTS, The mall is designed like a departure terminal with cool signage and graphics. different levels have different names. This mall has lots of branded and non branded outlets, we really enjoyed shopping. this place more organised.

Not as special as we imagined!. Some interesting decorations for sure (the Golden Gate Bridge, the Roman statues, etc.) but except for the Tokyo floor which had interesting (mostly Thai) clothing boutiques, really just a mall like any other mall.

AIRPORT THEMED SHOPPING MALL. Terminal 21 is a 6 story airport themed shopping mall located on the skytrain / mrt line in bangkok sukumvit / asoke stations.. The top floor is a movie theater complex and a fitness center .. Next floor is an excellent food court with tony roma's .. Ichiban curry house .. Jeffers steak house .. Manhattan fish & chips .. Mk resturaunt .. A few yakiniku resturaunts and a bunch of food kiosks with local and international foods each floor and corridor is a city theme san francisco .. New york .. London .. Dubai .. Instabul . There is a metel beam red bridge golden gate. Bridge suspended over the 5 th floor ... This mall is a great place to spend the afternoon at .. I recommend a visit and see for yourself how great this mall is..

Really cool shopping g mall!. This was a really cool mall, it has an airport theme and each level is called a different city--ie London, Paris, etc. Excellent food and drink options, the dining area is called San Francisco complete with a bridge built right in the mall! Fun and interesting, some pricey, some not. I would highly recommend! !!

Cool mall, cheap food!. Just located right beside Asok BTS! theres a walkway that link from the BTS to this mall. For shoppers, the type of pricing of the clothing here are like not say over price, just that its normal price. As theres shop like H&M. This is not like platinum fashion mall or MBK. So for people who specially come over bangkok to shop for cheap clothing, this will not be the place for you. But its definitely worth visiting as the concept of this mall is really cool. But the food here at the food court are really super cheap!! You cant find the price like this at other mall. The price here can be compare to those street stall! Really worth trying and they taste good too!
Will dissapoint you. From the name and look. Its not worth spending hours. Limited brands limited choises. Not many options or spaces to roam around. I give it only one hour.
Best Shopping mall in Bangkok. Everything you need is either in Terminal 21 or Platinum Shopping! Also when you are there and you get tired from all the shopping, you have to try "Let's relax"!
Nice food court. Its a big mall and one of the best attractions of bkk. in the city center and very good for movies and eating food. Good stores and outlets

Cheap quality clean foods. Probably the only place in Bangkok we frequented (>4x). Go to the top most floor (i think 5th floor), you will find a paradise of neatly arranged food stalls with quality meals costing only 25-40 Baht. Enjoy 2-3 foods per meal!

Disappointing. This is Bangkok's newest arrival in the shopping world and, having read so many positive reviews about it, thought I would pay a visit. The theme is very clever in that it resembles an airport terminal and as you ascend the escalators each floor has an arrival / departure gate depicting a City (Rome / Tokyo / London / New York) and that floor is meant to showcase fashion shops relevant to that location. From the reviews I expected better but it is rather tacky, I quite liked the London floor with big red buses and telephone box but that was it. The shops are all very low-end and I would say this mall is very much aimed at the late teens / early twenties age group with H&M and other floors containing shops equivalent to H&M but not as good if that makes sense. I am a stylish forty-something and work in the City of London, there was nothing here for me. I rather liked a shop on the Paris floor selling beautiful lemon scented home fragrance oils in containers but these were £80 so I think I found the only expensive shop there! Needless to say, I didn't buy anything. All in all it was not for me but the kids would love it!

A fantastic escape from the heat for a few hours. I typically avoid malls when travelling because you can shop anywhere, but this is pretty unique. The themed levels are interesting, and each store is tiny so you can cover a lot of ground quickly. The food court is also an easy introduction to Thai food.

Interesting themed mall. Terminal 21 has different themes for each mall. Even the restrooms had changed their theme following the different floor themes. The 6th floor (Hollywood) has a cinema and IT area. 4th and 5th are more restaurants and food areas. The other floors are the shopping areas while the LG has one of the most convenient grocery market as it has many Halal approved item for Muslims. We even saw many Halal approved items from Malaysia.

Shopping Fun. This is a good shopping mall and great for taking pictures.Every level is different. The theme varries from Paris, london,tokyo,turkey,Uk.The 5th floor has food court.Getting a taxi is no problem. There is a queue for taxis (something unheard of in Bangkok!!!)But if you want cheap quality shopping , Platinum Mall is still the best!

Interesting theme mall. One of a kind mall. Something really different from most malls I have been to with specific themes for each part of the mall. Things in the mall are a little more expensive but worth a go if you are around the corner

A must see ... A mordern shopping mall with a Theme on each floor....Although most of the brands are expensive, this place is good to explore and take pictures.The mall has a food court which serves all type of food (even Halal) aswell as drinks, icecreams etc (at reasonable rates).For movie lovers..a cinema in place. Few mobile shops at the top floor as well as Mobile phone service centers for DTAC, AIS etc.. (although they maybe crowded at times).

Airport themed shopping Mall. Terminal 21 situated at Asok BTS Sky Rail station is conveniently connected for access.Big and open spacious interior gives it a good feel with light and colour. All the mai shops are there for Brand names and a very comprehensive range of Restaurants and Coffee shops. In the basement a really good supermarket style grocery and fresh foods await you.Upstairs the centre boasts a cinema with the latest release movies. The airport theme is extended with each floor being a country flavour for example San Francisco theme on the fourth floor complete with Golden gate bridge, tram tracks etc..Interesting and worth a visit if you have already worn out Siam Central and MBK centres.

Department store closed to BTS. Like: Easy to access from BTS skytrain; Very clean, beautiful & hi-tech restroom; Very cheap & delicious food court; Has supermarket, movie theater, bookstores, restuarants, etcDislike: none

The Terminal 21 Experience. Terminal 21 is one of the latest additions to the already bustling retail scene in Bangkok. Conveniently situated close to Asok station on the BTS sky train system, it comprises several floors of different themes, ranging from London, to Istanbul to San Francisco, with a plethora of suitable shops on every level. At the topmost level, there is an abundance of eating places and stalls at incredibly low prices yet excellent food if you choose carefully! A really worthwhile and enjoyable retail experience in the main part of Sukhumvit, soi 21 !

Different !. A very quirky shopping centre. Each floor has a theme from all over the world. Even down to the rest rooms. On the London floor they have a mock up London bus and in the rest room it appears that you are entering the London Underground complete with train carriage !

Some original Thai stores but much as any other.. This is a bright, well air conditioned shopping center with a number of half decent food outlets (better than traditional food court quality). It has all the usual mid range brand names but on the upper floors some much more interesting Thai owned establishments, worth a visit to see some of these. Aside from that it really is just another shopping center, very busy at weekends.
lovely place. very accessible, good food choices, beautiful surroundings, should visit for both shopping and experiencing the place (state of the art/high tech facilities, interior design)

Its just a mall. If you are a tourist, this is just another mall. Its new and on the BTS line but I don't know why you'd bother as its mostly full of international brands. Owing to taxation, the prices are higher than in Europe or the US.

Fooood Court at last floor is the most important place here !. This is a very very trendy place !Expensive too. If you want to buy a cookie 75THB on a take away stall, this is a place you will love !But if you want to eat for 80THB full belly + dessert ! Vegan, vegetarian, full meat Thaï and non Thaï ! Everything is at the foodcourt on the top level ! The place has to be found in the whole building. Keep seeking, it worth to be found !The food is not bad, and there is a good variety !

Good place to do shopping and having foods.. Since I have stayed close to this Shopping Mall, so I used to shop and having foods there. We can take the sky train stop at Asok Station, you can find the shopping mall next to the station. This mall was designed uniquely by floor. The London design, Sanfrancisco, Tokyo, Istanbul, Paris etc. different floor, different design.

The best shopping mall in bangkok. In the middle of Bangkok... You will find this mall.... With lots of varieties and shops... And on the last floor you'll find an excellent massage place... It's crowded... But they are professional
Respite from the heat. Besides photo-ops and good food, the various thematic restrooms/toilets on each floor is interesting. Direct access from sky train stop.

Spoilt for food chooces. If you're someone not into street food and would like to be away from the heat during day time. This will be the place where you can find lots of eateries serving all variety of food from Thai to Thai fusion, Japanese, western and etc... Worth checking it out and it has got a pretty decent food court downstairs which might be slightly more friendly to the pocket.

Nice quirky shopping centre. Feel of the shopping centre is probably between the posh mega malls (e.g. Paragon, Central) and cheap and hectic shopping centres such as MBK and Platinum Mall. There's alot of shops where each floor is dedicated to a different country. Even the toilet in each floor has different themes. The must visit is the food court where the food is ridiculously cheap. One standard meal is probably ard 35TBH!
Photo spot and nice food. Photo spots and nice food. Don't forgot to take pictures in different toilets. Nice to window shop and relax.

BRANDED ITEMS OF DIFFERENT COUNTRIES. This was my second visit to Terminal-21 and the latest one in this month - May 14, 2015, this time around found that the new pavilions/outlets. Each floor has stuff from different countries including USA. Just a reminder that the items on sale are very expensive including the eateries/snacks/ice creams. I could only do some window shopping in most of the countries stalls, however, managed to find couple of items which were reasonable. IT equipment, networking areas, massage parlours are also in this location, also, games for seniors and youngster

Interesting Concept. Every floor has a different country theme. Makes it a fun place to visit. Many interesting restaurants. The food court on the top floor has very reasonably priced food. The lower level has grocery store and more oil choices.

Consider the place as another attraction while at Bangkok. The Terminal 21 offers you a unique shopping experience.It's all design is like an airport Terminal, "cross country shopping"You can find there the best brands as well as a small boutique shops. You will have no difficulty of finding a nice spot for having a coffee brake from the shopping experience and as well for food. Another attraction while at Bangkok!

No big deal. Nothing fantastic about this shopping but good for phototaking. I like the Rome arena most and the rest are just plain ordinary.Convenient for travel, just next to Asok station. Great place to hide away from the heat. Centralworld is a better place even if you are just window shopping.

One of a kind. This mall is right beside one of the train station which makes it easy to locate. The whole mall is themed from different countries. Even their bathrooms are well designed! I love how creative they are among other huge malls in Bangkok.

International theme. every floor is a different country.a very nice place for shopping, food and entertainment.very good themed decorations on every floors (including toilets)good food at cheap price.located on sukhumvit road and if you're using bts skytrain, get off at Asok station.

Unique theme mall. What a unique concept.A mall with a theme for each floor.There is Istambul at one floor, Tokyo at another floor, San Fransisco and much more.Very unfortunate no Bali floor.The food court is lying on the San Fransisco floor.The food were marvelous.Not to mention that they at a very fair prices.It is even more awesome as it can be accessed both from MRT or BTS.Therefore we can avoid the Bangkok's massive traffic jam.

Easy to navigate, easy to find things, makes for easy shopping. In complete contrast to some of the HUGE shopping malls in Bangkok this shopping mall, still massive by many standards, is so much easier to navigate around. It is easy to find too. Just a bit further along from the Robinsons department store, and very near to the Westin Hotel. I would get off the SkyTrain at Asoke station to get myself there. We needed some pretty diverse shopping from bedding to sport shorts, and presents to be sent back home, and to eat lunch if possible. All the stores were located with ease, and it was very simple to locate restaurants and coffee shops. All in all a surprisingly comfortable shopping trip, if such a thing can ever be called that!

Creative. I found this shopping mall to be rather creative!The whole design imitates an airport and each floor has a different theme which resembles famous cities like Paris, San Francisco, London, etc. I didn't actually shop there, but I remember seeing plenty of stores (as it is expected from a mall...). If you are planning do a shopping tour in Bangkok, make an effort to go to Terminal 21. It is attached to Asok skytrain station and near other interesting malls around.

Easy access from Asoke station. Right there between Asoke and Sukhumvit station. Its fame for many restaurants and food hall on the top floor at the back section of the building. The top floor front section is a cinema hall. At the food hall, you load a card with cash at the cashier desk for spending. When you buy food each time the seller will deduct the money from your card. What money is left if any you can get it back when you leave.The food hall is like a food market where there are many stalls selling different types of food. The prices are similar to street food but I found you get nothing much compare to restaurants in terrace buildings or street food.The main problem is that if you go at lunch time or a public holiday, the place is so busy that you will find it difficult to get a seat. Perhaps you could share a table with a stranger like street food but asking first and not sure if they really understand the request. Walking around trying to find a seat with food in your hand is not fun. Popular with Asian tours so could be really busy. I tried this place out twice, once on a very busy holiday and the second time late afternoon on an ordinary weekday which was easier to get a seat. That was enough for a laugh. You are better off go to any restaurant in there or any other shopping mall, after all restaurants in Thailand is relatively cheap anyway.

Highly recommended . Personal opinion, this is the best shopping mall Modern design, special concept, clear directionsCovers from affordable fashion to branded stuff Plenty options of food tooIf you are not the type of conquering shopping malls, but still wanna buy some local fashionThis is definitely the place

Shop and eat. This one big mall. A lot of shops. a Lot of choice but most important part: go directly to the food floor. It´s Huge. Its clean. It smells very nice and you have chances to choose diferent styles of thai food. If you are near by dont miss

Gorgeous mall. Great food court. Unique shops.. Situated right next to Asok BTS station, Terminal 21 is easily accessible. The mall has a nice "airport and global cities" theme and is very well maintained.The shops there sell items that are more unique. You probably won't find those that are "mass produced" and found all over night markets/Patrunam market/ Platinum mall and so they are priced higher.Despite that, it is still worth a visit even for budget travellers. The food court named "Pier 21" offers great variety at very affordable prices in a comfortable environment. (The vegetarian food is pretty good)There's a "Gourmet Market" at the basement if you need to get your groceries.

Good concept mall. Love the concept and the washrooms of the mall. However, things were pretty pricey there but with many variety of food at the restaurants and food court. However, the food court required you to buy some card for payment, which made me lost my appetite. ..
great food. I love going to this place. loads of restaurants to choose from along with a very cheap food court. very good cinema with half price tickets every wednesday

Well designed mall. We are staying just up the road from this mall at Red Planet, so we generally come here to eat. There is a great choice, and all relatively cheap. The upper food court on the top level is more up market, but my favorite so far is Santa Fe on the lower food court. Of interest also is a Daiso where most everything sells for Bt60 ($2). The building itself is beautifully designed, with an escalator at the entrance heading directly up to the 4th floor. The whole place is open and spacious so you never feel closed in. The restrooms are another feature, totally clean and designer, every floor is different, but all the toilet seats are fitted with electronically controlled squirters and dryers.You can take the Sky train to Asoke Station, and the skywalk exit will take you in at the second level. However if you enter from street level you will be personally saluted by the captain in a shiny white uniform.

Nice Shopping Mall. A good shopping Mall, which is good for shopping (prices are a little higher) and a huge food point at the top floor. Easily accessible through Metro Train. Very beautiful from inside but not much impressive from the outside

The best value quality food court in Bangkok?. The mall is wonderfully themed on each floor. Our family does not shop here but we discovered that the food court on the 5th floor is fantastic quality and relatively inexpensive. It's worth stopping at Asoke BTS station just to eat here.

Fun place and good eat. One can get to this shopping mall via the sky train. Get off at Asoke Station and the exit leads to the Terminal 21 Mall. Each floor is named by a place in the world. It is like going to an airport terminal. There are many shops, some with interesting and creative items. The food court on the upper level has many interesting and delicious items to eat cheaply. The environment is clean. Each floor has nice and clean restroom. Most of bidet. I have been to this food court numerous times and always enjoy it. As for shopping, I can get items cheaper in the US but it is still fun to browse for items that I cannot get in the US.

Interesting Concept. Each of the floor is themed on a city and it would really remind you of the city if you have been there. The classic part is that tight up to the washroom everything on the floor is designed as per that city. Amazing restaurants. Must See in Bangok.
Less crowded mall. The mall is reasonably less crowded. There is one again plenty of shops to choose from. But if you're from outside Thailand, you're probably used to all the brands available here.

Lose yourself here. you can SHOP SHOP SHOP at terminal 21. The themes of the floors are different places so you will find Istanbul and San Fransisco under the same roof. Very aesthetic. Great food and some amazing shopping choices especially costume jewellery.

Nice shopping mall to be seen. Saying that this shopping mall is amazing or must see in Bgk I'll say no!!! It's nice 'cos every floor is 'city theme' floor, resembling Rome, Paris, London, Tokyo,...The food court food is not good (5th floor) and shops are just international brands' stores, although they have pretty nice small boutiques.

Multi City view Mall. Terminal 21 as its name says... Its made on the theme of an airport and various famous cities of the world like Tokyo, Rome, Paris, San Fancisco etc. Every floor is themed like a specific city and its worth roaming and having the feeling of that city. Infact most interesting is even the washrooms are designed with the glimpse of that city. Apart from this they have huge numbers of loacl as well as international cuisine eateries. Its also a good place to shop as the goods like apparels, shoes, accessories etc are at nice proces or there is always some or the other kind of sale going on. Another attraction is they have one of the longest escalators which connect to multiple floors of the mall. This mall is very easily reachable via MRT Sukhumvit Station or BTS Asoke station. Unlike other usual malls, you wont even realise how time passes by and how much more you have yet to explore at Terminal 21.

Wonderful theme and great restaurants. Was highly impressed to see different themes on each floor with nicely co-coordinated bathrooms.Was there with a friend for dinner and movies. Great selection of restaurants and a huge food court. Lots of options to buy trendy clothes by local Thai designers as well. Easily accessible by the underground or sky train

Only mall worth visiting in Bangkok!. This is a MUST SEE. In Bangkok. Each floor decorated as a different city, so you " travel" from Rome, London. Istanbul, to Holiwood. Even the toilets follow the concept on each floor. The shops are very inexpensive and many local, and great, designers can be found here!

Great themed shopping centre. Loved this shopping centre on our visit to Bangkok and loved how each floor was themed right down to the toilets (of course we visited these on every floor). The themes are around Britain, San Francisco, Turkey, Japan etc.Bought a beautiful handbag from Hob Shop on the Turkish level (who have now moved to Siam Centre and who kindly reopened the shop here after it had closed for us to buy) as well as having an amazing cheesecake (sorry can't remember what food station it was from).Would definitely visit here again next time I am in Bangkok.

Pretty mall. All the various floors are themed on major cities, but there's nothing to correspond with the theme. Yet, a different concept. Lots of sales happening on the ground floor. My husband found a very comfy pair of shoes at the Camel store on the ground floor. And for me, there was just TOO many stores to choose from. Very pretty shop of random things right next to Boots on the lower ground floor. I found some very pretty small little kettle shaped pots at the store. Nice food court too. Would visit again!

AMAZING SHOPPING. The concept of the mall, whatever, I'm not a big fan of the mall but this place is one of my favourite shopping area in BKK. Lots of cute shop on 3rd floor with good quality, shoes, clothes, bags etc. I almost feel like I only have to come here once instead of going to Platinum, MBK, Centralworld etc.

Beautiful mall with good restaurants.. We like the restaurants and the food court. The mall is clean and beautiful, but expensive. The restaurants and the court are excellent. The location is great at the exchange of the two main metro lines.
Great toilet. Go there and get inside each and every restroom on each floor. Amazing decor!!!!! We especialy loved the shops on the japan floor...

Gimmicky. Interesting but gimmicky concept of trying to theme each floor to a major city, but the shops on each level largely do not fit the theme, and are just a mix and mash of over-priced clothes and accessories (by Bangkok standards of course).There's a fairly large spacious food court and a decent array of restaurants spread across the mall, but most are located at the higher floors. The mall is connected to the Asok BTS station, making it quite accessible.Additional tips! (1) If you're looking for a good, clean spa, I would highly recommend Lavana Spa, situated along an alley opposite Terminal 21 (No. 4 Soi Sukhumvit 12). My wife and I have been there a few times since our first visit in 2011, and always leave satisfied. (2) Want a better Japanese restaurant than what is available at Terminal 2? Head to Kisso Japanese Restaurant at the Westin Grand Sukhumvit, for a delicious Japanese meal! :)

Big and interesting decor. A lot of international brands e.g. Victoria Secret, H&M, Boots, etc but things are generally not cheap. I bet this is a high class mall in Bangkok. Apart from the different themes for each level, which could give a bit of photo taking opportunities, there aren't a lot for me to shop. The toilets are huge although the cleanliness can be further improved.

Didn't shop, but the food court is amazing!. Didn't shop here, went straight to the 5th floor for the food court. You go to the counter at the entrance and put money on a card so all the food vendors don't have to handle cash. 300-400 baht should be plenty for a couple meals. Then, go and get lost trying to decide what food you want. Not too much English spoken, but just point to something and know you may be a little surprised by what you get. But it is all delicious! Nice tables to sit at and everything is extremely affordable. Most meals are 30-40 baht.

Nice theme & toilet. Each floor has each different country theme include toilet. You may visit their toilet at different floor. Not much choice for me to shop , but enjoyed of the decoration & high tea around.

Food Court, a wide variety. I tend to agree to other reviewers that T 21 is not for local Thai shopping. Nevertheless, it is a great place for a wide selection of food, reasonably cheap too in the food court ! Especially when you want to get some light snacks/lunch/dinner ! Mind you, it tends to get quite crowded after 6.30pm, try to grab a table first before getting your food ! Good and clean environment as well....

Not one to visit if you want to experience thai culture. Terminal 21 was nice. Nice flash stores, american brands, european brands and a few thai brands. However, nothing we havent seen in other countries. If you want cheap thai shopping, with the wonderful thai clothes, colourful cheap cheap clothes than don't go to terminal 21, MBK is the mall for you.

Cool Concept!. We love this new mall's unique concept as well as the variety of stores, restaurants and services it provides. Also the location is an excellent start point if you want to walk the streets of Sukhumvit.

Very attractive mall. Terminal 21 is one the most attractive shopping malls in Bangkok that have more than 600 shops, Cinemas , tens of the fine restaurants , supermarket and food court.
You can find almost everything in this shopping mall.

Nice mall. This mall is about 7-8 story bldg.
As name suggests, every floor has been assigned an international airport terminal.
Like London, Paris etc.
Pricing at this mall is very high.
But you can visit here to just hang around.
On each floor, there are different kind of statutes to have photograph with.
Fantasic food and shopping mall!. We went to the food court basically everyday! The food is nice and cheap. You can get all transitional Thai food here. Also, there is a theme every floor!

Nice concept. Every floor is conceptualized to mimic one of the great fashion cities of the world. Even the restrooms on every floor are differently decorated. Worth a visit just to check out this unique idea. You might even find some good deals on clothes along the way.

What a disappointment. My wife and I were so disappointed by this place. It is just another rather ordinary shopping mall. My advice would be to visit if you happen to be passing but don't bother otherwise.
superb. i found this mall one of the most innovators of all, simply great to see the look of it and various brands are available too. had gone in June, July 2013.

Fantastic shopping and food all in the one big spot.. Drop the wife/Girlfriend off for the day and catch up with her for lunch/dinner. A full floor eatery with a large cross section of food for everyone to enjoy.shop to you drop people there is something for everyone here from all over the world. No cheap imitations here but plenty of good bargins to be found for a smart shopper.

Good and cheap food.. Was in Bangkok for a few days. Visited Terminal 21 quite a few times during my stay, not because I am a shopping fan, but because in the top floor there is a nice area with a number of small joints providing cheap and tasty food. Prices range from 20 to 50 baht per dish, so for a couple of bucks you get a pretty filling meal.
Nice shopping under one roof. free WiFi in the mall for visiting customers was a good experience, The items available in mall were expensive.

UInique Shopping Center. This is a very beautiful, unique shopping center.The idea is that each floor is designed as a different city in the world: Paris, London, Rome, Tokyo.... the entire floor is made to look like a street in that particular city, including attractions unique to that city, ie: a piazza in Rome, a red, double story bus in London, the golden bridge in San Fransisco ect..... Not only that but each store is designed in a beautiful, unique design.It is really abseloutly beatiful just to walk around the shopping center - everything is so colorful and special....Besides some big farmiliar names like H&M, Camel Active ect, there are many unique little stores, small designers selling amazing stuff.I highly recommand a visit to this shopping Center.If you take the BTS (sky train), you get off at ASOK station right into Terminal 21

Entertaining shopping mall. We visited Terminal 21 one night to get something to eat and ended up coming back again to do some shopping and have a look around. The shopping centre is themed like an airport with each floor (about 8 or 9 I think) being a different city for example, London, Paris, Rome and Tokyo. There is a really good variety of shops and restaurants and the food court was very busy. Also very easy to get to via BTS Skytrain and right next to Soi Cowboy if you want to go and have a drink and a laugh afterwards!
Awesome. What an amazing mall! Every floor have a theme with a distinct tourist attraction from other countries. Strolling and window shopping is even enough.

Very nice venue, lots of restaurants . This place was directly across from our hotel, and was a very nice venue. There were many restaurants on the top floors, probably three floors worth of restaurants, with american, Italian, and Thai food. The floors are all labeled after different cities in the world just for fun. Small clothing shops constitute several floors of shopping. They are in a unique mix of nice mall shops blended with the size of city markets.

Very entertaining mall with a difference. . This mall is exactly what the other reviews describe. It had lots of shops to meet anyone's tastes. Same goes for food spots. Lots of options to eat. Very clean and we'll maintained. Perfect place to break during the buzz of bangkok. Be aware during peak hour traffic is a nightmare. Don't expect to get anywhere by taxi. But to your benefit you can take the sky train directly from the mall. Hotels nearby are in abundance making the mall very convenient for guests. Enjoy.

Best food court ever!!!. If you want a great selection of food choices at a tremendous value, you must come to the food court here. For about $3 US, I was able to get 2 entrees and a smoothie. Food was delicious and the smoothie was great. Keep in mind that food portions in Thailand are not as big as in the USA if you are from America, so you might want to order more than just one entree. I don't know how everyone is so skinny in Thailand. If I lived here, I'd be fat from all the good cheap food options around town.

Not as good as expected. After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor we had expected something different from this shopping experience but we're a bit disappointed. When we read that each floor was themed on various cities we had hoped to see things relevant to that city, such as dining experiences based around the location etc but apart from an occasional visual reference there wasn't much else. Yes there is a little bit more of interest than a normal shopping centre but we found MBK to have much better variety and prices. We were glad we had a look but overall we were disappointed.

A very different shopping experience. This centre has made a HUGE effort to offer something visually different.Each floor is themed for the most part, Rome, Paris, Istanbul, London etc making for great theatre, and excellent variety.Definitely worth losing yourself here for a few hours of shopping fun.Entrance & Exit are between the Asok BTS and the Sukhumvit MRT making it very easy to get to.

Impressed by the honesty!. I am staying in Bangkok for last six months and have been to Terminal 21 a no of times. But what prompted me to write this review is yesterday's incident. We were visiting this place on a usual shopping and dining trip and unfortunately my wife forgot her cell phone in one of the washrooms. To make the matters worse, she only remembered it after about two hours when we were on our way back. I called up on her no and the call was answered by a security personnel who informed me that the phone was found by a cleaning lady who handed it over to the security department. When I reached back to the mall, it took me just five minutes to retrieve my phone. Though a small incident, it speaks volumes about the administration and honesty.Thumps up guys!! Not to forget the Pier 21 food court offers delicious food at very very reasonable price! Must try..

Great shopping experience.. Always love to go to T21, there are so many small shops selling different things. Even if we strolled through stores selling tee shirts, the goods sold are so different. We always manage to get something there. It is not just the goods but the decoration of the mall is worth noting. Each floor has a theme and the lights at the Istanbul floor are just adorable. Food court on the top floor offers a variety of choices if you dont want to sit inside a restaurant. Lovely place great shopping experience

Nice and cool with a good selection in the food courts. Came here a couple of times for food as good selection. Not cheap but not expensive either - if your not sure what you want it's a good bet to come here. Lots of shops too!!

It's a Mall...enough said but go see it!. Terminal 21 in Bangkok is easy to get to right off the MRT with covered walkways...just follow the heard.Like most other reviews, yes, it's massive and yes, it's a concept mall - meaning, each floor represents a different city/culture - so to speak. The London floor, the Tokyo & the New York floor and so on. It's really a decorative thing that does make mall walking more fun but Terminal 21 is still a massive urban mall where most things can be found at typical mall prices...I saw no real deals to be had.The food stalls are pretty good, there's a wide range of eateries from all over the world, chain type of course, the cinemas on the 6th floor are well presented and clean.There's plenty of security and if you want free (NOT STARBUCKS) WiFi you have to go to the info desk, present ID, they scan it and then give you the login info...mmm...odd but whatever!If you're in town and wish to get outta the heat, Terminal 21 has all the right fixings for you.
Great shopping center. You have to see this building inside. The different floors are great. You can buy different cloth, eat different food or walk around and enjoy the builing like a museum.

international and very massive. Like any other bangkok mall this one is enormous too with floors named after different world capitals which is an interesting concept. The mall is huge and always crowded. You need good 2 days to check it all out. Eateries are also interesting.

Great place to cool down. Popped by yesterday and nice to find somewhere cold this time of year! The best shopping is on the ground and first floor where stalls are set up by the shops with all their special offers on

Good place for shopping and F&B. This place is good for shopping. You can get variety of products to buy. This mall is clean and tidy. And it is very easy to access by BTS. Besides, there are many nice foods and sweets here as well as cafe.

WOW! What a mall.. I visited this mall, looking for a memory card for my phone. The Samsung store in a lower level had them, but suggested that the prices would be better at a electronics shop on the 6th or 7th floor. They were correct, I think I only paid a couple of dollars for a 16 G card. While getting to the upper levels, we toured some of the shops on the way up. What can I say? Every imaginable shop you could think of, all clean, neat, and modern. The mall is I believe 9 stories high, and covers a good part of a city block, so there are many stores to vie for your attention. I am not a shopper by ilk, so a lot of the hoopla was wasted on me. We did spend a bit of time in the super market/food court in the lower level. Lots of offerings, at very reasonable prices. I think my brother bought several cans of beer to take back to the hotel for about 33 Bhat each.(about $ 33 cents ea US).

One of the must visit mall at Bangkok. This is our first time to Terminal 21 upon reading the various reviews online. It is definitely a worthwhile visit here. Besides the shopping experience, each levels have different theme. Love the 2nd floor-London theme, 5th floor San Francisco Pier 21 etc. The toilets at each level also following the theme. The staff at the information country, the guard at the entrance etc all of them are wearing interesting pilot, stewardess uniform. Love the food at the food court at 5th floor. So many choices to choose from. We had pork stew with rice, pad thai, mango with sticky rice, pork balls etc. All that for 150 bath only. Wish we could eat more, but we were just too full....

Themed per airport shopping centre. Doing this shopping centre a tad weird to be honest, but it sad most think you might want. It's weird in that floors are given city names like Paris, Istanbul and Rome rather than just level one, two and three. I went looking for men's aftershave but looking across six floors i couldn't find a single vendor. I personal wouldn't bother returning here in a hurry.
Western Shoppping in Thailand !!!!. Fantastic shopping center, Fantastic prices ! A far cry from Isaan !!!! Nothing more to be said except bring a big wallet !

Best mall in bangkok. Very nice mall with loads of little shops selling local brands and products. Definitely more interesting than all the other malls such as Central World selling all the same brands. The mall is well designed

Interesting mall. This 9 storey mall is interesting to look at as each floor is modeled on a city, i like the San Francisco style with their cable car as a coffee shop and the San Francisco bridge.This mall sells mostly clothing but they have a selection of great food , starting on ground floor their is a supermarket, and there are 2 other floors with a variety of restaurants including a budget eatery where you can buy a meal for 30 baht.Located here... 13.737470, 100.560154 (MRT sukhumvit)

Great Concept, well appointed mall. My visit to here was on a recommendation of a friend. It is a really well appointed theme mall, very clean with great places to eat. As far as the shopping side goes, I get what they are trying to do here, but the brands are more for the teens to 20's something market. That being said, you will probably find something for everyone. But if your looking for that specific well known brand, then stick to other parts of Bangkok.

Ok, a bit expensive. So, if you are looking forward to buy at a cheap price expensive brands, this is NOT the place. H&M is as expensive as it is in Chile. The boutique floor is actually quite interesting and I liked a lot of what I saw there, but not cheap. Also, beware of the sizes (I'm busty and small and had trouble finding original clothes that would fit me).
nice place to shop and dine. really nice hip and cool place....lots of nice food and cafes.....love the artwork and boutique shops, you can find almost anything there

Interesting Themed Mall. We went to Terminal 21's food court for lunch, you will have more choice of food and the price is reasonable and consider cheap for me if i dine in any restaurant. It is a great food court if you have no idea on what to have. The mall is build on an interesting theme, which it uses city to name the floor of the building for eg, if you go up to the particular floor, it is Paris feel. We did not have time to visit all the shop but there is some interesting one although most are the common international brand.

A well designed "themed" mall.. This mall is themed with popular travel destinations throughout all floors. The signages make you feel like you are in an airport. The fashion leans towards the younger generations and a must-see are the toilets/bathrooms on each floor which are themed accordingly to different countries.You can also apply for free wi-fi by bringing your passport to the information counter located on Level G or M. The food court is also fairly cheap compared to other malls. There is a movieplex on the top floor if you need to rest your feet after shopping.

Lots to offer. Lots to offer, but mostly clothes and such (sizes probably won't fit a westerner), but still worth a visit. Food court is upstairs and I highly recommend the thai/italian, the sushi spot and the japanese pork curry place- all were really amazing meals (if you want to get to food quickly, use the express escalator that goes immediately to 5th or 6th floor). I also love how T21 connects to the skytrain.

Great Food Court. This mall has a great food court on the top level (Pier 21). You buy your "coupons" in advance - it comes preloaded on a card which you use to pay for your food. The options are varied and plentiful and any balance is refunded to you at the end. We were a group of 5 and were amazed that we spent approx USD10 only for a very filling meal

Great place to shop and eat. This is a shopping centre with a difference. Set out on an airport terminal design with different countries for different floors. Wide range of shops and lots of smaller brands and local designers for something that is not same same. Great range of eateries and sure to have something for everyone. Catch BTS to Asok to get there.
Country wise shopping at one spot. You can find few country's replica here with lot of shops. Nice spot for roaming, shopping, taking pictures and eating.
Terminal 21 - nice place for shopping. This is a nice shopping mall with connection to Sky Train station and MRT station. we like the food court very much!

Enjoyable mall. I'm in no way a mall type person but did enjoy my shopping experience here. There are Western standard chain stores (Levi, Nike, Camel, etc.) on the bottom level but the upper level has more Thai made items. I stayed away from the western goods and shopped entirely for local made products. Pricing was reasonable but no real bargaining. The floor layout was a bit odd to me at first but didn't take long to get a feel for the floor plan. Each floor is a different city/country destination but the shops themselves have little to do with these countries. Guess it is a way of not using boring floor numbers. There is also a movie theatre, large food court and various style restaurants if you are hungry. Food court had a large variety of types of foods. Mall was very busy, as are most malls in Bangkok, but place is relatively new and has been kept very clean. Restroom was one of the cleanest public facilities I have been in while in Thailand.

Nice Shopping Mall. This mall is made on the lines of an airport & world cities.Rest all remains the same.The location is opposite Soi Cowboy & Insanity Night Club on Sukhumvit.Next to it is Gurudwara so the location is all packed into one.The highlight of the mall is the the super long escalator the food court is good too but no beer.

Unique shopping Mall. Terminal 21 is definitely a one-of-a-kind shopping mall! The mall has an airport theme, complete with false metal detectors at the entrances and boards with flight times. Each level of the mall is decorated with themes from different cities around the world including London, Tokyo, San Francisco and Paris.There are multitudes of restaurants and food stalls. The clothing stores and stalls are grouped together depending on the style you are looking for, which makes it easy to find whatever you are looking for.The mall boasts a good mixture of local and international food and clothing stores.and an entire level devoted solely to their cinema complex.Something I personally found rather interesting was the ablution facilities,The Toilets are by far the most hi-tech toilets I have seen.
Amazing. Very nice food court and family friendly. Every floor has a theme. The location is superb and convenient.
Shopping crazy place. well worth to visit the place, lot of shopping option and beautifully decorated shops, loves the food court at the lower floor, lot of fooding options and well balanced choice.

love this place. Very interesting layout and concept. I particularly like the selection of exclusive and interesting shops. We went back almost everyday and come out with bags and bags of shopping. Cost more than average tourist place but much better quality and unique design that's already worth a ton. I'm already looking for another excuse to be back!

Well worth a visit. Bangkok is full of shopping malls but terminal 21 has been designed well and is unique as each floor has got a different city and country theme on it. It is full of quirky little shops many selling clothes they have designed as well as lots of other shops.There are plenty of restaurants and a large food court selling thai food at a very cheap prices and Is always busy.

Cute concept, mid-priced modern mall. This newish mall is designed to look somewhat like an airport terminal and each of its 6 floors has a different city theme (London, Tokyo, etc.) It's fun and a favourite with young Thai shoppers including a lot of teenagers. Unlike some other Bangkok malls there are few if any really upscale stores (Gucci etc.) but there are a large number of small clothing and accessory shops. There is a good, cheap food court on the 5th floor and a supermarket in the lower floor.

Excellent shopping center, with many restaurants, food court. Our hotel was only a 5-minute walk from this excellent shopping center, and we ended up going there almost every day. There are excellent food courts and restaurants of every variety, a variety of shops, and a cinema. There is also a metro stop by the mall.

Interesting theme and some hipsterish stores (London floor). Visited the toilet of every floor (haha) some themes are nicer than other. Would say it's worth the visit if you fancy taking pictures of interior designs.
Prices are a bit steeper here but products are more on the novelty side.

Good range of shops. Great new shopping centre in Bangkok themed around an airport with different country themes on each floor. Mainly small boutique style shops. Good range of restaurants and food outlets. Easy access from BTS and MRT.

Convenient and pleasant. Not a very big mall but very lively. Nicely decorated. Clean public toilet with Japanese bidet style toilet seat.Generally mid-range brands. SuperRich money changer outside the mall (from 1st floor exit) offers better rates.

An interesting mall. Bangkok is not short of shopping malls but I rather like Terminal 21. It is one of the newer malls and has an interesting feature in that the floors are named after different cities in the world, London, Paris, Istanbul etc, and each of these floors has a feature of that particular city. For instance London has a double decker bus and an old red telephone box which seems to be a favourite photo spot for tourists. I watched a number having their photos taken there the other day. There is a wide variety of shops and the prices are not too high. There are also a wide choice of restaurants and snack bars. I had a good Portuguese style chicken in Pili Pili Chicken the other day and there are many more to choose spread over all the floors with probably the most on the 5th floor. There are also cinemas and the mall has the advantage of being next to the Sukhumvit subway and the Asok skytrain stations.
Good mall with affordable price shopping. Me and my friend had lunch there and she bought a leather purse at Terminal 21, goods with reasonable price.

Day or night - just right.... Terminal 21 opened a couple of years ago and quite quickly became the meeting hub for people of all ages. It has a world class Cinema Complex at local prices, an exceptional food court, a myriad of mid level restaurants and the cleanest, most modern restrooms in the Kingdom.Whether it is for coffee, brunch, lunch, a casual dinner or endless shopping, Terminal 21 will generally satisfy.It has some restaurants that try to be high end and fail - I think they could be replaced with a cornerstone establishment or two catering to the dinner crowd but able to offer all day places for business meetings with a bistro feel. I say this because it has some great views from the upper levels that most visitors never see.It has a good range of mid level shops for mid level budgets. It does not try to be another high end emporium, nor should it.I suppose I come here three or five times a week when I am in town, sometimes more. You will enjoy it as a place to just 'get away'.

Terminal 21 should be actually renamed as Terminal Infinity. It is a fantastic place to visit, you get everything there. Idea of naming every floor with different country-city name is simply great, that shows Wholestic view for other nationals. Every floor is famous, top floor is best for delicious food to eat at affordable price, bottomest floor is best for eatable to buy and gift to nearbys.

Trendy shopping airport terminal near Asok Metro. It's trendy. Nice place to shop around. Spend hot afternoons here. Time shall just pass. On 5th floor there is a veg food stall towards the left on the second line with take away option.

Faux airport terminal with good food court. Terminal 21 is a modern shopping mall in the style of an faux airport terminal. It is very easy to reach on both the BTS (Skytrain) and MRT (Metro). It is also within walking distance of many Sukhumvit hotels, notably it is straight opposite the Shehaton Grande Sukhumvit and The Westin Sukhumvit and a few others. It has a pretty good food court on the top floor including some Thai food options such as Reflections and Swensen's, a nice icecream parlor.

Terminal 21 is actually Terminal Infinity. I enjoyed visiting Terminal 21. It is a great place to get everyting! It's closness to Asok BTS is also very helpful. Naming very floor a different Country-City name gives a flavour of efforts for satisfying mutlt-country customers. While as you get a goof deal at every floor, at top floor, you can eat best food at very good price & bottemest floor allows you to buy eatables to carry it to your home or country.

Terminal 21 bkk nice to look for multiple country shops. Good mall to visit for shops for multiple country floor wise......terminal 21 is place you can spend lot of time doing window shopping & variety of food to taste according to different countries...

Great shopping and great international food. During my stay in Bangkok we ended up at Terminal 21 twice, to get out of the heat of the afternoon. Terminal 21 is a great place to shop or even just walk around and sight see. It's a really beautiful mall, although the prices are obviously higher than what you would find in a night market. Each floor is stylized like a different country or city. I ate at two different restaurants at the top of the mall, and each one had great service and excellent food.

Always staying nearby here. This mall is one of my favourite malls in bkk. The trendy shops and the theme floors are a great idea. Its more of a teenager mall. The pier 21 food court is fantastic. The food prices there are serious cheap to bkk food court standards. I always stay at the Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit (FANTASTIC HOTEL) which is only a 5 min walk from the mall.

Ummmm....Wow!!!. This the mall of an American kid's dreams! My kid went nuts in this 8 story mall and his credit card was smoking by the time we left! This mall has a few mainstream brand stores, but tons and tons of off brand, mom and pop shops with plenty of cool merchandise to peruse through. We spent most of our time on the Men's floor and walked out with two Japanese silk jackets with dragons and phoenixes on the back, some crazy print shoes, Magic decks, wacky tshirts and a pair of leather sandals for me. We enjoyed chocolate banana shakes and had korean bbq on one of the upper floors of the mall. We tried to get into the really busy locals bbq joint, but the hostess was extremely rude and the locals rudely pushed past us to get their reservation numbers. The one we did get into was great - steak and seafood on the grill in the table! (Think it was near the American restaurant). The locals there kept watching us and giggling because we were struggling with our food (lots of unknown condiments like kimchi and pickled eggs) and how to effectively handle 1/2lb. metal chopsticks without continually dropping them on the table and plates. The bottom floor was also all about food and had some very interesting restaurants - hot pots, teppanyaki, sushi - it all looked delicious.

whats wrong with customer service ?. I ask for italian restaurant but she answer me back with kind of bad voice and after that finished my lunch meeting i walk to M floor with my co-workers and i saw a guy asking that customer service she answer that guy with bad face !!

Large vertical mall with options. Another shopping haven in Bangkok. It is easy to access with plenty of large city themed areas by level. It has an area to play video games and a movie theatre. If you need help with phone service, go to the sixth floor.

A quick trip around the world: Terminal 21 for great shopping and food.. Terminal 21 is a great place to cool off and take quick inexpensive trips to many Western and exotic places like San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge, France, United Kingdom and Japan just to name a few. The huge shopping mall is organized like an airplane terminal.Each floor is a different world destination as were the bathrooms. Every bathroom had a different motif, and many tourist including myself were taking pictures of the beautifully decorated and staffed bathrooms. It was so much fun going from floor to floor following the Chinese tourist taking photos of the bathroom. Each one was even more interesting then the last. after doing the bathroom run, we started at the top floor and worked our way down. They even have a movie theater in the mall. Some of the more interesting floors were San Francisco, London, China etc. They have a small replica of the Golden Gate Bridge spanning the center of the mall. You can take a great photo across the mall. Each floor had wonderful modern products and countless restaurants from all over the world. If you want a break from the spicy Thai food you will pleased to know that there were many chain food restaurants to select from. Terminal 21 is a must when visiting Bangkok.
Just for a walk. Nice mall to visit, has themed floors based on different cities . Saw the crowd indluge in window shopping than actual purchases. Picked up some stuff from Jaspals.

Just amazing inside!. Just amazing. The centre specialises in Thai brands so it is different compared to Siam Paragon and shopping centres around the world which have the usual 'standards'. I go here to eat at the food court on the top floor. Delicious and clean! People are always eating here. Acces is straight of BTS Asoke near my hotel. The restrooms are all themed and very clean.

Terminal 21. How good is Terminal 21? The most impressive is they used the airport terminal as their theme. The moment you step into Terminal 21, it is arrival and you see the destination of the shopping floors with the theme of different nations, France, UK, Japan, Turkey etc. The Golden Bridge of San Francisco is very impressive. The next is the public loo at each floor of the shopping complex, it just attracted you to make a visit to the toilets, wondering what is the decoration?. One of the family member even insist to come back to Terminal 21 when she was afar from the shopping complex for her biological business. The food court provided the Siamese food and others with many varieties. The ice cream with the steam boat deco is the most popular. The fruit deserts is appealing. It was considered as the cheapest of all food court, but with high quality environment. Overall we enjoyed the shopping in Terminal 21, it is great experience for our family.

Unique shopping experience in Bangkok.. In addition to interesting shops, terminal 21 is great to offer free wifi to foreigners, which is very rare in Bangkok even if it's ubiquitous throughout the rest of Thailand. Bring your passport or some form of id. Unfortunately the network didnt allow me to complete the registration process so you have to reconnect to the servers every 10 minutes.

Big but not overwhelming. Came to this mall when I stayed in the hotel next door. This mall is big. Floor after floor of shopping and eating. There are so many stores to choose from and a huge variety of shops. The mall is also super busy but the crowd of people flow very nice throughout. I wish I could have spent more time here.

I dislike shopping but this place is cool and interesting and a must see. We went via the BTS which stops here at Asoke.The first floor is set out like an Airport with floors designed with icons from London,Rome,Istanbul,Tokyo,Bangkok,San Fransisco as well as food courts above as well as gourmet food in the basement.The toilets are designed on the London floor as the underground complete with a train and a full size bus nearby!

A Creative and Unique mall. Connected to BTS Asoke, Terminal 21 is a big mall inspired by an airport. Every floor is a different world city like London,Paris etc. Also each toilet on each floor is themed by the city it is in. The mall also has large structures like an oscar award, Lighthouse, San Fransisco Bridge. Each level is dedicated to a category like San Fransisco for food. The mall also has a very long escalator that goes up to 4 floors. Overall, the whole mall is very worth visiting considering it is one of the most unique in Bangkok.

Interesting Mall. Came here to take a look of what it has to offer. A high class shopping centre. Each floors with different country scenery like Turkey, London etc. Very nice decor. Even the toilet are well decorated and each cubicle with functional bidet. I love to go to basement where they have all dessert shops there. All tasty and nice.

Fun and refreshing. Each floor has a different theme, which is followed right down to the toilets. On the London floor, toilets are designed to resemble the Tube. Lots of boutique shops and some international brands on the first floor. Visit for good food and a fun time.

What a Thai Hospitalty! A Mininature of Suvarnabhumi Airport. I had been there early Jan and this place looks like a mini Suvarnabhumi Airport with many gates resembled gates at the airports taking you to different floor and different types of malls and shops. You can find many things here from souvenirs, brand fashions, bycicle and biking gear shops. I am especially interested in the fruit and vegetables stores in the basement / ground floor where you can find a lots of Thai fresh fruits like mango, jack-fruits, grapes, durian.. All are tasty and really cheap. I have bought a lots of fruit candies back to home. Great great

the mall thing. if you are into walking around a mall for shopping, grab something to eat, coffee or watch a movie the Terminal 21 will give you your fix. there are bigger & better malls in Bangkok and further away to the very touristy NANA area

Interesting mall, boutique shops.. Of the 15+ malls and counting in Bangkok CBD, this is one you might want to visit. It is easily accessible by BTS train. Get off at Asok station and walk right into the mall from the platform, exit 1. If taking the subway, you can take exit 3 and also walk right into the mall. The mall is themed after airport jargon. Escalators called gates, etc. The floors are all themed and decorated after world cities. The basement has a Caribbean and beach theme. The ground floor is Rome, mezzanine is Paris, then Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco, 2 floors, and the top is Hollywood, with sculptures and Oscar statutes. The cinema is located here. The 2 San Francisco floors are all restaurants and food court. More restaurants in the basement floor also, along with a gourmet supermarket. The rest of the floors feature small boutique shops selling all interesting items. The walkways again named after streets in those cities. It is one of the better laid out malls with lots of interesting artifacts and sights of the different cities. Upon entering you can take one of the longest escalators in the world. I believe it goes up 4 floors. Worth visiting.

Special mall to visit . I didn't do top much shopping over there but it's quite nice to just look around. They have different themes in each levels and toilets. Clean and organized. They have special offers for tourists too. Do ask it from the service counter.
A little different. This mall is a little different than most other malls as it is made of a lot of little stores. You will find more interesting/unique pieces of clothing here.

unique mall with theme from different country. this is the best spot to take your instagram picture to next level. many unique spot to take picture. also at the lower level they had taekonoi land. which sell more cheaper than big c in siam

Fun place to visit. Terminal 21 is a shopping Mall with a distinctly different feel. On each floor there are products and icons from around the world. There is a Tokyo floor, a London floor and so on and the loos are definitely worth a visit with their themed decor. I spent ages there, although I didn't actually buy anything.

Great photo ops. Super helpful information counter. Beb from the information counter is not only stunning in her gold cheongsam she's most helpful and friendly too ! Great place for photo ops. Shops stocked some of the most interesting items from clothes to knick knacks

Shopping at its best. The shopping at Terminal 21 is outstanding for bargains like Levis. from the actual shop.
And the food court is yum and cheap as . And it is so easy to find. at Asok BTS station.

Must visit Mall in Bangkok. Please don't miss this mall.
London, Paris, Rome, SFO, Istanbul theme based floors.
Well connected through BTS. Get down at BTS Asok station.
Washrooms are a must see. You will see travelers clicking photos inside the loos. :)
There are many brands and shops and gourmet options available.
I liked london and rome the best.
feel like in airport. the interior design of the place is perfect. I like each corner . v.clean place to go in Bangkok . The best Bathroom ever.
Great shopping experience. Loved the concept, and the shopping experience. If you are looking for one place for some of the major brands and other regional brands, this is the place for you!!

A very nice mall. Been here several times, enjoyed each time :)Seen a bunch of cafes in the mall, bought some electronic gadgets, too. Pretty nice quality, pretty cheap prices.The mall's got 9 levels, each and every one of them is decorated in a unique way, which is awesome :)Also, Terminal 21 has lots - lots! - of cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, fashion boutiques, and the like, shoppers' paradise, no less. :)It is located on Sukhumvit Road, the closest BTS station is 'Asok', which is only 1 minute away from the mall, so the Asok intersection is nearby, too.The nearest MRT station is 'Sukhumvit'.The mall is open daily from 10am til 10pm.If you're in Bangkok and looking for shopping, then the mall's definitely the place you should visit, will not be disappointed.

Themed shopping mall! . The best thing about the mall is the food court. Lots of options , right from food stalls to fine dining. Lots of small details to take a photos. Also got the gourmet market where u can indulge in international ingredients shopping. Though the price is higher range , u can still look for few gems!

Just average. The mall has a theme. Quite exciting but not much to do there. The mall connected with BTS so it's easy to reach. The only thing I love much is the food ! It's cheap and delicious. Never had a cheap meal yet delicious like here. Will be back for the food. I ate rice with pork and duck. Soooo yummy !

Great for shopping. I absolutely loved this place. It can get a little bit overwhelming though, because it's so big. And I wasn't able to see all of it. I would definitely recommend blocking out a full day to see the whole thing, because there are so many hidden gems in this mall.If you're looking to shop in Bangkok, this is the place to go.

Cool design. I like the design idea of this mall, ie, each floor designated for one theme only. From the main entrance, it made you feel like you are really in an airport terminal, but when you go to other floors, you will feel like in another world. The most interesting place in this mall would be their toilets ! Every toilets has different design and very clean.

Average shopping mall. For being a new Bangkok shopping mall it's average. The foodcourt is excellent and one of the best in Bangkok. It also have very low prices. Some nice restaurant and coffee shops in the mall also. But nearly all the small shops are boring and most of them just have tourist things for an expensive price. Not at all like the other big shopping malls in this city
Best mall in Bangkok. To me this is the best mall in Bangkok. The themed floors make it stand out form the rest. Easy to navigate around.
Lovely place. great place to visit for shopping and eating. It has themed levels for different countries! Loved the toilets in here,with there amazing hot seats and remote controls!!!!
a variety of varieties!. a must go to walk around and see all sorts of things they sell there. from affordable to sky high prices.very interesting interior.

"Travel around the world" in a building interior. This was my first time visiting Terminal 21 alone, so I had my own time admiring the interior. This mall was just beside BTS Asok and could also be reached by MRT (Sukhumvit). At every escalators, there were signages which were usually found in airports - "Departure to" and "Arrival at". Every floors had their own themes, which were (as far as I could remember) : Paris, Tokyo, Rome, London, Caribbean, San Fransisco, Hollywood, and Istanbul. The interiors were decorated on each particular theme, and moreover, I really enjoyed the...TOILETS! Yes, the toilets! They were modern, high-tech, clean & of course, unique, based on the themes. The one that I really liked was on top floor - Hollywood theme. When I walked down the aisle to the toilet, I noticed that I seemed to be walking on a red carpet & then I noticed pictures of lots of people "taking photos of me". Camera flashes could be seen a lot. Felt like a celebrity on red carpet :DI liked unique sketch pencils, leather goods and cute scarves. They're all provided in this mall and not standard ones nor "standard branded" ones. All were sold in reasonable prices, although some seemed to be overpriced. In the end, I knew that most of the goods sold there were local products, but they could present very well. The international brands were mostly on G(round) Floor & M(ezzanine) Floor. 1st till 3rd floor were the floor I talked about previously, 4th & 5th gloor were culinary floors, while basement for tidbits - supermarket & the top floor for cinema (that's why the theme was Hollywood).
:-). Really like it! Can shop for different style from different cities of the world! And also have 2 floors of food court! Have a big variety of choice...
Thailand 2015. Interesting mall not far from the hotel. 9 floors of shopping with each floor set in a different décor depicting a different city from around the world - Rome, Paris, London, etc

Very interesting interior. We went a couple of times to this very chic and cosy shopping mall mainly because it was very close to the intersection of the BTS and MRT (BTS station Asok).There are plenty shops, a cinema, a Gourmet Market, banks and a large number of coffe-shops and reataurants. All floors are thematically arranged, focusing on different world cities - the basement level has a Caribbean theme; the ground level brings you to ancient Rome; the M level re-creates Paris and Champs-Elysees; on the 1 st floor you will land in Tokyo; on the 2nd floor you will pass through London; on the 3rd floor you will discover Istanbul; then you will finish with exploring San Francisco on the 4th and 5th floors.The extensive food court is on the 5th floor and is called Pier21.And now about the thing largely mentioned in the other reviews - the restrooms. Perfectly clean, as in many of the other malls we have explored in Bangkok, but very interesting and settled according to the city they represent on the given floor. Just amazing, there were many people making selfies in the toilets! The shops and brands on each floor are oriented to the city of the floor - not so many world-famous and expensive like in the Siam malls. In my opinion, it is worth a visit!

Food for everyone. I went here several times and mainly to the upper floor where you put money on a card and stroll around the different cooks who will make the food for you in a second. All thai food of course but great. You cant go wrong, yes there is vegetarian but thats not for me. Mainly the meals are 40 to 50 baht and a drink up to 30 baht. Excellent food! There are many places like this, Tesco and Big C are also like this, all with cards.

The Food Hall desk clerk can't understand and speak English. We tried to find some vegetarian food in Food Hall. But the desk clerk can't not understand and answer our simple question. At last, we ate expensive pasta at other floor by looking around with the English menu of almost every restaurant.
Good food with good prices. The food is good and the price is like the normal local price. You should try the Thai coffee and Thai tea. too

Lots of Fun. I find it interesting that the first two reviews I read are about the toilets as that was my first experience with this Mall (third floor Turkish ones are cool). Beyond that, this mall was just completed as I was leaving Bangkok after living there for three years, thus I was happy I got to finally visit when I recently returned to the city. It is set up with differently themed floors, but all in relation to cities and transportation and travel. The third floor was by far my favorite with its plethora of little boutiques selling knickknacks and the like (NO SLEEP SHEEP). The ground floor and the lower ground all have mainstream shops and food. Floors 1 and 2 are clothing, women's and men's respectively. 4 and 5 are food and the 6th is the movie theater and entrance to the Fitness First. I spent several hours there are on my own and had fun just window shopping....

interesting toilets. shop choices were not bad... lots of shops and quite a number of restaurants at the food court. most interesting thing will be their toilets, for you to find out! (floor-by-floor)

Terminal 21 Toilets...more than just a "comfort zone".. One of the common dissatisfaction we experience in going to malls particularly in some countries we have visited is the restroom. Fortunately, Terminal 21 did not fail us but even gave us more than the unexpected. Yes, the place is not just a fashion and food haven but it is where the best “comfort zone” can be found ever in Bangkok.. The facility is clean, spacious, overflowing hand sanitizer and sanitary tissue, hand driers and friendly housekeepers. But what makes this part of the mall unique is the themed toilet in every floor. Such as the Caribbean designed restroom at the lower ground floor; the spirited colors and featured drawings of Caribbean touch really attract travelers including us. To our delight, we did toilet hopping, of course not to answer natures call but to take selfie photos with our newly bought monopod. Who cares? After all, Terminal 21 toilets are not only for discomforts but it is also where you and friends can spell the word f-u-n. Whoever created this idea, I salute you, you got brilliant minds.

Most useful and modern mall in Thai capital.. Easy to get and to walk about. Good quality Thai brands (cosmetics and wear). The tasty eateries all around the mall. Don't miss the food court at ground floor!

A fun shopping experience. definitely one of the more unique malls I've been in, it's a fun place to go and escape the Thai heat. There are many restaurants as well as places to shop, but my favorite part is actually the bathrooms. Each floor's has a different theme, and I haven't seen nicer toilets in Thailand!

Superb Place. Terminal 21 certainly lives up to its name either each different floor being represented by another place around the world, brilliant. In one shopping trip I managed to go to exotic places like Paris, Hollywood, Tokyo and the lists goes on. Was looking for an underwater camera but strangely enough only one camera shop in the entire place and pretty expensive. Some great shops though and some amazing places to eat. Well worth a visit!
Nice Mall. It is a very nice vibrant mall, has lot of restaurants. At level 5 the Food court is very Nice and Clean.

Impressive Themes. Refreshing Themes with every level of the building comes with a representation of a country style entered by a gantry. LG Floor – CaribbeanG Floor – RomeM Floor – Paris1st Floor – Tokyo2nd Floor – London3rd Floor – Istanbul4th Floor – San Francisco (City)5th Floor – San Francisco (Pier)6th Floor – Hollywoodwith the top floors having Movie Threatres and a large food court. Popular Eateries like coco ichibanya, MK are all there. You just never get hungry.More picture available here http://www.umakemehungry.com/2015/01/terminal-21.html

Amazing. This place is AMAZING!!! The theme on every floor is simply genius. I love it. Rome, Caribbean, Paris and many more. And the view from the food court is also something that is WOAH!!! They have so many good stores and various restaurants that I really like. To summarize this, I would say that this is a must on your "places to go to" checklist! I'm sincerely, it's the best

Very nice shopping mall!. Lots of restaurants to choose from Japanese, Thai and Western food. The food at the foodcourt is quite cheap. I took a lot of pictures with my friends at several photo spots.

Fantastic place for original Thai designs. This mall has everything u need if u want to buy original Thai local designers and some International brands for the change. It also has a great supermarket downstairs which from which u can stick up on any missed items, delicious fruits and and grocery items u need.The mall is designed amazingly well and the quirky theme throughout is really cool. Loved loved loved this mall!

Every day some new building. I have been to thailand many many times 3 times per year,and have seen this building getting built From the ground up.this is a must see for shopping food and for just the way the building has been built The themes are from all around the world ,You can eat for 100 baht to what ever,very clean ,movies theatres ,clothing ,There is restaurant blue spice I think we went back on a Sunday for s'mores board and I don't think They like me back ,as I must of ha d over a kilo off smoked salmon .plus others like prawns,cakes ect,and yet only 400 baht.Must go there don't mention me ha ha ha go to ASOK sky train station right outside.

A 21st Century Mall. This is one of the most impressive malls that I have ever been to. There is many levels to this complex on which each has a unique theme based on different countries.On one floor there is a UK theme and you can see various London based products.International malls should take note.

Terminal 21. I stay in BKK six months every year and this has become my favourite shopping mall. It is easy to access straight off BTS Asok. Each floor represents a different city; the London floor is mainly men's clothing. The shops are small, almost like a market in fact with a very interesting range of clothes at reasonable prices.On the fifth floor is the best food court in BKK. The prices are amazing, cheaper than street food and the quality is excellent. Kua gai for example is 25 baht and rad na moo 28 baht. Another must try are the delicious fruit smoothies and of course the definitive mango with sticky rice. There is a cinema on the sixth floor.The toilets are state of the art Japanese style with an array of water jets, a blow-dry and a heated seat :-)

Overrated. We made a special trip after reading that this is on some of the "must see" lists for Bangkok. The theme idea for each floor is, frankly, a bit lame if you have been to these places. Shops are pricey and uninteresting. The best part of the place is the food court at the far end of the 5th floor. Go past the restaurants tp Pier 21 food court where you need to buy a card since the food vendors do not deal with cash. You cash in your card at the end if any money left on it. The front cashier will be very busy so make your way to the back cashier who is waiting for customers. We think this food court is better than MBK as far as price and serving portions. Nice bathrooms in this shopping mall.

Different yet Great. We were here yesterday and can only concur with all the positives mentioned below. Loved the themes and our 8 yo Daughter had a ball posing with the various themes on each floor.
