As a bonus, there is even free wi-Fi in Coffee World, which I think is on the third floor - there could well be free wi-Fi elsewhere throughout the SC, but we found it there, and were comfortable with it. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

SO MUCH To See and Eat. You need a full day or Two to see all there is here... SOOO Much Food, you could spend a month eating here, and Great shopping of quality items. Loved the Shopping Themed Floors. Can't wait to go back when I have more time. Nearly connected to the Sheraton Grand Suhkumvit

Interesting Teenagers Haunt. Terminal 21 is interestingly named with various country themes on different floors advertising their interesting products.
It also has a foodcourt and have various floors.
You can easily reach it via Asok station.
A good photoshoot location.

An amazing mall. Its located next to the Westin and the Sheraton. There is a train station nearby! There are a lot of cabs to around the area, so no worries about your shopping.Ensure you get on a metered cab. The shopping mall is amazing with different themes. Whatever your size or your choice of colors, ladies or gents you can get it there. Price range differs from low to high. But you will definitely get something for yourself or your love ones! Eateries are available so you don't have to leave the mall to look for food!. Enjoy!
Nothing much... If you are in the nearby its OK for shopping, but rather only for eating. Shops are not that interesting/nice, and rather on the pricey side...

Terminal 21: visit many countries in a mall. A brilliant idea: create a mall where you can know different parts of the world. That's is Terminal 21. The visitor departures from one flor to another and have the opportunity to arrive in Italy, the USA, Japan, London and other places. You should also visit all the rest rooms of the mall because each one of them are unique and extremely fancy. The stores are not so expensive. Enjoy your visit! I know you won't miss this out.

Something Different. This shopping mall has countries as the theme for each floor. Each floor is laid out with smal shops of quality clothing and accessories that are different to the mass designs available at MBK. This centre is a good starting point for bargain hunters and those shopping for something different before heading to the more well known centres. The food court was clean and cheap and there are also cinemas for those who need to get away from it all.

Excellent food court. The shopping center was interesting but expansive for my taste.The food court on the other hand, was excellent. Most of the restaurant quality dishes cost around THB 45-50 each. Cheaper than other malls' food courts. Choice is amazing, with many ethnic food represented. The food court is on the top floor.

A newly Shopping Mall. The shopping mall is design like a airport terminal, selling most Thailand' s own designed brand, shirts, house hold goods, a shopping mall that not like others.The rest rooms (Toilet) in every floods, the entrance are having the difference design, e.g, Train station, zoo and etc.At top floor foods court are selling most of the local foods delicious and cheap not more than THB50 for a bowl of noodle.But is better to take a BTS or MRT to move around BKK town, now a day most of the taxi driver in Bangkok are not collect their taxi fair by meter, every time must ask for the price before you get up the taxi.

The washrooms are just amazing!!. Terminal 21 is a themed mall which each floor is given a themed of a country/place. As the name of the name 'Terminal' so the signs in the mall are similar as what in the airport terminal.What I love the most of the mall is the washrooms, the washrooms are also themed, how amazing. I love especially the washroom in 'Japan', the design is traditional and love the colours used.There are lot of small shops in each level that cater for different category/generation of customers. You can find lot of local designer brands here too with slightly higher price compared to other wholesaler mall, but those designs that you can find here might not able to find elsewhere.The food court at upper level serves amazing local foods from main course to desert, you might have problem to decide what to eat here.. haha..!! Besides that there are few café selling nice coffee and cake which is just nice for you to sit down and relax after shopping. There are cinemas at upper floor where you can see there is a huge Oscar nearby the escalator.There are free wifi in the mall where you need to show your passport to the reception in order to have the password.Overall, I love this mall. I will definitely go to this mall for food and shopping whenever I am in Bangkok.

Eat lunch from around the world in just a few steps. The visited the Century 21 Mall only because it happened to be right next to our hotel. What we discovered on the ground floor was a choice of small stalls selling a wonderful selection of food at excellent value-for-money prices. We first tried 'squid-on-a-stick' (chicken and pork were available too), followed up with a selection of wonderful Japanese seafood dishes, and ended lunch with a selection of gelato ice cream flavours. A true trip around the world in the space of just a few steps.

A little bit different. This shopping mall is relatively new and a little bit different from all the other large shopping malls in Bangkok in that it is themed as an airport terminal. Conveniently situated on Sukhumvit Road, you can access it via the Asok BTS station at a higher level as well as the main entrance at ground level. The information staff are dressed as air stewardesses. Each escalator has a destination plaque for the next floor. Each individual floor is representing a city, London, Tokyo, San Francisco, Istanbul. Check out the toilets on each floor too! On the London floor there is a London bus and a metro car which are made into small shops. San Francisco has the golden gate bridge spanning the area. Istanbul has lovely lighting and Tokyo has Japanese lanterns and typical architecture. The basement holds a food court with loads of options, the top floor has a cinema with the latest reclining seats. There is also a small IT shopping area next to the cinema.Overall, lots of eating places, many interesting shops, plenty to see on each floor. All air conditioned, this makes a great place to spend time, shopping, having a meal, taking in the latest film. Well worth a visit.

A Fun Shopping Experience. This is a very enjoyable shopping centre which is a little quirky in so much that it is themed as an airport terminal which each floor being representative of a different part of the world. You can for example buy clothes in London, eat in San Francisco for lunch and then head to the middle east for coffee. Even the toilets on each level are themed which is quite an experience! The shopping centre is large, clean, bright and consists of a large number and variety of shops from retailers such as H&M to smaller clothing stores, well known western eateries together with a good selection of Thai food. There is something for everyone in Terminal 21 including a cinema complex. For a good fun shopping experience I recommend this complex.

Go for the Food. Start in the basement food court. Then, if you've still got the appetite, proceed to the upper floors. Although there is a strange over concentration in Japanese food, don't let that stop you from using this mall as a fun way to sample some great eateries at a reasonable price.Check out the extremely clean toilets with bidet cleansing and warm air drying fans under the toilet seats and then wonder why you haven't already installed one in your own home.

Shopers paradise. Have just been to terminal 21 shopping mall with my wife.I guess if you like shopping this is the place for you,theres even a cinama on the top floor.As you can guess from the name the building is based on an airport terminal.Every floor is based on a famous city in the world.On the london floor theres even a red london double decker bus which is converted into little mini shops.even the girls at the information desk are dressed up like air hosstess's.If you like shoping this is the place for you,get off at 'ASOKE' skytrain station.

I like this place- cool. Cheap. Concenient. In Bankgkok's hot weather, i was very happy to find this cool place. Actually it is similar to other shopping mall. Modern, Big, Convenient. I like it. And especially i was content to underground food court. There are various kind of food. And i bought Mango smoothie in there everyday. It is awesome. And all restaurant seems clean and neat.  I like that place. Sometime when you are tired and dont wanna find the place to eat, Terminal21 is fast and convenient choice.

fancy theme shopping mall. when im going to Bangkok i always going to Terminal 21. i love the theme. cool places to hang out and find food. near to BTS train station. free wifi. and you can find stuff to buy. recommended this shopping mall!

Terminal 21 - great shopping mall - terrible service. I have visited Terminal 21 shopping mall in Bangkok (Asok BTS station) on several occasions and it's a very nice high-rise mall with many interesting small shops.However, the service in 80% of the shops is terrible. Sales people are texting and watching movies on smartphones and iPads and you feel like an annoyance if you walk in. It's like... can you not see I'm busy texting my friend or do not interrupt my movie? Many sales people don't even look up if you walk in... they continue texting. It's extremely inpolite and very uncomfortable to be there. I do not take visitors with me to Terminal 21 anymore because it gives a negative impression of Thailand with it's lousy service and no smiling store employees.Sometimes I wonder... don't the mall's leadership team ever walk around? And if so, don't they see how bad it is? Tell ALL sales people - ABSOLUTELY NO TEXTING OR MOVIE WATCHING while working. MUST look at customers, smile and help!The only stores that provid decent service is all American brands with trained employee like the recently opened Victoria Secret. Wow what a difference!

Great Shopping Mall. If you are tired with the glitzy large shopping malls around Siam, then head over to Terminal 21 on the Skytrain to Asoke station for a different shopping experience.The mall is located over several floors with each floor representing a different city around the world with decoration to suit. There are a number of branded shops but also a lot of independent Thai shops selling Thai designers goods. It's a lot more relaxing than the large malls.Also located on one of the upper floors behind the Golden Gate Bridge is a hawker stand designed food hall, which has great local food at cheap prices. All you do is buy a card with whatever Baht you want to add to it and seek your favourite Thai dishes and drinks. At the end, if there is any Baht left just return to the cashiers and get your money back.

A Tour Around the World. After going to Night Markets and Bazaars, my brother said that going to Terminal 21 Shopping Mall is a must. It is a six-storey shopping center where different floors have different themes.Each floor is patterned to different countries. Like their top floor (cinema), they have designed it as Hollywood. Some floors were decorated like you went to England, Japan, Istanbul, San Francisco, and a lot more.We did a little shopping since stores there were a bit pricey compared to Night Markets and Bazaars. We did a lot of picture taking though.Unfortunately, we didn't go to their restrooms because according to my brother, they also decorated it by different countries.
Beautifull mall. Looks great, nice to visit. European prices, near to sukhumvit station. It's funny to see details of different cities frim all over the world.

A little different from most Bangkok malls. Terminal 21 is a little different from most Bangkok malls for several reasons. Firstly it is designed a bit like an airport with each floor being a different famous world city. Secondly while there are many well known shops and chains there are also plenty of smaller shops and boutiques selling things you wouldn't necessarily find in the other 'standard' malls like Siam Paragon, Centralworld, Emporium, etc.It's certainly a interesting mall to visit with plenty of shops as well as places to eat and drink. It is easy to get to as well as it is at Asoke which is served by the BTS Skytrain and also the MRT metro.Definitely recommended as something a little different from the usual malls.
Beautiful shopping place. Very nice decoration shopping terminal. One halal restaurant available at the food court. The toilet very comfortable. Its really the best shopping with affordable price.

Very interesting mall. It's right next to Asok BST Station....The floors are assigned to one major city of the world (eg Paris, London, san Francisco, etc....) and the decor is centred around each cityHowever the goods are not. It's still a normal mall selling clothes etc. But don't expect to find french cuisine on the Paris floor or London clothes on the London floor.There are some restaurants on the upper floors which are specific to the cities (ie you do get a few American cafes)Worth the 33 baht train ride...Got a spare couple of hours...try it..Enjoy the different environment
Beautiful shopping mall. Beautiful shopping mall, build in airport style. Every floor is another capital. It is very new and not everything is ready yet.

Shopping mall with special design. This shopping mall is not a mega mall, but you can found quite a numbers of local and small shops inside. The Terminal 21 can be easily reached by both BTS(Asok station) and MRT(Sukhumvit station), in fact, just right next to both stations. When you walked inside, the interior design just like an airport. Each floor is different with own theme (country), and each floor’s toilet has a special design matches the country theme. I visited the Japan and Turkey, they are awesome.

Great family shopping mall. Each floor with different theme, Terminal 21 in Sukhumvit area is offering different experience in shopping. The staff there are friendly. I even saw a security guard at ground level try to make funny moves so that kids can be entertained and laughing. Foodcourt here (Pier 21) located on 5th floow is also very good. Try their fishball, which is very fresh. Food here is inexpensive, I even thought that it is almost the same with tje ones you will get from street. So if you fancy street food but want to have shopping mall experience, Pier 21 is the place to go.
Good shopping mall. Some excellent whole sellers here - cheaper and good prices as they are local brands.Each floor is named after a city. The third floor "London" floor is mainly men's.

Novel Concept, Unique & Vibrant Bangkok Mall. I went on a whirlwind stint at some of the world's most iconic cities - all in downtown Bangkok ... when I checked into Terminal 21. Tokyo City, London, Istanbul, San Francisco - they are all there! A lifestyle mall with robust personality. Unbeatable! (for now?)How Terminal 21's centre management orchestrates their seasonal promotion will determine how exciting or jaded the experience there will be in future.Stepping this world of mind boggling difference brings you to new levels in your shopping and dining feel. But once exposed, how can excitement and wonder be sustained - when you next visit?The arrival and departure levels (via escalators) leading to different zones peculiar to a designated international city - which resonates quite closely like parts of the real thing - ensure that one is not bored when shopping or window shopping... or just bumming around.Christmas Eve, 2014:The atrium on each level boast Yuletide scenes that reflects the culture or the "In Thing" of the iconic city it represents. For example, Tokyo City's Atrium display is titled "Snow Factory" under the Centre's theme of "Santa's Wonder Village". There are obligatory Snowmen, Bearded Elves ... and pride of place is a huge Maneki-neko (Beckoning Cat). The featured cat is white in colour - for good luck. (Black is for good health to lure away evil spirits, Gold is for monetary good fortune). The permanent Sumo Monument, shows 2 giant sumo wrestlers, strangely ramming a stone pillar between them (instead of grappling with each other). Red Tori Gates, Japanese Lanterns covering every each of the ceiling possible along corridors. They are there. This level features women's fashion.At the London City level (men's floor), there's Barnaby Street for you. And there's a red train heading for Charing Cross in London's Underground (The Tube) - its selling Jeans! And one of London's principal icons, the archetypal red rear-entrance Routemaster is parked at the London City level. Its panel shows Camden Town, Covent Garden, Bond Street routes. Istanbul, is on the 3rd floor. You can saunter down a zouk & buy gifts, jewellery, fashion accessories toys,home decor items, beauty toiletries. The Mall's main highlight, San Francisco is where food outlets thrive.... in the form of restaurants and independent operators.For food court eateries, go to Pier 21 on the 5th floor.The 6th floor houses an 8-screen cineplex. Saw "The Hobbit" on Christmas Eve night... spacious, clean, top class, fantastic screen and sound, excellent comfort. Wow!The basement, with its Gourmet Market, takeout food joints, grocery vendors, banks and bookshops, has a Caribbean theme.Rome is on the ground floor, Paris on M level takes you to the Champs-Elysees where branded fashion awaits you.Yes... Terminal 21 is nothing short of 'Wonderful' .... if only more a much more robust and obvious Christmas ambience could be evoked... it would have been "Fantastic".

Unique shops, Lots of Dining Options. Located right beside Asok station, this hip mall is quite cool. Designed as if you are "flying" to various fashion cities. Eg, Pier 21 San Francisco has all the food joints; level 2 is London with loads of cool tee-shirts outlets. One can spend hours here checking out all floors.

Good shopping mall. I love this shopping mall over other famous one like Siam Paragon, because I love shopping at different boutiques selling different styles of clothing. Some shops here also have another shops in JJ markets too. Here you can find shops with different price ranges but sure you can find something you like. Both my boyfriend and I enjoyed it. Right next to BTS station. There is a Super Rich money exchange shop in BTS station too!

Nice Location. I've been to Terminal 21 in last month. This is one of the most shopping malls that you can find lal you need here. The mall just like an airport which can give you some shopping experience.

Interesting. As mentioned in the other reviews, each floor has a different country theme and its quite interesting. However, its not really a place to shop as shops there are quite generic with big brands (H&M) so don't expect to find clothes at wholesale prices.

Nothing special.... For anyone coming from Malaysia and Singapore, I will recommend only going there once you're done with other shopping spots and attractions. I took the hassle to come here, only to find it pretty much the same as shopping malls in Malaysia, carrying the same brands like H&M, Jaspal, G2000, Esprit, all too familiar.The different concepts on each floor failed to impress me (probably just me?) and my friend, so we left within an hour. It's one hour because we spent time eating the coconut ice cream at its food court. Food court pretty much the same as in other Bangkok shopping mall.

One of my fav mall. There are some supper cool and unique shops to visit and shop there some pricey some not too expensive. And I am in love with this mall because every single floor is in another theme : there is a Japan floor, London San Francisco, Istanbul .. all with own and unique decoration .. you can find London big, red buses, turskish lanterns and streets, sakuras and geishas .. simply love it !

Great place to come when you visit Bangkok. Trerminal 21 is not a big shopping center like Central World or Siam Paragon, it's like a house of thousand shops with variety goods from ornaments, accessories to clothings, etc. I really attracted by the building decoration with unique concept of airport terminal. Each Floor will give you different experience of culture, architect and feelings of big cities all over the world. You can find a lantern street in Tokyo Fl., Bus in London Fl., Tropical decoration in Carriberian Fl., The experience on each floor was so amazing that I can't help continue discover what will be in the next floor, next corner eventhough at that time my leg hurt and got so weary to stand with my eagerness. Beside, you can find many beautiful and original goods with reasonable price here. You can even find a supermarket named Gourmet market in Carriberian Fl.. I was surprised that some of its goods have cheaper price than Big C's (of course it cannot have the same quantity and variety as Big C's). You can even buy some Thai Milk Tea here, delicious >_<

go here n shop n eat. good food selection including a thai floor via a card to purchase food system. one can also eat at restaurants by itself, is a busy mall as right at asoke BTS station. lots of locals and tourists.check it out

Love the different layouts on each level. This shopping complex has been really well done! it's also really easy to get to once you get off the BTS. It's a must see even if it's just to visit each level and feel like you're in another country, There is a good variety of shops, I found some great buys here and they have great food options available. I had Pepper Lunch for the first time here and I loved it. Staff are all nice and friendly. I had a great time here.

Tour the world here !. I really enjoyed my time spent exploring each floors in this shopping mall. Each floor is decorated with a country theme; LG floor = Caribbean,G floor = Rome, M floor = Paris, 1st floor = Tokyo, 2nd floor = London, 3rd floor = Istanbul, 4th floor & 5th = San Frans, 6th floor = Hollywood I spend a good two - three hours here checking out the cute stores. The stuffs here are slightly pricey but worth checking out. They are pretty cool and unique. Overall, highly recommending this place in BKK for tourist.

Concept Mall with Excellent Food . This mall distinguishes itself from others in Bangkok by portraying a different global city on each level. That level is fashioned on the theme of that city. Best part of the theme is the toilets. Each one is different and novel. It sounds strange to recommend but it is really fun to visit the restrooms on every level. The mall is not really for cheap or bargain shopping but there is some excellent stuff by local designers at competitive prices.The food court, Pier 21, on level 5 is probably one of the best with most reasonable prices in Bangkok.
Trendy Shops & Restaurants. Walking distance from my Hotel and on Ashoka Station. Large selection of clothes from local designers.

Good and cheap!. Terminal 21 shopping mall - very conveniently located and easy accessible by BTS Asok station. Big and has many level shopping mall. Each level is themed by different countries like London, Paris, Los Angeles, Tokyo...... . Mixture of goods and products. Affordable price. I like the most is the food court which serves most Thai local authentic food. Though comes with small portion, it is good enough because there's so many delicious choices of food to select. If you can, try all stalls. I enjoyed the most was mango sticky rice.... it has one whole mango with sticky rice costs about 70baht and half mango with sticky rice is 35baht.... of course you will go for the whole mango! The sticky rice is superb.... well cooked and tasty topping with some yellow crunchy stuff!Another place to be praised of is the toilet! It doesn't look like a toilet to me..... I thought I walked into a wrong place because the basins are unique and colourful. Big and spacious toilet. Very clean. Oh yes, the toilet bowls are equipped with many buttons for water spray, etc. I am impressed.

Amazing Complex. This was my first time to visit Terminal 21. Definitely worth a visit!The shops are excellent, well balanced assortment of stores, amazing restaurants and entertainment. The toilets is an attraction in itself :-) Spend the day!
Very nice and new shopping complex. Very nice and new shopping complex, with a lot of Restaurants. Stylish, floor to floor theme, impressive long escalator at the main entrance. I like it.

Cleverly themed shopping centre - Ingenious. This shopping centre is absolutely stunning! The Venice themed level is so beautiful, even the bathroom basins were shaped into Italian marble fountains. The London themed level of Terminal 21 hosts an impressive model of london bridge and a double decker bus, along with a clever replica of the Underground subway system (with a train model coming out of the wall!) in the bathrooms! I certainly loved the boutique shops and beautiful decor of Terminal 21, if you have time to shop around after CentralWorld in Bangkok this shopping centre shoud be on your to-visit list!

SFO to London, via Istanbul, on an Escalator. It doesn't look much from the outside, but it's huge and the architecture is marvelous from the inside.The ground floor is crowded and tacky, but things get better as you move upward. I particularly loved the Japanese and Turkish levels and the shopping there.The food court at Ground -1, has interesting and cheap local / asian / fast food, and the restaurants on a higher floor offer more expensive and "fine dining" options. For us, the food court worked great, as it was a discovery of various interesting Thai options.

Shopping centre with the theme of an airport.. Security guards dress as pilot and receptionists dress as air hostess,an airport theme.A big Shopping centre with both BTS and MRT next to it. Pier 21 food court at level 5 sell all kind of thai food with reasonable price. Good place to spend in a lazy afternoon.
Beautifulll.... Nice theme based mall....someone searching for various cities at one place...this is there destination....nicely themed ....like an airport.

Very cute. After chatting with a local, they said that Terminal 21 is a must see even if we weren't interested in shopping. The advice didn't disappoint. Each level in Terminal 21 is based on cities around the world with food & shops to match. The information desk assistants are dressed as flight attendants so you feel like you are hopping over to a different destination at each level.

Funky idea!. On a rainy day me and my boyfriend were stuck. We decided to visit terminal 21 and as a shopaholic myself I was over the moon! We had been travelling for 3 months by this time as it nearing the end of our trip - therefore we didn't have any money. However, it's still fun to walk around and look at the cool layout as each floor or level is a different country which was a really clever idea and was done really well! We ended up going to the cinema which I would definitely recommend as it's a fairly surreal experience. There are luxury cinemas around Thailand which we wanted to do but didn't but this place was quiet a bit cheaper than home!! Just make sure you get an English film! We nearly made the mistake of watching 22 Jump Street in Thai. Also you have to stand up for the national anthem which I got a bit testy over :L but was done really nicely :)

Shop 'till you drop in Bangkok. BTS Asok, must see, each floor a different country. You can pick up bargains, lots of variety, take your time and you'll find some fab things to take home - good food options too.
Great food. Lot's of restaurants of all tastes and one of the best (if not the best food court in all the malls in Bangkok). There isn't a kids play area, which is only problem (if you have kids).

happy shopping experience in Terminal 21. Terminal 21 is a delightful shopping mall, it is located in BTS Asok station. The themes are interesting and funny, it includes many famous countries and cities such as London, Rome, Tokyo, San Francisco and the idea is to bring all the visitors to different part of the world. Many chain stores are on the lower zone and featured shops occupied in upper zone and run by the domestic designer, it will give you lot of fun being there.

Why so many good reviews?. Ok, before coming to Bangkok I was looking forward to visiting terminal 21... So the first day we arrived that's where we went..... HmmmmmIt's set up like an airport, escalators with arrival and departure boards above them, arriving at London etc... Great idea, however there is something missing....Shops that you might actually want to shop in. Ok there are plenty of food shops, but remove all the food shops and there is very little left.If you or your family like souvenirs traditional Thai gifts etc then forget this place and go to MBK not too far away from T21 The themed areas are ok (just) the Golden Gate Bridge complete with toy cars stuck on top of it, now while some people find it very incredible, I found it a little tacky. There is a London bus that looks ok from a distance but up close a very poor representative of one made of plastic, a uk red style phone box but get up close and there is no phone in it its just empty. All the themed areas looked a little like that. A great idea on paper but the implementation was lacking.. Why they couldn't get an actual London bus or a uk phone box etc baffles me when clearly that is the whole idea of the design of the place. Costing millions and millions to build why stop at the final decoration stage?But the biggest problem is the shops. Simply there isn't enough variety. MBK is way better.

Very modern shopping mall. Every floor is themed and all the public toilets are also themed according to each floor, brilliant. You can spend the whole day here as this mall is very big. I would describe this mall as targeting the middle market so this place is very affordable to shop and dine.
Nice Mall. I mainly went there to eat. Though they have a number of small shops for clothing. I am 185cm and 115 kg, their clothes will not fit me. haha

Great food market!. The food downstairs is delicious! Actually probably the best I had in Bangkok. Also, it was clean and just felt super sanitary. Also very affordable! I liked browsing through the shops but came back for the market!
unique pleasant experience. food court food is good and reasonable in price,atmosphere at every floor is every unique will like to visit your shopping centre whenever I travel to Bangkok

Incredible. My husband and I were amazed at the effort and detail put into the theme and design of this mall, we spent hours looking around just at the decor itself, it's fun and interesting plus the array of independent designers and choice of dining, we will definately be going back again to explore further!

Another mall with a twist. If you need to escape the mid day heat this place is a good place to kill an hour or two. The malls in Bangkok are a dime a dozen. I'm not sure how this one fairs against the rest but we enjoyed it. The mall is split into themes by country. For women the japan section was good and london good for menswear. The mall has many western brands but prices are high and better style and prices can be found in the smaller boutique stores.food court is good- grab some gourmet popcorn from the basement and catch a movie- not the most authentic thai experience but good if your looking for some simple comfort from home!

Awesome mall, even for sightseeing. Beautiful and clean mall. Each floor has a different country theme, and each theme is very detailed and true to the real country. Great little unique stores and right next to Asok BTS station on Sukhumvit road. We went to the food court so many times, it's on the basement level and has something for everyone. World cuisine, pastries, an awesome grocery store. Highly recommend at least one visit to Terminal 21.

Best Bangkok shoppingmall. Bangkok is big in shopping mall, most are very boring and a waste of your time in this great city (except for MBK which is fun for it's own reason). But this shopping mall is very cool and fun! Great little stores with creative cloths, shoes, etc. Go at the and of your trip if you have room in your bag.
best food court :D. when I went for holiday to Bangkok, I came here three times just because of we love the food court! Surprisingly cheap and all the food was great! Loveee

Interesting Concept. Interesting concept, floors/zones based on various culture/places like Carribean, California etc. Nice restaurants at level 4 especially Thai ones. Kids will love this mall. Located in front of BTS Asok. Some nice bakery shops in basement selling excellent cupcakes.Must visit.

Cool place to visit. Terminal 21 is nice mall with themed floors for different cities like Istanbul, Paris, and London. The mall has many brand names for shopping and large number of restaurant for fast food and different kind of cuisines. In addition to large number of small boutiques for gifts. It's a place to spend nice and long time with your family or solo.

Interesting concept!. Love the airplane/destination concept of this mall. You walk through security gates to enter the mall like the airport and each floor is a different destination. The mall is complete with your typical mainstream stores and provides a variety of boutiques with the local style and items for gifts and souvenirs. There's also a nice super market in the ground level floor.

Good shopping complex. Terminal 21 in Bangkok is not your ordinary shopping centre. Each floor is themed differently which I liked and the food court of the top level is fantastic.Some of the stores are a little pricey but the centre court specials are usually worth a visit.

Cool shopping centre!. We visited this shopping centre as it was not far from our hotel, ideal way to escape the Bangkok heat!!The shopping centre has a theme of cities and each floor is a different place, pretty cool! Security are also dressed in pilots uniforms.There is loads of shops, from your usual to your not so usual. We really only visited to escape the heat and the thing we actually enjoyed most was visiting the supermarket, gotta love checking out all the different stuff they have!Worth a look, not really for bargains though.

A quirky mall with an interesting concept.. In the country where mall is plentiful, this one definitely stands out. It has a very interesting concept. It was design to look like an airport and every time you are going to a different floor, you feel like you are departing one country and arriving at a different country as each floor was designed with a theme of a different country. Like London fashion street for male clothing or Japanese Harajuku floor for female clothing.The food terminal at the Terminal 21 has a wide selection that you can choose from. But be careful when you come here during meal time at any day. It's so crowded you might have to wait or haggle for tables.

Good for first timers. It was my 2nd time there in June. I loved the concept of having different themes for each floor, down to the layout of the toilets and the matching dressing of the attendants. It's a place first timers could go to catch the interesting structures and take photos. The interest was there during the first visit but not as much during the 2nd.Food wise, the food court sells a good large delicious portion of mango sticky rice at cheaper prices compared to other food courts. Prices of clothes at the stores are inflated and I could get some pieces at half the price at Platinum mall and Union Mall.
Visit. Enjoy the shopping during our recent Bangkok Trip in November 2014. A good mix of shops and food outlets. Pleasant way of relax, shop and food.

Nice quirky mall with unique finds.. I absolutely love this mall in Bangkok. It has many nice and unique finds. It has become the go-to mall of me and my husband during our Bangkok stay. I liked the fact that it showcases unique Bangkok brands at their finest. The mall is clean, pleasant and world class. Speaking of world class, each level has a theme corresponding to a different country. Fabulous!:) Also, a delicious food court sits at one of the top levels. Definitely worth a visit when in Bangkok!

Terminal 21. I visited Terminal 21 during my last trip to Bangkok. It is very modern, clean and has a large variety of shops. I was looking for a sun hat and sunscreen, but was unable to find either.Upstairs, there are many food outlets, serving most types of food, from around the world, at affordable prices.All in all, its definitely worth spending an hour or so, walking around the mall.

amazing. it is something unique ,when the first time i visit Terminal 21 I saw the signs of the locations i thought i was in Airport ,it is a good experience and it is something different than you visit a shopping Mall ,every floor had a different city name and its related views.I personally appreciate this unique shopping Mall.

top floor foodcourt is tops..... nice clean mall. good security. I was telling a Thai bar owner that I didn't find Emporium useful, and she sent me to T-21 foodcourt. Been back many times.Beautiful building.

always here!. I stay in Thailand for many months in Thailand and in Bangkok my hotel is near Asoke Intersection.In the area my favourite shopping center is Terminal 21 expecially for the food area. very good quality dishes at a fair price!
nice experience. if you like Fashion, terminal 21 is one of the best place in BKK. Also offers very modern facilities and free WIFI

Superb toilets, useless guest WIFI. Nice Mall, as they all are at Sukhumvit, the toilets were super-clean and a pleasure to use, but the guest WIFI did not work as it should even though I go a a login/password by showing my ID card at the information desk.

Shopping at Terminal 21. Conveniently located beside Asok BTS station, Terminal 21 is a cool place to hangout All activities can be found here; eat, shop, watch a movie, chill & relax.Every level of the mall has its own country theme; example, London, Japan, Istanbul etc.If you are in need of using the restroom, Terminal 21 has one of the best toilets around. You will never feel anguished having to use a toilet here.To top things off, there is also free WiFi.

I love it!. It's one of the best shopping malls in Thailand! They have many thing uniques, the shop has a designe interesting and the toilets are the best. It's one of my favorites! I have been four times in BKK and this is one of the first places that I go to visit.
A Must visit shoppping Mall to visit in Bangkok. A Must visit shoppping Mall to visit in Bangkok with airport theme.Rated 4 starts because i'm sure there're still rooms for improvement :)

Delicious&Fun!. I stayed near the Terminal 21 with my family for a week. We walked in there severaltimes for relaxation. It was amazing for us to see the layout of shops and it's concept of airport and various countries. I love it!

An Out-of-This-World Experience!. Terminal 21 was such a mind-blowing experience! There was something for everyone in our party - from the 70 year old senior citizens to the 20 year old and 8 year olds! The free Wi-Fi totally was so appreciated and all the stores were beautifully organized and stocked with amazing and affordable merchandise. Totally go back again!

Great mid-size mall in central Bangkok. Great multi-story mall in central Bangkok directly connected to Skytrain station (Asok station). No major department store like Emporium, Central or Paragon but a lot of smaller stores and shops. Excellent selection of reasonably priced restaurants and even a supermarket. Always a good size crowd but never too crowded. Just a really nice newer mall where to shop, eat or just wander around.
Find your treasure. It can find very more treasure, like gourmet , shoese , clothes. Most importantly ,the price is very cheap

The best mall in Sukhumvit area. Terminal 21 is a mega shopping mall in the Sukhumvit area that can be reached by BTS Asok or MRT Sukhumvit. The design is like a big airports and when you reached a certain destination, the location will have design and iconic decor from that destination. There are various and complete shops that offer you international or local clothing brands as well as a wide arrange of international and Thai food restaurants.

Great place to shop for sales!. Went here with my boyfriend yesterday and enjoyed a leisurely shopping experience. They have a ton of smaller boutique shops in which most won't break the bank. Some of them will even bargain on the price while others remain chain stores with set pricing. If you go to the information desk, they may have special deals for foreigners for VAT (thailand tax refund) or just discounts on merchandise in general. There is also a good number of restaurants and a theatre on the top floor which costs 160 baht. You could spend a good day here as there are numerous floors and most restaurants have some sort of "happy hour".

Great design. Made sure to check this place out during my stay in Thailand. I've certainly never seen a mall designed like this before. And of course, as everyone says, the washrooms are so cool!I didn't end up buying anything here except for a few things from H&M, but it's definitely worth checking out if you're in the area. However, I'd recommend saving your shopping for JJ Market!

Pleasant shopping experience. Just like to share about my experience. This mall is not about brand. It is about having shops selling quality clothing at a affordable price. For ladies, there are a lot of shops selling gowns and quality dresses. These clothing are without brand, but do not lose out on quality.For guys, there are ample shops for you too. Jackets, jeans, shirts, bermudas, you name it. Let me add that the pricing is at least two times more than platinum fashion mall, but you get quality.Thumbs up.

Must visit. It is also big size mall...located in the heart of city..close to Asok BTS & MRT. the attraction here is..it keeps on always giving various sales offer..& stock of sales like. I recommend to visit it once.
Amazing Bathrooms . Toilets have heated seats and squirting out water when you ask it to. trust me after the spicy food you eat you really won't regret a visit to the well decorated loo.

Interesting Concept for a Mall. The idea behind the mall is to create the feeling of being in a different country on every floor. Some of the floors include Tokyo, London, San Francisco. It's a very well-kept mall and is really interesting to visit. On the San Francisco floor, they even have a miniature version of the Golden Gate Bridge. All in all, it's a fun place to visit.

Feels like an airport.... Terminal 21 located at sukumhit Mrt or asoke bts station is a shopping centre that looks like an airport especially with its security scans.Every floor has a theme of a different country from Japan to Rome to San Francisco to London and more!Quite a good range of hippie fashion shops, apparently some of these shops also operate from jj market! For tourists, showing your passport at the information counter entitle you to a wifi password which you can link up your gadgets too!

Surprise shop. The shopping layout theme is based on you taking plane and arriving on different countries. For example, level 3 the theme is London where you see things associated with London. Do take time to visit the toilets. There some good buys if you take your time to shop. Otherwise, most items are expensive or can be found cheaper elsewhere.

Quirky shops, interesting designer items at surprisingly good prices. Been to BKK many times and yet never before entered this mall, despite it being within walking distance to hotels in Sukhumvit. What a surprise. You won't like this place if you are a large or super tall strapping Western body type, but if you are of a lean to medium body type, this mall is worth a visit. Each floor has a design theme, from Ancient Rome, through Japan and London which makes for a visually interesting experience. Many smaller designer clothing outlets selling interesting and well priced items. Well merchandised and a little quirky. We visited one evening for about 3.5 hours including dinner at a great Taco place. Purchased some great shorts around $20 aud and Tshirts about $7 for my husband and a few other gifts. It is not the chain outlets (H&M G2000 and others) which held our interest but the smaller more interesting stores on the levels above. Good if you have had enough of the usual tourist trap merchandise and want some interesting well priced merchandise you won't see everywhre. Really liked it.

Great Concept. I loved the concept of Terminal 21, its fin to go to the different floors and see a representation of those cities. There are some nice restaurants there as well and some interesting independent retailers.

Amazing theme shopping mall. This is a great concept of shopping mall. There is different fashion styles from many countries as each level is a destination airport. The price is not as cheap as u expected. However, there is still some shop with reasonable prices and the time I visited, H&M is on sales, so I could get some stuffs here.The food on 5th floor is great.There is also a cinema here as well. I did watch a movie after shopping trip ^^It is located at Asorb BTS which is only 3-4 stations from Chitlom, the central one. It is short trip to travel to.
Excellent Food Court. If you like street food and have hygenic concern, look no futher, this is the place. Food is cheap and you have plenty of choice. After the meal, enjoy your shopping here.
Global setting within a mall. Modern with themed (country/city) floors. Plenty of shopping and eating outlets. Free wifi with passport to register at information counter.

great cinema - reasonable price. the cinema at Terminal 21 is on Level 6 ... the movie cost 190 baht and 160 baht for large coke and large popcorn ... the cinema has comfortable good sized seating ... there are lots of places to eat while at Terminal 21 (food court and specialty/franchise restaurants) with amazing variety ... its possible to find many vegetarian options and fewer vegan options (ability to speak some Thai will ensure you get vegetarian/vegan food) ... lots of shopping opportunities with the odd bargain if you look hard

Cheapest street food options. T 21 is probably the cheapest street food option of sukhmvit. The foods look hygienic but yet cheaper than the street itself. There are some good proper restaurant in the mall too. Great place to hang round. Good for shopping or just having a bite

A Mall with Options. Terminal 21 is an excellent mall as based in Bangkok. The Terminal has all the facilities as required. But, most of the shops are Banded Shops which is quite impossible for few tourist to effort to buy. If the prices of the products were reasonably less in compare to other malls like Platinum, Indira, MBK. And also there should be more varieties product like other malls as well. More Entertaining for children should be added. Signal of WIFI needs to be more powerful to be accessed from different shops. Over all the market is quite good.

Shopping Mall with a Theme. First of all, this is a shopping mall.That means, the price is pretty standard and you'll probably see lots of familiar brands around. However, it doesn't mean that this place has no charm.Go here for:- photo opportunities. Even the toilets have different theme for different floor.- shopping. get some nice dresses and cute tops- the familiar brands like Starbucks and Baskin Robin's in case you're homesick.Bring camera!

Each floor dedicated to a country. Terminal 21 is different from others, here, each of the 4 or 5 floors is for a country (i saw Japan, US, France, Italy). The food court has many options at very reasonable price. The grocery store on the ground floor is pretty extensive!
Shopping mall with theme. Great design shopping mall separate by country for each floor. Toilet for this mall also depend on the floor theme and worth to pay a visit.

cheap and expensive with many food choices. Love the top 2 floor with lots of food choices. Another 3 floors for free style fashion. With small little shop selling uniquely designed clothing. And the rest of the few floor with franchise clothing shops.

Waste of time. This place is trying to be something it is not !Basically its just another Mall not at the top end or the bottom just lost in between. !!Then theme is rubbish they have just called each floor by a different country. ie UK has a red telephone box otherwise the shop are your usual collection of....would anyone actually buy that !!!

Visit only, shop somewhere else. That mall is huge, beautiful and has smart design. Every floor designed with influence from cities around the world. It's great for looking around and taking pictures, but the prices arn't so cheap (for Thailand ofcourse).

country-themed mall. with affordable prices. much cheaper bargains than siam. you can even bargain there, except if you go to stores like H&M, etc. cheapest food court i have ever come across. huge variety of food. keep going there every time we go to bangkok. always end up buying shoes and bags from there.

Beautiful. At fact ,it's my first time to visit Tailand,Terminal 21,and without a travel team,so when I got into it ,I thought my choice was very very nice.I couldn't stop my camera ,all of the plaza were beautiful ,the serxicing,the waiters and so on.I hope to visit it in the future .

Travel themed shopping mall. Travel to a different country at each level. Loads of shopping with many small shops that would surely meet someone's yearning for wallet lightening exercises. Movies at the top level, loads of food and a supermarket at basement level and a myriad of shops in between ranging from women's shoes to fashion and scents and most importantly did I mention women's shoes. Like there's enough women shoe stores to keep any women happy. Well, except mine who was engrossed with novelty trinkets more than anything else. Easy to get to the mall, take the BTS rail to Asok. It's also right beside Soi Cowboy for those looking for a drink with some spice...
Worth a visit. Great concept to this shopping mall, enjoyed exploring each floor. Shops are well priced and enjoyed looking around. Worth a visit if in the area.

A Mall with difference. Terminal 21 is a Shopping Mall located right next to the exit of Asoke/Sukhumvit MRT/BTS Interchange station. I was primarily there to activate internet on my Thai sim card. Once I entered the mall I figured out that each floor is dedicated to different and popular cities of the world. Each corresponding floor is decorated keeping the particular city architecture. The floors are named as Paris, The Carribean, Tokyo, Istanbul & London. I had fun while I stayed there. Took a few photos as well. Sharing them for your convenience. Oh and restrooms are amazing! :P

Different theme per floor. I love the concept of the mall that they have a different city theme per floor (e.g london, san francisco). There are lots of restaurants to choose from and it is very accessible via the BTS (it is connected). They also offer free wifi to tourists. Don't forget to bring your passport as they need to record this and they will give you a different password each.

Great shopping mall. We recently visited Terminal 21 shopping mall in Sukhumvit Rd as we were staying down the road and it was a short walk from Soi 11. The mall was really great, it was set up with theme levels, each level you were in a new country like London, Paris, San Fransisco etc. there was also a really great food court on the very top level where the food was really cheap and great. If you prefer not to eat in a food court there were plenty of other eating places one level below also well priced. If your in the area I would recommend a visit.

Fusion Shopping Mall. Impressively with floors in different theme, they really goes all out in creativity and this what Thailand is all about....Creativity...Plenty for you to shops with F & B available plus is connected thru walking bridges and BTS,MRT.
Nice place. I go here like all the time..a mall that has an attitude,.with different theme places you can enjoy,also every season there's a different theme.. a must see!

Interesting concept, but ultimately, just another mall. Right next to the Asok MRT station (along the Sukhumvit line), it's an interesting concept of a mall, where every floor is supposedly reflecting a different destination. It's a great place for photo ops with the statues and the decor but ultimately, it's just another mall, selling the same things.I would totally recommend the iced tea from the Number One Brand outlet in the basement. So far, it's the only place that I've seen to have an outlet.

Worth a visit if u stay in the vicinity. Good shops. Good food court. It is a mall worth shopping from if ur in BKK. The place was swarming with people when we visited on a Sunday afternoon. But was a fairly good experience.

Good shopping centre. It is a nice modern air conditioned center with many shops. mainly clothing. But the themes are interesting - you can go to San Fransisco or Paris etc... Great for exploration. Food hall is very good. The cimemas on the top floor are fine. Worth a visit!

Mall in a different league!. This place is amazing! Has themed floors from Rome to London to Tokyo to Istanbul! The shops are incredible! If hungry look at the basement floor as there is awesome market stalls away from the restaurants on the top two floors. Worth a trip to!

Shopping mall with a different. I like the way they create different theme on each floor.. Not cheap but not too expensive items for sale.. I think people visiting this mall to browse or buy something unique that they can't get it anywhere eg MBK .. I had a peak at food court and liked it .. but we already had lunch so next time we will eat here for sure.. This is the kind of shopping mall you would make you feel good after your visit with or without purchasing anything.. I will definitely come here again.. highly recommended.

Wooooowwww... just wooow. Very nicely designed. The mall and the concept is so beautiful. Each floor is dedicated to a different country. Amazing even though the price is very steep. But there are sales going on. So you can definitely catch good deals. Its worth visiting even if you dont buy. Its 31 baht from BTS and the platform is infront of the mall. No hassles. Never seen such a beautiful toilet. God! The toilet seat has a digital corner.... Impressive. Do not miss this place. The food court is not as impressive as Siam Paragon but you will certainly find something. I had a rice burger at the burger corner. Never eaten a burger made of rice. Delicious...Just go there. You will certainly end up loving this place. However if u r looking for souvenirs please hit Pratunam street. Amazing.You will get to see things u dont get to see usually. Beautiful and very well designed. Just go without hesitation. Cheers

I don't get it...?. If you've never been to a mall before then this is worth a visit, if you have too much money and want to blow some then you could go here and buy the same products you could buy at home but pay a little bit more. If you don't like Thai food and crave the stuff you get at home, then the food hall is for you, a wide selection of mostly western (or Japanese) fare. If you want a unique shopping experience, you want value and you want things that you probably can't buy at home (even if it's just because they're knock offs), then go to MBK. Oh! It DOES have the most incredible public toilets I've ever used, for me they were the highlight!

Different and Fun Shopping Mall. Having read about the Terminal 21 themed shopping mall and seen some of the pictures, we wanted to see it for ourselves.With direct access for the skytrain, it was quite something to see with the different city themed floors and décor, not to mention the extensive range of restaurants with a lot of European and American franchises.Most of the shops seemed to be smaller boutiques and seemed mostly geared to fashion – the prices seemed a bit on the higher end. I did however come across a branch of “Pink Pussy” – a fantastic accessories shop with amazing metal evening bags, a crazy large selection of costume jewellery, scarfs, hair accessories, and all that is bling bling – but with really good prices.There was a motor cycle promotion and exhibit on the ground floor on our first visit and a watch expo on our second visit two weeks later – the motorcycle exhibit certainly drew a large crowd of young people.This is a great shopping centre to spend some time in just to see the different city themed floors – the décor was very good and well designed, and all the public toilets on each floor are themed as well, with no floor being the same. Definitely a fun place to spend some time.

An air conditioned distraction.. Clean, tidy and well presented shopping mall. Hard to get lost, shops have good range and prices. Food court on top floor is exceptional. Remember to buy credits/tokens. (Very common in Thailand but also a bit pointless). As others contributors have mentioned, each floor has a themed approach. Toilets are quirky, though do find the use of 'handicap' rather than disabled a little outdated for those less abled who need to use them. Right next to MRT and BRT stations.Overall a nice oasis of cool air, calm shopping(compared rob insight markets and MBK).

Big Shopping mall. Nice theme with Airport style of shopping, you will find both luxury brands & small shops in this mall, it is a nice place for shopping in the whole day. Most shops are having huge discount when I was there as much as 50% off, it is really worth you can manage to buy what you want at a much cheaper price! Alight @ Asok Station Exit 1 will leads you directly to the mall.

Well designed mall. We didn't do any shopping here, just went around the mall to checkout all the floors and the decor. Each floor of the mall had a different theme (with landmarks from various famous cities). It gave a very museum-like feeling to walk around the mall. We enjoyed it.

Around the World in Shopping Haze. What a fun concept! Each level is a different city and the boutiques are mostly small businesses so you get a great variety of merchandise. Prices are good and when you're done shopping or need to take a little break there are plenty of eateries to choose from as well. You could easily spend hours here getting lost in the maze of shops. Easy to get to as the train stops right outside the entrance as well.

A shopping mall with unique theme. The mall is designed as an airport terminal. With each level representing different cities (Caribbean, Rome, London, Paris, Istanbul and San Francisco), the floors are decorated with attractions and cultures of respective cities. As a shopping mall, it is quite neat and nice. There are not many brand shops though, but still a good place for shopping. A food court on the 4th and 5th floor and a movie theater on the top floor makes this a place suitable for repeated visits. Also there is a direct connection to the market from Asok BTS station which makes it easily accessible. A silly but nice thing, the wash rooms are probably the best in Thailand with fully electronic equipment.

Dont waste your time. Other far better shopping malls in Bangkok ie every other shopping mall including MBK, Asiatique, CenterWorlds, Siam Paragon and Pratanum. Over rated and over priced. Unfortunately many people who think Thailand is in Sukhumvit will only see this shopping mall so will not experience other far better malls with better food courts and better value shopping

A Nice Shopping Mall. A shopping mall which is a must visit.
It is located on Sukhumvit and has 6 floors of shopping and eateries.
The shops are located on floors and have separate names like
San Francisco
England
Tokyo
etc
Nice place and must visit

Travel the world!. Don't miss Terminal 21 shopping mall where each level represents a different country of the world. Interesting shopping, fabulous variety of foods to try and you must go to the toilets on each level which are decorated in theme. The electronic toilets are full adjustable, seat warmer, wash and dry, etc. worth a look!
Recommended . A very nice shopping mall. Very nice small shops. Very cool with this different countries every floor. Good eating places and super toilets 😊

My Fav Mall!. Gotta love this mall. I love the different floors with different countries as a theme. Must visit toilets at all floors. Don't worry, it's very clean. Check out the mini shops on every floor. Shopping is in a variety at an affordable price. Head on to Pier 21 for food :)

Yet another mall. Really, I can't get enthused by Terminal 21.
Its set up as tough you are in a different city on each floor, but thats where the interest ends.
Same goods as you'll find anywhere else in BKK.
Really, nothing special.

Nice to look at. Liked the whole concept of the mall. The glass exterior like an airport, different floors representing different cities. My friends and I loved the basement, we bought their delicious crepes and some souvenirs at the snack store. The clothing and stuffs are expensive, so we didn't even shop there. Took a lot of pictures though, worth remembering.

Dine n Shop. Definitely worth visiting. Every level is a different decor altogether. You could experience Istanbul in one and San Fran in another. Great place to shop and terminal 21 has ample dining place for one to choose from. From western to local cuisines. It's not overly crowded and has interesting things you could buy. Love coming to this place to hang with friends.

Nice place for eating and hanging out. This shopping mall is well-decorated and each floor is designed with different themes such as San Fransisco, Japan, London, etc. The restrooms are also lovely. There are many international restaurants that you will enjoy trying them and also lots of small shops for hanging out. I went to this mall with my family and they liked it. By the way, I think it is only good for being chillax and finding something to eat more than coming for shopping.

reasonable price for shopping items, good quality, variety of food selection above all the dream price. strongly recommend, reasonable price for all shopping items.good quality food, variety of food selection, dream price of food.Linked access from sky train

Great Mall with everything you need. We visited this Mall as we were staying in Sofitel Sukhumvit and it was 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Its a great place, the theme is of an airport with all the Mall staff dressed in Flight attendant outfits. Its a clean mall with lots of food places, great shops, clothes, chemists, bits and bobs.

Interesting Mall Concept. Interesting mall modeled after an airport and various countries of the world with a Japanese floor, a Middle Eastern floor, a North American floor, a British floor etc... Even comes with a airport terminal like arrival and departure flight info turnstile board. So too the info counter gals... They were dressed impeccably like air stewardesses. Such a very original concept of a mall. Even the restrooms were of the same theme as the floor they are at. Especially liked the Jap themed one with lots of bamboo like material used and paper lanterns. Other than all the themed deco, this would have to be considered quite a well organised and clean mall with well thought out management and segregation of products. Look out for a Polaroid shop( I think on the 3rd floor) selling limited edition Polaroid sets for fans of these cameras. At the basement is a pretty good Thai Tea and coffee stall too. It;s the one with the a "thumbs up" logo on its products and cups.

Amazeballs. I love the concept of this mall. Different themes on each level. Love the escalators show the city you landed on xD. Pretty creative wash room and toilet design. Cheap food at the food court up there. Very accessible to this mall using BTS and MRT.

Awesome one. It's a nice shopping center with lots of variety & of course different price class.It's organized well. Floors a designed as different country.U will find cheap as well as expensive shops.Its also connected to Ashok BTS.Very nice & loved to shop here.

Better than I have expected. Its my first time here and I really like the way they categorized level by level. As we didn't have intention to shop for men's stuff, we skipped that level altogether, making our shopping spree more time efficient.Many food selection and its next to BTS. Toilets are very clean and easily found.

Amazing shope. A great place for photos, the restaurants are good, cinema and, the secret place or I should say a gem in Bangkok, its the food court! The price captivated me. Its street food pricing at an incredibly cool shopping mall. Definitely a big draw for me to keep visiting Terminal 21. I felt I didnt eat enough from the food court as I only came across it after having so many meals at the restaurants there!

Terminal 21 Shopping Mall. We just ate at the MK Restaurant here. No time to browse and shop. The MK Restaurant was great. We had the shabu shabu with roast duck and BBQ pork. We left full and satisfied.

best place to visit for shopping. Shopping mall close to skytrain/subway stations. Mall is segregated into international floors, e.g. tokyo, london, these floors have products/shops from these locations. Mall also has dining choices and a movie complex. Everything you can think of in terms of shopping is here.
Impressive!. Great mall where you can spend hours walking around. I loved the different levels with each and one different and represent another location such as: London, San fransisco and more.

Pier 21 Food court on the 5 floor. Cheaply priced food with all manner of foods found here. However I found the food not warm enough for my liking. for example only the rice or prepared gravy is kept warm & hot while the chicken or crispy noodle are not even warm. quite a turn down for me. Go for the on the spot stir fried dishes or fresh noodles. Maybe you can get better warm food.

Interesting shopping Mall. Do spend about 2-3 hours in this mall. Visit every toilets possible as they will surprise you. My favorite is the toilet with London Underground theme. Food choices were plentiful, we ate at the Korean Restaurant and it did not disappoint us.

A theme shopping mall is fun. So far this is the best shopping mall in Banghkok to me its just simply because of the decor inside. The little secret is the washrooms, go visit every washrooms and you will be surprised !

Interesting Mall with Special Toilets! Cheap and good food at Pier 21!. Have fun visiting and exploring the special toilets of different nations in every floor! Go to Pier 21 food court and enjoy cheap and good food! Must taste the special sticky mango rice dessert (half mango 35 baht, whole mango is 70 baht, we paid 170 baht in the Don Moeung airport). Fried rice, Pad Thai and many other delicious food with affordable price!

excellent offers in a very pleasant mall. The mall has excellent shopping particularly clothes including very interesting thai designers. There are a lot of offers all the time, I bought t-shirts and polos of high quality from 5 to 10 euros!

Awesome place for photos. A great place for photos, the restaurants are good, cinema and, the secret place or I should say a gem in Bangkok, its the food court! The price captivated me. Its street food pricing at an incredibly cool shopping mall. Definitely a big draw for me to keep visiting Terminal 21. I felt I didnt eat enough from the food court as I only came across it after having so many meals at the restaurants there!

good shopping mall. Modern big mall with a funny theme. Great selection of local made men's street wear, hip tshirts, shirts and pants. Some vendors have their stalls on chatuchak, prices are also similar. For woman it's also original, and local, but sized rather for girls, with specific Asian look.There is also a standard fare of traditional brands, but it's same same as everywhere, boring!If you're not of Asian or Hispanic size, you might struggle with finding anything that suits you, for us it was perfect :)Don't skip two levels of great food with plenty of restaurants, and cheap street food like food court.

Interesting and spacious mall. The mall is just right at the doorstep of BTS Asok, with a lot of dining options and shopping as well. No doubt the price range is higher than the wholesale malls, the quality of products here seems to be better and unique independent boutiques . There is a cinema located in the mall as well and do visit the food court at level 5(?), very delicious food and good variety, served at over a dollar or more per one-serving item.

Large, with cinemas, restaurants, retail and a Just Relax massage. Retail shops are unique, not the typical multinational outlets. I think they're local designers at good value.Food court is pretty big with a wide range of food.Massage was packed and I think you need to make an appointment.

A good place to get away from the heat and pass some time.. Terminal 21 is one of the newer style Shopping Malls, this one is located centrally on Sukhumvit. Featuring a large range of shops from fashion through, also 2 floors of restaurants and of course Starbucks. On the top is also a Cinema complex to catch the latest flicks. Ideal to get away from the heat and humidity, grab a bite, or a drink, of course shopping is also an option.

Nice place Nice food. Like this place and my second visit with my family. Different team on different level : Istanbul, London, San Francisco etc.Many eating outlets & I love the food court - Pier 21. Good food great price. You must try the sticky rice with ripe mango, it's so yummy that we ordered twice & my daughter doggy bag one more portion back to the hotel. Other things are slightly more expensive than you pay at platinium or pratunum but overall it's a good place to shop and eat. It's just next to the Asoke bts station.

Great Foodcourt (Super cheap!), One of a kind mall. This is one of my favorite malls in BKK, I have been living here a few months and visit this mall at least 3 times a week for dinner. I eat for 50 baht (max) which is similar to the street yet I know what I am ordering and the staff can generally speak english. The gourmet market (supermarket) downstairs is also good - has everything we need. There is a Nike and H & M there aswell as tonnes of boutique stores. The mall layout is amazing - worth a visit even if just for a coffee!

Quite interesting. The interesting thing about this place is, each floor is decorated in a unique style based on famous countries such as Japan, UK, US... The shops are nice and small and dainty and lovely. some of them offer alright prices, the others are a bit high i think. in general, it's a must-visit place in Bangkok

Fabulous Shopping Center. Air conditioned shipping center with 6 floors. Great things to see and buy. At the 6th floor there is a great food court. It has everything. Also at the Kentucky Fried Chicken you can get an ice cream cone for about 60 cents. You will love shopping here.

Local treasures. If you are lloking to have fun while shopping, or are looking for something different to buy, then this is the place. The whole shopping centre is nicely themed throughout, and has a balanced collection of international (non-luxury) shops as well as clusters of small boutiques selling shirts, leather goods,etc - most are locally-designed and made. The mall is easily accessable by monorail. Last but not least, as mentioned a few times by other reviewers, check out the themed toilets on each floor, they're good fun!

Interesting mall. Although I have been to Bangkok a few times, this is my first trip to Terminal 21. It's an interesting shopping mall, each floor depicting the theme of a country - e.g Japan, France, UK, USA. One can get some good bargains here. For e.g I got some blouses and skirts, 200-490baht. Most of them are small stores and kiosks, with a few bigger and branded ones like H&M & Nike. The disadvantage is that trying is not allowed in some stores. The highest level is where the restaurants are located. There are quite a good variety - Chinese, Japanese, Western and of course some local delicacies.To go there, you can take the BTS. The train stopped right at the doorstep of the mall.

Amazing!. I was extremely impressed with terminal 21. The centre is huge and had alot of shops. Each floor was decorated based on the world's famous city like Paris of Japan. Shops are many and reasonable pricing. I bought myself some handmade shirts at 200THB! The foodcourt was cheap and delicious. Terminal 21 is totally my favourite now.
good !. it won't get bored every time i'm back to Bangkok.each floor is unique especially the washroom. Well maintain and friendly to tourist

Different from the other malls. Among the different malls we've visited in Bangkok, Terminal 21 is so far the most unique. It is themed as an airport where each floor is a different destination. It's like you've been to different countries in just one building! There are various places to eat at the bottom and top floor that's why we had a hard time to choose where to take our meal. In addition, the mall offers free wifi internet access. Foreigners just have to approach the information desk and show their passport then a pass key will be given.

Interesting Mall. There are just too many malls in Bangkok and to stand out, you need a bit of creativity and imagination. Terminal 21 is a themed mall, and they make the shoppers' experience the travellers' experience. The mall is a big flight terminal, and every floor has a world city as a theme (London, San Francisco, Tokyo, Istanbul...) and are decorated accordingly, including the washrooms. Food court on the San Francisco floor was huge. The shops are not too different from other malls but Terminal 21 is worth a visit just for itself.

its just a mall.... wow I heard about this place and read about it on tripadvisor as a place to go when I was looking for hotels. It's just a mall with a very tacky marketing gimmick aboiut being around the world - honestly, the floors are just a little different, and there is a fake london doubledecker bus (with shops in it..)So yes, it's a mall, and a big one at that, but nothing special about it and I would not go out of the way to see it. Of course, go if you are close and want to buy something !

Nice concept. A interesting themed mall adopting the airport terminal concept. There is a different country theme at each level, including the toilets. Personally, apart from the visual experience on the design of the mall, there was nothing much to shop here.

Interesting themed mall. Even if you don't want to go shopping, you may still find it interesting to visit this mall, just for its design and its idea. Each level has a different city as its theme - London, Paris, San Francisco, Tokyo, etc, and each level is decorated according to its themed city, even the bathroom. The foot court at the San Francisco level is worth a visit. You won't be short of choices. One of the biggest mall foot court I've ever visited.It's easy to stop by for its visit given its excellent location - right next to (connected to actually) the Asok sky train station.
Unique 'around the world' experience. Quite a relatively new shopping mall with different country names for different floor. Lots of shopping from local brands to renowned brands.
Fantastic place. This mall totally deferent with other malls in decoration . It's shown each floor Rome , Paris, London, Istanbul , Tokyo in quite place.Many brand shop available her

Must Go for unique experience. A mall not like a typical mall.. I loved this place, each floor is different even the washrooms (they also worth a visit). Lots of shops ranging from local to branded. It well connected with sky train so reaching here is easy. Great opt for foodies as well..

Interesting, cheap food court. Visited a few times as it was very close to our hotel.We ate 1 night in the Fuji restaurant which is pretty much the same all over Thailand, another nightwe went cheap and had the food court. You'll eat here for about 30 - 40 baht per dish on a stored value card (typical of Thai food courts) which you can top up and is valid for 1 month. We shopped on a couple occasions too, some shops like H&M I found great value compared to home, others were similarly priced. My GF found some value but you should allow some time to browse, there's many levels and escalators in 2 sections, side alleys on some floors with little hidden gems. If you're from the west, for a laugh check out the toilets, they've installed the high tech Japanese versions :)

A different mall experience. We really took our time to visit this mall because of the unusual theme it has. And yes we were not disappointed. We even just can't get enough in strolling and taking pictures that we almost forgot that our coach going back to airport is already waiting for us in our hotel. This is definitely a mall experience that teleports you in different places.

Nice shopping mall filled with mostly local brands. Located right beside Asok station and is directly connected for convenience of travelers. Located at the intersection of Sukhumvit and Asok Montri Rd.Terminal 21 was just opposite to my hotel (Grand Millennium) and hence it was in good promixity for everything! The mall comprises of a movie theater, electronics, good quality local brands, departmental stores, pharmacies, grocery and lot of accessories' stores! Often filled with tourists! Has a lot of restaurants, fast food options a couple of coffee and dessert places!!! Every floor is designed in a different way. What I mean is they designed every floor as if it were local stores of a different country: Turkey, England, USA, Italy are a few of them! A couple of great pics can be taken.Overall it is a pretty decent mall in a good location.

Amazing and unique shopping centre. I love this place. I wish the shopping centre back in my home city was like this! We heard about it from a travelling friend who worked in Bangkok. As soon as she told us about the floors themed as countries and the heated toilets we knew we had to check it out!!Found it easily by taking the sky train from our hostel. The first two floors are full of regular brand shops you would find back home and at the entrance there is an information desk which is useful as you are likely to need it due to he size of the place. We went up to the fifth floor to the food court. You get a card and you pre-pay money onto it and then go choose your food at a variety of different places. Food is fairly standard and doesn't come out as good as it looks on the pictures but is very cheap! The Tokyo floor is all boutique women's fashion and the London floor is men's boutique fashion. I bought some amazing print to shirts you couldn't buy on the high street and the most stunning collared shirt! I went a bit mad with the credit card which was unlike me as I can't stand shopping usually. Themed bathrooms were very clean and the toilets were the best past! They had heated seat, heated bidet water you could aim and it even had a dryer ha ha. Friend of mine got confused and sprayed the jet everywhere on the floor so beware ha ha. Great shopping centre. Check it out even if you don't like shopping just to see how bizarre and unique the place is!
