Interesting place, lots of tips to enjoy your visit. This mall, one of many on the BTS sky train is a direct connection from Asok station. You arrive at the mezzanine level, with an information desk and computerised store finders. There are no maps. You might notice that the security guards and information desk staff are unintentionally dressed like extras from "Thunderbirds". Each floor is themed by City eg Rome, San Francisco etc. London has a pastiche of a tube train, London bus, Guardsman ( with an unrealistic busby) and phone box. It is interesting to see the Japanese posing for photos alongside everything in the "pretend" London. The other floors did not have the same fascination. Sadly, for my wife who is petite, so sizes should have worked, the fashions were, well how can I put it, very Asian. A lot of dresses were a little Minnie- mouse or not in cooling fabrics. A lack of cotton and linen but strong on synthetics.We ate twice. The mall is full of eating places. The fish and chip outlet on the London floor served a really good cod and chips with tartare sauce. Strangely, it was served in a frying pan but this did not detract. After so much Thai food, it was welcome. It is alongside Piri Piri as it appears to be part of it.The food court is even more fascinating and incredibly cheap. Nearly street food prices and very hygienic. Dozens of stands serving their own specialities from soup through main courses to deserts. It gets so busy with few Brits but many locals. If you think a table is free but there is a small item there, maybe looking like a discarded bag, the locals use it as a marker to reserve their table while they select their food.Cash is not accepted but menus are clearly displayed at stands with prices. You pay at the cashier and pre charge the plastic card supplied at the cash desk with any amount. 100 bt for one is probably ample for a meal. Your receipt at each stand shows the spend and balance. The card does not show the balance so keep your receipt for next time, alongside your card. It is an inexpensive way to eat good food, in cafeteria surroundings, kept very clean and tables cleared after you. There is so much choice, you are spoilt.If you are returning by BTS in the MoChit direction, try alighting at Nana, one stop away. There is a great hairdresser on the station concourse, near the bra shop. They do men's and women's and speak English. If the review was helpful, please indicate by voting

Shoppers paradise. Terminal 21 has a novel twist to the way they get us to consume (more). Each floor (almost, San Francisco gets 2 floors) is a different city and therefore also some of the shops have the flair of that city and even more so the food offered. It is nice since it is different from most shopping malls, of which Bangkok is well equipped. I am not really for consumption for the sake of consumption so be careful and ask yourself, do I really need this and do I need it now. Enjoy

Worth a look.. I often stay in the asoke sukhumvit area of bangkok there are a couple of familar clothes fashion chains there . I love the food court I think fifth floor once you worked out about the card system you can choose from all the various oriental styles its about 40baht a dish remembering your in bangkok so its good value I always seem to rush in and out of this place maybe because its busy but I promised myself next time I will browse round a lot longer

Terminal 21. Shopping malls are plentiful in Bangkok, but I feel Terminal 21 is different from the rest, ok there might not be the designer brand names, but who wants them , as they are over priced in Thailand anyway, and can be bought cheaper at home, But what Terminal 21 gives you is individual small boutiques offering different designs and nice ideas,As eating it has one of the best Food courts in Bangkok, and has a designated Vegetarian outlet, which is fantastic, cheap as chips and lovely food, definetly worth a visit if you are a vegetarian.All in all Terminal 21 is one of my favoured malls.

unique place. every floors has different theme, I love it here. especially the food court, has so many choices. on the ground floor, you can get dessert with cheap price also have market to buy goods (shampoo, soap, etc)

Terminal 21 - a new experience. Highly recommended to visit at least once, to give yourself at least 2 hours to cover the shops on each level and eat something or have dessert from the food court, which is much cleaner and orderly than MBK food court.
Just an ordinary shopping mall.. This is just an ordinary shopping mall. Nothing special. It was so boring to walk around. Prices were too expensive.

Aircon shopping Mall with each level themed to a country. Its an aircon shopping mall in Bangkok - barely a novelty.Its conveniently located and "western", unlike MBK which has that market feel.Its not cheap - its another mall like you will find across the globe.Yes the toilets are themed as well and clean.But its a shopping mall - hopefully trip advisor users are looking for more than this

Gateway to Cities. This mall is not as grand in scale as Siam Paragon or Central World but it has its own charms and is themed as an air terminal and gateways to various famous cities of the world. First timers will find the mall littered with icons from around the world cities at the various level toilet facilities amusing and good for photo-taking. However, it looses its charm for repeat visitors.

Very interesting concept. As the name suggests the mall has an airport terminal theme and I must say I was quite impressed with how it was executed. I even saw a security guard in a London guard uniform! Corridors are wide. Toilets are clean. Very conducive for shopping. Although they seem to target a younger profile, T21 has a good mix of shops selling mostly local designer apparel and accessories that are pretty well-priced and of better quality(compared to those found at Platinum Mall). There are also plenty of food options available for meal breaks. Will re-visit on our next trip to BKK.

Will return. Great place to shop for local thai designers clothes and shoes. There is a great foodcourt with authentic thai food and a variety of food available. Every floor represents the fashion of each city, for e.g. San Francisco or London or Istanbul etc. worth to go! I bought 5 stone washed t-shirts of B$1000 only!

Cool Mall. Every floor takes you to a different country. I know it sounds silly but i suggest you check out every comfort room in every floor then you'll see why. It's near the Train Station. I kinda like their gourmet market at the ground floor wherein you can find all of the fresh and good foods available.

Good ambiance and food. Of all the malls I feel like this one falls on top of the list of ones to go to. Siam Paragon falls in a very high price point but Terminal 21 is accessible and charming. The top floor has amazing affordable Thai food. Each floor is themed as a different place which creates a charm all its own.
For the shoppers. Lots of clothing shops. There are bargains but you have to decide with your budget in mind. Something for every taste and quality good.

Creative themed mall. Massive mall and HUGE food court! Lots to see and eat, very impressive with many choices of culinary delights. Stores are plentiful and prices are more expensive than in the states, but still nice to wonder around.

Quite like a convenient air-conditioned room during riots. Consumerism is major in Bangkok, hence the cornucopia of malls within Sukhumvit and 30 km radius around it. You have proper malls, and stalls outside those malls. I visited BKK during the protests and people were just everywhere. After daywalking in the heat, you can easily make a detour to Terminal 21 for a quick upper. Coffee shops, boutiques, fast food chains , etc can be found in the fancy city-themed interior of the levels. There's a Paris and a San Francisco level. The place was clean, especially the toilets. Honestly, it looked more like a mall you'd grab a bite in, cool down, but not shop madly at.

Yep, it's a mall. Air-conditioned comforts of home, plenty of food both in the basement and on the upper floors. Head to the food court for prices that compete nicely with street food outside.That said, it's one of several new Bangkok malls - you didn't travel to Bangkok just to go to a mall, did you? It's a nice break, but really shouldn't be a main destination when there's plenty else to see.

One-Stop Mall. For those of you who are in the Sukhumvit district, tight on schedule and just need a place to shop abit, Terminal 21 is the place to go. It has almost everything you would need there.From basics necessities to novelty items(souvenirs?), this place has it all. Many options of cafes and restaurants there as well. I was pleased to find that CoCo Ichibanya, a Japanese curry house was located there as well. Ah, the curry!For those who needs Bangkok Sim-cards and have had trouble communicating with the 7-11s around, head on over to the highest floor as there's where all the large Telco shops are. There's bound to be a staff who can speak basic English who could help answer your queries. If in need for a quick Wi-FI fix, head over to the Information Counter for Tourist Wi-Fi login (you would need a passport for that)One unique attraction of this mall is of their restrooms. Each restroom has a different theme, by a different country (Technically by each floor but the restrooms show more details). Do visit each floor to check them out. I recommend starting from the top floor (many, many floors in this mall)and working your way down. No two toilets are the same as for instance the Japan floor has two toilets based of different Japanese themes. You'd only need to visit this mall if you are planning to hit only one mall. However, being in Bangkok, you'd want to visit the other malls as well!

Very interesting concept!. I love visiting shopping malls for the concept, design of window displays and goods offered and Terminal21 has all that. Each floor was themed and named after a city: Istanbul, Tokyo, Paris, etc. And from that, one can gather what shopping offerings on that particular floor. Many local cuisine as well as franchise food outlets are available too! It will take you a full day if not more if you were to explore each floor and each shop. So for those who have a short trip and want to get a variety of shopping done and good food in one place, do try Terminal21. It is connected directly to the Asoke BTS stop.

Modern designed mall. Modern Mall Each floor is designed by another Country.....European style....Nice gimmick !!!Located opposite the train stationVery very cleanIt has all the facilities and Services requiredIf you like shopping, you will love itNot for Children !!!

Countries-themed. The shopping mall's name itself might give you a little bit of an idea!Terminal 21.That's right,airport!Every levels in the shopping mall has different countries as theme.I don't mean to sound crazy,but you got to visit every floor's restrooms.you can even take pictures in the toilet,they are clean and most importantly,they are unique!They have many different branded stores to shop from,it is nothing like you see from the street.The price maybe way more expensive than the goods sold in the streets,DUH!,but you can still shop around for some higher quality goods.Did I mention their food court?Amazing!you can choose to sit by the large windows and enjoy the view while dine peacefully.(I ate fish steak for only 40 bhat! And it taste fairly good!)

Big shopping mall at BTS. I am not shopaholic, so I found it is not really attractive to me. But it is good to visit the food center where you can find a lot food chain store and a lot delicious food.

Something different in center. If you are tired of casual shopping malls in Bangkok or if you are tourist and would like to see something new, this is your spot!I love the concept, that each floor is designed as different city and honestly they have the best bathrooms ever! The concept is different and the shops are too, you will not find Zara or Mango there. My favorite floor is Istanbul with a lot of accessories and interesting stuff around.As well, my favorite restaurant is Piri Piri Chicken there and i go to Fitness First Gym on the last floor.This shopping mall is located very conveniently, linked to BTS and MRT + there is bus stop around.

Good mall with a lot of opportunities . Nice mall with different kinds of stores, everything from H&M to small handcraft shops with mainly clothes. My fiance found a nice dress there. Good cinema and the food opportunities inside is very good, a lot of dishes with varied pricing.

I found it confusing. It's a new shopping mall however I found it difficult to find a specific item I went there to buy. The layout of shops isn't well thought out.If you're just window shopping, then go for it. You'll spend an enjoyable time.It's next door to BTS Asoke and the MRT system as well as the bustle of Sukhumvit.Top floor also has new cinemas.

A more up market shopping center. Terminal 21, has several different themes . One floor might be Rome, one istanbul, one Japan and so on. The goods are of better quality and are priced accordingly. We were there on the weekend and the center was very busy. Well worth a visit

Quite interesting with a great food court. This is relatively new mall in Bangkok with some interesting theming in the style of airport departure gates and floors styled as various cities around the world. Lots of clothes shops, some standard chains and a number of restaurants of various sorts. Couldn't help but feel the shop layout was a little like an upmarket market. No real high end shops here.Food court on the fifth floor was great though. Once you work out the system of putting credit on a card at the cashier you then go to any counter and get your food, they take it off your card and way you go. Lots of good stuff, and almost street food prices so very cheap. Once you have finished, hand your card back to the cashier and get any remaining credit refunded.Great for a quick cheap lunch. Would not hesitate to try again.

Amazing Concept. Nice way to take in some sightseeing in a shopping centre. Wonderful concept each floor. My daughters shopped while my husband and I walked each floor and took photos. Amazing. We had lunch in the food court up top. Good food and Great choices. Also nice and cool. Something all the family can enjoy for free too.

Unique Mall with Great Food Court. We decided to visit Terminal 21 at the last minute, but I was glad we did. Each floor of the mall has theme (Paris, London, Istanbul etc). Many people were snapping photos with theme objects. It was unique, airy and open.We decided to have supper here too, and the food court offered one of the best choices in town. The price is right, and choices were plenty. I will definitely go back if I visit Bangkok again.

Very interesting . Five or six floors didn't quite understood that, each have it's own design and name. Top two floors are food areas and thing you want. Each floor specializes in something food, shoes, etc. Easy to rich from subway

shop here!. A very nice mall with a great variety of items which are fairky priced.I was lucky to be there during the mid year sale therefore i got great items at great prices.Each floor is themed as a city and thus its great adventure.Be sure to visit the food court first to stock up on energy for shopping! :-)

good visit i you like food. currently in bangkok as i write thisstaying at the hotel next door to the terminal 21 shopping centre which is rather bigbut s a foodie this is a added bonus top 2 floors packed with restaurants and a busy food courtthen i think level 1 it looks like a permanent food exhibitionthe fresh mangoes was sweet and tastybought a few street snacks like thr pork jerkydef worth a visit, theres high street shops and boutiques as well

Great place to discover Thai food. If you have never tried Thai food or were put off by experimenting at a more expensive venue for fear of not liking what you ordered, The food court at Terminal 21 is the answer. The Thai food on the 5th floor food court is authentic Thai. Also you will note that the vast majority of the people eating there are Thai. The food is as inexpensive as your typical street vendor food, and just as good.This allows you to experiment with a little of this and a little of that for just over a dollar for each serving. The serving sizes are geared for Thais and is far from super size. So combining 2 dishes makes a hearty meal of it, and that is a good thing. Seeing that all of that food is likely less expensive than your typical single order from Starbucks, it is value, value, value. Even if you don’t like what you ordered, being out a dollar is not hard to take. Just get back up and try something else. To use the food court you need to get a card at the cashier. You put money into the card and the card is used throughout the food court. Then when you are done just return the card to the cashier to be refunded what you did not spend. I suggest putting between 100 and 150 Baht on the card per person, you will get back what you don’t use.The one down side is finding a seat during busy times. Wandering about with a tray in your hand is often the case. But with roughly 500 seats, one will become available in just a minute or so.Then once you have a bit more confidence in what you like in Thai cuisine, you can head off to a more upscale place if you are looking to set the mood for other adventures in Bangkok be they public or private.

Bangkok in June 2014. I visited Terminal 21 which is located in Bangkok's Sukumvit in June 2014.As a renowned shopping centre in Bangkok, Terminal 21 is "attractive" with its amenities, from eateries to restaurants and stalls to shops. These amenities contribute towards creating the atmosphere of the cities (London, Paris, etc) in which the levels inside Terminal 21 are named. My trip to Bangkok was short, lasting for 2 days only and I stayed in Sukumvit most of the time. As a tourist, I consider this trip relaxing, enjoyable and pleasing. There was a strong sense of security which allowed tourists like me to enjoy what Bangkok could offer: good food and enjoyable shopping, amounting to a satisfying and fulfilling short vacation.

Great Mall in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is a great place to shop, eat and watch a movie. Just like most malls except this mall is walking distance to Soi Cowboy and a short BTS (Sky Train) ride from Nana Plaza.
Best mall we have visited. During our visit to Thailand, it was the mall were spent most of time there. Love the layout of the mall arriving in terminals around the world. Has all types of goods.

Break from the norm. This is a cool place to kill a few hours out of the heat in Bangkok. The entire shopping centre is laid out like an airport with security booths and arrivals/departures boards. Every floor represents a different country. It's cheesy and over the top but I loved it and the prices are reasonable for the most part too. I would def recommend a visit here
Halal Food. Food court serves Halal Food that was great. The mall was nice... a little expensive. But there were some attractions to go around and look for ..

5 stars because its different . The rating is based on the uniqueness of this mail. Each level represents a different country such as, Italy, england, japan, usa etc. It actually works well and has good novelty to it. Plenty of little stores and lots of major brand names. Very well priced also. A 2 left food court exists and has something for everyone. To me it looks like the crowd is local upper class young adult. Not as many tourists as i thought. Im glad i visited as i would've been more curious of this if i hadn't. At the end of the day.. Its another mall but it attracted me.

A Reasonable Price Theme Zone Mall. 6 or 7 storeys mini mall ;Located at Aosk junction /Sukhumvit Subway MRTA train; these places has middle range shopping things price; where each floor set in national country theme decoration!! Food court are cheap and yummy also!!

Terminal 21, a different kind of mall.. We found this mall by chance as we were sating at the Rembrandt hotel, a short walk away. It's different to all the other malls we've visited in Bangkok due to each floor being themed. It feels very modern, and is lovely and clean. There seems to be more locals than tourists which is always a good sign. The shopping was excellent with a different variety of things to other malls. The clothes particularly were excellent. We'll definitely return on our next trip to Bangkok.

Clean Toilets. The mall was modern and security was good. Guards were stationed at the entrance to check all bags carried into the mall. Well effort taken to protect the security and welfare of the shoppers. The mall was unique in a way that every floor portraits a different theme. The toilet is a must to visit. I was really surprised that the toilets were well-maintain by the cleaner and it was very clean indeed. There was a cinema in the mall and movie tickets were reasonable priced. It was a good choice to shop in the mall.

I was impressed!. How can anyone not be with those toilets! I've never seen anything like the city themes either, I loved them. We didn't shop as such but enjoyed browsing, & popped in there a few times for our evening meals. The food was good & cheap! I'm still craving a trip to Terminal 21, although I'm back home now. It's a must see!
not that impressed. I read a bit about terminal 21 and I really was expecting more, passed a rainy morning but would not rush to go back.

A different place to shop!. We were surprised to find this shopping mall in Bangkok. Very different and themed to make you think you are somewhere different. Spent a merry afternoon here in the cool and just 'hanging out' as the youngsters seem to.....but we are in our sixties!It had a nice buzz!It may have wheelchair access but I didn't notice, so please check!

great shopping and food. my family loved shopping there. Great range of shops to chose from on each floor. love how it was set up like an airport. Also try out the toiliets, each one is themed. food courts on the top floors really good aswell, prices are good, and you get air con! avoid lunch/tea times, very busy. overall great though

Good to go and have a look:). Accidentally we found the Terminal 21.Each floors are designed with a different counties and we loved to take photos each levels.Even the bathrooms were unique!The most favorite part of the Terminal 21 was the food court.4th floor has mainly sweet shops such as cafe, cake shop, drink shop. 5th floor has a big food court and some restaurants.When you go to the food court around Lunch time (12 ish) or Dinner time(7 ish), you might find seats a bit harder. ( We kept looking for seats for a while one day about 12pm.)It was much better food court than Paragon food court!!

New enjoyable mall. The malls floors are themed to international cities but what I enjoyed were the small shops, booths really, with inexpensive, wild and crazy, unique clothing and other gear. Also the food court is clean and there are many vendors with a variety of different cuisines to enjoy for small money.

Great shopping & dining experience. Centrally located, this is an excellent place to hang-out, spend an entire day or more, have fun eating all sorts of food inside the mall in fancy restaurants or outside on the street with delectable thai cuisine... The mall is on the main ASOKE station of the metro rail of Bangkok, so easily accessible, and is a fun place overall to enjoy your trip....

Creative interiors. This is by far the mall with the most creative interiors I have been to. Every floor is designed with a different city theme such as Mediterranean, Istanbul, Tokyo, London, etc. Floor tiles, shopfront design, lighting are all different, to match the theme. The most amazing touch is that even the toilets are themed. We spent five hours going through the entire mall, visiting all the toilets. Oh yes, free internet access for tourist for two hours. Definitely a must visit, especially the toilets. Be there.

very good malls. these malls sell unique of clothes and accesories, mostly handmade by local. I found alot of good clothes in here. Also the food court serve delicious food with cheap price. Can reach these mall by sky train or mrt.

The best food court. If you happen to go to Terminal 21, you must eat at the level 5 food court. Here you purchase an amount to a card where you can you at the many food stalls. If you don't use all the money in your card, you can get the money back. The atmosphere was clean and very welcoming. Food prices were absolutely cheap! Quality of food was great too! Love this food court. It's even cheaper than street food! You eat in the comfort of an airconditioned area and the tables are constantly cleaned by the cleaners. Wonderful concept and wonderful prices. It's a must!

Creative & Stylish Mall at Asok!. The concept of the mall is really creative and fantastic! Every single floor has a different country theme. It is very cool! I can't get enough of that lol The food court is awesome! many choices to choose what to eat! cheap, delicious, and clean! and the view is nice too! Many shops and restaurants! Very lovely mall! Just one thing I don't like is the theatre.. it is quite small and uncomfortable.

VERY COOL. Modern shopping mall, every floor has a theme British, Japan, Middle East, lots of quirky shops, very unique design clothing very different to what the other malls sell in Bangkok. Has a very trendy food court upstairs clean and cool lots of choice, Highly recommended for window shopping. Easy accces very the BTS. Next door is also the Robinson Shopping Centre.

Most amazing & creative mall I've been!. Such an amazing mall with a great concept! Really enticing and great way to keep customers from leaving the mall with all there is to see and explore.What I love most is the female toilets that are decorated and furnished according the the country each level is assigned to, so every single toilet is different! Spent about thirty minutes going to the ladies on every level to take pictures. Also, the view from the floor-to-ceiling glass windows are amazing! The cleaners also dress up according to the country they're "in".Really cute mall with lots of small quaint stores:) Great mall atmosphere!

Convenient location and various good restaurant there!. This shopping mall is big, you can get anythings you want there. For me, I enjoy dining in there. There are several good restaurants that you can try! Personally, I prefer Thai food most!I enjoy go to their big supermarket to buy snacks. There are many small shops selling special style fashionsIt is good to spend half day there!

Nice mall. Terminal 21 is a modern mall with hundreds of small boutiques and a few big stores. It’s not a mall where you can bargain like MBK, but there is some good bargains you can find. The food court on the very top of the mall is the best deal. One floor below has all the name brand restaurants. It connected to the Askoe , Skytrain so you can easily access.
New and it has everything. Good location with many little shops and many restaurants. Cinema on the 6th floor and many hotels in walking distances.

great food at Pier 21 in Terminal 21. Great food at Pier 21 in Terminal 21. All the local thais eat there including college students. So you really can't go wrong. The prices are same as the street vendors and quality and cleanliness far surpasses them.

Fun photo opportunities!. Loved this place for the way they have done up the place. Each floor is a destination (Level M was Paris, France, and it also had Hollywood, San Francisco, Tokyo, and London). Each level has a few fun things from the destination (London - red Double Decker, Hollywood - movie producer statue, etc.) And it is quite big, so hours and hours of fun. I didn't shop, but I enjoyed myself so much, looking at all these attractions. And the location is great! BTS, MRT all extremely close by, and was on the opposite block to my hotel, Windsor Suites. Some of the best hours in Thailand this time.

The cheapest food at the Bangkok Shopping Center. My family consists of 4 pax have visited Bangkok in June 2014. Our accoommodation nearby the Terminal 21 Shopping Mall. We found that the Terminal 21 food court has a wide variety of hawker food and it is very cheap compare with the food court at other shopping mall.The food price range from THB30 to THB50. A plate of Chicken Rice cost THB30 and other noodles as well. The food court located at 6th Floor and it is next to Ashok MTR station.The food court environment also good and has a good view. Thus, if you want to try a good and cheap food in Shopping mall, Terminal 21 peir food court can not be miss.

Shopping center with value for money. This shopping center is a great one, vey nice to go around and see all the different kind of things they sell, here you will definately find a souvenir to bring home.Worth mentioning is the toilets here, try them out when you'r there!What really sold me on this shoping center is the restaurants, many to choose from with a variety of foods, a good place for al us foodies.

Good location BEst of its kind. Sukhumvit Soi.....its just right situated in the heart of the area. You have best outlets, with best food chain shops, as well as cinema theater. Plus mostly you will love the mall interior its done as if you are really in a terminal building. The pricing of the shops are worthy of buying things. The qualities are best. I just love shopping there. Its the most favorite place of mine if i am in Thailand.Just one request you need to increase your electrical or mobile outlets more with better shops.

You'll find the take-home gifts here. Conveniently located on the train line, the Thai level of this shopping mall offers many quality attractive items appropriate for your souvenirs and gifts. I did a lot of business with a jewelry crafter, who put together custom items on-the-spot for me, saving me trips to other retailers, and getting me unique items for my special gifts. There is a stainless steel housewares shop that has an extensive array of unique and very attractive items, as well as fabric stores, tailors, clothing, and decorative houseware items. Fun to look at the attractive displays, whether you buy or not. Comfortably air conditioned, with elevators/escalators and clean bathrooms. Variety of restaurants close by.

Really cool and Imaginative Shopping centre. what a cool place for a walk around or a bite to eat... Each level is themed of a Country or Area, and its done Brilliantly..most of the shops dont have relevance to the country.. except for i'd say Japan... the Fashion on that level is very Close to what you'd find in the funky area's of Tokyo..well worth a walk around if you like the not-so-normal shopping mall... lots of food options on the top floor.

Creative Shopping Complex. Like other shopping complex, Terminal 21 has branded shops that sell clothes, electronic gadget, and stuff... however its architecture is simply special to visit. The food court offers local foods which is cheaper than expected!!!Just take BTS to Sukhumvit, Terminal 21 is just in front of you once you drop there.

Mall with different countries theme at each level. The mall is very big, nice and clean. Each level is decorated in different country theme, eg Istanbul theme, Japan theme and London theme, even the toilet is decorated in the country theme. The things sold here is not as cheap as compare to Platinum mall or Chatuchak but its a unique mall which offer a different kind of shopping experience. Also not to forget about all the restaurants in this mall.
Want something unique?. This is absolutely the best shoppingmall for original clothes,hads,scarves, shoes and accessories and great gifts. No touristic stuff buth original self made artist !

Great Food. This shopping centre is very easy to get to, you can walk straight into it from Asok BTS station, I never really looked around the shops, but on the 5th floor there is an amazing food court, you first have to go to a cashier and get them to 'load' some money onto a card you then walk around the various different kitchens and order what you want they cook it in front of you and deduct the cost off your pre payment card, it is great food and SO cheap, four or five plates of food and a drink for less than 200B. When you have finished you return the pre payment card to the cashier and she returns any money you still have on it, all so easy!

Average mall, excellent food court. Large modern spacious shopping mall along busy Sukhumvit at BTS Asoke. Good place to get out of the sweltering heat and spend an hour or two windowshopping. However we did not find the shops, layout or the "airport" theme very interesting. Overall, it lacks the elegance of Siam Paragon and diverse personality of other shopping malls in Bangkok. However, top marks for the excellent food court offering a wide range of local and Asian food with fast, efficient service. Although the servings are rather small, the average price of 50-70 baht per plate makes dining here an absolute bargain. It's practically street food prices and lower than the food courts in other malls. Oh yes...do check out the washrooms on each floor as the luxurious decor are all different based on the country theme of the floor.

Unique. Considering that this mall is relatively new in Bangkok, my family's curiosity is piqued and decided to visit the mall on our first day in the city and we found out that it is indeed unique because you feel like checking in at an airport. However, the awe stopped from there because the stores, boutiques and choices are limited and expensive. Overall, it is nice to hang-out in this mall but not really to shop.

Decent Place to Eat and Shop. Terminal 21, I found to just be a place to eat and shop, and there are places to eat and shop all over Bangkok. This does have the benefit of being in a great location that is easy to access from many other parts of the city via public transit. The rest of it was all cool, but if have already heard about it, might be disappointed. The fact every floor is themed after a different city is a bit overhyped. Most of this is just very limited decorations related to that city and is mixed with large multinational brands, and Thai brands too, some disorganized and some things where they shouldn’t belong.One nice appeal to this place is food. The food court I believe is located 3 floors higher than the ground level (G). Be warned there is levels below ground level. This has delicious Thai food popular with Bangkok residents. There is also Jaeh (thai word for vegan) food in the same food court. I ordered bags of take out of that for just 35 baht per serving. There are many other places to eat besides the food court. For example one floor down from it has MK, Mexican Grill, a Japanese restaurant, Swenson Ice cream and other shops. Another floor has a Starbucks, and Subway is down on the Caribbean level, and here I’m just mentioning what I remember. Point is food in the food court and food spread all over.The shopping was filled with a mix of name brand and generic. There is some brand specific shops. The ones I noticed included Levis, Nike, and a Roxy&Quiksilver store. There are far more shops not named after a brand but many of which do sell brand names. The places we browsed had prices that were on the higher side, but nothing all that unreasonable either.Worth a mention is the supermarket for grocery on the lower ground (LG) level is very good. This has everything you could need and more for groceries and snacks, as well as a good salad bar too. This is self-serve, but when finished they seal it airtight. For those staying in the area hotels, that salad bar is a great option for taking back something to snack on between meals.This mall is however not much of a tourist attraction. Siam Paragon, or even MBK, is a place tourists might enjoy more. For families with children needing to make a choice of which mall to pass time in, Siam Paragon has much more to offer with their arcades, ocean world, toy store in Robinsons (which has games inside it and ability to sit playing with legos) etc. That place also has the same shopping as Terminal 21 and much, much, much more on top. I rate this place average just because Bangkok has great shopping malls, and again this place is mostly just a place to shop and eat which can be found all over Bangkok. The positives are location, and an attempt to make it more interesting with having the airport / various city theme.

A little disappointing. Visited Terminal 21 with great expectations. Unfortunately I wasnt as impressed as I had hoped to be. I was staying in Sukhumvit while in Bangkok and was looking forward to this new shopping mall being on my doorstep (relatively speaking)The reality was that the mall is large, themed to look and feel like an airport with each floor dedicated to a different city and has a good selection of international brand shops.The problem for me was that it was a bit soulless, it was trying to hard to be international, to be cool and different and it was not enough Thai.I did however buy my wife a new handbag and purse at the Guess store :)I think its a great place for kids to hang out and spend their time after school and at the weekends, lots of food outlets an all floors and a whole floor at the top is just restaurants but for me I did most of my shopping at my favourite MBK.

A great mall with great food court. It's a great shopping mall with different theme at each level. Next to Asoke bts station. Most of the shops sell branded stuff. As branded goods are cheaper in Singapore, we did not get anything there. The foodcourt is amazing. Food is simply delicious. We tried food in different food court, platinum mall, central world, etc. This foodcourt is the best!!! We had the pad thai, mango sticky rice, coconut ice cream, etc. Reasonable price and delicious food.

Nice haven from the heat of Bangkok. Connected to Asoke BTS by skywalk, we visited Terminal 21 (coming from Ploenchit BTS-2 stops west) with the intention of buying a local sim card to save on the extortionate UK roaming/call charges. We ended up doing this at the DTAC store on the top floor for anyone interested.We probably ended up spending around 2 hours here in total as we didn't realise there was a food quarter, and didn't realise the whole building would be so modern with air conditioning. If you fancy a change from local cuisine, there is a fantastic Mexican restaurant as well as many others, or even if you just want to get out of the heat and humidity for half hour and you're in the area, have a coffee here, you won't regret it.

MBK Substitute. shops - many small shops that are selling good stuff and at good pricesvariety - not too bad but sold many things which can be found in MBK but this is a MUCH nicer mallpeople - locals, tourists, teens (the ladies - SWOI MAK)food - ee-nee-mai-nee-ee-nee-moh.. yup, its THAT manyBTS - AsokMRT - Sukhumvit

Take your time. Located at Asok BTS and directly connected to the station. A themed shopping mall that looks like an airport terminal. The concept of each level is inspired by local cities features like London, Tokyo, Istanbul, San Francisco. There are lots of small, inexpensive shops with funky and stylish products made in Thailand. Even though you are not interested in shopping, you will be interested in dining here,as the food court is great!

Ambience, great location, super shopping, fab food hall. Terminal 21 is one of those huge shopping complexes you go back to every time you're in town. There's everything you need in the spectacularly set out 6+basement floors. It's light, airy and spacious, clean and colorful. I love the thematic setup of each floor together with its appropriate ornamentation. And as for the 5th floor food hall - exquisite, and so inexpensive; I don't know why anyone would bother cooking at home with this available!

Cool shopping mall. This is quite a cool shopping mall close to our hotel. The cinema on top floor is high standard with some English language movies, and the floor below has a nice food hall with cheap Thai food. There are other bigger malls but this one is a bit different.

A good place for picture taking. I like how they make every floor a theme park! There are Istanbul, Tokyo, San Francisco, Londo, and so on. The supermarket is not that good there (a little bit expensive), but the food court upstairs is pretty good. For me, it's a good place to take pictures, and get a good mood in terminal 21.

Great Shopping in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is a shopping centre along Sukhumvit Road in Bangkok near the Asok Skytrain Station and a lot of the hotels in Sukhumvit. It is very new and has a lot of quite small stores, that sell unique and quirky items. It is not like some of the other better known tourist type Malls in that the items are sold are generally not the typical tourist stuff you see everywhere. A lot of items I have seen here for sale I have not seen elsewhere. It is quite big and will take many hours to explore.I found it a great place to buy gift for my family that differed from the usual stuff sold on the street and in other well known malls.There is a cinema and gym complex on the top floor, and extensive food available on the top and bottom two floors. Toilets in this complex were free always very clean.This shopping centre had the longest escalator that I have ever seen!

Very convenient place. Now I found that Gourmet Market under ground floor. This shop is smaller than Siam's one. But you can find good quality foods, beverages, etc. It must be useful. In food court you can have nice Thai meal less than 100 bahts. (I did not have other than Thai food. So I do not know other meal is less or expensive.)On the middle floor I could watch traditional dancing for Songkran festival. It was held until 20th of April.On the 6th floor there is IT terminal. You can find some mobile phone and gadget.

Swanky and well positioned in middle of bangkok. We found this to be a very upmarket hotel, we felt a little outta place in our tshirts and jandals. Breakfasts were spectacular and free!! Hotel staff wonderful cant really complain

Very fun decor on each floor, with interesting toilets and dainty small shops that is perfect for roaming around before. Each floor has detailed decor. The toilets are decorated with the same theme. Even the security guard is dressed to the theme. The food court is very affordable. The cinema sound system and screen resolution is very impressive (we watched Captain America The Winter Soldier). Shops sell similar stuff to Chatuchak but at higher proceed. But well, you get a aircon environment.

Unique theme shopping center with great food. Went to Terminal 21 by taking the underground to Sukumvit. Found this shopping center to be interesting as each floor is themed after a familiar city example, London, Rome, Tokyo, the Caribbean, etc. However, I found the shopping experience to be less interesting as compared to those in Siam, MBK Or Centra World.However, one plus point is the food center on the top floor of the building. A great choice of food & I really had a wonderful feast there from 'pard thai' (fried flat noodles) to hot plate oysters.Would suggest to go there for the unique experience but more so for some excellent Thai street food.

Mall at Asok BTS/Sukhumvit MRT. Good shopping mall and better footfall than some of the other malls we visited in Bangkok.We didn't buy much but I saw some interesting stuff around. They have a massive food court and many restaurants on almost all floors. Mexican, Chinese, Japanese et al.. I didn't see many shoe shops. Mainly clothes and restaurants.

It was awesome. Love the concept travelling to different cities with different themes each level. The bathrooms were immaculate, so much great variety to choose from with food, clothes and everything else in between. The size of the place was massive as well. This is a must do in Bangkok, you won't regret it.

Eat and go mad shopping. This is a must do Eat and go mad shopping here at Terminal 21Check out all the shops plenty of bargains to be had and the friendly staff will give discount on merchandise is asked politelyFrom clothes to electronics it's a blastDo yourself a favor and visit Terminal 21 when in Bangkok

Eat here and don't miss the bathrooms!. Food court is currently the best of Bangkok malls as of April 2014. Price better than Siam Paragon and taste just as good. Don't miss the dessert Mango with sweet rice. Very interesting decorations, all malls should be themed! We found the best decorations were in the bathrooms on each floor and we visited them all. Some even piped in unique smells such as sourdough bread for the San Francisco floors. Japan bathroom was my favorite, which is yours?

Not Much Variety. This is a large, modern shopping and eating mall with escalators to each floor (each named after a city) or an express escalator that takes you directly to about the 3rd floor.The toilets are amazing with an arm rest with bout 12 push button controls though I've never had the nerve to press any!The shops, however, are mostly very "samey" clothes shops.There are restaurants, phone shops etc as well, though.There is a cinema on the top floor, though not a great variety of films shown.

unique theme. As its theme suggest, the entrance feels like checking into the airport. Every level leads you to a different country.As we were quite hectic in our shopping, we did not spend time taking the photos. For my mom & I, our target would be the food court above.We have visited a few food courts in our 3d 2n trip, & find the prices here the most economical. The oyster omelette taste great but the pad thai is only so so. The fruit juice & dessert is great though.There's a small Jap cafe on one of the level that serves really delicious cakes…Next time if we ever to pop by longer, gonna spend more time there!
Interesting themed mall. Visited this mall on 11 April 2014. Located at Asok BTS. Walking distance from BTS NANA.Have alot of shops in it.Interesting themed mall.

Can shop, eat or just hang over. It can be comfortably reached by sky train, get off at Asoke station. They have a wonderful food court with extremely reasonable price and I'm not disappointed with the cloth pants those were sold there. Pants' style and quality were great but the price was much cheaper than other bangkok's leader shopping malls I visited.

A visual feast. So many malls, so little time. In terms of preference, this is my number 2 amongst my top 5 favorite malls in Bangkok, right after Siam Paragon, and ahead of Centralworld, Siam Center, and MBK, in that order. Like many reviewers before me, I too was drawn to the interior design themes. However, I would not call it a themed mall, considering the products or merchandise being sold are mostly unrelated to the theme of the floor in which the stores are located. So the so-called "theme" is just decoration, nothing more really. That said, it is unique as the design sets it apart from other shopping complexes in town. What do I like about it then? Well, food. Again, there are choices that cater to all tastes and budgets. But my favorite would be the food court selling mostly Thai street food. There are enough varieties to satiate ones appetite. The best part of it all is that it is cheap, very cheap, comparable to those you would find at the roadside stalls.For those who are into fashion, there are hundreds of small little outlets with mainly locally-designed goods. Many of these stores carry products that cater mainly to the younger generation. Though not all are cheap, it is still worth checking out.The easiest way to reach the mall is by Skytrain. Get off at the Asoke stop. The mall is right next to the station and is connected by passage ways.Chris Lee
best mall in bangkok. i love how they create the theme of the mall. each floor each country, they even decorated the bathroom, it looks really nice

A Themed Shopping Mall. This was our first trip to the mall after it being recomended by friends and I must say for a shopping mall it did its good points.It is what I would call a "themed" mall with each of its 9 floors being based on cities from around the world.LG Floor - CaribbeanThis theme is Caribbean Beach Town, decorated with a beach, a sea anchor and a lighthouse. It contains a Gourmet supermarket, quick service restaurants, banks, bookshops and convenience shops.G Floor - RomeThis is reserved for luxury brands and brand name boutiques, It is decorated with marble, sculptures Roman mythological figures, and well-known paintings.M Floor - ParisIt's Champs-Élysées Boulevard and Parisian Streets theme, full of Thai designer's boutiques and beauty shops. It is decorated sculptures with Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower.1st Floor - TokyoThis floor is themed after the Nakamise-Dōri Market and Harajuku Town. It is mainly ladies boutiques, decorated with sculptures of Sumo, Torii and Maneki Neko.2nd Floor - LondonDecorated with iconic red telephone boxes, London's double-decker buses, Tower Bridge and a Union Jack Flag. The theme is Oxford Street in London, with mini-shops of men's wear, jeans and sporting goods.3rd Floor - IstanbulAn Istanbul Market Town theme, decorated with Istanbul style lamps. It is full of mini-shops of shoes, bags, jewellery, gifts and decoration products.4th Floor - San Francisco CityThe theme is Chinatown of San Francisco.and is decorated with sculptures of the San Francisco Trams and Golden Gate Bridge, serving for Thailand's famous restaurants.5th Floor - San Francisco (Pier) international restaurants and a food court Pier 21. It is decorated with seaports and fisherman village's, themed after Fisherman's Wharf.6th Floor - Hollywood Hollywood Studio, decorated with sculptures of the Hollywood Sign and an Oscar Statue. It has an 8 screens Cinema , a health club and spa and IT & Mobil phone products .Well worth a visit and not far from Asok BTS train station.Remember to take a camera too!

Terminal 21 for Food . It's a swanky shopping centre or 'mall' if you like so expect it to be expensive but don't let that put you off because even if you can't afford the shopping - go for the food. Pick up a food card at the counter - (100thb will get a feast for two!!) then wander around the stalls to see what you like the look of. Personally, today we had the this noodle beef green curry, a bamboo curry with rice, spring rolls and sweet corn fritter type things. Beware!! Greed alert. It's all so cheap and all so tasty you will stuff yourself. Enjoy!!

Feel the difference here.. Nice and cool experience you would get here. There are so many shops, restaurants, cafes and interests of oneself, though you can go there during day time, but I would suggest to visit at night. Very nice place to go and very easy to go, just take Sky train to to BTS Asok..
Nice Mall, expensive stuff. Nice mall with good theme. However, the things there doesnt come cheap. There is a tops supermarket there. Spent around an hour there.

Good Currency Exchange, Eclectic Fashions & Excellent Food Court. Hotel concierge recommended Terminal 21 for currency exchange in the Sukhumvit area. Loved the layout of the mall, exploring the various themed floors, and food court. Each floor has a theme - Rome for fashion, Harajuku for funky eclectic styles, SF Pier 21 for food. Not the best prices in Bangkok, but a nice, new shopping mall with high quality local fashions/goods.Pros: Ground floor has a legitimate/secure currency exchange with good rates, air conditioning, inexpensive and popular food court on top floor (mango & sticky rice, papaya salad, etc.), fun/diverse local shops.Cons: Shopping mall prices.

Great experience. We are not mall people, and never meant to visit a mall in BKK. We arrived here by mistake, and loved it. Great smart concept (terminal - on each floor you arrive to a different city in the world), great design (each city's landmarks appear beautifully throughout each floor. Seriously - just going into the toilet in each floor is a design experience) great thinking with small "market streets" for each city (we did most our shopping in 'Camden market'), and great attention to details on every aspect. This is by far the best mall experience I've ever had. You won't find many big expensive brands here. Moderate price international brands (like H&M) and good local stylish and inexpensive shops make this mall great value for money as well. We did most of our BKK shopping here.

Works on so many levels (pun intended). As a shopping mall it works on so many levels (pun intended), for kids, family, individuals, groups of friends , tourists and dating couples. Whether it is to eat, relax, buy, window shop have photo opportunities you can do no wrong and visit Terminal 21, be it your 1st trip to Bangkok or not.

Mall with theme floors. When we went to Terminal 21 it looked like any other premium shopping mall, only when we entered we found it very different. This market/mall has different theme floors. Mix of modern and traditional theme from London to Middle east and far east. It is a premium mall and while roaming around Sukhamvit one should visit the mall.

world's cities come alive on every floor. more than the shopping - the concept is so much funwith every floor themed after a city - so you have paris - istanbul - london - Rome - all at one place(even the washrooms are individually designed - on every floor)shopping - good bargainsfood - plenty - from the basement level & then on the 5th floorCinemas - SFX& whats more its right IN sukhumvitjust GO!!

Lots to see, bargains to find. For Bangkok this is a very American mall. However, there are shops that have designs made inThailand and good prices. You just have to find them. The food at Pier 21 on the top floor is excellent and true Thai. It has street food prices but is clean and can be trusted. We ate here most days after seeing rats running around the street vendors carts. Eating at Pier 21 was an adventure into Thai cuisine each day.

Themed Mall. Honestly, I'd thought what could be so special about another shopping mall. It turns out that Terminal 21 was a themed shopping mall!Every floor has it's own design based on various cultures, and every detail was captured very superbly.A must visit are the bathrooms on every floor, especially the Japanese one.

Worth to shop there!. I was found that place in internet before I went to Bangkok.This shopping mall will give you unexpected visions.Each floor was separated by countries.For one example, Paris floor was most filled with Paris branded shops,Paris city decoration.The food court is also filled with international foods.We ate at cute decorated seafood restaurant.it was a little expensive,but the taste was amazing and the decorative will make you pleased.As the mall is combined with famous branded and some Thailand local designers clothes,it was worthy place to shop there.You can easily get there with Skytrain,it was linked with Asoke station.
WOW. Never see it before. Is great to visit.Amazing shooting place.Exit at station Asok , walk 3 min, is terminal 21. Must find every restroom , you will never see it before

Great and Interesting Shopping Centre! Good food options downstairs!. Its a great place to visit even if you dont like shopping! So much to see and take photos of. It is set out as an airport theme then country themes on each level, very interesting and decorative mall. The food there had a good choice. Its similar to what you find at markets but theres no scammers or people who pressure you to buy. Infact, the staff were so unenthused with their jobs in some shops they had fallen asleep. This wasnt that unusual but we saw about 6 different shops where the shop assistants were asleep at the counter. This was an interesting photo opportunity for someone western as you would lose your job for doing that in a western country! :)

Best shopping mall on Sukhumvit. Bangkok got 3 main shopping areas for tourists: Silom, Sukhumvit and Khao San road. The best shopping malls are all near SIAM area (Paragon, Central World, Gaysorn...) but if you prefer Thai brands and thai prices, definitely visit Terminal 21 mall. Right near Asoke BTS and MRT stations, this new shopping mall got amazing food court on 5th floor (chicken steak and french fries for 35 baht?), many popular restaurants like Fuji and Swensens, but the best thing about this mall is the design. Every floor is named after different famous city eg: London, Paris, Istanbul and even the toilets are matching the design of these cities. Its got many good places to take photos and the highlight has to be the massive lift rising from basement all the way to 3rd floor. TIP: the best coffee shop there is not Starbucks or Coffee world but the one tucked in the corner of the food court on 5th floor. Amazing iced espresso for 30 baht anyone?

really had fun here !. this place is so unique.. every floor has different theme. i love the London floor ! when i was there, there was a musical appearance, Beatles looks alike, they performed in front of the red bus.dont hesitate to take a picture EVERYWHERE.. really.. EVERYWHERE.. this mall has many good spot to take a picture !
Loved the food court on level 5. During my latest trip to Bangkok, I ate several times at the food court on level 5. Cheap and lots of variations. It gets crowded, but it's a huge place.

Great shopping mall. Very nice interior. Every floor is in style of another country or city like: Paris, Brooklyn, London, etc.
Lots of small shops with cool clothes, accessories and technical stuff.
Most of the malls in Bangkok are home to mayor brands, this mall has it all + all the little boutiques.
Very nice, recommended.

Not the Ordinary Mall. A themed mall. Very trendy and preppy. It's like an airport terminal. Each floor of this Bangkok shopping mall has a different theme based on various cities around the world, so it's like traveling to a new shopping venue when you hit each floor.My favorite is the 1st floor which featured Tokyo. The set up was really good. Filled with small shops with various clothes made by local designers. My daughters were able to buy shirts and blouses at cheap prices in this floor. Good quality for the price. Of course there are branded stores, too.Even their restrooms are different in every floor. And as you alight the escalators in every floor there's a landmark that would greet you. There's so much to see. You have to visit all the floors and enjoy everything that is featured. If you are a camera addict then take pictures as much as you want. Great souvenir shots.There are lots of restaurants that you could choose from. All types of cuisines. We dined @ The Terrace Restaurant - Thai Cuisine. Reasonably priced and the food was excellent.

Such a fun place to eat and wander around. This shopping centre is such a unique place to visit with each floor representing a different country. The toilets in the 'England' area were heated and had many buttons. The clothes are for the smaller sized people but some European sixes are available. Such a fun place to visit! It has named shops and little boutiques with unique pieces.
Favourite mall. Great food choices, interesting local designers, just the right size - not too big or small. Also enjoyed the cinema experience here.

Trendy local fashion beyond the normal uninspired tourist wares. Half the mall are known brands, but the real highlight are the multitude of small shops. Some of these small shops are indeed local designers with their own designs, some are trendy shops that sell a variety of brands that fit the theme if the store, while some are just slightly dressed up MBK stalls. Take your time through these small stores, they really are the gem of the entire mall. When done, go to the top and enjoy the awesome food court which blows MBK out of the water in pricing and taste.

A shopping mall. Its a shopping mall. Yopu could be anywhere in the world. If you want to spend some time shopping go ahead but there is nothing special about this place. Standard shops at western prices. The only reason I found this interesting was to see that some Thai people have lifestyles similar to the rest of the world. If you are here on holiday I would recommend seeing the city and do the same shopping back home.Also there is aircon and the toilets are clean and interesting.

Amazing. Amazing shopping mall, food facilities and cinema complex.A lot to see and a vast variety of food available on the upper floors. Open between 10am-10pm and located on Sukhumvit Road between soi 19 to 21, easy access from either BTS- Asok stop, or the MRT.Minutes walk from our hotel so after resting from a long haul flight this was our first visit in Bangkok. We were not disappointed. Definitely recommended.

GREAT Mall. I think this might be my favorite mall in bangkok, i wont spoil the suprise i will just say that this is a themed mall. It is themed as an airport and the floors are countries that you visit. I must say it is very cool and there are lots of themed suprises in store if you visit. TIP: there is free wifi for 1 year if you register for it at the customer service desk and the wifi is fast.Theres a cinema here and lots of deals to be had if you like shopping as well as lots of great places to hang out and eat.

Nice shopping mall. We have been to terminal21 many times and we really like it here. Nice inside, food court is good and plenty of shopping to do. The mall is well maintained and connected to BTS makes it easy to get in and out.

first rate shopping complex. Must see mall. Shopping, eating, movies. its all here. variety of shops should take care most of your needs, with multinational restaurants with great variety. Restaurants are great bargains, with food and services being better than average to great. Close to subway, skytrain for easy access.

Unique concept. The concept of every floor being dedicated to a country is very novel. Not only are the floors dedicated to different countries, but also have products that one is likely to find in that country.
The variety of stuff available is mind boggling.

Never seen a mall like this before!. I really wished I had brought more money when I visited Thailand! I have never seen a mall built like this before. They had a lot of cute clothing and really good food places.

Must be there. One of the most popular place in Bangkok. Every floor is decorated with different country theme.
Brand shoppers definitely like this one.

Great for dining and some shopping. The shopping center is located at Asoke-Sukhumvit junction and can also be reach by MRT (Sukhumvit Station) or BTS (Asoke Station).
Each floor is themed after a city (London, San Francisco, Istanbul, etc.) and there are a lot of really good restaurants most of the floors.

What an amazing world themed mall!. Amazing design of this mall. I was so intrigued, I want to research the interior designer. They did a fantastic job and its a site to see in Bangkok- even if you dont care to shop. The 5th floor has great clean food at cheap prices too!
Beautiful. This sopping must be visited, it is beautiful, each floor dedicated for a special city , at tjhe last one you have a lot of restaurants and a amazing decorated area...I loved it...
Great mall for food and movies. It's a gigantic mall with a themed floors... good for food tripping and great movie cinemas and great location to take some photos.
not a regular thai shopping. The mall is very good but its not a regular thai shopping place like mbk for indira market.. the shops are bit up-scale but ya the stuff is very good.

A different place to shop.. This shopping centre comprises of 5 or so floors from different cities including London, Tokyo, San Francisco and Paris. My young adult son really enjoyed shopping in the London boutiques as they offered different clothes.
It is well set out and offers something different to the other shopping malls.

gourmet market. use to go to emporium down the bts, but no there's a wee smaller one downstairs in terminal 21. would you believe prices are a little bit cheaper than down the bts? and they are. they dont have a bigger selection but items i did but were cheaper. and if you cant find it there go across to top market downstairs of robinsons. over there is massage place at 300bt for 1 hr. very nice and lots of tourist and locals popping in. back to terminal 21 also eat at safeen duck and steak by lao. bargain meals - the food court is too noisy and crowded and too cheap, really cheap food. pay the extra bt and get a seat and waited on. as for shops too much for the twenty crowd. and shirts and suits i went to dino's across the street next to sheraton grande - best price i have gotten on tailored shirts but i bought the materials from home and at nai chan in central world. also brought two shirts i like for them to copy. at steak by lao - have the crab curry and the garlic chili clams and dont forget the fermented pork from up northeast.

Go for Lunch or Dinner. While I enjoy outdoor markets and bargains, I am not a shopper in any sense of the word. Nevertheless, Terminal 21 is located very close to the hotel at which I stayed. Good reviews piqued my curiosity.From my ("non shopper") vantage point, it is just another mall. There is nothing I can say about the prices. The floors are essentially ordered by what is being sold: women's clothing on one floor, shoes and leather bags on another. This gives the shopper the ability to easily compare goods and prices. Whether it is better or not than other malls in Bangkok, I really don't know. I personally do not condone spending a tour to a foreign country in shopping malls.I did enjoy the food court on (if I remember correctly) the fifth floor. There is a tremendous variety of quality food at really good prices. And for that, if for nothing else, I recommend a visit to Terminal 21.Access by MRT ("Sukhumvit") or Skytrain (enter directly from Asoke station).

Boutique Designers at their best. I visited this boutique on several occasions December-January as it was within walking distance of our hotel on Soi 8. It has a great food court not to be missed. I especially liked the layout of the mall, each floor represented a different country-England, France, Istanbul etc with wonderful designer boutique stores. Some of these clothes were quite unique and represented a vast array of Asian designers. This mall unlike others in Bangkok had a different twist. Worth a visit!

One of the best shopping centre's in Bangkok! . After visiting Siam square and shopping around, I found that terminal 21 was one of the best shopping centre's offering individual and one off clothing stores. The sizes can be quite limited to smaller sizes and they are a lot more different to European sizes, however it isn't hard to find clothes that you will love. Bargaining isn't hard at all as they are independent stores so it's easy to grab a deal on multiple purchases within an individual store. The only let down of the shopping Centre is the food court, there isn't that much variety to have a proper filling meal but rather the food is for those that are peckish.

One of the best shopping malls in BKK. I have visted this mall not once but twice in one trip. I visited this mall at the first day i touched BKK as it was cose enough to the hotel that im staying. I really got amazed with this big mall, everything was good the shops, the cafes and the restaurants. I did some shopping at the first day and i came back and did some more shoppings at my last day in bangkok. Great place to shop dont miss it.

The only mall in Bangkok where I would eat. The mall is located just around the Sukhumvit Station. It is very convenient to walk to the mall. And as I recall there is a walkway on the MRT that will lead you right into the building without having to go down to first floor. This is quite convenient as most of the MRT stations in Bangkok do not have escalators.

Interesting to visit if you have time. Themed shopping, with each floor named after a different city. Nice and clean with mainly small boutique type shops selling stuff you don't really need at prices you don't really want to pay. Lot's of shoe shops and restaurants. Not really an attraction and neither is it a place for serious shopping but worth popping in for a look if you happen to be in the area and have time.

Unique Concept Mall. Terminal21 is located in Asok, and is reachable by BTS to Asok Station. Every floor has different theme, like London, Paris, Tokyo, ect.Not only cloth, pants, ect. The restaurant choices are insane so eclectic. Tons of dessert places.  It's a very nice experience and for all those who love shopping must go there to gain this awesome shopping experience.

touchdown Terminal 21. well this is a very beautiful mall. desgined like an airport terminal, every level for another city/country. many food courts and many shops. worth to visit and very easy to reach. BTS Skytrain station Sukhumvit.

Definitely an impressive mall, but stiff shopkeepers. . This place is huge and tall, and has unique place based themes on every floors.. While the mall is nice to easily spend a couple of hours, what puts you off is the stiff attitude of many shopkeepers.. unlike other places where average Thai always make you feel welcome, this place is not one of them.. many simply don't seem interested and it's difficult to have a conversation with them.. would have lowered a rating by one more, if it was not for the entire get up of the mall itself..

A very nicely design shopping complex with great food court. Terminal21 is located in Asok, and is reachable by BTS to Asok Station. This mall has a very unique concept, with every level containing different architecture and design from cities across the world eg: Tokyo, Paris etc. One thing very special is that every level has a different washroom design! Besides that, the food court located at the top level serves a very good variety of food with extremely affordable price! Dishes like Duck Noodle / Fried Rice / Hainanese Chicken Rice cost on average 35 - 40 bath only! It's definitely a good place to shop and hang out, highly recommended!

Mall with unique theme. A very unique mall with different themes at each floor. Even the toilets at different floors have different themes. Many branded label stores are available in this mall. Not a good place for bargains though but still a good place to find unique stuff.

I have landed at Terminal 21. When you enter Terminal 21 you feel welcomed and at home.
The stores are small and very cool.
Each floor is a travel dream come true from all over the world.
The restaurant choices are insane!
So eclectic. Movie theaters and coffee shops. Tons of dessert places. Great people watching. A really fun mall.

Good Shopping & Eateries. Excellent location on Asoke, Sukhumvit which was very close to our hotel. Nice large modern shopping mall which houses shops like H&M and also has many eateries on the top floor. Very busy around peak times but worth a trip.

Huge and modern. This new and modern shopping center is well worth visiting if you want to do some shopping during your stay in Bangkok. It is organized in an interesting system of worldwide destinations. Quite exclusive and maybe not the ideal place for the great bargains.

Very comfortable seating. SF Cinema in Terminal 21 has the most comfortable, well-designed seats of any cinema I've ever visited. The seats are well-padded, naturally recline, and there is plenty of leg room. I saw "The Wolf of Wall Street", a 3 hour movie in Cinema 7, and not once did I feel uncomfortable, even though it was a long movie. I would definitely see another movie there.

Very Interesting Mall to visit. I went to this mall with my two sons... they loved the mall so much. every floor represent one of cities in the world.. Amazing decoration and so many cute shops. Don't forget to bring your camera with you.. and try to visit every toilet in the mall... hahahaha.. Try it.

Modern Shopping Centre. Modern shopping centre with all british makes as well as some designers. Not sure if things are fake but they're definately not cheap prices. Excellent food court on the top floor, cheaper than street food!!! Also a cinema in this complex.

Many Japanese restaurants. All shopping malls in the center of Bangkok suffer from the Bangkok Shut Down by opposition politicians and so does Terminal 21 on Sukhumvit road.This is a futuristic mall with different themes on each floor going from London over San Francisco to Tokyo (each of the 7 floors another city).It is worth a visit to see the nice structure but for shopping there are better places in Bangkok.On the top floor have several movie theatre showing the latest films.On each floor there are several restaurants, but for Japanese food, you have the biggest choice on San Francisco floor

Awesome Shopping at this state of the art mall. I simply loved shopping there, not because of anything else, but simply because of its state of the art presentation. We spent hours in this mall doing shopping, dining without feeling how the time passed by. It's a very nice experience and for all those who love shopping must go there to gain this awesome shopping experience.

Cool idea. The themes of each level is a really cool idea, makes it a lot more intriguing to pop onto every level just to see the cities. The shopping is very westernized. Most shop assistants aren't bothered by a sale so don't really talk to you, good if you want a break from market stall owners. There are a lot of shops, most quite boutique like so you could spend hours looking at all the unique clothes. Well known brand shops are all normal prices too so don't go here for a bargain.
Better Shoppping Centres in Bangkok. The title says it all. Was not too many shops, not busy at all and the staff all looked very bored in all the shops - no smiles and sitting on their phone.

State of the art shopping mall. If you are a fan of shopping centres Terminal 21 is a must, it is not the biggest in Bangkok or the one with the best bargains but the design of the building is state-of-the-art and the originality and the beauty of each floor makes it unique.The facade is impressive, specially at night.The shopping mall is designed just like it was an airport terminal building and each floor is a destination : The Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Tokyo,London , Istanbul and San Francisco + Hollywood. Everything, including the restrooms , is decorated to remind the visitor of the name of the floor.Besides it is really easy to get there by both BTS and MRT. There is a wide variety of restaurants to chose from and many shops .www.theleisurediaries.blogspot.com

Best mall I've ever seen!. Of all the malls I've seen in all the countries I've been to, this is by far the most lavish and finest! Each floor is based on a different city, e.g. London, Paris, Tokyo, San Francisco, Rome, etc. and the decorations are likewise. It took about 4 hours to simply scale all the floors....without even going into most of the shops! The food options are incredible! The food court scales over two floors....apart from the food stalls on the ground floor! An amazing place where one can easily lose themselves for an entire day! The items are a bit pricey and so is the food, but you can find a good deal here and there if you look hard enough. Most of the restaurants at the mall are international chains and the food options cater to all nationalities. This mall is definitely commercialism at its best! Just when you think you've seen all the floors, you climb to the top floor which has a movie theatre and a video game lounge! the bathroom on the Rome floor was the BEST....it was spick and span, and electronically superior to any bathroom I've ever seen in the world!

Cute mall, interesting decor. this mall was only 4 blocks from our hotel. We were starving and thrilled to find a small sushi place on the bottom floor in a clean, air conditioned atmosphere.Each floor of the mall is dedicated to a different city (Rome, Paris, Tokyo, San Francisco) and is decorated accordingly. Certain adds more character that the malls back in the USStores - nothing local or exciting but we didn't come to shop, just walk around.We had some time before our flight home and actually when to a movie here. But be observant of your atmosphere. Here the stand for the anthem and pictures of their king before each movie and you better stand with them. They are serious about this stuff

Great places to eat.. The shopping in Terminal 21 is OK, lots of small shops, and a few larger "brand" stores with H&M being the largest, but mainly catering to Asian sizing, no major department stores. There is a good supermarket in the basement along with lots of food stalls, but the major food court on the upper level is great. It is very clean. Huge assortment of food on offer. There are a large number of restaurants as well spread throughout the Terminal 21 complex. We have eaten here on several occasions. There is also a good hairdressers with manicures/pedicures on the 3rd level. Usually there is a pop up sale on the entry level. Terminal 21 is handy for people staying near Asok BTS station.

Great shopping mall. and just the best and most easy access location in Bangkok (Asoke), great shopping mall with lots of options for food (love the ramen shops) and lots of shopping etc. Very modern and clean.

My most favourite shopping malls in Bangkok. Having stayed in the Sukhumvit area with family on a number of occaisions, I have had a good opportunity to explore a lot of the malls in the area and I have to say this one is my favourite. Each floor has a theme of a city (i.e. Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul etc) and the shops are also in that style as well. There are European designer shops as well, but if you are from the west, I would not bother with them due to the huge amount of import tax. It is not as cheap as the markets such as Platinum or JJ, but the facilities are better but there are other boutiques that sell other items that sell quite a few items that are affordable or the high end affordable. I even found myself picking up some bargains from more of the back end boutiques. Throughout my stays in Bangkok, it has been a great location to meet with friends and family as there are notable places to meet, take pictures and eat - you have places as cheap and tasty as the canteens and Mos burger to western and more traditional Thai food. You can also take amusement in the shops, displays. The toilets are plentiful and in great condition.

Great Location, Poor Shopping. Terminal 21 is in a good location to go and kill a few hours if you're in the Sukhumvit area. Nothing in it is affordable, and the quality seems a bit shoddy for the prices! It's not the kind of place that you can run into a grab a tee shirt or dress for the evening's activities, or pick up that left/forgotten item. It's slightly pretentious and the cities designated by the floors do not really seem to have all that much to do with the actual city it purportedly represents.It can be a bit crowded, and on weekends slightly overrun by teens who seem to be standing/loitering around and not really shopping, and kinda in the way if you actually came there to shop.I wasn't all that impressed with the Food Court - but I suppose it's mall food in all it's glory; nothing fancy or great or authentic!All in all, if you have nothing else to do!
