(Especially on a rainy afternoon.)

Cosmopolitan Shopping Centre. Terminal 21 is famous for its theme at each level. It is a typical shopping mall of the higher end where you can find food, clothes and all but all at a quite an expensive price as compare to places like Platinum. It is great to take a look at all the themes but not good for shopping (especially for people like me who are looking for items that are dirt-cheap)

Great variety for shoppers and diners alike.. You can find everything you need right here in one building. The way they have built it so that each floor has a city theme from around the world is really nifty! There's lots to choose from in the many shops available and when you get hungry and need a break from the shopping you can go up to the top floor and sample some local cuisine. Again here there is loads to chose from and something to satisfy every taste. Highly recommended for couples and families alike.

It's like shopping all over the world. I love this mall,, every floor has a different theme of a shopping city in the world .. The design of the mall is really nice. One can reach it very easily by taking BTS Asok , skywalk connects to the mall. It is a mid range mall. Lot of boutiques of Thai designers. It houses warehouse on the lower ground which has really good deals. The lower ground also houses gourmet market, which is a must visit. One can have amazing varieties of desserts over here. I really love the outlet of pink pvssy in this mall. There are quite a lot of boutiques specialising in xl clothing like lady phat etc.. The bathrooms on all floors are a must see, really welThe food court is really nice. The soi cowboy is just round the corner,, so one can see that place on the same day .. I think this mall is really lovely and a must see .. For detailed review about terminal 21 along with other attractions of bangkok please visit http://bhakti-pinkandeverythingthatgirlswant.blogspot.in/2014/01/thailand-bangkok-tales-1st-day-terminal.html

Themed Shopping. Themed shopping is here.From Istanbul, Tokyo right to London, San Francisco.Do visit the loos on every floor s they're eye pleasing & photo attractive.Prices are reasonable, too. Locationwise is great.Drawback for me was that the lazy protesters congregated here for snooze & window shopping & being a nuisance to others - the admin here should've kicked them out as they should be on the streets.

A must!. Pros:Different level corresponds to a different city, paris, san francisco, rome etc. so each level AND bathroom is themed to that particular cityLots of variety of different shopsAlways something to see there and always something happeningCons:Just because it's Thailand doesn't mean the cheapest buy isn't there, double check the price before you buy.

All in One!. Located right next to our hotel. This mall was great as it had some really good stores and had everything for everyone! The themes of the different levels are also quite fun as well as the props used to create the scenarios of the themes! The ultimate outstanding experience of this mall that is the Food Market/Court. There were so many option to choose from with a variety of every kind of food from the world over! Worth a visit!

A Great New Mall. I've reviewed this mall once before but wanted to reiterate about it again. First off, location location location. They planted it right at the major intersection of the BTS and MRT Asok, and at the major roadway of the same name. This is a very tall, and very clean, swanky mall (which also has a hotel called Grande Centre Point, and is also located in T21), and there are all kinds of stores to choose from, as well as a large range of eateries. The mall is open everyday and from 10 to 10. My personal favorites/brands to spin by are places like 'CPS Chaps' which is a Thai based and rock themed store carrying both men and women's clothes and is on the right hand side when one walks into the mall from the third level (the same level as the BTS). Then, on the same floor is H&M which is in the very back. Next, on the second floor there is a Quiksilver store, and finally, on the basement floor there is a bakery called Breadtalk along with a Subway (which I've always enjoyed with it being an American based sub shop).* On the ground level there is a currency exchange booth for those who may wish to change out money. Finally, on the third level and right next to CPS Chaps, they will commonly have various sales at tables and small booths that will be set up from time to time. Products vary from clothes to jewelry to shoes and one can never really know what they will have but it's usually worth checking out if the vendors are at all set up. Access to Terminal 21 could not be any easier and can be reached by either using the BTS and getting off at Asok, or via MRT (the underground train). Even from T21, there are plenty of other places to explore via walking further west up the road as it being Sukhumvit Rd. and nearer to the tourist district, there are many other small shops and a Robinsons (a department store), teamed up with a McDonalds and Tops Supermarket.So, a number of things to do in this mall and alot of things to do in this area. Enjoy!

It's great. Terminal 21 is one of the very many shopping complexes in Bangkok but this one is different.They don't have the all the fake stuff that the other shopping complexes have. They have both the high end boutiques and the smaller stores that sells there own design.

Great shopping. One of my favourite shopping malls in BKK. Great products at decent prices. I can always find great quality products at good prices, and different styles than you can find on the general markets and bazaar style shopping malls. Worth seeing also for the architecture. Also try the pier 21 food court. Great foods available.

Cool shopping experience. This is an interesting shopping experience right in Bangkok. My family which loves to shop enjoyed this much more than any of the Central locations. Each floor is a different famous city, which is neat to see. For me, it's just a bunch of shops, not much to go out of your way for. But if you enjoy shopping, give it a look.

Unique shopping mall. Each floor is themed to a location in the world (Carribean, Paris, Rome, Tokyo etc) which makes it quite interesting as you ascend the floors. As you reach the upper floors there are more independent retailers and smaller shops. Overall Terminal 21 doesn't have all the big brand names compared to Central World or Siam Paragon, but still worth a visit.

Interesting shopping experience. Terminal 21 is relatively new shopping mall of Bangkok. Although it didn't have any of the brands we could be interested in we liked it a lot. The design and the architecture is quite nice. The top floors have a selection of local shops which sell clothes by Asian designers. There were some small nice boutiques with cute pieces. You have to have time to go around them as they may have nice things in. Please note the sizing in Thailand is well different. Their male XL is more like European M :)) The food court is big, has a wide selection of local and Asian cuisine. The pharmacy on the ground floor was very good. The girl there gave us very reasonable advice about some remedies we wanted to buy. The location of the mall is very convenient as well - just near the BTS station Asok.

Great shops, great food.. As anyone who visits Bangkok will quickly find -- the city is insane, especially in the Sukhimvit area. There are people everywhere, street vendors, and no shortage of questionable massage parlors. Terminal 21 is a welcome beacon of hope in an otherwise crowded, and sometimes overwhelming, area. The mall offers great little shops that are higher-quality than other major shopping malls, like MBK. There is authentic merchandise, unique souveneirs & jewelery, and best of all -- an awesome food court. If you're looking to eat like a local and have a variety of food options available to you, the 5th floor Food Court is a must. There are a variety of restaurants, as well as an open food court that has a large amount of Thai food available for purchase. And it's all very affordable. (Also, if you're in the need for a haircut or manicure, my husband and I tried out the salon on the 2nd floor and loved it. Affordable, clean and great service.)Would recommend to any visitor!

Too expensive . For thailand the stuff here is so expensive! I didn't buy anything! It's not really worth going to if you want bargains, but if you have a lot of money to throw away there's a few nice things there

Must visit. I always visit this place when I go to Bangkok. Shopping is good - they offer something different and although some of the items you can find on Chatuchak market cheaper here experience is different. You have nicely displayed clothes in the mutliple shops. Great selection of different styles and also good for souvenirs shopping. Another plus is two food courts - one on the ground floor with snacks and a some grocery stores and Pier at the top floor with massive selection of Thai food. You just buy a card, top it up and go choose from hundreds of well selected salads, noodles, rice dished and whatever you wish. Clean, cheap and great value for money. Must go!

Modern and clean, a change from the streets of Bangkok. Visited Terminal 21 for the food market on the top floor not to go shopping. After eating street food and having enough of the dirty and manic streets of Bangkok after a couple of days or so it gets very samey! Heard about the food court here, it's like indoor street food but a lot cleaner and a lot more variety and at good prices.You purchase a credit card from the reception desk on the top floor on the way into the food court, you can credit it with as much money as you like, there is a small fee for the card and if it runs out of credit the vender you are using it with will not return it to you, so you pay the remainder in cash and will need to get another card to continue. But you can top up the same card at the reception desk before all your credit is gone to keep it going.Collect your tray, walk around looking at all the different venders, all the prices are clearly displayed with a corresponding reference number on boards on the back wall of each vender, all you need to do is state the number dish you want and the food is cooked in front of you (very fresh), hand over your card and the amount is deducted. There is lots to choose from.The shopping mall is modern and clean with security on the door, the guard may check your bags. The mall has a world wide theme running throughout it, i.e. London Underground, San Fran and Golden Gate Bridge etc, all very nice.The food is good in the food market and I can recommend it, try it for a change instead of going to the restaurants in the mallIf you found my review helpful please hit 'YES' and have a great time
Cute Mall. Cute Mall.... Lots of shopping for the women. not much for the guy.. Good food court.. They also had a mini super market.. picked up some good bread and ice cream for the kids ...

Great shopping. This is a great shopping centre.Go beyond the first couple of floors and find local designers, with their one off fashion. Also bargain quality fashion goods.In the basement supermarket, good fresh food and juices.

Nice ambience. This mall offers a nice ambience of each floor. The food price also cheap, last time i bought a plate of pasta carbonara and ice lemon tea for only 250 baht which i could not buy the same menu with the same price in Indonesia.

Best mall decorations!. I already went there many times, not only for shopping, but for the organization of the mall itself. It is inspired by airport theme, so each floor is supposed to be a famous city and you can see signs like " Departure to Paris ", " Arrival at London ". There are decorations related to each place on each floor, typical red phone boxes / buses in London, San Francisco bridge, street names, so on so forth!Do check all toilets, there are also very well decorated and stylish!For shopping you will find internal brands as well as smaller shops.The food court is great AND cheap (I was surprised the first time, it starts from 30 THB like in the street), do sit there for a while to try Thai dishes. Perfect for people who want to taste street-food without sitting in the street!

Variety is the spice of life!. What an amazing shopping venue. Feels wrong calling it a mall because this place is so unlike other malls in Bangkok. There are a few of the usual suspects in the ground and first floor and then things get interesting, really interesting! Floors 3-5 are chock full of tiny independent retailers many selling thai made goods from thai designers. Separate floors for menswear and ladieswear and just so much choice! Pick of the bunch for me is funky stationery and accessory shop labrador. Top couple of floors have amazing eats and a cinema to top it all off.

A little different. The shops are mid range but the overall ambiance of this shopping mall is a little different. It is themed around air travel and each floor has a different city/country themeWorth a look if you are in the area

Interesting Themed Mall. Each level has different country theme! Makes shopping fun and easier to find. Also one can find many interesting brand with good quality. Food places are also great! A great place to just hang around in an afternoon

Daily Visit. We were staying nearby so was here pretty much there every day. Out the front was a huge Christmas tree and at night it was lit up and looked fantastic and that alone was more beautiful than any Christmas street decorations we have back home and in Thailand they don't even celebrate Christmas. This shopping centre was very clean and the toilets had different themes on each level. My kids wanted to see the toilets on each level just to see what each one looked like.The food hall Pier 21 was very cheap with meals for 25 baht. You need to get a card from the kiosk first and put whatever amount you want on there and this is how you pay for the food. Then at the end you can get your money back from the kiosk.Just be aware with some of the smaller shops they don't take credit card, it's cash only. There is a money exchange as you walk in the door and there is a sign saying we need to see passport, but my husband was asked only once.At Information counter I have seen strollers and wheelchairs, but not sure if they are complimentary or you need to pay a fee.

Nice place for hang outs, FOOD. Terminal 21 was stone throw away from our hotel, so became the first mall to be visited by us. A very nice, themed, avg size mall at great location. We would go there daily, sometimes twice a day.Eating joints were really good, yummy crape', pizzas, pancakes, several snacks even indian food everything is good about this mall. Every floor has different themes, it added to its decor. we had most of our meals here.A point to note - This mall has limited collection of clothing and accessories, there are lots of other good places for cloth shopping because its BANGKOK buddy :), but is a great place for hang outs.
Shop till you drop. Everything you could ask for in one shop. Bright new intersting shops. Clean and worth a visit. Allow at least 3 hours if not more as so much to see and many floors to visit.

Neat set-up, but not great shopping. This mall was huge, each floor is themed after a big city (Tokyo, San Francisco, London, Rome, etc). And the shops follow a theme on each floor, too. So, women's clothes on one floor, men's clothes on one floor, etc. Prices were not amazing (I wanted to buy cheap stuff in Thailand), but not over-the-top. For the number of stores, I don't think there was that much variety, but it was cool to wander through. Worth going to, if you have time, but not the most exciting shopping centre.

Great place to eat and shop. I always make a habit of reading the negative reviews before posting my own to see if there was something I missed... Please take it from me that they are completely off the mark. Also, please note that I generally hate mall shopping, but felt compelled to write this review for Terminal 21.In short, Terminal 21 is worth the visit if not just to have a look at the toilets (as creepy as that sounds) and eat at the food court. In addition to that the stores are actually quite good, with minimal brand name stores around making Terminal 21 relatively distinct from the malls on the Sukhumvit BTS line (albeit not as 'market-like' as MBK outside National Stadium Station on the other line (the name of which escapes me).Each level has its own theme and whilst some may think it is gimmicky they really nail it with the toilets. I am not going to yammer on too long about them, but suffice to say it really adds a great quirk to walk to the toilets on the London level to have a London Underground theme! In addition, the food court is clean, cheap, quick and delicious with great variety. No, the workers won't respond to you in flawless English, but who cares? I can't see why that was a gripe in a bad review... Why would you go to another country and expect everyone to speak your language?! My personal recommendation for food is the pork salad from the stall across from the end of Golden Gate Bridge (you'll get it when you see it). I couldn't get enough and the staff got to recognise me pretty quickly!The shops inside the mall are great, with some really quirky stuff mixed in with the actually quite rare cheap touristy stuff. We (my wife and I) found that despite the confusing layout wandering around was fun and we got some great buys as a result. My personal favourite was a store called Folio, where incidentally I bought a great all leather folio with free name embossing. All in all worth a visit even just for a quick bite and visit of the facilities!PS. The biggest downside to the mall is the complete lack of an adequate directory. Very frustrating initially so only visit if you are willing to invest the time to walk down the 'streets' of each level.PPS. Feel free to bargain in the non name brand stores... We found that a good portion of the stores would bargain to avoid a sale walking away!

Great Mall in the center of town, full of energy, great for the teens. I really wasn't thinking we would spend time in a Mall during out Bangkok visit, but the kids needed something so we popped into Terminal 21, what a nice surprise. Its not a very large footprint (but it is 7 floors) and on each floor they tried to capture a theme. Each floor represents a City and each floor also tries to cater to a certain demographic. What I really liked was the way they made many streets within each floor allowing for much smaller retail stores that were almost like "stalls" allowing local entrepreneurs the opportunity to have a store in the mall instead of all the usual global names you see everywhere. We were able to find many things for my teenage daughters ( and my wife too) from local retailers who carried new and unique fashions that we cant get back in the US. Also of course there are a fair share of knock offs on display.It was the holidays and there was always some sort of event or entertainment happening in the common areas.I really think this is worthy of a visit if you have kids with you and dont need the Gucci and Versace store to make you happy.

Really cool Shoping Mall, each floor is based on a culteral place in the world!. Really cool shoping Mall, each floor is based on a culteral place in the world. I really Liked the San Francisco California level. With the "Haight Ashbury" street scenery. Golden Gate Bridge Replica was so Cool. The Corner of Hollywood & Vine. The other levels display Tokyo, Istanbul Paris, Rome. On the different Themed Levels The public Toilets are uniquely designed, and modeled as to the different countries. JUST GO to see the Toilets at Least, LOL..... I have not seen such cool Toilets since. The many Restaurant's are also wonderful, With Really Delicious Foods From so many Countries and Cultures. 5 star's on this Shoping Mall Experience.

Not for the budget shoppers. The mall opens from 10am onwards. It's really interesting but if you are here to shop, get ready to fork out 2 to 3 times the amt u can get at wholesale shopping malls. Food center is located at the top floor and has a variety of food. I would recommend spending 2 to 3 hours just to walk and take photo. Shopping would be more fun, cheap and bang for the buck else where.

Another Shopping Mall with a Unique Theme. This is another mall with a unique theme modelling after airport terminal arriving in different cities such as Istanbul, Tokyo, Rome, Paris, etc. There are many small shops selling different type of products with most of eateries on the top 2 floors. Do visit to enjoy the decorations and the toilets are unique at each level.

A good place for shopping. This was my first visit to Terminal 21, last year i was in bangkok i didnt have the time to visit this mall but this time i did. I visit this mall on the 2nd of december before flying to phuket did a bit of shopping and had my dinner there. I was so happy of wat i have got from it, so i decided to go back. On my last day before i fly back home i did some nice shopping, loved it so much everything that u want u can find in this mall. We ended our big shopping day by setting in Häagen-Dazs cafe in the mall, dont miss this place best ice cream in bangkok. Defenitly im comming back to Terminal 21.

Conveniently linked with BTS, Hotels, Offices and Thai Schools. This trendy shopping mall is an ideal shopping mall for those who would like to meet up. There are varieties of small shops and many good restaurants (Thai-International) in this shopping mall. Inexpensive restaurants are also available on the 5th floor. The place's called "Pier 39" (a food court).Its location is ideally linked to BTS Asoke Station. Furthermore, you can walk on BTS Sky-walking through other buildings such as Interchange Tower, Exchange Tower, Westin Hotel, Grand Sheraton Hotel, Robinson Department Store and Times Square Building where you can find a few good Thai Schools, in this building. There are also many foreigners coming in this area for learning the Thai language and the Thai culture...I am sure that you will like Terminal 21 and its neighborhood! :)

Fantastic Shopping. Across from The Westin, the shopping here is fantastic, lots of little shops selling clothes which are reasonably priced, however most places don't allow you to try on and sizing is small so buy a size up. Toilets are really clean.

Good , no regrets of going. Great mall with great shopping outlets at affordable price. Many food outlets , love the mango sticky rice in foodcourt . Toilets is big and unique to its theme . We had a great 3D movie there , cinema is big and comfortable and do remember to rise when their national anthem plays before the movie.

Best all round shopping center. This mall has it all, from brand shops to restaurants and cinema, so you should be able to find whatever you need here, the prices are above average but not expensive. Best thing is the BTS is stopping outside this mall.

Themed shopping fun. You can tell the developers of this mall put much effort into making Terminal 21 unique. Each floor is themed after a different country which adds to the experience. The food court is very good and reasonably priced. Plenty of mango and sticky rice for only 65 Baht!

Overrated Airport Themed Mall. Just a small shopping mall with an airport theme decoration. (every floor represents a city - Rome, London, Tokyo, Istanbul, San Francisco, Caribbean) In terms of shopping, there's nothing special about the place and not a suitable place where you hours at. If you want to shop, visit Platinum Mall instead.But if you want to visit Terminal 21, please visit the washroom in every floor as that is where the main decorations are at. Other than that, please don't waste your time here if you are in Bangkok for a couple of days only.

Interesting interior design. This mall is unique in its own sense. Don't come to this mall expecting to find cheap bargains because you will be disappointed. However, come to this mall to explore the different themes on every level. Each floor is designed to represent a city like Rome, London, Hollywood, etc. Though it may seem weird, it is fun to check out the toilets at every level because they are designed to reflect the unique character of those cities as well!Recommended to come to this mall if you have spare time in Bangkok after having your shopping spree and if you are interested in exploring a unique and fun themed shopping mall.

Mediocore mall, with an odd airport concept. Strange airport themed mall with each floor representing a city. Includes Rome, London, Tokyo, San Fran, somewhere in the Caribbean. Sadly, none of the shops have much connection with the theme of each floor. Food court ok, quite a good value local one. There were two types of shops... mid-range chains and one-off clothes shops. A few of the boutique clothes shops are fairly high end local designers, but bulk sell local fashion. Main reason to visit would be to visit these local designers... ignore the odd theme.

Themed all the way!. Loved that each floor is themed in different city decor - right down to the toilets! For example, the London floor has the tube decor leading to the loos, the Tokyo floor has Mangga characters in one loo and a Japanese garden in the other, the Istanbul floor has Turkish details, etc. Quite amazing! Only loos in the world that actually made me whip out my camera for a few shots! Loos aside, the stores are quite a good mix. The food court serves great Thai food, and at the most reasonable prices of all Sukhumvit Road shopping centers. Lots of international food outlets there too. Overall, makes a nice alternative to Central World and Siam Paragon.

Visited all 6 various country theme washrooms. As told my many other trip advisor, we decided to visit Terminal21 for it's various country theme washroom. Sound rather strange ....
Nothing particulars, however at least we been there, seeing the toilets...

Beautiful architecture, ridiculous prices. Very beautiful mall with nice ambiance. Every floor offering different architecture. Many branded and non-branded outlets. Brand outlets offer their regular rates but non-brand outlets are ridiculously expensive. Good for a visit, but same non-branded stuff cost at least 3 times less at MBK.

Interesting and attractive shopping mall!. The theme of the mall is very interesting as it is based on an airport. The body of one of the elevators look like the underside of an airplane while the entrances has metal detectors simulating the experience of being in an airport. The prices in there are average and they mostly sell brands like Nike, H&M and so on. The food court at the top floor is especially nice with its low price and reasonable portions. The toilets are also attractive with their own themes; each one is different.

Worth to check it out. Nothing much to shout about this shopping mall. You will see a 'doorman' in uniform saluting you when you walk through the metal detector square into the mall. Worth to check the interior of the different designs and theme on each floor, otherwise merchandises sold are more or less similar style back in KL or Singapore's shopping mall. Toilets design are pretty OK, different from what we will usually see in other shopping malls. For the food choices at Pier 21, there's a plenty of them. Just get the prepaid meal card from the 'coupon' counter before going over to the cookery areas to order for your food. The mango sticky rice here is not good.

Shopping. Interesting concept. Those looking for nice Thai fashion clothes can visit the 2 and 3 floor. Modeled after an airport. 2nd floor is for ladies fashion and third floor is for men. Prices are not low but average pricing. Dun expect the cheap cheap market prices.
Great Themetic Mall. These mall may not be the best place to shop. But, it has a unique interior which amazes. Do drop by to see the architecture if passing by. An ok place for a lunch/dinner too.

Worth a visit. This is a good mall, different from the others and worth a visit. Each floor has a theme..London, Tokyo etc there a some good stores that sell different things you don't see other places. I wouldn't spend ages here 2 hours should be enough. There are a lot of places to eat and a cinema as well, worth a visit.

Cool bathrooms!. Every floor had it's own unique theme and it looks like they put a lot of effort into the theme, including the restrooms. Also, the restrooms had toilets with seat warmers and toilet seat disinfectant, and were super clean to begin with. Mall food on the top floor was great and inexpensive. There were lot's of cool shops. It was off the MRTA and the Sukhumvit line and next to our hotel so we always stopped by before or after our daily outings in Bangkok.

Love the themes!. I like it when malls put in effort to differentiate themselves. Malls that do nothing but rely on the strength of their shops' brands to pull visitors bore me. This mall segments itself by levels, so every floor is done up in a different theme. Even the retailers they carry aren't the usual international brands -they're mostly Thai indie retailers selling local designs/produce. The main attraction of the mall, though, has got to be the lovely way it's been done up. Excellent mall.
Def worth a visit. Great mall but doesn't have typical mall shops. It had lots of what seemed like independent retailers with unique items. All the malls are huge and this one is no different!

Worth a Visit. This mall is very interesting, every level has different theme based on major cities like Tokyo, Rome, etc. The toilets are definitely worth the visit.It has a mixture of international and local brands, remember to check out the local brands on the upper levels for some reasonable priced shopping. We managed to buy dresses and tops at THB200 each.The food at the food court was reasonable priced too, we ordered 6 items and 3 drinks cost us only THB361.We will visit this mall again if we were to go Bangkok.

Food, photography, shopping under one roof. A very unique concept for a shopping mall. Each floor is themed on a major city on the map e.g.: Tokyo, London, San Francisco. Getting here: Take the BTS train to Asok station and you would see the building standing next to the station. The signage at the station is very clear and concise- just follow the exit to Terminal 21.Wifi: Free wifi in the mall. You have to register beforehand at the customer service counter on M level with your passport, after which you will be advised on how to log in.To do: It may sound very silly but please do visit the washroom on each floor. Every washroom is themed in a way corresponding to the city. You may run into a bakery shop washroom on San Francisco floor or a underground subway washroom on London floor. Give it a go!Shopping: Good mix of brands around from middle range to higher end brands. Each level has its own unique stores corresponding to the city it is themed with.Food: The food court at level 5 is something not to be missed. Not only is there a variety on authentic local food, they come in very affordable prices too. The service is extremely quick, yet the quality of the food is not compromised. You will have to purchase coupon in the form of a credit card at the coupon counter in order to get your food. It's a good system in a way as you don't need to have so much small change around. Check what you want to order and estimate how much you credit you need for your coupon before proceeding to the coupon counter. Fried oyster, pad thai, som tam and their desserts are not to be missed. If you are not in the mood for Thai food, no fret, there are a lot of other cuisines available as well. Choose from Japanese to Western to fast food...you are basically spoilt with choices here!

Nice lunchtime food at bargain prices at Asoke station. So here is how it works. Get off at Asoke station, don`t go down any stairs, just follow signs to Terminal 21.By all means have a look around the shops, but if looking for food go to level 5.Give the nice lady at the till some money (any amount you like) and she will give you a credit card style card with the amount on.Choose your food from one of the many vendors, pay with card, take to table and enjoy.Meals are usually around 30B (about 60 pence) and delicious ( if any complaints meals are a little on the small side, so why not get two ?)Drinks are cheap and delicious too. Everything nice and clean.There are other places to eat in there too apart from level 5 food court but we never tried them.

Want to shop new clothes?Shoes?Jewelry?. This is the place to be to buy original clothes. You can find tiny shops here with very original and creative designers in it. If you really like to see something different from the standard shoppingmalls this is the place to go. Forget Siam and Mkb because this is the best shoppingmall in Bangkok for clothes, shoes etc.
Interesting concept. Interesting concept with each floor themed on a major worldwide city. Great way to kill a few hours in bangkok.

Terminal 21, Bangkok. #terminal21#bangkok A shopping mall in Bangkok reputed for its authentic architectural design in terms of outlet allocation and level classification. With each level featuring retail outlets that market apparel and accessories with respect to the designated country/region, it boasts of an interesting concept that not only reflects it's brilliance in organisation but a unique and attractive way in which future malls can be assembled. Indeed,Terminal 21 has made a name for itself with each floor having it's own exclusive restroom embellishments. These were some of the tiny nick knacks that set Terminal 21 apart from other shopping malls in the area (I.e. Central World). While I must concede that the multitudinous array of goods and services attracted my attention (and my pocket), it was the very framework of the place that made our visit to the mall a memorable one.

A Good Mall to Shop In. I was travelling for business and Terminal 21 mall is one of the best shopping mall near the hotel (Sofitel Bangkok Sukhumvit) that I am staying in.It's located next to Asok Station and was built to resemble an airport terminal. Consisting of 9 levels of shopping and dining. Each level has its own theme, such as Tokyo for ladies’ wear, London for men’s wear, Istanbul for accessories, San Francisco for dinning etc.Even the restrooms on each level have a different theme. There was a restroom in bakery theme and I swear I actually smell freshly baked bread at the entrance to the restroom. It was so bizarre!Bargaining is NOT acceptable at this mall. Honestly, the prices here are more expensive than places like Platinum Fashion Mall or Pratunam Market. But you get to try on the clothing in a proper fitting room, unlike Platinum or Pratunam, where you just have to rely on your luck to pick out something that looks good both on the hanger as well as on your body. It frustrates me to buy stuff back only to regret the moment I put in on.Plus, there are abundances of dining options from restaurants to food court. Do yourself a favor, don't go to any western restaurants, try the Thai's. My favorite restaurant is Have A Zeed, which served the most delicious Grass Noodle with Prawns. I was so addicted, that I ate the same thing twice in 3 days! And there is also a supermarket located at the basement of the mall.Anyway, Terminal 21 is really interesting and makes a really worthwhile place to shop and dine. I would definitely be back when I come to Bangkok in the future.

Snap and shop. This shopping complex is accessible through Asok BTS station. The price of items sold are ranged from middle to high. If you are not interested in shopping, you can just hang around and snap photos because every floor has different theme. Even the restroom on each floor is themed too! It's a good place to stay away from sun or rain.

Great Shopping Concept. Terminal 21 is one of our top 2 favorite shopping mall in Bangkok. It has an interesting concept, whereby every floor is categorized by different country. Even the toilets are designed according to the particular country theme.The mall itself is also very clean, well-maintained, and new, and most importantly the walkways for shoppers are spacious.

Interesting concept, but overall a little boring. Being not really a mall person, I only truly appreciate the themed idea of the mall. Plenty of things, but everything is rather expensive, and given the choice I'd rather shop at MBK or the nightmarkets. But that said, Terminal 21 does have a very expansive choice of shopping options, clean and very well kept. Each themed floor also sells mostly themed things. Terminal 21 is also right next to the BTS and MRT which makes getting there quite convenient.

Shoppers paradise. Terminal 21 is situated on Soi 21, Sukhumvit, Bangkok. I have been travelling to Bangkok since a long time and almost ignoring this place. I have visited yesterday for the first time and I was glad to see the quality products in merchandise especially at good price. They have a dedicated floor for eating joints as well, they have video games for the very young and young kids. They have almost everything where visitors can spend 3-4 hours. I will highly recommend this place for one visit atleast when you are in Bangkok.

Big glitzy shops. Nothing but big glitzy shops...if you really want to shop without breaking the bank then this is not the place to go. Go if you want to see designer stores. And everything closes by 8 even the food court!

The only mall in Bangkok where I would recommend eating, clean, nice, big, and lots of Thai designer clothing. The only mall in Bangkok where I would eat! Very good, clean! Nice Mall, big, lots of Thai designer clothingThe mall is located just around the Sukhumvit Station. It is very convenient to walk to the mall. And as I recall there is a walkway on the MRT that will lead you right into the building without having to go down to first floor. This is quite convenient as most of the MRT stations in Bangkok do not have escalators.I would highly recommend this mall for anyone looking for local Thai designer clothing, it is packed full of it, and one of the few places in Bangkok to find such things. The other being in Siam Square malls. Also if you are hungry and are not interested in street foods, you can go here, it is clean and easy and the people are friendly, but be prepared, there are lots of people here, might be difficult to find a table depending on what time you come. This is the only mall in Bangkok where I would recommend eating. All the other malls we went to we ended up leaving as soon as we saw the eating areas as all of them were just really bad. But Terminal 21 is great for both shopping and eating.If you have any questions, feel free to write.

Nice hangout and lunch place in sukhimvit. We loved the Foodcourt of the mall. You can get fresh juices which are very nice. Mall is pretty clean and organised. It has concept floors after diff cities. Price range is not diff then any other western European city. It is next to the Asoke station which is a plus point.

Tootu jewelry store. I am on day two of my visit to bangkok and while the large shopping malls are entertaining, i was frustrated that I could not find unique items to bring home for myself. Maybe we have gotten too global. I went to this store based on a recommendation of another writer on trip advisor. The items were very pretty and very well priced. Because the owner makes the pieces, she galdly adjusted sizes. I spent $125 and got a wide variety of gifts including ones for myself, but the money was irrelevant--the pieces were very pretty and unique

Quite disapponted!!!. As this was next to our hotel, we decided to visit there once as we liked the concept. We did but was really disappointed with the decor. Though the mall is extremely neat and clean and lots of shopping options but it did not get with the concept. Except Turkey and UK other concepts have no link with the products in display. A fantastic idea but poor execution.

Nice centre to browse but not for shopping. Definitely a good centre to browse as the general concept is very interesting but not a good place to shop. I bought an item from Destination (one of the boutiques) and found it less than half price elsewhere, they refused to exchange or refund and was quite unpleasant. Understandably most of these shops don't do refunds as I discovered today but manners doesn't cost anything and this shop lacks it.

Tootu Jewelry Store, Terminal 21, Bangkok. This is an interesting shopping center and I particularly liked Tootu store on the 3rd Level -Bangkok. The owner of this shop makes all of the various stone jewelry and she has a keen eye for detail. The prices are low and the jewelry is beautiful. She has a chart to show you what the stones are called in each piece. I bought several pieces of her jewelry, all in beautiful colors and the earrings are on stainless steel wires so no skin irritation. We couldn't believe how fortunate we were to find this shop. It's better than the night markets for quality and price.

Best Mall in Sukhumvit. I may be biased here as this mall is just 5 minutes walk from my place and I see it everyday through my balcony but this is the best concept mall here. It might get crowded but I've never had to push or bump into people as I do in Paragorn or Central World.Shopping is great here that I don't even go anywhere else. Food options are fantastic too! The food court for one is the cheapest you'll find out of any other ones while not lacking in quality. Great place to watch movies as well as they have one of the best in Bangkok. There is just so much to do here and plenty of "Instagrammable" hotspots.The coolest thing is that each floor has a city-theme from Istanbul & Tokyo to Paris & London. Even their toilets are retrofitted to the themes!

Big mall with good concept. It's alway jammed packed with people.Each floor has a different concept.... England, Japan, Turkey, San Francisco etc...The top floor is where the gym and cinema is located.Plenty of choices when it comes to food and shopping.

Overrated but Interesting. Location is right by a BTS station at Asoke. This is an interesting concept mall, with different themes selling different stuff from different countries /places on each floor. It's got beauty salons, beauty and health shops, supermarket, bookstores, a lot of good restaurants, Fitness First gym, stores which sells unique and novelty items. It offers free wifi and has a foreign exchange counter on the ground floor. Very convenient mall for a traveler like me.

Looking for cheap eats-go to the Pier 21 (top floor of T21). We came back to our hotel which was not far from Terminal 21. We were so hungry but didn't want to spend insane amounts at the hotel restaurant. After someone's TA blog on Terminal 21, we found Pier 21 which is a "movenpick" type of food court. First you line up to put money on a food card. Line up may look long but it operates very quickly. Using that food card, you can purchase food/drink from a variety of fast food restaurants. There are so many options! Rice, fried noodles, mango sticky rice, noodles in soup, stew, dim sum The prices average to 35-45 bhat. Portions are on the smaller side. A lot of the men had at least 2 dishes!

Fun place to be, very nice food court and shops. Pretty neat shopping mall with lots of small shops, mainly fashion items, you can get special discount for tourist if you get the discount card from information as you get in from BTS station. You need to bring your passport to qualify. I was there number of times and was able to get nice pair of jeans which was one day sale for 60%off for two, so my wife and I got one of each. It was absolute bargain, same jeans in Australia retailing for $289. We were quite happy for the price and service, presentation, food....and lovely Thai people.

Disappointed. We had heard a lot about T21 and visited - but what a disappointment .... Destination themes are a good concept but poor execution.More importantly the shopping is nothing special with a very limited range and almost the same stuff available on all floors.They gave a Gourmet Supermarket in the basement - but ask for "Marmite" and you get a blank stare !!! Even showed them a photo of a Marmite bottle on my android .... zero recall !!Go to MBK - better range, value and fun.

Don't need shopping as a reason to visit. Each floor has its own city theme.Little detail was considered in the interior design, even the toilet facilities.We did not make any purchases but had lots of fun checking out each floor.Lots of stores to choose from.Lots of restaurants.I don't know how old the mall is but it feels very new.Connected to Asok Skytrain Station.Can easily spend 3-4 hours just looking @ its city themes.Adds a different flavor in shopping experience.I think it is better than Siam Paragon due to the fun themes. Siam Paragon's design is what you can expect for most Westernized shopping malls.Fun for everyone.

Highly recommended: good variety, friendly price tags!. It is a relatively new mall with themes for the shop floors (Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul. San Francisco). Even the toilets are also designed with themes!It offers good variety of merchandises, with friendly price tags! Check out local designers store like Jaspal, tourists can get 10% discount when you produce passports.There are also cineplex, supermarket, restaurants, huge food court selling local and international fare with reasonable prices. I will certainly revisit.

Better than Siam Paragon. Located in Sukhumvit area, less hi so than Siam Paragon, Terminal 21 is definitely a better choice for a drink, selection of food as well shopping. Less than Siam Paragon but more interesting as each floor has it own country style (London, Istambul, Paris etc...)Cinema there is great and we love to go there. Never been disappointed.Toilets are quite funny.Their food court is great, yummy and with a nice view...

Themed shopping mall.... Mall is connected to Asok station, check out the interesting destination decor. London, Tokyo and San Francisco are my favorites. Restaurants are plenty on 5th floor, cinema is on 6th floor and worth trying out the spa/massage there.On basement you can find a ery nice supermarket with plenty of stuffs to buy, there is a gourmet market serving good choices of western and asian snacks...A nice place to hang out and escape the humidity and hot weather!

Terminal 21 is fun!!!. Of all the major shopping malls in Bangkok, Terminal 21 is the most fun to visit. Each floor is themed after a different city and it's really well done. You can't help but take a ton of pictures. My personal favorite was Tokyo. So colorful.Don't forget to eat at Pier 21. The food is sooo good!

If you like shopping malls...... A huge shopping mall, themed on each level with different countries including the uk, USA and Japan.I'm not a massive shopper to be honest but so many people recommended this to us as we were staying in the sukhamvit district of Bangkok.As malls go it was good, there are two levels on the top floors that are primarily given over to food (something that I am interested in!). We went to MK restaurant for our very first Thai dining experience. Not entirely sure that this is typical of Thai food but nonetheless it was great. Each table has a hot plate and this boils the water in which to cook your food to your own tastes.Staff were friendly and efficient.

Great food on 5th Floor. I was staying hotel close to this mall. I use to have my lunch & dinner everyday here on 5th Floor at food court called Pier 21. I t was so good food here & up so cheap. One dish only cost just 1$ woh woh.There is lot of shopping to do as well here.

Suburban & chic. Edge of city centre. Needs taxi or train transport. Modern & chic. Themed after major cities eg San Francisco, Paris, London. Golden Gate Bridge sprawled across the atrium. A life sized replica of a Red London double decker bus on another floor. Even the toilets follows these themes.Top level is food paradise with good yet cheap Thai fare. But the need to pre-purchase a stored value ticket before ordering & paying for yr order is cumbersome.Variety of shops. Home furnishing. Fashion. International luxury brands.Surprised myself with many purchases. Like in everywhere else in Thailand, they are very good for value.Free Wifi offered to tourist can't work and is certainly a scheme to capture our email addresses. Frustrating.
Convenient and Sprawling.. Nice concept. Good stores, much.much better that MBK Mall. Fabulous food court on the ground floor and Delicious Ice-creams! can spend almost half a day there.

Interesting themed mall. This is a themed mall connected to Asok Station. Every floor has famous shopping street atmosphere that includes Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco and Hollywood. Washrooms in each floor are also themed accordingly. They actually look unique, cute and cool. They have floor for Thai designer clothes as well as fashion brand names both for men and women. On the 4th floor you will find lots of restaurants and cafes. Fifth floor offers Thai bistro around Bangkok and Pier 21 Food Court where you can find local snacks, meals, drinks and deserts at very reasonable prices. Cinema in the 6th floor and there is a supermarket at the lower ground floor. If you are looking for a department there is a Robinsons that is also connected to Asok Station. Happy shopping. . .

The food court >. The food court at Terminal 21 trumphs every food court I've ever been to. They have brown rice! The mall is pretty cool too. Every floor is designed after a region or city in the world. The Caribbean. Rome. London. Istanbul. Hollywood. San Fran. Japan. Paris. The architecture is amazing. All the malls in Bangkok are special.

overrated. Unless you stay or hang around nesrby in Asok station, it 's not wort to go shopping or sight seeing. I did't visit food court but went to 5th floor "San Fransciso" for dinner, I thoght just so so. The washrooms each floor has a theme, funny idea but I wouldn't say it 's special. Better go to flea market or Siam / Chitlom station for shopping.

Travel around the World without Leaving the Mall!. Every level is a photo opportunity! You could pose on Vespas, bicycles, even touch 2 sumo wrestlers! All while shopping in the comfort of air conditioning. The details of the interior design are amazing- you know you've got a winner when the toilets look like a London Tube station or a San Francisco bakery. Shopping is a bargain too! The Mango sticky rice is scrumptious at only 70 baht!! Remember to add your money to a food court card that allows you to buy stuff there. Don't miss the cinema in Level 6 Hollywood- the seat actually recline and make sure you stand up to respect the King's Anthem. :)

Tooo cute to shop. Even if youre planning on not shopping, just visit this mall for its super cute features and lovely environment. Built to replicate 5 major cities London, Rome, Istanbul, San Francisco and Tokyo, each level has its own style and ambiance. I adored the food court with the best satay I have ever tasted. Furthermore, the shopkeepers were friendly and fun. We found some fab deals.

excellent choice. Terminal 21 - 6 floors big shopping mall on good position on Sukhumvit road.....not to big, perfect....offers an excellent choice of shopping, a great variety of restaurants, supermarkets with fresh herbs and fruit juices and healthy combination of fresh fruit juices...very good concept like on airport, themes from around the world.....

Nice toilets!. The toilets are very nice. Each of them has a theme.Note only nice, but they are very clean too. We took quite a number of the toilet pictures as we do not get to see these kind of themed toilets in our country.

another secret gem. discovered this on the last day we were in Bangkok - It is a hidden gem not at all full of the normal tourists and noisy but full of locals and full of different shops with very good and different style choice please go and take a look

It's a interesting mall to visit. I visited this latest shopping mall on my first day when arriving at Bangkok.The theme of this shopping mall is very good with different levels been named after different cities names.The Pier 21 foodcourt is interesting and there are many different foods to choose from. And the food are tasty too.There are many Thailand origin shops which sells merchandises designed and produced in Thailand. Some of these merchandises are quite expensive, but it's worth looking at. And if you love it, and you think the prices are right, just buy it.Oh.... I visited the toilet (ladies) and the toilets are very well designed and decorated. Each level has it own individual design.It's a interesting mall to visit, and I will go back again for my next trip to Bangkok.

Terminal 21 shopping mall. the latest mall right next to the Asok BTS and Sukumvit MRT station.Many floors of shops and eateries. on the top floor is Pier 21 which is a larger food court offering all types of food from thai to western , japanese.....
Cinema in Terminal 21 Shopping Mall. Great Shopping Mall at Asok BTS station. Cinema on the 6th floor very good. English movies shown as well. Movies in 3D, Digital Sound, etc.

Must see. Truly amazing! Another seven store shopping centre with each floor based on a theme of a particular place such as Hollywood and London. As strange as it sounds, you have to visit the toilets on each level as they are themed around the city. As weird as it sounds, they are amazing. The food outlets are also amazing and Jeffers offer really good value.

Mini window of the world. I went to Terminal 21 to look for a magic shop, but sadly it wasn't there anymore. The place was well worth a visit, though, and I spend a couple of hours going from one world to another, so to speak, as each level has a theme according to a different international city. There are loads of good food, but I'd recommend the food court, where meals are available for 30 baht (as opposed to 100s of baht charged in restaurants for similar food). The entire place is non-smoking, which is a big plus. The toilets are the best I've seen in Asia and they actually have toilet paper!

Best mall in Bangkok. This mall so amazing with theme on it.. London, Istambul, Tokyo, etc..I really like the concept of this place. Lot of branded store also, and the price still reasonable..Really enjoy have my shopping time here..

Great shopping mall with awesome food court. As shopping malls go, this is clean, has a mix of boutique and chain stores but what sets it apart is its different floors and themes on each floor. A number of reviewers have mentioned this so I won't dwell further.What made me want to rate this (I don't tend to rate shopping malls....!!!) is its food court on Floor 5 called Pier 21. More focused on South East Asian cuisine, particularly Thai - the options are varied and amazingly cheap (most meals were less than 50 baht = less than 1 pound). You have to buy a top up value card to pay for food but like most places, you can redeem all unused credit. It lasts for 30days. I'm greedy as hell and love Asian food so I went nuts - topped it up with 500 baht (10 pounds) and was like a kid in a candy shop!I stayed nearby (Tune Hotels) and as they do not serve food, I came here for breakfast/lunch in total 4 times and came away stuffed every time - damage was under 300 baht so redeemed the rest on my last visit. If you do want to try other cuisines, pasta, Japanese, Fish & Chips etc, there are various other outlets. If you want to do a spot of shopping, I'm sure you will probably find something though I guess you can get better deals at MBK (probably anything you want, especially fake goods and souvenirs) or Pratunam/ Platinum Fashion Mall (mainly ladies clothes at wholesale prices - if you haggle).

very high end, but let's go shopping. I love the theme of travels of this mall…it's fascinating and make shopping and great experience... This mall give Bangkok a good representation. There are not so many people as many as other malls....but there are great shops…and food. it's near to BTS and underground trains which make very easy to get there....Great shopping mall,
nice. nice and good for shopping....some branded shop inside the mall....feel happy to shopping there....lovely place....:)

First class mall but expensive. Fabulous mall with theme revolving around the aviation industry. It even has staff dressed as pilot to greet you at the door. Every level of the mall has a different country theme; Japan, London and turkey etc. Even the washroom are very clean and equipped with the latest technology (heated toilet seat and washer etc)However the mall contains international brands such as H&M thus the pricing are not cheap as compared to other malls in Bangkok. Top floor has a cinema and arcade. Overall, it is worth going to experience the theme mall and catch a movie which is quite cheap at around 550 baht for their premium couple seats. Additional Information :1) There is a money changer in the mall but the rates offered are not as attractive as others 2) Free wifi available in the mall but you must register with your passport/ID at the information counter3) There is a Tao Kae Noi outlet (thailand famous brand of seaweed) at the basement of the mall. Price there are the cheapest as compared to getting it outside. 4) You can get free rental wheelchair and strollers from the information counter.

Fabulous shopping mall. Love this complex. Each of the levels has a big city theme ... Rome, Paris, London, Istanbul, San Francisco. It's a great concept with appropriately decorated toilets, pillars, bench seats etc. the quality of goods sold is very good compared to other shopping malls. There is entertainment .. The Fab Four (Beatles copy band), a Thai band, do a brilliant job with all Beatles songs. I bought some very good products.

Excellent shopping mall with great personality. It is a world class shopping mall. I would have expected management to do a little more search on the cities before name the levels.Istanbul has been written on signage with Arabic look a like English letters as if Istanbul is one of the Arabic cities.Just a little reminder, Istanbul is the biggest city in Turkey. Turkey is not an Arabic country and their language is not Arabic but Turkish and they use English alphabet.I hope that I can see the sign changed at my next visit.

Terminal 21 is a fantastic place.. Terminal is an interesting place to visit, for shopping, eating or just hang out or browsing. Even seeing a movie or two. What's best is that different floors have different themes of a number of countries or cities. You have Istanbul, London, New York, Tokyo, etc. Even the washrooms have the particular theme of the floor. I found Tokyo the best. Clean, neat, orderly. The food court has a variety of foods, mostly Thai--and a very reasonable price. In addition there are many fast-food or other restaurants on all the floors. Some shops are quaint, interesting and even if you don't buy anything, its nice to just browse around. There is a cineplex where a number of latest movies, including English ones, are run.The place is easily accessible by train, bus or taxi.

different country theme in every floor. every floor,every toilet is different theme,feel free can take a look,foodcourt the price is good!food is nice!good shopping!!there was a long escalator there....
Good quality and unique items. More unique and better quality than the other malls we visited. The stores were smaller interesting shops and the great finds were well priced.

obsessed with the food court. We are in love with the food court here. It's big, clean, busy, delicious, and so cheap. We come here to enjoy the a/c then eat food, always ended with a mango & sticky rice (the best we've had in a month in Thailand). The independent shops on the "London" floor are fun. Movies are half price on Wednesdays (100 baht!). This mall is such a great way to escape the heat!

More than just shopping, Terminal 21 is an experience!. We end up at Terminal 21 a few times every time we go to Bangkok. It’s well worth the visit if you haven’t been before, if only to check out the cool theme of each of the levels! Set up like an international airport, with “arrivals” and “departures” signs at every escalator, each level is decorated like a different famous city or area. There’s the Caribbean on the bottom floor, with lots of gourmet ingredients for sale and a few places to get fast food or donuts, ice cream, pies, cake etc. Then there’s fashion, accessories and beauty products on the next few floors: Rome, Paris, London (awesome alternative style clothes for guys), Tokyo (quirky one off type clothing for girls) and Istanbul (mostly shoes and accessories). On the highest levels (San Francisco and the San Fran Street Car level) there’s a number of sit down dining options and I think maybe a cinema? The effort they’ve gone to with designing each floor is amazing to see! The prices are a bit more expensive than your general Thai market places or MBK etc, but the clothing I’ve bought is of a much higher quality too, so you get what you pay for. I love the Tokyo and Caribbean levels, particularly the gourmet market. My partner really likes the London floor, and both of us have bought heaps from the whole shopping centre every time we’ve been. It’s really easily accessible from the Asoke BTS station – it’s actually connected to it, you never even have to set foot on the street. If you’re in the Sukhumvit/Khlong Toei area, definitely make time to see Terminal 21 :)

Have to agree about the loos!. Interesting shopping mall, very different in its style, shops are good, but some of the staff seem 'missing' - mid afternoon and some shops not manned! Food outlets OK we had an expensive and indifferently served cocktail in a bar on one of the top floors, quite expensive and served with much grace either. Fat cats and complacency, with too many people with their heads into their smart phones!

World class restrooms indeed. Went here juz to visit every's floor restrooms.... Each floor with different world theme... clothes n shoes prices are on average prices... But the design n quality are definitely better than streets fashion....

Interesting shopping mall. There's a different theme on every level but the most interesting part will be visiting their toilet as it also have different themes. Other than that, it's just the same as a normal mall. Good for photo shooting session. Wifi is available to foreign visitor by registering GF lobby area, just produce your passport for the registration, However, the Wifi connection was very bad.

Good cheap prices. Each floor is themed with a specific city in mind. You must visit the bathrooms on each floor as they are designed to suit the city.Stores are independent shops rather than the big names that are in the near by malls. Clothes are pretty cheap in comparison.

Good shopping, food & location. As I always stay in the vincinty, Fourpoints or Aloft. I would always make a point to come here for some shopping and food. They have an excellent Thai restaurant, Yum Saad, located on the 5th floor (I think), which serves very good thai food at a cheap price. Do note that it is very spicy and they do not accept credit cards. As for shopping, they have about 4 levels of shopping with different concept at every level. Interesting statues for phototaking as well.

Very nice mall! Unique and interesting.. Wasn't able to visit last June, this time we made sure we visited the mall. It has a nice feeling on shoppers. Spent 2 nights in bangkok but we went to this mall twice. Enjoys the photos..

Great place to take some awesome pictures!. I went there twice for my Visit to bangkok. Obviously there not much to buy there beside snacks because the clothes are in poor quality and overprice. But there are some big brand names that u can buy from. The second time I brought my friends there but we know that we only go there to take pictures and stuff lol but yeah worth your while to go and check it out :)

wonderful place in the heart of Sukhumvit. loved the place. great themed shopping centre. Able to find what you need without paying the premium prices and able to get reasonable discounts. Loved the food court with reasonably cheap and well portioned food

Not for Shopping but for Food. Best place for shopping is Central World want to watch movies , buy some stuff from the basement super market and a little shopping is ok but for food this is paradise all kinds of cuisine Japanese , Korean , Thai , Mexican etc great restaurants if you want to eat at MK's then be ready to wait for 20 to 40 mins during dinner . But you have plenty to choose an easy access connected to Ashok BTS or Sukhumvit MRT

A unique shopping experience. this is far the coolest mall in Bangkok. It has many themes, different themes on each floor. And try visiting the toilets at every floor. The toilet really matches the themes well! The highlight of all is probably the food court, which is really cheap and value for money! Get yourself a Food card at the counter before patronizing the stalls. Every purchase in the foodcourt is done by the food card. The food prices are really cheap with prices around THB 30-50.

A World class mall. As I Said, a world class mall, it's just amazing how you feel in each floor that you are in a different country, from London to Turkey to all the other terminals, it's a unique mall experience you will keep in mind.Prices is fair and food court is great.It's really a most to go mall if you are heading to Bangkok.And don't forget the Sukhumvit market street.

Terminal 21 - Shopping. Toilet seat is advanced! Every level is different theme. You get to see different toilet concept to even the toilet lady, security guard, dressed to the level theme. Something different.

So much fun. This place is great!We loved walking around and visiting different areas but what made this place so amazing is the food court! Do yourself a favour, buy a meal card and eat up. We found we were being over charged on the street so this worked out sooo much cheaper and amazing food. Love this place. Also, experience the toilets, they provide a little entertainment with the different themes.

A wide range of merchanise and a great food court. This was the second time we went there and I must say, it is still as good as ever. Shops:Just an awesome range of goods. You will find there are something that you want or something that you didn't know you want....but they are all there. Restaurants:A really diverse range of restaurants there. The prices are all very reasonable and the atmosphere relaxing and welcoming. Location:Connected to the Sky Train (Stop E4), so you won't even get wet if it rains. Timing:If you are treating your trip to Thailand a shopping one, I would allocate at around 3 hours including dinner at Terminal 21.

Great food court, exciting decor. I come here all the time for food. The food court on the fifth floor is the best value for money and biggest quantities I know in the city. The floors themed around different cities are also great fun. The London toilets are probably the best lavs I've ever encountered. There are also lots of temporary displays, sales and music events here that are all free entry and can be a good way to hear modern Thai pop music. As I mentioned, probably the the most interesting tour of this complex you can do is to visit all the fantastically creative toilet facilities. Also, there's free WIFI, which I am taking advantage of right now to write this review!

Nice experience for shopping, food, cinema and the design of the mall. This is One of my favorite malls in Bangkok, easy access from sky train station Asoke.Cool and innovative design of the mall, initiating an airport and each floor is a capital.Tokyo with cute boutique shops with Asian design, Istanbul full of gems and other bling, London being my personal favorites with nice urban design and street style clothing.Fair prices and nice little shops.Restaurant floor is great with a huge selection, quite pricy food though for being bangkok.Food court in basement is great for trying local specialties and food shopping.Frozen yoghurt stands with pick and mix toppings are to die for!Cinema complex in the top floor was great, offers non dubbed original versions of international and Hollywood films, popcorn and snacks.  They really crank up the aircon inside the theater to a freezing 16degrees so bring a sweather. Really nice and clean bathrooms with different designs in each floor is a must to visit!

Great food and shopping/touring!. Unique positioned to capture the images and fashion of each great selected cities, you will get different floors to fashion catering to Paris (Level M), Tokyo (Level 1), London, Istanbul, Rome etc.Even the toilets on each floors has been carefully designed to capture the feeling of the cities!Yo can have various picks of city icons and landmarks for photo taking. Photo taking is definitely allowed here and encouraged, whereas some major shopping centres in Asia actually ban photo taking within shopping complexes (Singapore, Malaysia etc)Price is not the cheapest, but the pick of the fashions here are very good and kudos to the stores for their good eyes and fashion senses.The food mall on the top floor takes the cake! It has food galore pandering to every taste buds, and is very well priced and affordable, though the portions can be a tad small, but then you get to taste just about every local delicacies of Thailand!
Perfect !. Great placePerfect locationVery good & kind serviceRich breakfastGreat value for money!We stayed 3 night Very clean & high standard hotelEnjoy....

Very Trendy Mall with Best food court, must visit. Amazing food option at ground floor food court, dessert/cake area at level 2or3 and Pier 21 (main food court) at level 7. Bangkok Gourmet Food Market at ground floor is very nice. Each floor has its own theme based such as Rome, Paris, Istanbul, Tokyo etc. Beautiful & Clean mall, Check out the toilets on each floor. Toilets are amazing. You can buy mid/high range clothing. Pier 21 is amazing food court. It huge, clean and very cheap. You will amaze when you see the choice available to eat there. Everything is between 30-60 B per dish. You must try fruit smoothie (39 B) outlet and coconut ice cream (35 B) outlet they are out of the world. They have bar and set down restaurant as well if you want to eat in restaurant. Nice Chinese, Italian and Mexican restaurant with some international fast food choices are there. Don’t go there, shopkeeper trying to slow down after 9 and after 9:30 most of the food is sold out or they too busy to close down. Must visit

Worth visiting mall. I just visit terminal for 1st time. This is a good mall that for youngster to shop bcoz of low price and variety in pattern. I personally like their food because i am surprised that their food price can be that low price even my own country's mall couldnt sell such price. I think is to protect local people.

Excellent unusual mall. Went to this mall for H&M but its amazing! Particularily impressed by the pateries, bakeries and sweet treats available - incredible selection aswell as a massive range of store well priced and nicer than markets. Being in the aircon was great - highlight was the bathrooms with electric toilets -what fun! Dedinately worth a visit!

Bland, featureless, boring. Here we go again - Bangkok, so it must be yet another anonymous strip mall. I had arranged to meet a friend there, and took the opportunity to snap an internal and external view or few of this place.As I explain to my students with Powerpoint pictures, it's very difficult to distinguish one of these Mammon emporia from another. What do you have? yet another global coffee outlet; yet another global burger chain; and, another bland, global, anodyne, clothing shop. So, what does this mean, exactly? a featureless, boring, characterless super-arcade catering for the masses with lots of Bahts to spend but from my perspective, with very little to recommend it other than cynical gimmicry. Positives? it's very close to, and accessible with, Asok Skytrain; it's cool inside; it has boggs on every floor if you're taken short. That's about it.

The toilets are great. I visited the toilet on each level. Every one of them has a different theme :) very nicely done. Even the sinks are different. My favourite has to be Tokyo :) The male toilet has a tree in it :)

Shopping heaven. Very good looking and well taken care shopping with a broad range of products to offer from typical food stands to jewelry shops. All the floors are themed after 1 different city and offer a category of products. The lobby usually has live music going giving the shopping mall an incredible atmosphere.

Free Wifi for Tourists. Conveniently located at BTS Asok, this new mall offers free wifi to foreign visitors, just show your passport or ID at the information counter. Nice concept of different cities for different levels.We were there late so didn't have the chance to discover the whole mall. Went up to the London level for men's fashion. There were many small shops which offer great varieties of clothes, bags, shoes etc. Not a must visit, but good place to just hang out for the nice interiors and free wifi =)

Check out the themed floors... And the food court. It's not very hard to go around the mall since as what everyone else has pointed out, each floor is themed. It's also easy to find what you need to buy from each of the floors.One thing I have to mention as well is the food court. I would prefer Terminal21's over the food courts on the malls in Siam since it's less crowded most of the day and the food is cheaper yet filling and decent enough.

Accidental Surprise. We walked in here trying to find Escape Hunt (in the next building) and were happily surprised at how different it was. Each level is a different city, with the architecture fitting to the country and staff on each level wearing costumes. We didn't buy anything but there looked like a good range of prices. Not as cheap as the markets but still affordable. Free wifi if you bring your passport and ask at the information desk. Food court on the top floor looked extensive, as well as treats and drinks on a few floors.

not the best one , neither to shop or watch a movie. you can shop here, obviously, but I found both World Placa and Paragon Cineplex so much better, also when it comes to go to the cinema for a couple of relaxing hours.It was good, but cant give higher ratings because of those other places.

Many themed levels. The centre has a unique style with themed levels, but is still just a shopping centre. The Istanbul level was designed like a market with many smaller boutiques. There is a golden gate bridge and lots of options to eat and shop. Located at the Skytrain station it is very convenient if you are staying along the Skytrain line.

Worth the whistle place !. There are so many shops with different own brand and design which distribute on each floor and pander to their theme(Tokyo, London,Rome....)as well. If you don't have time to Weekend Market or other places. This shop mall is like a collection place for you. I am sure you would find your style and meawhile you could have a nice meal and rest on 5th floor.

The T21 Mall, at BTS Asoke. This mall is kinda built like an airport terminal and every floor is themed after it's country name. Especially interesting are the toilets on every floor, which are all well worth a visit! See for yourself! T21 consists mostly of small boutiques for the "small" ladies, small as in Thai sizes in clothing. There is also a lot of jewellery here and some bigger stores with things for guys & gals in "farang" sizes, like H&M. The top floors have plenty of good restaurants and a food court Pier21. Theres also a cinema at the top. I would mostly recommend T21 for shopping jewellery and shoes, having a bite and watching a movie. A must visit for the happy shopper, just go to BTS Asoke and elbow your way through the massive crowds into here :-)

Very unique. This mall is built with each floor representing a big city which makes it very interesting. The mall has some very nice shops with brand names in almost every floor as well as some famous chains like H&M. There are some nice resturants on the 5th floor and a very nice movie theater on the 6th floor. We visited it several times and just spent time going around and having coffee. It is a must see
Creativity Seen. Efforts and creativity can be seen in Terminal 21 where you can experience different country culture in different floor/level.

Great local designers. Loved the quirky design of each floor ! All bathrooms were also decorated in different themes. Loved the local designers. Great food selection as well.
Couldn't find baby changing facilities or breastfeeding rooms.

My favourite mall in Bangkok. Very unique. . I loved loved this mall. It is connected to BTS Asoke station so it's very easy to find and accesible. Each floor in the mall has a a diffrent theme that's a city. Say for the Tokyo floor you have statues of a geisha and sumos and on the San Fransisco floor is a miniture golden gate bridge. The stores on each floor are fitting to the theme city of the floor. The bathroom on Rome floor was the coolest! Most of the stores in here are not big brands like all the other shopping malls un Bangkok. They are mostly boutiques with medium to high quality merchandises. The food fair is supoosed to have good food but I just had shaved ice at ice monster which was really good. Highly recommeneded.

Best shopping experience. Terminal 21 can be reached by sky train. Sukhumvit line, station Asoke which is attached to the shopping mall Terminal 21. I have visited many shopping malls around Europe and South East Asia but from London to Singapore I found Terminal 21 best place for shopping. I like it so much because I like traveling and airports and Terminal 21 is made like an airport terminal. Each floor represents another famous city. From the ground floor up: Rome, Paris, London, San Francisco. London floor is maybe best for male clothing, while Paris is more filled with woman's clothing. On the top floor there are many restaurant but I recommend you to try self service Pier 21 restaurant. You can try delicious Thai dishes for just as little as 40 bahts with an excellent view on Asoke district.

More like a western Mall. You've got all the shops on the first 2 floors that you'd find in any city centre in the uk, (H&M, Nike, Adidas, puma, Paul Frank etc)Not that the prices are massively cheaper but with then the extra of local type small shops on the upper floors for some great bargains. good food options downstairs too.
Love this shopping mall!. Saw pics of this place in tripadvisor, but it is better when you're actually there. Make sure to try the donuts at Mister Donuts on the bottom floor!

Around the World in 9-Levels. Terminal 21 is a travel concept shopping mall. It could be reached by BTS - alighting at Asoke stop (light green/lime line). The concept is refreshing and it offers lots of photograph opportunities.
