Each floor is represented by a city of a country.The floor layouts of the mall: Lower Ground - Caribbean (Snack and Fast Food); Ground - Rome (Luxury Brand); Mezzanine - Paris (Thai designer) ; Level 1 - Tokyo (Local boutique); Level 2 - London (Men's Floor, jeans); Level 3 - Istanbul (knick knacks); Level 4 - San Francisco (City) (local restaurants); Level 5 - San Francisco (Pier)(Food court/international restaurants); Level 6 - Hollywood (Cinema & Arcade).DO: (i) Visitors should register as tourists at the concierge and enjoy tourists' discounts. Pick up a passport directory from concierge. (ii) check out the country concept restrooms on each floor. SHOP: The merchandise offered In Terminal 21 may not be as extensive and value for money as in other popular malls but it is still worth a visit. Tokyo floor offers flavourful local boutiques. EAT: Ate at Terrace, a fusion Thai restaurant at Level 4, its crab roe fried rice with thai duck was delicious. What was really exciting for me was discovering the design of each country concept restrooms - Tokyo floor, Japanese style bamboo concept, London Floor, King Cross Station concept restroom and Istanbul, bazaar concept restroom. Even the uniforms worn by the staffs were based on these concepts.

Most interesting. This place is a must-visit. We took the skytrain and stopped at Asoke BTS Station. Terminal 21 is just 2 mins' walk away. We had a good meal at The Manhattan Fish Market, after which, we went to each floor to enjoy the feel of different countries. We managed to find some good buys too; shoes and tops. The prices were very reasonable because they happened to be on sale.This is a very classy building. We loved the total ambience.

go here for pic taking. aside frm the usual shops, people go here for pic taking as the floors are themed. the food court also has affordable food. I find the statues of the 2 sumo wrestlers funniest as people get creative in posing with these 2 statues.

Comfy shopping experience. An amazing shopping experience. Theme based on world destinations. The entrance for each floor is a 'terminal'. You'll be arriving in the UK, Turkey, Japan, Paris and USA among other places. Suitably decorated according to landmarks or cultural influences.The passageways were broad and the stalls offered a diverse range of goods. Some merchandise could be found at the night markets or the weekend markets. These merchandises were generally sold at the same price. The difference was that I could shop for these same products in comfort with minimal hassle.There were many stalls for men's wear. A plus for a guy like me.

The Disneyland of malls. Most amazing mall I've ever visited. Every floor's theme is a famous city. The best part are the toilets of each floor where it features the best of that city. The attendants wear costumes as well of that city. I toilet hopped just to see each toilet. I had so much fun. Must visit!
Must visit !. Unique mall design. Interesting mix of shops. High-mid-low price range. I like the higher floors where there were small shops and items were unique and different. Food wise - aplenty.

Just another gimmicky mall.. If you need to spend money this is a great place to visit. But you are in Bangkok so go to the markets.
Seems to be a mecca gor tourist photo ops

Not typical. I loved Terminal 21 because it was different. It was filled with independent small shops and the food court was cheap.
http://iammrsk.blogspot.fi/2013/01/terminal-21.html

New mall with theme toilets. This mall is new but overall not so worth shopping except looking into their toilets. Each floor comes with a theme of its own so it can be unique especially the toilets - must visit each floor too. Mall has most brands that Singapore has so it might not be appealing to us.

Preapare your camera and get ready to strike a pose. You can go here by using the train and go to Childom Station.. For me, this is the BEST mall I've ever seen. I am so in love with the decorations. Each floor has a different theme. Not only they decorated the wall, but they also put some other decorations like lampions for Japanese theme, the red telephone box and double decker for England theme, street lamps and old bicycle for Paris theme.Even the bathroom itself is so modern. .Not only the decor that made me fell in love with this mall, but also the stuff. The clothes here is not too expensive (but not that cheap either). I found really good stuff at the Japanese and England floor. You can't bargain at this mall of course. But my mom tried to bargain a little bit, and she got a discount ! It was not much, but she was very happy with it.It's too bad that my stomach was full at that time, so I couldn't try the restaurants up there.If you go to Bangkok, your trip won't be complete if you're not going in this mall !

very good shopping mall. Very accessible train, taxi, bus and etc. We just walk from the apartment we stayed and everything is here, restaurants, shopping of all walks of lifes kids, infants, teens, adults and old ages..very good shopping mall..

Latest mega mall. Located right next to BTS Asok, Terminal 21 is one of the newest and biggest mall in the area.A dizzing array of shops on every floor.Dont forget to visit the food court on the top floor where food is so cheap, it almost beats street food prices!

The best one-stop mall in Sukhumvit. Plenty of shopping options - and the food court on the 5th floor is one of the best in Bangkok.Right next to Asok BTS station - this is a must-visit for all shoppers and diners

Love this mall. This is my second time at this mall. Love the design and shops.Lots of Thai young designers open their shops there. The clothes, shirts, shoes and bags there are geogeous. Good quality with a minimum price.Again they only cater for smaller size people. Free size-MMust visit!!

great interior and vast array of shops. great interior and vast array of shops... food lovers would enjoy the various options available... guys could hand out on the IT level and play video games whilst the ladies shop till they drop... photo opportunists would love this deco...price was ok but not fantastic as compared to MBK...

Great idea for a mall!. Imagine being in another country every level you go in this mall :) their concept is cute and unique, they have plenty of shops and restaurants, the mall is connected to the exit of the BTS Asoka Station. They have a supermarket at the basement. Lovely decorations and design on each floor including a miniature version of the golden gate bridge.Every floor represents different countries and they sell goods from that country on that floor.There's even a movie theater on the very top floor.If you're staying at nearby hotels,this mall is convenient to go to!

Amazing shopping mall. Just to walk in is to feel that you are on your way to somewhere, one step up and you are in Paris, one step more and you are in Tokyo, you can take a coffew break in London, see a movie in Hollywood and relax at the fountain in Rome, and also make good shopping of course from excellent small boutiques who offers unique items for moderate prices. Go ahead and travel around the world when the heat is to much outside

Trip to Terminal 21, Bangkok, Thailand. A unique experience to be in a great shopping mall in Bangkok. Its right at the Asoke MRT station.It has every level of floor labelled under each great cities of the world like Rome, San Francisco, Tokyo etc.Each level displays the product of its named city for example if you go to the Tokyo level, you will get to buy Japanese products and also food. Don't miss this place when you are in Bangkok.

Brand New Mall Classy Shopping Considerate Sales Personnel. Only one disliked that is merchandise expensive.This 2 years old mall is clean and situated near the bts and mrt intersection. Should tourists encountered difficulties and a change of itinerary they can consider terminal 21 mall with aircon to cool down. Food court sell cheap international food and flavourful local cuisine.

Fantastic toilet. The mall seems to be pretty new and has very interesting concept but what blew me away was that there was an attendant in the toilets. This is the 1st time I've come across a mall with such service and usually only luxury hotels provide such service.

Love their Washroom. I literally went to every toilet in every floors as each has very different deisgn complementing their theme destination of each floor. The small little shops in every floor also make it a good place to hunt for gems. One good thing about this mall is they are trying to group their vendors according to their theme destination. For example: London: they will sell things related to UK such as MU souvenir shops and etc

The mall with plenty of food options. I frequented Terminal 21 daily as I stayed just 5 mins away. This is another mega mall along the stretch of Sukhumvit Road. It has a good number of the mid-range shops and many smaller shops which sell apparels/accessories commonly seen at Platinum Mall. I didn't compare prices though. Anyway, it isn't as crowded as Platinum for sure.The airport theme is definitely an attraction, especially the well designed toilets. But the biggest draw of Terminal 21 in my opinion would be it's numerous food & beverage options. There's Thai, Chinese, Mexican, Korean, Western, Japanese, etc. My fave was this little restaurant Yum Saap which serves decent Thai food at reasonable prices. I assumed that it's not a touristy joint as it was filled with locals when I was there for dinner twice. If you are looking for more variety, the food court at the top level isn't that bad either.

A unique, fun mall in Bangkok. The "Terminal 21" mall in Bangkok is really nice. It's only opened in the last couple of years, so I had not seen it on previous trips here. It's a shopping mall, but what makes it unique is that each of it's 6 or 7 floors is themed after famous cities around the world. The escalators have signs over them making you think you're in an airport, heading to London, Istanbul, Rome, San Francisco, etc. On the top floors there are awesome restaurants and a food court that have foods from everywhere. Enjoy your time there and Bon Voyage!!

Excellant shopping spot. This is great place to spend a few hours and a few Baht. Great range of little boutique shops , full of all imaginable things from makeup to leather goods and great designer shops of cools cloths' Another quirky feature are the theme levels i.e. London, Tokyo etc. And on each level the public toilets are designed to match, they are very well done and I have seen people in there getting their picture taken. Awesome work.Plenty of places to get a snack or even a full on feed. Easy access from Asok station.

First experience in Terminal 21, Bangkok. The concept of having each country culture and identity is very new and interesting. It's definitely a crowd puller and new tourist destination to explore in Bangkok

Good shopping. Really enjoyed shopping at Terminal 21. Lots of good shops without the really high end stuff. The little boutique shops on the fourth and fifth floors are great with lots of original clothing. Make sure you check out the toilets on each level for something a bit different.

An airport in a shopping mall. Blown away by the design of the shopping mall. Each floor has its own theme and each toilet has its own design.awesome design. Shopping there however is not much of a hype as most of it are independent designers.however you might find something you like there.

What a take off!!. Another new shopping haven in Bangkok. Being here for the 1st time really took my breath away! Like previously reviewed, the mall is designed to be like a terminal and the concept is like you are exploring the country at each level. It is huge and you may need at least half a day to cover all. Some tips:1) How to get there: Joined with Asok BTS and Sukhumvit MRT, how convenient!2) There is free wifi provided in this mall, Yay!! - just go to the info counter and register. They will need identification if you are a tourist (passport, ID or driving license will do)3) Plenty of eateries (maybe > 60) comprising small to huge lots and most of the famous chain restaurants are here: Fuji, MK, Tony Romas, KFC, Swensen, Secret Recipe, etc...etc...mostly located on 4F and 5F.4) You may forget all the eateries and just head to Pier 21 (foodcourt). Amazing food court with coupon system with plenty of local Thai food options...best of all, it is the CHEAPEST food court ever...(I know because we stayed for 6 days and surveyed a few food courts in other malls). You must must try the mango (35THB) + sticky rice or durian (30THB) + sticky rice + coconut ice cream (served in a coconut shell with bits of fresh coconut flesh (28THB). We regreted eating in one of the restaurants as we were too full to eat the local food which was in abundance and mouth watering!! But the mango + sticky rice is the cheapest and it tasted good too...very fresh...we tried everywhere else and nothing was < 80THB....5) Those who are for shopping will be spoilt for choice too.. men & ladies, everything is available. Some may find it too trendy and slightly up-market but if you hunt well, you may get some bargains...if you are into the cheaper options, then MBK is more for you.6) There is also a huge cineplex there (SF World) so it caters for a huge crowd. 7) Most important is the space...although crowded, you don't get the feeling of too many people maybe because of the high ceiling.All in all, would go there again, if not for the food, but the atmosphere.

Fantastic place to spend a few hours. The concept of terminal 21 is travel and airports/countries. Each floor has a different country theme and decoration and I must admit it is the only shopping center I have made the effort to visit toilets on every floor (the toilets are decorated to the theme country (must see London & Rome)- and it is not unusual to find people taking photos in the toilets as well as at the many special country decorations- like the Sumo Wrestlers, along the way. My personal favorite floor is Istanbul for the shops and selection of merchandise. I have recommended this place to many travellers and so far no-one has been disappointed. Whether you are looking for something a bit special or just for a fun day out- try this.

Shopping experience. Well worth a visit for something different. Make sure you visit the bathrooms and take a camera. Purchased a cheap meal at the bottom floor also for lunch. Interesting shops and escalates that give an overview of floors.

Its huge. Terminal 21 is a really big shopping center with an amazing theme of different country's for each level. There are hundreds of shops lots of food outlets some shops are not much bigger than a wardrobe and most being quite small. Prices are okay with plenty to chose from. A great place to have a look and maybe buy something.

A must see World view - Terminal 21. Terminal 21 is literally out of this world and yet of this world. It has multiple floors built on themes of different countries. As you go up and down the escalators, it is like moving from one country to another. And, besides the theme in which the shops are done up represent the country's looks and culture, the floor also sells the stuff from those countries. Terminal 21 is a somewhat classy mall so prices are certainly not cheap. If you look hard enough and if you have been to Platinum Fashion Mall already, you may find some bargains on sale if you are lucky. Certainly a great place to window shop

amazing concept!. First time visiting this mall and was very impressed by its layout and concept. The mall has different floors catering to different countries, with a distictintive country feature. For example level 2 covers London and it has a huge London bus in the middle of the floor with signs to Westminster Abbey. Even more awesome are, surprisingly, its washrooms! They designed them based on each country's theme and even has the janitors dressed in theme! This was a truly impressive and novel idea as it meant that the washrooms are not just a washroom. As a first timer, i had to visit all washrooms on each floor. Sadly, it seems that each floor only has one grand toilet, so be sure to find the correct one! If you do not have time, I will suggest the London / Rome /Paris washrooms.one thing I disliked about the mall is that, the mgmt separated different categories of shopping. All of the Men clothes are on 3rd floor, while gift and decors on 4th floor. While it made it easier to shop, it also meant lesser time spent on each floor and that shops are consolidated.

Interesting mall - different themes for different level. Heard that it is a new mall and they have different themes for each level. Interesting concept however it feels very touristy. You can spend a day walking around, browsing interesting things from over the world. There is also a wide variety of food available.

Airport Style Mall. Excellent designed. .Different floors with different style..Mainly based on airport style..Free wifi , just show your passport at information counter for wifi ID n password..Enjoy local foods at level 5 food court with top up prepaid card for ordering your foods which refundable balance unuse..Different floor different lavatory design. Money exchange just in front entrance. .Just 5 min walking distance to SOI COWBOY BAR STREET. .Opposite to WESTIN HOTEL & SHERATON HOTEL..Front of ASOK BRT STATION..Taxi easily available. ..

Most exciting mall. I found it quite exciting and would recommend it as a place to visit in Bangkok. They have really nice Thai designer shops. Each floor is a different count, as is the theme.The washroom on Paris floor is just amazing. I thoroughly enjoyed by Terminal 21 visit.Not much you can buy but its nice to see how it is. Very stylish and yes they have a Manchester United shop in here.

Modern and stylish, great variety of shops. The title pretty much sums Terminal 21 up. Everything is clean and well laid out and the escalators that travel several floors are a massive help when you know where you need to go. There is a huge variety of shops and plenty of food option as well, not to mention the perfect location next to both BTS and MRT stops.

Even the toilets are theme based. I enjoy being at Terminal 21 mall. It's different themes on each floors are delight to indulge into and it's the most convenient mall for spending few relaxed hours with your near and dear ones.The toilets on each floor represent themes on that floor and great place to photograph yourself. Surprising .... But true.

A different theme on every floor. Most different shopping experience we have ever had.Each floor is themed as a different city, San Francisco, London. Rome. Istanbul, Tokyo, Paris and Hollywood.As homesick Londoners, we went straight to level 3, and the design is brilliant. There is a large London bus statue and there are shops within it, and there are some British themed clothes shops there, including a very London shop which was the Manchester United club shop (which is where all their fans are based). The cinema on the top floor is so cheap and we bought a ticket and extra large popcorn for £4 which was amazing considering a ticket in England is £9! Please visit and it is accessible by the local MRT training.

A Mall with many Themes.. I was very impressed with Terminal 21. Each floors are being made into different themes according to countries like Istanbul, London, Tokyo. Just to name a few. Im lost for choices in terms of food and things to buy in that building. Getting there had never been easier. Taking the BTS to the Asok. From there it is as easy as a pie getting there. It is just next to it. The toilets are really clean and each have different themes. I would recommend this place.
Cool. Nice place to spend your day .. Many little shops that you can spend ours lookin at . Have many different restarurants to choose from .

Great mall, great food court. Having just arrived we needed somewhere close by to eat and not get too hot. This place is perfect if you're staying in Sukhamvit near Soi 20.It has an amazing food court with a large selection.

Very touristy but great food options. This is the epitome of 'touristy' The mall has 7/8 floors each styled as a different city/country of the world; Hawaii, Tokyo, paris, Rome, San Francisco etc. Each floor has some artwork/decor related to the particular city. Its a fun place to go and look at tourists clicking pictures of all the 'monuments'. The mall has many food options...and some of the better ones are on the San Francisco floor.

Amazing place. Love this place. You can find everything in here! Prices are great from the "expensive" shops, to the market stalls. Very easy to get to and worth a trip of its a rainy day. The food court is out of this world, and has stalls serving food from EVERY continent on the planter, at VERY reasonable prices. Worth a visit.

Pretty but overpriced shopping. This mall has different theme/country tagged to each floor. My first time here, I was rather confused why am I going to a country when I am simply going up the escalator?! I was really staring around to get a better understanding of what was happening, only to realise the theme is different countries on each floor. There are food at basement, that sells small snacks/drinks. Restaurants at 4th floor are plenty. But note that once past 9.30pm, many of these restaurants are already closed. Only very few not-so-nice restaurants are opened. I had asked information counter only to realise there is only 1 money exchange in this big mall - Can't confirm if this is really true as I had not combed the entire mall yet. But is rather ridiculous to have only 1! Rates are rather bad too. Go change money at MBK for more options to do your comparison. Shops sell mostly overpriced items. There are few and rare shops that sell things cheap. Also noticed that some of these "push-cart" stores actually have their big shop somewhere else in this building. Toilets are tagged with different themes too, go explore. Overall, would be a place I would go to get some free air-conditioning, buying snacks at basement and mainly to take some nice photos of the different themes/decors. I did not buy anything from this mall. FYI, this is linked to BTS Asok, very convenient to get to. Would say visit here, only if your hotel is nearby / just passing by / if you have extra time in Bangkok.

Maybe my favorite mall in the world. I am not much of a mall person but this mall was a lot of fun. Each floor has a theme of a different city/place around the world (though there are 2 floors for San Francisco). Lots of good stores--I'm sure overpriced and not things that I was interested in buying. BUT the food court upstairs is amazing. Great options and really fantastic prices (ESPECIALLY considering it's in a high-priced mall). I know this sounds silly, but you must check out the restrooms / toilets / bathrooms on each floor (all unique). The womens' bathrooms have huge windows looking out onto the city. There are a total of 9 floors. You'll have fun! Quite assuredly...

Good location and a lot of resturants. Shops will not have repeated clothes unles they are same bossvery hard to bargain which I do not like about this mallprice are not cheap alsoThey do not sell a lot of kids stuffs1 floor selling mens wareanther floor selling womens stuffstop 2 floors are resturants a lot of choicesBasement is supermarket and wastons boots

World tour in the heart of Bangkok.. Excellent reasonable Priced Food centre. Very good location, and excellent decor.Every floor is designed to represent a different city, London, Rome, Istanbul,Tokyo and SFO.
Best mall in bangkok. This is one of the best malls in bangkoko with excellent shopping for everything... Based on a concept of a airport it's fresh and new

Nice design, well executed, overpriced, but.... ...a nice air-conditioned walk through to the BTS line. Read (given other countries, "read" is pronounced as "red" in this circumstance, as many American words interpret differently in how they're used in a sentence...whew) a previous review I just saw of how the USA doesn't have malls like this one & thus is more of a developing country. Ignorance isn't bliss, just stupidity. Well they do, if you ever bothered getting out of LA & traveling your own country; and a shopping mall doesn't make or define a developing country. I'm an American, born & raised in LA and will never piss all over my own country.I commented on this location in another review as a side note. It is a very nice themed mall/shopping center with everything you need for the typical tourist or non-American expat (exception to the American expat that has not really lived in America the past 4 years). Being a middle-class American, there are way too many things this country just doesn't have or allow access to. The prices here can be up to double or a bit more than what it would cost in say...Beverly Hills, California, USA - that would be food, beverages & any imported products...mindful imported American products come from China, Vietnam, Thailand & India :-) ...so they don't travel far. Though still believe Paragon is the better quality choice including food. MBK being a hit & miss but for cheaper electronics (however, be aware of fakes, do your own research beforehand). Back to the Terminal, also be aware of the 17% tax on all food & beverages (10% service charge which isn't for service but a made up tax to fill the owners pockets - none of which go to the staff; and the 7% VAT government tax) (my info isn't a guess, but 3 years of research...understanding this country is quite the challenge). For products such as electronics (value vs quality-wise).As far as myself, I'll only eat at the Tony Roma's & drink Starbucks, otherwise just use the bank, DTAC or AIS access; or just enjoy the air conditioned walkthrough to the BTS.I selected my "Visit as June 2013", but been here many times before.Recommended for tourists with money to spend.

This is a great mall. Spent a lot of time here during our last 2 trips to Bangkok. The mall was next to our hotel. Great themed mall with plenty of shops. My wife very much enjoyed the little clothing stall in the Japanese themed level. I wish they had malls like these in the U.S. I fear that in many respects the U.S. is becoming the developing country.
Fabulous shopping centre. Great place to cool off shop and have a snack and watch the world go by. Lots of smart pricey shops with some boutique she's on the upper levels.

City within a city. I visited the mall after visiting Siam Paragon, MBK and Grand Central. Terminal 21 is the bestest of all. The most exciting part about Terminal 21 is that it is designed to look like an airport. The mall has several cities inside like Carribean, Rome, London, Paris, Istanbul, San franciso, Hollywood and Tokyo, though Eiffel tower was missing in Paris but London was superb. The mall is attached to Asok Skytrain station and opens at 10:00am Thai time.

UNLESS YOU ARE GOING FOR IMPORTED GOODS. Base on my last visit to Terminal 21 in 2012, honestly, I don't find its worth visiting/shopping. Unless you are staying in BKK and trying to buy imported stuffs. In terms of price, its not cheap. I must admit, I probably won't go there again unless someone in my group wants me to accompany them.

Rude customer service. The mall is such a delight to see coz of it's different cities theme but unfortunately the customer service is damn rude. 2 things that I asked, food court & wifi. She simply gave a straight and stern face. When asked further, she can't understand me. What a disgrace! She supposed to understand English but she struggles. The mall itself is great. Food court on 5th floor is the best. Many choices and they're cheap compared to like MBK food court for instance. There are many unique things that you can buy here.

Interesting mall but expensive clothing. We came by after our massage session at Healthland ASOKE (see my other review). It is a nice 10 minutes walk. Very interesting mall and it has been designed to look like an airport. It has the cutest toilets i have ever seen - so clean with lots of designs. The information counter also allows you to borrow a trolley with a pull out chair (very innovating). I wont recommend you do to any shopping at this mall coz if you have been to Platinum Mall and Pratnum Market, you will find that the clothing here are much similiar at a more expensive price tags. So i only recommend you to do sightseeing (i.e. window-shopping) and save the shopping for elsewhere. I like the food hall at the basement that sells a variety of Thai food. Do try the grilled octopus - it is deliocus! There is also a supermarket at the basement. It is expensive but i managed to get all stuff i needed - maggie mee, local spices. The mall is conviently located next to ASOKE skytrain. So it took us only 10 minutes to come from Chit Lom. Overall nice experience.

Nice place to shop n eat!. Good - Toilet hopping! U must visit every floor's toilets! Each floor got 2 toilets and every toilet is unique!Interiors deco is original n interesting!Many food to try n prices are really cheap!Nice small shops with different themes.There is 1 stop selling Egyptian stuff which are replica, really interesting!Bad - The Mango sticky rice is so so, MBK food court still the best!if u take a taxi back they refused to go by meter n each trip is minimum 150-200baht! So choose ur hotel carefully in Bkk! Always stay near BTS!!Alight at Asoke station.
Great Mall. Great mall for young and old. Each level is a different country. So great for photos. A bit expensive but still worth a look!

A good place to check out, however a little pricey.. This shopping center has been creatively designed with each level representing a different city in the world. I visited Terminal 21 on a Thursday night in hope of finding a few bargains. Unfortunately the prices were not much cheaper than in Australia. I would recommend checking out the Istanbul level for cheap homewares and gifts.It is also worth while to have a look at the San Francisco Food Court - I ate at Sunrise Taco and enjoyed the service and food.Terminal 21 is located near the Asok BTS Station, however I walked from Soi 5 and it took approximately 15 minutes. I decided to take a Tuk Tuk back to my hotel for 100 baht which took a lot longer than walking due to traffic congestion (a regular site in Bangkok).

each floor is a different city. other than that- typical western shopping mall.. the bathrooms are fantastic with interactive toilets and decorations themed to which city the floor is representing. a good range of shops. in a nice part of bangkok. nearest train station is Asoke.

High End Shopping.. I just wandered about looking for something different to buy , as a souvenir from my trip. I didn't find anything, but there are some very good brand name shops, also plenty of eating areas.It's cool in here and very easy to get around. Also very easy to find.

Interesting new mall. It is located right next to Asok BTS station. A new mall with a refreshing new concept. Modelled like an airport terminal with departures and arrival signs. Every level has its own cities (e.g. level 2 is London and level 3 is Istanbul) and themes. Your shopping experience at each level will be according to the different cities, right down to the experience at the rest-rooms which are wonderfully built and decorated.A mall as a tourist sight by itself. Two-in-one experience. Unique.

Excellent mix of shops, several gems can be found. Good mix of shopping throughout the mall. International brands on the lower floors are a little overpriced in my opinion. However, there are some gems here that are really worth the visit.I love denim. There is a Dsquared2 store that has extremely good prices, and it is authentic. On the men's floor (3rd or 4th floor cant remember) in the back lane, there is a local Thai denim shop "Rakucho" that sells jeans with Japanese embroidered design, similar to "Evisu Genes" but with very good price and fantastic quality. Othere "Evisu" looking jeans I've found in Thailand look like it but are extremely poor quality, this is the best you can get, and its not fake, its a local brand.Also on the men's upper floor, there is a small shop to the right of the lift lobby that sells shoes and belts. They have embossed leather belt that looks and feels like Prada, again local brand. The quality and feel is exactly like the real one that I have, and it comes in many colours including purple.

Wonderful Experience. The latest, smartest and the most beautiful mall in Bangkok - a must visit. The toilets at each level are totally amazing and worth visiting even if its just for a photograph. Great shopping, good food court.

Cool shopping centre. Worth a visit, probably my favourite of Bangkok's many shopping centers.
Interesting concept, each level based on a different city/country. Wide selection of shops and restaurants. Some real treats at the food court on the bottom floor too.

Great decor. The decor is something that really intrigued me. This mall I believe, would be more suitable for teenagers and young adult who are into high street fashion. Was informed by the information counter that there is no outlet which dedicated in selling kids clothes, however note that there are a number of shops which sell soft toys and toys in general but dont expect a big scale toy shop such as toys 'r' us or any of its equivalent.

Very nice mall with a good and inexpensive food court on the top floor. This is a new shopping mall, near Sukhumvit Soi 15 and connected to the Asok BTS and Sukhumvit MRT. The mall is large, though not as big as Central Mall. Every floor has a different theme, e.g. London, Paris, Istanbul. A lot of detail and attention was put into the landscaping and design of each floor. The shops are all very interesting. There is no anchor tenant, but rather many small shops. You can find good deals if you look hard enough.The toilets are also very interesting. The toilet on the London floor was a big hit with my kids. It was modelled like a London Underground station.There were many restaurants at the top floor where the food court was, as well as food options at the basement. There is also a supermarket at the basement.

Interesting concept and themes. A new shopping mall in Sukhumvit area. Near to Asok BTS and Sukhumvit MRT. The mall is huge with different themes at every level. Remember to visit the washroom as every toilet is also uniquely designed. Lots of good and cheap food upstairs. A supermarket at the lower floor. There are also Watsons and Guardian equivalent shops below for your daily necessities or even medicine. Was unwell during my trip and the pharmacist recommended some good medicine that works. It can satisfy most of your needs but is not the best place for shopping in Bangkok though.

halal food in Bangkok. It was our first trip to Bangkok and our hotel was very near to Terminal 21.A chance encounter with a Thai lady saw us making our way to a halal food stall in this complex. It is on the 5th floor called Pier 21. It is the only halal food stall operating there. One has to buy a food coupon first before buying our food. The menu had a variety of food dishes comprising yellow rice and buried fish or buried chicken or buried meat. it turned out to be fried fish/chicken!.Reasonable price at 45 Bhat. We also had coconut ice cream there.

Fabulous place to eat and shop!. Set over several floors that are supposed to represent various destinations such as Paris, Tokyo and London, this shopping mall combines food and fashion really well. Ok, so it's a bit hit and miss on the fashion, namely because you have to be super slim and petite to fit into the clothes, but there are some really interesting and quirky fashion trends that were an eye opener, especially in the Tokyo section. What stands out for me is the vast selection of foods available. From fish & chips, burgers and steaks to Malaysian Laksa's, Korean treats and of course Thai. It really is inspiring and offers a good choice for all budgets. It's linked to the BTS Asoke so very easy to get to. Fun place to spend a few hours.

Unique Shopping Mall that you must visit. To get here:-Go to Asok BTS or Sukhumit MetroThis shopping mall have unique concepts and design, every floor is different. The design of the toilet is very unique. I think you must visited this mall if you have time. I highly recommended you to eat at foodcourt (5th floor), the price is very cheap.

Some really interesting independent shops - but not cheap!. Check out Zhoelala on Istanbul. Terminal 21 is located at the Asok BTS. You just get off the Skytrain and walk inside, like all other malls along the BTS route. What makes this mall different from those located at Siam is that the shops - lots of them around the central escalators - are independent. Some are really cool Bangkok designers. Cool things to take back for your office. On Istanbul - yes, the area is set up to be named after parts of the world - the names seem to bear no relation to what is sold but it is a good way for remembering where you bought something in case you want to return. On Istanbul is a really cool little shop that sells flip flops. It is called Zhoelala. The prices range from 200-250 baht - similar to other prices for flip flops in Terminal 21 but wow...are they cute. I was practically run over 3 Korean girls who started squealing when they saw the designs. Down another aisle is a little shop that sells spa soaps and creams. Prices are only slightly less than in Canada but the scents are different and they put them in a patterned silk bag. There are places to eat and get drinks - note that the Starbuck's is often full. There is a gourmet market in the basement area.

New Shopping Mall. We visited this shopping mall just because it is very near to the budget hotel that we stayed and also it is link to the BTS Asoke station. We like the interior design which comes with the famous landmark from different countries but honestly not many things to shop or buy here. Also the food court and restaurant too crowded with tourist as we cant simply to get a seat as well. My advice for the travellers who plan to visit to Terminal 21, please take BTS (Sukhumvit Line) and alight at Asoke station. Terminal 21 just located next to this station.

New Mall. No doubt this shopping mall is new and products are more expensive than MBK or platinum plaza. Depending on what type of goods and prices you are looking for and the prices you are willing to pay. If you are looking for cheap and not so good quality items, you can go to MBK or platinum. If you are willing to pay slightly more or a lot more ++, you can go to terminal 21.

Excellent food court, airconditioned!. This was easy to get to, right off the sky train. It was fun to walk around and explore, even though we did not purchase anything. It was uniquely decorated. The food court on floor 5 was incredible. You had to put money onto a card, 100 baht per person was more than enough. There were several thai and chinese options to pick from. You can purchase from multiple stands using that card. Outside this food court, Subway, KFC, and other non-thai restaurants. On floor 4, there were also some sit down restaurants that would have been interesting to eat at.

product always on sale. It is a good shopping mall for students. Products are always on sale or very low price. you can find many outlet. This mall is fashionable and affordable for students. I personally think T21 is better than MBK center.

Big generic mall. You could be anywhere in the world. Each floor is themed and as it is new it is nice to visit but nothing really special to go out of your way to visit. If you want a break from the oppressive Bangkok heat and are close by then drop in. Has direct access to the Sky Train. We ate in the food hall and the food was good. Went to the movies and that was good too. More expensive than cinemas in other malls we visited in Bangkok (MBK and Central World) but still cheap by Australian standards.
Nice new shopping mall. Nice not to big shopping mall with some nice thai fashion and good restaurants. The toilets are amazing!

Nice and Trendy.. As it is near to where I stayed-Tune Hotel, T21 is just a five minutes walk. The mall is neat and very organized. Every floor has it's own theme. Found a few goodies here. Don't miss it. You'll love this mall.

Movie Theater here is Great!. I went here to see a movie ad escape the afternoon sun of Bangkok. Theater much nicer than even a top tier theater in US. Assigned seating. Seats large and very comfortable. Great sound system.

Awesome Mall. We had a great time strolling here... each floor's named and decorated like a city - San Francisco, Tokyo, Paris etc. Variety of eating and shopping options were available - from grocery to crocs. Only thing for kids to do was play video games here. Great section for shopping for cell phone accessories!

Magnanimous...... the next best after Central World. The terminal 21 is really huge..... u will get Lost in it.... But you will be happy and too busy shopping to realise or wory about it.Theres one really Huge escalator.. almost 3 levels high... which is the tallest in Asia... I hope I am correct... :)The different levels have different themes from across the world, and this makes it really unique....So while shopping, you will also be busy clicking loads and loads of pictures...the food court offers good variety, I tried Thai green curry and Rice combo at KFC, and it was really good.The movie theater is also good with variety of offerings...In short... you will be spoiled with choices....

Amazing food hall. Strongly recommend to try out the food hall - you buy coupon from desk (maybe 150 baht/person is enough) then choose from the different kiosks and point at the food you want (they have photos) and then wait while they cook it fresh, give them the coupon card, they will deduct the value for the food, after you finish, you take the coupon back to the desk and they refund any change. Great choice and very cheap.

So much fun!. A destination in itself. The food court is fantastic. The section with local Thai designer clothing had some great, unique finds. Fun to wander around here and escape the Bangkok heat or rain.

Cool Concept, good for sightseeing. It is very easy to reach as it is attached to BTS Asoke. Very cool concept for a mall, had lots of fun going around different floors and see the decor. They are amazing! Each floor pays homage to different country/city. It is generally quite pricy to shop here compared to markets and Platinum mall, obviously, but it is worth a visit, at least for lunch or dinner. The food court is great with variety of affordable food (i think it is cheaper than eating in teh famous night street food place in Sukhumvit Soi 38 by 10b lol) and yummy snacks. The only hassle is that you'll need to buy voucher for food in a card that you use like a debit card. (I bought 100b voucher and got 20b left in there TT) But it's a small thing. You could easily fill it with the amount necessary just to pay your food with making sure beforehand. All in all, it's a cool mall that is worth a visit.

Very Unique Mall in Bangkok. When you are tired of shopping at a very hot temperature in outdoor places like Chatuchak or Asiatique and want to search for some specialty items, this is definitely the place!You can find very local Thai creative designers' items at very reasonable price after you have compared those being sold at Siam Centre.For sure, you can grasp some items here. Very worthwhile to go! And must try the MIX restaurant as well.

Best mall in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is a sight to see... It is both a super mall and an exquisite tourist attraction unto itself. With each floor of the mall representing a different international destination, great food selection, and awesome small owner operated shops this is hands down the best mall in Bangkok. Very close to the Asok BTS station and easy to get to by taxi or walking if you are close to the area.

Good Unique Shopping Mall. This is a better shopping mall in Bangkok. Good mixed of tenants,offer better n variety merchandise. From cheap to expensive, local to international branded goods. My wife picked up n bought a good crocodileskin handbag at Co Ko in Level 3. Good price and very happy with it. Shopping at Trrminal 21 is always a luxury and enjoyable.

Only go if you need to buy some clothes that aren't $2 on the street. If you don't mind buying those knock-off Red Bull shirts on the street and count that as "shopping" then you probably don't need to visit Terminal 21. However, if you want to check out some local styles, this is a pretty good place to go and escape the heat of BKK.The upper floors are good for men and you can find some pretty unique stuff that nobody will be wearing back home. Lots of indie designs, and I'd describe the style as a mix between skater/hipster/nerdy-on-purpose.I usually pay a visit every time I am in the area.

The world is here!. This is one of the best laid out malls I have visited. The higher floors have direct escalators, and access to all floors is easy because of multiple points. Each floor is very well laid out and one can spend more than 2 days here!

Looks can be deceiving.... It looks like an expensive place but we found cheap bargains and unique shops in here. Be sure to dedicate at least 3 hours here, you won't be disappointed with the find here!!

What stands out is the "micro" shops.. This mall is really well set up. The interior design, and concept of different countries on each floor is really cool. A lot of detail in lighting, colors, and layout.But what really stands out.....above the first couple floors that are typical high price brands, is the several floors of "micro" shops and independents. Many stores only 10ft x 10ft in size. Yet merchandising and product placement in these micros is really well done. There must be a leasing requirement to run your store layout through Terminal 21 designers. (Unlike MBK that is a free for all). Neat concept. Really enjoyed browsing and shopping as opposed to normal malls. Would love to see my hometown mall be like this!

Another expensive hangout in Bangkok.. A smaller version of Siam Paragon but equals in its market scale and designer labels. Not your day-to-day grocery shopping haven. It has a classy atmosphere and a pleasant place to shop.

Great place for shop and photoshooting. This shopping mall come with different level with different theme and it's so impressive. You should go and experience it...Including different levels's toilet too ^^

Great Place for Eat & Shop. Terminal 21 can be reached by Bangkok MRT. Just few steps away once you get off from train is the entrance of Terminal 21. The mall has offers many shops from branded to local label of clothing. This mall provided with different level of theme. Each level represent Egypt, Tokyo, London, San Francisco etc. The washrooms of each level also has their own theme, unique and its a must to visit each of it. Terminal 21 also offers with restaurants, cafes and not to forget the food court! There are many selections and varieties of foods to be chose...Anyway, if you choose to eat in food court, before you get your meal, you've to purchase a card at the ticket counter. You've to pay according to how much you want in your card, you can add on if it is not enough and you can redeem once you've finished your meal. This place is a MUST visit not only for shopping and eating but also for photo taking!

Worth visiting for the toilets!. This sounds funny, but you can visit Terminal 21 in Bangkok for a host of reasons: nice shops, good food court, free concerts. But imagine going to a shopping mall only because of the toilets! You'll be really surprised by the state of the art toilets on every floor of the Terminal 21. These are the best toilets I've ever used in my life, and I can bet you'd love them if you decide to go to the loo ! These are simply marvelous and innovative. It'll take me a long time to forget the pampering toilets in Terminal 21 although I may not remember many of the stores or the kind of things I bought from there.
Great place to eat. Made a change to see a shopping centre with lots of small shops. The food court is on 2 levels with loads of choices at reasonable prices.

Must visit the restrooms.. Terminal 21 shopping mall is designed to resemble an airport, with different floors named after popular destinations. Some of the floors I can remember are Paris, Tokyo, Rome, and San Francisco. There are a lot of great restaurants there, but the best attraction is their restrooms. The restrooms are also designed to resemble the name of the floor it is located on, and they have toilets that spray water on your bottom and blow hot air to dry you off when you're done.

Mega Mall madness. This mall was near our hotel and we were seeking an air conditioned environment and gifts. This mall has a quirky set-up of many levels representing different great cities of the world. This is a large mall, but worth a visit due to the fun of it all and with many great shops. Most of the men's shops were on one level which was great. I loved the variety and unusual aspects of the stores. Only disappointment was the food court. I did not like the method of payment and much of the food was not attractive or tasty. The mall itself is worth an afternoon or evening of great shopping.

Great idea for a shopping complex. The concept for this shopping complex is very unique and interesting. Went to every level to see different country theme and visited the toilet for every level as they are all having different design for each level. Worth to pay a visit

Interesting concept shopping mall. This shopping mall has different levels for London, Paris, Tokyo and San Francisco- even a golden gate bridge on the top level. Definitely worth a visit while in Bangkok, and easily accessible from the BTS.

Terminal 21 mall. This mall is near to Asoke station. In fact the mall has direct access to asoke station.the mall itself is huge but i found it a little bit on the higher side in terms of cost. e.g a small toy bike was costing 3000 THB which i feel is on the higher side. you could see lots of designer label shops in the mall which gave you a feeling of a high priced mall. Good for people who are brand conscious. Just beside the mall is the Hotel westin.

mall with a theme. this mall is unique. every floor with different country theme. a nice place to walk around. but what i really loved was the food court, Pier 21 on the 5th floor. clean, cheap, delicious and air conditioned. what else to ask for!

A very creative way to design a Shopping Mall. The first time I stepped into Terminal 21, I was amazed. The interior design is superb and the concept is creative. Terminal 21 was designed as though it is an airport and different level symbolises different country. Each level was decorated according to the country it was assigned to including the toilet. For example one level is called London, and they have the tubes on the level but with shops inside. So creative!In terms of goods, i think Terminal 21 provide a wide range of product where you can possibly find everything. I particularly enjoy the clothing there. A lot of variety and cheap too. But if you plan on visiting Jatujak Weekend Market to shop, you might as well stop yourself from shopping at Terminal 21 because i noticed that some of the stuff they sell in Terminal 21 also available in Jatujak, only that it is so much cheaper in Jatujak. Otherwise, if you want to avoid the big crowd in Jatujak, shopping here would be wise and reasonable too.Terminal 21 also has a movie theathre, a good one. During my trip to Bangkok, I got a chance to watch Iron Man 3 here and was impressed of the quality of the cinema.

Lovely shopping malls. Well, I don't like to go shopping malls as there is a lot in Hong Kong.However, this shopping malls really unlike any other.it has variety of shops. Some of them are local stores and which attracts me a lot.Me and my partner buy a lot in Terminal 21 and definitely feel very happy about the services.The most important things is that the prize for those small shops are very reasonable.Quality of the clothes is just very good.We love this place!

Cheap high quality food court...like $1 cheap. If you are a visitor to bangkok and afraid of street food stick to the malls. This malls upper most food court has 20 vendors serving food at an average price of $1 a serving. Servings are small compared to American standards so I would order 2 main dishes, a drink and all for $3-3.50 a person. Very clean mall and clean food. FYI - don't be fooled by the first food floor you see with expensive American priced restaurants...the food court is one more floor up.

A very decent mall. Great place to shop and eat. The variety of shops and restaurants are great. It range from cheap to decent price, and some with some great view of the city as well. The food court provides you a cheaper options, but the quality is not bad neither. For shopping, It is possible that you can bargin with the stores, but dont expect you can get a great discount though. location wise, it is great also. The mall is right next to the Asoke station. Very convenient.
Creative theme. Good for a first time visit after that it becomes just another shopping centre. Each foor is themed to a different country.

Normal Shopping Centre.. From the design inside you will realise it is actually designed to look like a airport. look interesting. but the things that amazed me is their toilet. Toilet for each level is based on different country. Other then that it is just a shopping centre but with good design and is new and clean.

Boring like an airport. Designed like an airport, this is a newish mall. It's quite corny really, where they label the floors with international cities, and the signage pretty much reads like what's in an airport, with terminals etc. more importantly, the shopping and dining options are quite blah. The shopping attempts to mimic the stereotypes of each international city, so it's a mishmash of local and global. The food is mainly overpriced street food packaged in a mall. But at least it provides somewhat of a destination for the sukhumvit end of Bangkok

Excellent Shopping Mall. This shooping mall is just beside the BTS Asoke/Sukhumvit station and connected to the skyway. I'm really amazed with this shopping mall, the best I have experienced so far interm of facilities and decorations.The floors is designed and customized based on countries, the most floor I liked is London and San Francisco. There's even The Golden Gate crossing the mall.Toilet is superb ! They even decorate the toilets following the country of each floors.Very clean and hi-tech. Really love the bidet installed. They are using Toshiba bidet, you can even set the toilet seat temperature, shower or move rotation of bidet and built-in blower after you finished your business down there. As for muslim, there's one muslim restaurant at the foodcourt, Pier21. We ate here almost everyday since the food is nice and reasonable. You will get a set of yellow rice with a bowl of soup for 35 baht. Drink will start from 20 baht. They're using prepaid card systems, you have to top-up your card and swipe for payment.As for shopping, they were selling items like shirts and dresses which originally from chatuchak weekend market at a slightly higher price. Well, we did spents a little here since it's weekedays and about to leave bangkok. Price is reasonable based on the presentation and quality, well it's in a shopping mall right ? You can't expect it to be as cheap as chatuchak. Lower floor selling a high to medium end items.

Moderate. Been to Take Care Nail Salon (1st Floor).Service taken:1- Acrylic Extension Nails2- ManicureService number one, she pinched my nails hard. Taught that I did not feel anything until she heard 'Ouchhh' 3times. (Deaf? Or ignorant?)By accident, one of the manicurist stepped on my newly done Nail Art on my toes. She did not speak english at all but she said sorry. After all, she should've redo my nail by redoing the color and glue back the crystal (5 pieces) for free but She did not. Spoken to the lady-boy, representative (receptionist) he just nodding his head. No service recovery, nothing.All I can say, thanks for the memories.

Unique, a tourist attraction. Loved going through every level of this shopping mall as each level was so different and well decorated. Check out the toilets too - they're an attraction in itself! Great place to find some nice restaurants but do your shopping elsewhere because the prices here are a bit $$$. I found similar stuff for half price in MBK.

unique mall. near to the sky trainvery new mallunique & cool with many different country theme on each floormany restaurant (i don know about muslim restaurant as i cannot find one)this place is good for sightseeing only. The shopping part is definitely not our taste as we could find it back home

This is interessting!. Fantastic mall - built as an airport terminal. When you take the escalators you are told that you are now going to Tokyo and so on. The toilets are an experience, remember to try the on each floor as they are different, according to what town you have "landed" in. All the right shops, and also nice offers. Nicely located close to Sukhumvit Soi 12 for outdoor dining and drinking, nice place for a shopping-break!

unique mall. Each shopping floor is unique. One floor has more of the high end brands, while another floor are for women's clothing, another are for start up clothing designers. There are other floors with different concepts. This is great as each floor is different. Check out the toilets on each floor. The toilets are themed as well. Food court at the top floor has great choices. The basement with the supermarket also has several food choices right in front. The supermarket is smallish and would have be better if it was bigger.Also, terminal 21 has a great location, right smack in the middle of the mrt and skytrain.

Unique concept mall with great foodcourt. The mall is located near Asok BTS station. The mall has a unique concept make it looks like an airport terminal and every floor represent different country. At the top floor they have Pier 21 food court with many so many options and very cheap price! Free wifi in the mall (for a year!) if you sign up at the Information counter. You will have to show them your ID card or passport to register.

It may sound ridiculous but you need to visit the bathrooms!. The bathrooms are the highlight of this mall. It is very well-designed and elaborately decorated. Each floor has its own style resembling something from each well-known cities around the world. Definitely check them out.The food court here is less expensive compared to other shopping malls (i.e. Paragon, Central World, ...), so it is a good option for low-budget traveler. Also, there are a so many restaurants to choose from in this mall. If you are familiar to Thailand's chain shopping mall restaurants, you will find restaurants in this mall more familiar than, say, Siam Paragon, which has more high-end cafes.Overall, definitely worth visiting once if you are in Thailand. I brought friends here all the time when they come visit Bangkok and they all like it!

A shopping and food highlight in BKK. An amazing place, massive choice of shops and restaurants , themed by floor .I wont add more as the other reviewers have said it all, well woth visiting whenever you are in BKK, I know I will

Relax, eat, and shop.. This is a great place for shopping and eating. This mall is not too far from the Grand Mellinium Hotel so we would walk there for dinner. We felt safer eating the food from here than off the street. There are eating places on at least two different floors. On the upper floor you have to load money on a card which is free and then you are able to buy food you cannot just pay cash. There are several desert places as well. all tuk-tuk drvers and cab drivers know where it is so no problem getting there
A Place to hide in the heat. Not a place to go for cheap prices but definitely the place to go for a pleasant shopping experience.convenient location, spacious mall.

Interesting concept, very affordable and good food. The mall is styled as an airport terminal, each floor having a different city as its theme, eg Istanbul, London, Paris, San Francisco etc. Personally I did not find myself attracted by this concept. However, what is worth checking out is the floor with local designers' goods. You may find something interesting that you may like.The food court on the 4th and 5th levels are a must-try. Food is so affordable and because it's a new mall, the food is prepared in relatively clean conditions.

Unique and amazing. It's a unique building, brand new. Every level is a different country theme. The restrooms are so clean and according to different themes. The automatic toilet is another attraction. I thoroughly enjoyed the food court on the fifth level. The food is full of flavor, price is so cheap and the vibe is great. Take BTS to stop Asok, and you are literally there!

Shopping and a whole lot more. Terminal 21 is a lot more than just a mall, it's an innovative shopping experience. Next too and connected to the Asoke Skytrain terminal, it's easy to get too. Several themed floors most with small unique boutique stores. The floors are segregated, one just for men, another with larger labels, another two just for women and then there is the food. There is a food court on the bottom with a market and stores selling mostly sweets. However floors 4 and 5 are all restaurants. There is a large and very good buffet which really should be tired. However the best part is all the different small restaurants. This isn't mall food like in America, this is really good food in a sit down and served setting. For the most part it's inexpensive for restaurant dining, but more than street food (which should be expected). The mall is beautiful and spotless. It really is worth a visit even if you don't plan to buy anything.

Echoing earlier reviews. If you are a shopper or just a wanderer, be sure to stop at Terminal 21. I thought it was the most visually interesting mall in Bangkok. It was horribly hot when I was in Bangkok so I spent more time in malls than I might otherwise. This one was a real treat. I even took pictures of some of the restroom designs.Plus the shops seemed to offer items that I had not seen elsewhere or at least they were more easily seen due to the mall's design.

A step into the future. This mall is set up like an airport. Each floor is a 'terminal' and has a different theme of a country. It's really pretty cool. It's cool inside, you have to visit the bathroom and check out the 'futuristic' toilet system. The food court is AMAZING!!! The food is really cheap, what Thai food SHOULD cost and it's tasty. At peak hours you might struggle to find a table though. There is a Gourmet Market which is great and the rest of the mall is filled with expensive labels. I visit malls for food purposes and wish I lived next to this one just so I could eat here daily!

Innovative mall. Many peoples has been talking about this mall. The design of the entire mall is like the airport terminal. And, each floor is decorated with different city theme or culture. So, it is more than a shopping mall. And, there are many foods there. Although the price is a bit higher than the one at the street but worth for it.

A mall with a difference. It looks like your average shopping centre from the outside but inside, each floor is designed with a different city in mind and entrances to escalators are like airport departure gates to a new destination - nice idea to keep shopping interesting.

Clean, themed, air-conditioned, food, shopping. What a great find for us, as we looked for something to do on our first half-day in Bangkok. Wanting to save a full day for temple sighting, we ambled off in search of a light activity that would be worth exploring and give us some sort of reprieve from the hot & humid Bangkok weather.We found it! Terminal 21, located at the Asok sky train stop, is certainly worth a visit. Every floor had a different city-based theme; Rome, London, Paris, San Francisco, to name a few (the bathrooms also follow the theme of each floor and are impeccably kept).On some levels, a plethora of *tiny* shops (other than the regular-size H&M) line the walls, offering all sorts of interesting clothing items and jewelry options. On other levels, sustenance is the favoured need to be fulfilled, and many culinary delights await. The top floor has a few small electronics shops and a CINEMA, playing English movies with Thai subtitles. The Lower Ground level is for anyone with a major sweet tooth; this is where all the dessert kiosks are. Additionally, there is a supermarket that accepts credit cards... a major bonus. (All shops and restaurants in the mall seem to, from our experience)There are escalators between levels, as well as elevators. You can even exit at skytrain level, and save yourself some stairs (from street-level).Our visit coincided with a music festival, thus we were serenaded by Thai musicians playing old favourites. The quality was good and the live music certainly added to the atmosphere.

Too many small shops. Terminal 21 is definitely the shopping mall with the largest number of stores i've seen. Not because is big (despite it's6 floors) but because of the size of the stores, many many of them very small sized making it even a bit overwhelming to walk around. There are some cool shops though, with local designers presenting creative t-shirts. If you're looking for somewhere to shop head to Siam.

Never bored. I just love this mall cause of the uniqueness. The layout setting really is something. Especially for the auto toilet, maybe its too much, but i just love it.Lower ground, everytime i come here always consists of various food bazar.Foodcourt on the top floor is a dining unique experience.I will always try to stop by at this mall everytime i visit bangkok.It is all connected to a bts. If i am not mistaken just stop at asok station right two station after nana station.

Walkabout. Terminal 21 is 10 minutes walk from the Park Plaza Hotel. It has 7 floors and a cinema complex. It provides a vast array of shops and restaurants and is situated adjacemnt to the MRT and other transport hubs

Great mall. This mall is one of the best that I've been to in the world! It has almost every store that you can think of. If you're looking to do some bartering, I would suggest going somewhere else. This is a typical mall setting with the high-priced items that you would expect. It's a great experience and a fun theme. I would suggest using the interactive maps to find stores. I was told four different things by five different workers when I asked for directions to a store! I eventually found it, but I will definitely use those maps the next time!

a great place. One review says, its not a destination but a great place, I totally agree. We discover this place when we stopped at Asoke station to get to another place through BTS. Its Songkran festival so there are many things going on. They just opened H&M and so on...We found ourselves looking at the cute stuff on the stalls up for Retro Disco Splash. there were several other interesting items...We got freebies upon signing up for tourist privilege card and wifi. At the ground level we saw a showcase of local foods. It was perhaps, the best place in Terminal 21. Food was really good and cheap. (Maybe it wasnt that cheap but i think it was not that expensive as well, considering the prices of food in Cambodia in USD). At top level of Terminal 21, we saw shops of various tshirt prints. whoaaaa, i really love it. The prices of the shirts are just the same as ones from the night markets and Platinum. Probably, there are other places which sell these shirts in a much cheaper price but buying from here is much more comfortable. Well, i heard about Bangkorker in Khao San Road, but that's far and we didn't have time...

Not a destination, but a great place nevertheless.. If you find yourself near Terminal 21 on Sukumvit Road, it is a great place to shop, eat or take in a movie. It is fairly new and I believe it opened less than two years ago. From the bottom floor up where you will find a super market through the grand halls complete with marble like Greek statues or Herculean sized sumo wrestlers hugging a pillar, through a great, but not too intimidating food court and movie complex. The latter to spend a couple of hours cooling off, then getting a bite to eat.They have, by the way, the cleanest, free bathrooms in BKK. It is worth stopping just for that if convenient.When traveling, I always check out the malls, hotel or restaurants for the leanest bathrooms...just do.Terminal 21 has its own mark and is not like the other malls with their over priced, high end stores which are out of reach for many. While not low end fun shopping like MBK, it will not break your budget and there is something for everyone. One could easily spend a couple of hours here just meandering around and cooling off.
nice place!. it's big, clean and fun. Near all the hotels and near the MRT. Good for a walk or to do some shopping

Brilliant food court some good shops. I wrote this review after reading a different review by someone whose experience was the exact opposite to mine.I found the food at the food court excellent - a huge variety of amazingly fresh produce at local prices. Also delicious Thai fruit dessert (mango and durian sticky rice outstanding). Lastly freshly mixed fruit juices made while you wait (2 mins). For a good sized meal made from fresh ingredients by locals in a pristinely clean environment for under 100 baht is a bargain.The location of the mall is perfect - easily accessible by Sukhumvit MRT or Asok BTS since it is at the junction of MRT and BTS.Didn't do much shopping but the range seemed good. Also an ok movie cinema as well

Finally make it to T21 for a purchase. In March & November 2012 ,we transit T21 and on 19 March 2013 we finally landed at T21 at 2100 after our dinner at MBK.We were looking for a bag and found one on the 3rd floor and bought it for 3125 bht.We just walk up the 4th floor with our tiring leg to window shopping and our final destination is at the 5th floor foodcourt for hot drinks but it was closing time and only cold drinks can be purchase.We ordered 5 Pepsi and sat there till we forgotten to change back the stored value card to cash by 2230.We managed to find out that ,it has an expiry date of 30 days and we decided to encash it back the next day.

Unique theme shopping mall. It does gives shoppers a different atmosphere to shop due to its different theme for every floor. Less crowded as compared to MBK, Platinum Mall.... The clothing sold there are not those price you can get at MBK but did managed to get some designer T-shirts at 200 baht (the quality is so much better) at the London theme floor. Had a great lunch at the MIX restaurant at the top floor, to check out the lunch promotion. There is free wifi available but you need to bring your passport along to register.
Great shopping, food, movie theatres and wifi. Two food courts, wi fi and a shopping mall with all the mod cons.....seemed better than the more top end malls in the middle of town (Siam) .....

Nice Place for branded shopping. This shopping mall is one of the new ones in bangkok. It has a good atmosphere compared to other mall in the city. Every floor is different theme. But you dont get anything special from here what you cannot buy elsewhere. But nice place anyway.Lastly, food court was a nice surprise. Loved Sunrise Tacos at the top floor. Absolutely mouth watering . Try the fajitas.

Pretentious junk mall. The idea of making it look like some destination with names for each floor, backfires amazingly.It has instead become a very confusing layout, where one must be used to this mall if one wants to meet anyone here.The mall is littered wth a huge number of smaller vendors, with all kinds of made up English names and words. They are basically competing in who is most pretentious. But when one look closer, this is nothing less than upscale junk, which one can buy in most markeds in Thailand.The majority of these small one or two-person stores are closed for a few hours each day, so the staff can go and eat, or be left alone with their mobile phones.The food court area is good, but again, failing spectacularly.Loads of teenagers running the stores and restaurants, making it frustrating for a tourist, since very few of them speak any English (a few words here and there).Look again, and one will notice that the vast majority of people in this mall do not carry anything which prove they didnt bought anything at all here.The location is bad, and is next to the busiest road in Bangkok, with 24 hours traffic jam.However, the sky train station (Asoke) is next door, for those who can use, or know how to use it.Almost impossible to get a taxi from the mall, due to the heavy congested Sukhumvit road next to it.With so many other malls in Bangkok, stay away from this one.

Pier 21 Foodcourt. This mall is built with a Airport concept in mind with every floor representing a different country. Its a very creative and interesting concept but the highlight in this mall goes to their foodcourt, called Pier 21. It has an amazing selection of food at reasonable prices. Loved the coconut ice cream!In terms of shopping the mall is not a place for bargain hunting and prices tend to be from average to high.

Amazing experience. This is one of the best shopping malls I have visited. A very interesting place. The floors have different themes, capitals of various countries, which is a brilliant way of making a shopping mall lots more interesting. Toilets are really good and I couldn't help but had to check the different themes for toilets too !!!!!?You can get free wifi from the information desk on floor G or M by showing them your passports. Speed is retry good for wifi. Shops are very cool and many brands which I have never heard of. Prices are pretty good too, I wouldn't say it's cheap for some times but I ended up buying some clothes for a lot cheaper than ordinary shops in the UK. I loved the unusual designs which the shops have on offer.. In short, I would say, make sure you visit it and allocate a few hours to it, you won't be disappointed .

Well worth visiting. My 20+ daughter and myself visited April 2013. Not really the place to go for really cheap shopping, but a nice place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city, and the heat! Very well designed and a lot of thought has gone into making it a place to see, rather than just a place to shop. After reading a review that suggested to visit the toilets here, we started at the top level and checked them out on each level. Might sound a bit strange, but it's well worth having a look at them all. The ones on the London level are amazing. Would be nice if Australian shopping centre designers did work like this.

Worth a visit. Great shopping destination with variety of items to choose from, themed floors very interesting and excellent photo op. Watch movie, eat in the food courts, try the lower ground for eats, bakery, grocery, pharmacies. Free wifi from information desk in ground floor.

Around the world. Every floor is themed as a different country. Good place for men's wear and I bought a shirt for my boyfriend here. Little shops at the ground floor and I picked up a customised charm bracelet. Surprised to find some gown shops on the ladies floor. Beautiful wedding gown only costs approx SGD500. We went across the street to Korean town for lunch as well. Worth a visit

Nice surprise. Have been couple of times at this mall and I must say this is a very pleasant area. Unless the other malls, Terminal 21 does provide a great experience in shopping with every floor being a different city, which also means a design of the floor according to the city itself. I am sure the owners have splashed a large amount of money to design and build this place and the result is really pleasant. Besides among the 500 stores they claim, it is mainly small unknown brands or handcrafts items. Definitively worth a visit.

Great Selection of Western food. Not a big shopper at big malls but enjoyed walking around and seeing the decor! This mall has a great selection of Western style places to eat too! Much more than other malls that I have been to in Bangkok!

Dull Mall. Nicely architect shopping mall but has absolutely nothing to offer. Shopping here is one of the worst in Bangkok if compared to MBK and Siam Paragon. This place is only good for taking photos and perhaps eating out. But there are plenty of shopping malls I would say better, don't make this your priority.

Fantastic Shopping Mall near Asoke BTS. This is a relatively new Shopping Mall on Sukhumvit Road in Bangkok. There are fabulous statues and Icons that decorate this fabulous mall. There are 9 floors in this mall, each floor has a theme of an International City. You could be walking in Tokyo, London, The Caribbean, Paris, San Francisco, Rome, Istanbul. The opening hours are 1000 to 2200. This Mall is worth a visit.
Good for food.. Start your day in the food hall - very cheap and very clean.Meals are on average 45bht each which is about £1.

Best Mall Dining in Bangkok. Terminal 21 is a well planned theme mall. Comparable to Central World, Paragon, and MBK. Where it really shines however is in it's eateries... All the familiar names are here, but the star of the show is the 5th floor food court: great variety, high quality, large area, good views and the best prices of any food court in Bangkok.

Outstanding architecture. Terminal 21 is a new modern shopping mall with every floor dedicated to differnt city... as San Francisco, London... True its a place to see, but its too expensive you can get the same stuff on the street cheaper or i would recommend if u like to buy go to the Weekender Market!

worth the visit. Terminal 21 is just off from the Asoke train station, it is connected via an over pass and it is very easy to locate. This busy shopping centre has many different levels. The bottom level has a gourmet shopping centre for grocery shopping and other bakery and food stalls selling everything you need and the pharmacy and newsagents are also on this bottom level. The rest of the levels are shopping and coffee places. The shopping isn't cheap but you can get some good deals if you look around. The top level has a cinema and sells mobile phones. Pier 21 is the complexes food court and requires you to load money onto a card that you use to buy food and drinks its a great idea that saves worrying about correct change or paying too much. The local thai food is cooked in front of you in you find the right stand and sells many different kinds of thai traditional food starting from 50c - $2. Coffee Corner is good for your basic iced and hot coffee & tea. I have eaten here many times and the food is different and cheap and the staff try their best to understand the tourists!!! It is a safe and easy shopping complex to get around and has a large mix of locals and tourists. The Asoke station can they take you to your next destination.
