Great place to shop and dine.. Terminal 21 is one of the newest shopping malls that was opened in 2012. It is just next to the Asok BTS train station, with a linkway from the exit of the station.Terminal 21 is organized like an airport terminal, where there are departures and arrivals. Each floor is named after a major city in the world, e.g. Tokyo, Istanbul. The decor of each floor is also according to the destination of that major city.You will find lots of shopping, food, restaurants, and also a supermarket. The toilets are also very clean.

trying to be different. This mall has different themed floors that each represent a country. I took the BTS to get here it is near asoke bts station. The shops are mostly boutiques. I found a few cool things for my daughters and also for her mom.they also have a starbucks if this is what you would like......

Great place to shop and eat!. This is a very modern mall with trendy and unique stores. You could spend several hours in there. It is great especially when it is very hot outside. The food court and all the restaurants are great. There are many options. Also, the restrooms at this place are all extremely clean and uniquely themed on each floor. A must see.

Food Court is clean, tasty, uniquely decorated, and inexpensive. I enjoyed Terminal 21 Food Court because of its cleanliness, its good taste, its good value, and its interesting San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf theme. I enjoyed the Som Tom, the Pork Neck Spicy Salad, the Mango Sticky Rice, and the Fried Oyster Omelette. The food was such a good value and taste, I came back for a second time in my two day Sukhumvit transit.

Experiences of the world..... This is a brand new place with each floor themed after a prominent city from across the world. A massive structure which is directly connected to the BTS & MRT, this is one place for all possible shopping. Even if you are not for shopping, its an experience exploring the place for the variety it offers!!!
Excellent food court. Cheap and high quality air conditioned meals at street food prices. We ate here - family of four and paid 200 baht total.
this is another beautiful shopping. we went to many shopping in Bangkok and terminal 21 is a good shopping its new shopping and has good layout so many things to buy here and good for price to buy

A very good moment. Date of visit: 08/03/13 and 09/03/13I have to say I'm not a fan of shopping mall but this one is the best I ever did and I would be damned not to visit it.You don't go there for the shops and brands you can find, you go there for the Airport like decoration.Every floor has a different theme (London, Paris, Tokyo, NY, ...) and is decorated differently.I even found myself visiting all the restroom of Terminal 21 (or most of them)... Crazy you will say but I assure you it worth the try. For one floor the restroom is a bakery, for another one it's a London subway station, Paris airport, antique roman building, ...)Be aware:- Terminal 21 is at Sukhumvit station- There is a cinema- Lots of restaurants but the cantine on the 5th floor (don't remember the name) is much cheaper and very good with lots of Thai dishesHope it helps

T 21. Nice place where to find good quality products from thailand and oversea. The center is modern, clean and very nice. Caffè restaurants and on the top floor there is also a very confortable Cinema ! To be visited!

A shopping mall conveniently located at Asok BTS. Since we were staying at Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit which is opposite the shopping mall Terminal 21, we just walked over as and when during our stay.It is an interesting mall with different countries as destinations on each level. What we liked was that most of the stuffs were by local designers and of course there are also a lot of international brands housed in it.There are also a lot of eateries conveniently located on most of the levels.
Huge but not cheap. Those expecting great bargains will be disappointed but the centre is enormous and will cater to all tastes.
interesting mall. Shop a mall that's modeled after an airport terminal. Each floor is a different major world city. Even the restrooms are a must see as they reflect the floor's theme.

Great place to shop, visit and eat!. Our favourite mall by far in Bangkok. It's located in Sukhumvit near Asok BTS. Firstly, every floor of this mall has a different concept - the floor and the washroom is based on a country's theme. We cannot help but visit the washrooms in almost every floor! And we weren't the only ones. Weird but you have to see it for yourself. The countries include San Francisco, Paris, Rome, Istanbul, Hollywood, Japan etc. The Japan's washroom is decorated like a Japanese tea house and the staff are dressed in kimono to fit the bill. For London, for example, one of the washrooms are decorated like a subway station. Pretty interesting! I love the shopping here too. Plenty of small shops selling clothing and accessories from their local designers. Quality is better and classier than Platinum mall. There are plenty of food choices at their food court too! And it's even cheaper than MBK! It's a cashless system so you need to get a stored value card. I most definitely will come back here again if I return to Bangkok.

Good place to have a break. It was raining a lot and this was the solution for me. A clean place with lots of space and light. Nice places to seat and eat. Nice gourmet supermarket on the basement. Wifi for free, money exchange offices and ATM machines everywhere. Prices are ok. Bought nice shoes and had 2 meals. The restrooms are fabulous clean and luxurious.

Most value for money meal at Pier 21 foodcourt!. You can get the best bargain for nice food at this foodcourt. Just purchase a stored-value card to pay for your food, the foodcourt practises a cashless payment system at the stall. Any balance in the card can also be refunded. Most try dishes include the duck rice, mango sticky rice, fish maw soup and many more dishes!
Very Posh. This mall is for the rich only. So only window shopping. We could not identify a Indian restaurant here. Has got one of the biggest supermarket in bangkok.

Destination Destination. A clever new concept for a shopping mall, a must see and now the best choice for daytime wanderers escaping the ravaging heat and pollution of the Big Mango.The new designs and lavatorial elegance somehow manage to eclipse Siam Paragon as the most talked about mall in town right now. Situated at the crossroads of Asoke junction, BTS skytrain and the MRT underground, it is perfect as an 'eat and greet' or date movie location. Rest assured that in the eventually of Mr. Bruce Willis being unavailable, cockney geezer Jason Statham can be seen flexing his biceps in the wings. Only Thai movie? No way people... Hollywood's finest understudy (cough, um) Nicholas Cage will be ready to pounce on your ticket receipt given short notice should you require it :) Yes, they like their action movies here, and why not... anything's better than that horrible Hobbit right now zzzzzzzzz. What a total flipping disgrace that was, anyway back to the review, sorry...as far as the shopping goes I'm not so convinced, it needs a real book store for foreigners like Kinokuniya at Paragon. Also visitors may prefer bargain hunting at the markets in Pratunam, Chatuchak and getting their electronic services at Fortune Town or MBK... but the stalls are funky and nice at T21 and plenty of places to eat at. All in all it fills in a few hours in a pleasing conceptual kind of way... and I like that.

Best Bargain Foodcourt. When visiting Bangkok and wanting to sample a food court, you must visit Terminal 21. Easily reached on the BTS Sukhumvit line, get off at Asok and enter directly from the platform. If you like Som Tam (green papaya salad) be sure to sample it here-they will make it to your taste, Thai style(no crab) or Isaan style with crab.About 45 Baht $1.50-also the sweet mango with sticky rice and coconut milk is the lowest price in town,about half the price of MBK(Mah Boon Krung) and fresh, at 35 Baht for half or 70 Baht whole. There are various stalls with any imaginable food found in Thailand. The shopping mall itself is very entertaining, and prices are fairly priced. You can also access movies on the sixth floor, and a market in the sub basement.Go where the locals go-here.

Ok , but not wow. I have been there on march 7 , walked all the way from Dream Hotel , it's expensive very limited stocks , had better time in a Platinum Mall and better deals.Don't waste your time , there are better things to do in Bangkok
Must see, and must visit the toilets on every floor. Even if you're not shopping, you must see this tourist attraction. This is probably the most interesting interior I've ever seen.

Terminal 21. After Chiang Mai, Bangkok was very difficult for me to digest as it was different on all levels. Terminal 21 was my ice breaker and I was able to have a good time there jumping from country to country. Their food court is amazing and is not to be missed!

Love the food court!!. It's a great shopping mall with different theme at each level. Next to Asoke bts station. Most of the shops sell branded stuff. As branded goods are cheaper in Singapore, we did not get anything there. The foodcourt is amazing. Food is simply delicious. We tried food in different food court, platinum mall, mbk, central world, etc. This foodcourt is the best!!!

Very cool layout. The shopping centre has an airport theme with flight boards & different cities on different levels. It's pretty cool & interesting. There's lots of stores & food choices. Only thing I didn't like was that a lot of stores on the Tokyo/womenswear level were closed for breaks (this was around 7pm). The shopping centre is also next to two train lines so super easy to get to.

You will love it !!!!. Clean, convenient location (linked to Asoke BTS), great range of shopping, super wide range of food option (restaurants, food court Pier 21 (level 5) - you can spend at least 3 days to try all the food offerings, specialty eatery outlets at basement, different theme at every floor (UK, Hollywood, Middle East, Oriental,etc ...and even the clean toilets are individually themed to the floor! even the toilet bowls were automated with douche and auto function... The mall is opened 10am to 10pm daily....What more can I can say? Terminal 21 seeks to differentiate itself from the hordes of malls mushrooming in the vibrant Thai capital...just don't confuse yourself and try to check in for your departure flight with the airport themed mall, where staff wear uniforms like stewardess or pilots..lol

A very new and trendy shopping complex near Asok.. Upon entry you look up and see escalators going to all 6 floors of shopping and eateries. The basement also has a large grocery and deli store. Top floor is a multi plex cinema and fitness centre.
Gimmicky. Different floors with different destination themes.Variety of goods sold, fairly generic local "chain" brands like AIIZ and Chaps. Good for a quick look if you like cam-whoring.

Loved this shopping centre. We loved Terminal 21 especially the themed floors. Our favorite floor was Istanbul. The themed restrooms were also an attraction - they were designed to fit the theme & so clean!!Great food court & restaurants. Spent the whole day shopping.

Excellent place to shop and with one of the finest food courts !!!. One of the best Malls located at Asok Metro Station in Sukhumvit 15. Nice place to shop with most of the brands available. Food court had a very large variety of International cuisines

Great for family!. Was recommended by a friend to visit it. Very fascinated by it. Very accessible by the mrt. Was welcomed by receptionist who look like staff in airport. I was confused for a while, then realized that the whole place is designed like and airport. With arrival and departure signage. Each floor has a different theme, like San Francisco, Japan and China. Good variety of restaurants and I particularly loved the food court! The place is clean and the quality of food is very good and very cheap. Don't miss the toilets. They are equally interesting. The staff on each level also have uniforms that matched the themes. Spacious. Loved it!

So so. Nothing much. Some clothes are similar to any other malls or cn even get better ones elsewhere. Expensive for the type of mall. But its interesting concept and decorations. There is a Tokaenoi store at the basement.. Aesome for their lovers.

nice concept, nice shops. I really thought shops inside the mall were expensive 'cause the mall's facade looked expensive. But really, very affordable finds inside. They have really nice and unique shops that are affordable. Would shop here again for shoes.

Interesting place to shop in Thailand. I like the concept of this shopping mall. Every floor is of a different country theme- u have san francisco, london , chinatown , turkey etc...It is very different from the usual finds you have in Bkk. You can locate local designs, various country fashion styles. Japanese British and middle eastern to name a few. There's a shop on the 3rd floor i think that sells cute earrings as well as cute t shirts . A lot of shoe shops too. You will like the place if you are sick of the hot and humid shopping in Bkk.
Excellent food court - way better than MBK. Top up your card and get eating. Full of Thai people eating which is always a good sign. Really good value around 40bhat for massive portions.

Good Value. Watched a movie here in February.Theatre was only about 10% full. Tickets for 2 in the Premium section was about $12 for two people. So about half the price they are at home. Theatre was clean and seats were very comfortable and spacious. When tickets are purchased you are able to select assigned seating, so no need to rush to your seats. Top tiered seats are a row of comfortable sofas at the rear of the theatre. These were sold out, however looked very comfortable.
expensive. nice design but found it expensive enough...good thing they offer free wi fi for a year if u give details at information center

Very creative shopping centre. I only spent half day there, plus a quick lunch. It is very creative plaza. Every level is a departing gate to different places, and the stores on that level are the style of that destination. Very good place for eating and shopping.

Very Nice looking mall on the inside. Every floor is designed differently.There is a level totally for men, most floors are for women.basement and most top floor consist of foodhall and restaurants.There is also a cinema on the most upper floor.

An interesting place. Every floor has a different decor, an interesting place for taking picture.very unique things from some giftshop,my boyfriend get an saving money box has password protect running by battery ,cost 1400 bth so funny and lovely place

photo~. it is quite a new shopping mall in bkk,the location are good.just get off from the Asok BTS and you can walk into the mall.a lot of artistic decoration that you can snap picture with.go to the concierge and show your passport to register for tourist privilege and also free wi-fi that only expired after one year.Amazing~for ladies, there are a lot of different style that you can shop for.they even sell bridal and evening gown and i believe you could not find it in somewhere else.overall if you are looking for something extra ordinary than others, here the place you should come.

Impressive layout but not practical shopping for me!. Yes, great layout and whoever designed it did it beautifully but wow, expensive clothes! The food court was good especially the mangos with sticky rice and I liked their banana and strawberry drink.
Although overall I didnt spend much time here, because it was so expensive and I would rather do something more affortable.

middle and high class shopping in neat atmosphere. the terminal 21 is located at sukhumvit road and is a brandnew shopping mall which fullfill nearly every shopping dream. the different levels are named after cities (london, istanbul, tokio, rome, paris) and every floor has it own typical atmosphere. between tiny shops there are stylish restaurants or cafe bars, the entire top floor (san francisco) consists of restaurants, which offer food from all over the world. a very hugh cinema also is located in the shopping mall and specially when its raining the terminal 21 is a top destination in which it is no ploblem to stay for hours and no boredom arises. the shops are expensive in relation to the prices in mbk or the night markets, but the ware which is different from other shopping malls have a better quality. a visit of the toilets is a must!...they are completely automatic with heater, bidet and all electronical nonsense which is conceivable. we can recomment the terminal 21 very much, because its architecture and atmosphere is extraordinary and in a high standard.

my fav shopping spot in bkk. its a great break from regular crazy shopping... this place offers some aesthetic value to the whole shopping experience . each floor takes u to a different zone of world.. fm paris to san francissco..... the food is great, the cinema is good, and the shopping is just as good.

A nice, new mall with great food floor!. Because we stayed at a hotel nearby (The Key Bangkok hotel) we used to come to Terminal 21 for some meals or dessert. Generally, this is a new and well decorated mall. the goods are not as impressive as the mall itself. But the food are all good! We tried many and pleased with all!
Fun theme mall. Fun concept. Each floor has different city theme and is decorated accordingly. The bathrooms on Istanbul floor are fun. Good variety of restaurants on the upper floors. Worth a visit.

Great theme needs a bit more. Terminal 21 is a great place to stop and take pictures. Each floor has a famous city theme and they really thought about the design of each floor. Even the bathrooms go along with the theme. There are plenty of stores but they are very small and don't have a huge selection. I find myself just wandering looking at the decor more than shopping. The jewelry on the Istanbul floor is pretty unique, but I have trouble finding shoes and clothes. The food court is very good and is reasonably priced and in the basement there is also an assortment of food. It is an easy place to get to so stop on in, but I won't guarantee you will buy anything.

Fantastic idea for a mall. I loved this place. What a funky idea having each level represent a place in the world. I really liked the toilets they were very well done. They even used the toilets they they use in the country such as in the toilets for Japan they had the heated seats and everything just like in Japan ( I should probably be embarrassed that this entertained me). Any way not only is the idea funky the stores are filled with nifty little things that would be hard to find elsewhere. If you have a few hours free then definitly take a look.

Fun mall to walk around to look & take pics. We didn't come here to shop. The concept was interesting and that is what drew us in. It was cool that this was also right off the BTS Asoke stop.Some of the floors (Caribbean, Istanbul, and Paris) were weak and do not represent the destination concept as well as it could have been. But nonetheless, the rest of the mall was super cool. Having actually visited San Fran and being one of our favorite cities to visit, we loved how well the city the was represented. My boyfriend, typical male who hates anything shopping, actually really enjoyed walking around the mall.

OK mall. I visited a few malls during my stay in Bangkok and Terminal 21 was just ok. Each level represents a big city (Paris, San Francisco...) but it wasn't that impressive. A lot of food shops. I liked Paragon much better.

Local shops and good restaurants. Terminal 21 was quite a good mall to be as big as it was: good selection of shops and a large number of local brands. There ws also a good number of different restaurants. Easy to access, co-located with the skytrain ( Asoke).

Interesting place for taking pic. New shopping mall and nice decoration, each floor have different theme, especially the restroom are all different and special. A lot of people take pic in the restroom, quite uncomfortable but maybe the designer will be happy about this. Hope every year they will have something change in the mall so give us the reason to visit again.
A fabulous mall!. An interesting mall that imitates and airport and each level is representative of a major city. There are a large range of stores and it was easy to navigate!

Huge mall!. awesome mall to shop if you are looking for genuine product. this mall does not sell fake items :) Its like a huge maze... every corner you turn is different. You'll need a whole day to go around the mall

Average shopping mall. This place look cool for take a photo. Every floor, i enjoy to took a photo especially i love their restrooms. I think in Bangkok Terminal 21 is such a best restroom in shopping mall in Bangkok. But if you want to buy clothes or fashion mall, i think another place, it's better.

Latest Shopping Mall with Country Theme. Terminal 21 shopping mall is unique. Each floor represents a country (Britain, San Francisco, Paris) etc.
The food court offers very reasonable food prices.
They have a gourmet supermarket at the basement.

A world of cities in a mall. The theme is world cities. It allows the shopper to walk the streets of their favorite cities. Many varieties of items for sale. There is lots of restaurants too. Bring your camera to take memorable pictures like Golden Gate Bridge, sumo wrestlers, London police, geisha girl etc.

Best shopping centre in the world. It wins because of its charm and quality of shopping. It's not just full of the same old chain shops althogth there are a few of those on the ground floor.Every level is a different part of the world. I loved London and Turkey levels. The quality of the shopping here is excellent. Normally I don't shop in Thailand because although often cheap it is usually mostly low end, but that's not true for Terminal 21.It still has reasonable prices but good stuff. I bought what I wore for my wedding day here!Food is great here, from fresh asian food at the coupon food court averaging 40baht a meal to the korean bbq or affordable japanese food at Fuji.
Shopping, Food, Entertainment. Well i hadn't been here before and i have to say its incredible.Big shopping centre, loads of restaurants, more bargins and a cool concept.

Wow! Give Yourself Plenty of Time to Explore!. This mall is packed with private designers and wares! We found handmade jewelry, fun graphic printed tees, gorgeous one-of-a-kind clothing, and some fantastic food! Oh, and the fanciest toilet I've ever seen. Must visit the restrooms. =) Give yourself plenty of time to look around.

Worth to visit. It's a new shopping mall and directly connected to Asok BTS station. Unlike other huge shopping malls in Bangkok, it's not huge but still big enough for you to shop for 2 to 3 hours. It has many little shops and a few famous brand shops. Prices are reasonable.The great thing is, this place is beautifully decorated. It uses one international city/country as theme for each floor. For example, 2nd floor is Japan. 3rd floor is England. 4th floor is Turkey??? 5th floor is San Francisco. Each floor has its own unique decoration and it's great for taking photo. On the cinema floor, there are many giant figures too. For example, Woody and buzz of Toy Story, BumbleBee of Transformer, etc.. All these make the shopping experience very joyful.There are many food choices. Again, very attractive decoration in the food court and for each restaurant. For example, they turn a San Francisco cable car into a restaurant. Too bad we ran out of time and did not try any food there.If you like spa, there's a popular spa on the 6th floor and it opens until 12:00 at midnight. So it would be great if you do a few hours of shopping there, have your dinner in one of their restaurants, and finally finish your day with the spa. It would be a wonderful experience.

Quirky, worth a look. What an interesting concept, name each floor of a shopping centre after a famous international city and go with the theme for the whole floor, We did not spend a penny here, but did look around for an hour and were very entertained for that time, there were lots of things to see and buy, there is a cinema if you are looking to see the latest and a food court that looked very interesting, you need to put money on a card that you then spend at the vendors and get a credit for anything unspent at the end, we did not participate as we had just eaten but it all looked good. If you are in the area you should at least have a look.
Your average shopping mall. since I was not able to find anything that originated from Thailand. If I want kiplings etc I can find them at home.

a mecca for all. Containing local, hand-made clothing shops to world brand's like Levi's, to a movie theatre and gym, this little terminal to the world has it all. Terminal 21 is attached to Asok BTS (sky train) station and just outside of Sukumvhit MRT (metro) station while buses 2, 25, 38, 40, 136, 185, 501, 508, 511, and 513 take frequent trips outside of the building. One doesn't have to look to the streets of Bangkok for sightseeing, but instead step inside this world-themed mall to seek not only globally inspired fashion, but entertainment as well: Terminal 21 hosts year-round events! One might find themselves strumming their fingers to local musicians playing on the lower floor while enjoying a coffee at Starbucks, or stumbling out of somewhat bizarre and local restaurant, Reflections, only to find Chinese Opera Dancers reenacting a drama for Lunar New Years. A Transformer might greet you at the door one day, and the next week a mime may be welcoming you inside instead.Each floor of the 6-story high mall is themed from places around the world (Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco, and Los Angeles). A replica of the Golden Gate Bridge can be seen from the upper floor food court while a giant "money cat" welcomes you on the Japan-themed floor. The entertainment doesn't stop at the shops: Themes are continue into the bathrooms (most, if not all, are equipped with bidets). The most interesting, in my opinion would be on floor the 1st floor (Tokyo) and 4th floor (San Francisco). Prices vary, but the mall is overall more laid back than those up the street and has something to offer to everyone. Thai banks are located on the lower ground floor as well as a small grocery store that caters to the diverse crowds that shop there. There are many kinds of restaurants and food vendors spread throughout the mall, but the biggest "food courts" are located on the lower ground floor, and the 4th-5th floors. ATM's and internal phone booths are located within the mall, and free wifi is provided (as long as you bring your passport or a form of ID) on the main floor. Be sure to check out what kind of live entertainment is presenting at the mall! Some of the shows and acts are worth planning ahead for!

My Current Favourite Mall in Bangkok. Mall is directly connected to Asok BTS station - super convenient. As stated in the other reviews, the mall is done up like an airport with each floor themed after a major city of the world.I like especially the upper floors with the smaller shops. The prices are slightly higher than in wholesale malls like Platinum but quality seems better too. And you can try on clothes for size before purchase. The sales staff here are also friendlier and more helpful.This is my current favourite mall in Bangkok (I've been to BKK 7 times in the past 15 years). Can't wait to visit again soon!

It's all in the detail, visit the world at Terminal 21. This place absolutely fascinated me. Okay yes, I'm a woman who naturally loves to shop, but the design and the detail that went into this place is unbelievable!With every escalator to each floor (next destination Japan, next destination London written above the escalators in an airport style) came a different country with all the themes that you'd expect from that particular country. For example, on the London floor it had tube signs, London buses, it was just amazing to see the detail that was involved in a shopping centre. Even some of the shops were themed to each floor and country.The toilets were absolutely immaculate too and pretty high-tech! We had lunch at an Italian there and that was delicious. Although I didn't buy any clothes, I'd recommend a visit to Terminal 21 just to check out the place. I've never seen anything like it in my life and loved loved loved it.
Best toilets ever. Okay mall but check out the toilets! They are themed to the city of the floor they are on the best we think was Rome, Tokyo and San Fran!

Themed Floors, Interesting Stuff. Interesting themed floors - like terminals of the world - UK, Japan, etc. The shops on each floor were nicely decorated. Prices are reasonable. The quality of the goods sold here seemed better than the wholesale malls, MBK. This place was clean, bright. The sale staff - friendly, not aggressive. You can browse in peace.

Cutest mall ever!. This place is super cute. Each floor is inspired in a different city: Tokyo, Istanbul, London, SF, Paris, Rome and I think that's it. They have a mini Golden Gate bridge and the toilettes are just amazing. They also have a a lot of good options to eat. It was walking distance from my hotel, but you can arrive easily if you go to Sukhumvit/ Asok.

It's A Small World Afterall. What is interesting about this mall is that each floor has a different theme or is designed after a particular city such as London, San Francisco, Tokyo to name a few. For a first timer, it was quite delightful to be greeted with some of the world's familiar icons. So instead of shopping, we went to each level to see what it had in stored for us. I have been to most of the cities featured but that didn't stop me from snapping pictures with these remade icons. And even if you have no urgency to go the toilet, please visit the toilets of each floors coz they too are designed according to the cities of the world. I especially love the London theme toilet which was modelled after the famous Tube and its trains. Love it, love it, love it. The food court is alike any other that you can find in Platinum Mall and MBK with the usual Thai fare like Phad Thai, omelette osyer, rice dishes and soup noodles. Taste wise, it was fairly decent. If you are hoping to find lots of clothes to buy here, you will be in for a disappointment as there are limited choices here and they are not cheap. However, there are a few shops at Level 2 & 3 which have some really interesting and uniquely designed t-shirts ranging from TBH250 to 300 (about USD 10 and below). Most important of all, the mall is conveniently located just at the Ashok station of the BTS. So, even the infamous Bangkok traffic jam cannot stop you from visiting. Terminal 21 is a winner.

Really terminal of the world... Very accessible train, taxi, bus and etc. We just walk from the apartment we stayed and everything is here, restaurants, shopping of all walks of lifes kids, infants, teens,adults and old ages..very good shopping mall..

Interesting Toilets. This shopping mall has an interesting concept. Each floor is themed by cities, There are 6 floors in total with 5 cities theme. I didn't really do any shopping in there but one of my friends got a few leather items for really good prices at Level 3, if I am not mistaken.I spent all my time visiting every toilet on each floor! It is really interesting.
Interesting Shopping Mall.. I love the Japanese concept. Where I can get nice clothing, accessories, shoes, bags etc at a reasonable pricing. It is simply a shopping haven for me.

Ultimate. there are malls and malls but there in one Terminal 21!! Amazing is the word. Huge array of stores and great shopping. But it is their themed floors which makes shopping here a delight. Each floor is themed!! Definitely worth a visit and then there is the massive food court where the food is fantastic, huge array and dirt cheap!!

one of the coolest themed malls!. Terminal 21 has to be one of the coolest malls i've ever been to. the mall layout is themed after an airport in different cities. each city themed a little differently on different floors of the mall. the inside of the mall seems very much like an airport terminal. i've never seen so many escalators in my life which makes getting to the top a bit of a chore unless you take the express escalator...which then only takes you around half way. the mall staff are dressed to the theme as well which makes it a lot of fun. the stores vary from low to high and also has it's very own cinema. it has a good selection of restaurants and also has a spa. located near the BTS it makes getting to the mall super easy. even if you don't plan on buying anything you have to check out this mall. a must see while in Bangkok.

Very cool set up, large variety of shops to cater for all types. This mall is a testament to why Thai shopping is simply world class. This particular mall has a different cultural theme for each level, with corresponding shops. The Japanese level offers some cheaper alternatives for female clothing, and there are some gems here if you can find them. There are also handfuls of boutique shops with local designer clothing that are very stylish for those shopping in the higher bracket price range. The food court on the top level is about 1-2 dollars per dish, with very impressive sanitary practices. The toilets also deserve a mention- like the shops, they also are differently themed and are an experience in themselves! Ditch the guys and spend the day here girls!

Great hotel with fabulous pool. Great hotel that sits on top of a very interesting shopping centre - where each floor is 'themed' on cities around the World, including London (with a London Bus!) and San Francisco (with the golden gate bridge).The infinity pool is worth a visit on top of the 6th floor, with a nice set of gardens where you can relax.Downsides - there is no hotel bar

Fashion and food. After MBK and Panthip Plaza I have a third favourite shopping place in Bangkok.In Terminal 21 directly at BTS and MRT Asoke you find a huge shopping temple with hundreds of small shop, a floor full of restaurants and a big Thai food court. The unique design and the big choice of inexpensive food made me visit a few times already. Not to forget the usual movie floor showing Thai and English movies. If you dont want to buy or eat, maybe you just need a clean toilet, you'll find it there. http://www.terminal21.co.th/mainAnd if you are still not satisfied, MBK is just 4 stations and 15 min away.

Just like a mini world. Different countries theme design in the shopping mall. You do not need to travel anywhere else. The food at Pier 21 is great and affordable. A lot of shops for you to shop till you drop. Must visit the famous seaweed snack shop at the basement !!!

WOW WHAT A MALL. Biz Intelligence can be seen in the way this mall is RecreatedIt has each floor dedicated to diff countries like Istanbul/Rome/London/Japan/SFO etc and has a lovely food court which has Excellent food at unbelievably low prices.Full Value for Money

Must Visit. A novel mall ....different floors represent the cities of different countries...Paris, Rome, Istanbul, San Francisca etc. Food Court - Pier 21 - is very very reasonable and offers a great variety of delicious food.

Cheap n delicious food @ pier21. The shopping nothing fantastic. The deco is something worth taking time off. But the food at Pier21 deserves all my stars. Very very cheap n delicious! Definitely return there whenever I go bangkok!

5-star to the shopping concept. We were there last week. Amazing design and shopping concept, we will accord 5-star to the shopping mall idea without hestation. However, we did not find the items in the shops interesting. Looks like an upgraded version of the things on sale from places such as MBK-styled shopping mall. Many shop units are tiny and this may have constrained on the variety of products on display. Sure, the famous brands are there too but it lacks the attractiveness of good quality products seen in Siam Paragon or Pavilion of KL. Perhaps, this mall is more suitable to the young or the middle-income shoppers. Still, it is not too bad a place to go for some 'aircon' comfort on a humid day. Recommended, about 1 hour plus... will suffice.

Massive shopping center. Very nice concept, with one level, one country. You will find everything that you need: fashion, jewels, shoes, books...Food court at the top, cheap and very good. And if your boyfriend is bored waiting for you while you are going from one shop to another, there's also a cinema which should save your relationship :) Nice place.
great mall to visit. lots of good food and shopping choices and its right off the sky train.there is a gourmet food store at the bottom and movie theater at the top. good choice to visit.

Great shopping. This is an excellent mall within walking distance to Ambassador Hotel in Sukhumvit Road. It is planned very carefully and is extremely interesting as each floor is dedicated to a different country and therefore even the washrooms are themed accordingly.
Interesting concept. Although I did not buy anything from there, I found out the concept is interesting. Each level is representing a city and a lot of boutique shops are on each floor.
Cheapest food court in Shopping mall in BKK. If you want lunch or dinner for less the 3 USD terminal 21 is the place to go , very clean , cozy and free wifi

An interesting mall at Asok. Walking around the on the floors with the small stalls reminded me a bit of Chatuchak, but cooler both in temperature and style. The place is definitely quieter than MBK. We found a lot of friendly shops but also a few that should have posted the “Do not disturb” sign.An interesting thing is that you enter from Bangkok – thru the left door. But from then on you seem to be in Europe and you will be using the right escalator. Each floor has a theme from a city around the world like Rome, Tokyo, Istanbul, San Francisco and on the top you find the food court at “Pier 21” which has good food at a very reasonable price. We had several breakfast/lunch for around 150 Bath for the two of us. If possible avoid the lunch rush 1-2pm. There are also a lot of restaurants in different styles, to choose from.In the weekends there will be some show or sales promotion on the big lower open spaces. This will draw a crowd and be noisy.In several of the shops we found the mid-year sale with “No fitting, No exchange, No refund”. Personally I would have walked away because of that but the people working there encouraged fitting anyway only there were no fitting rooms... Compared to that I bought two pairs of short pants on the street only to find they were too small so we brought them back the next evening. “No problem, I bring bigger tomorrow, you come and pick up”. And then they fit.

Great mall. This mall is a great competitor to the other big malls in the city. Lots of local high street brands mixed with small alleys with petite boutiques selling their unique style. There is a good range of different restaurants, something for every taste. We went to the cinema twice and often ended up in the mall buying snack in the food hall before going back to the hotel.

Interesting Mall. I like the way the mall makes each level feels special. San Frans, Japan, Landon, etc. Top 2 levels are all food and we dined at the MK restaurant for brunch on a week day which is less crowded. Food at MK is good esp the green noodles. Went to this mall twice in 4 days as the first day we got there, was pretty crowded. DIdnt get to shop much. Price wise, more expensive than other malls but a huge range of different shops available for you to chose from. Overall, great experience there. Oh, do check out the toilets, interesting concept on every level too, if you are in for some photo taking

Favorite Shopping Mall, Bangkok. Many Malls in Bangkok, these are my favorites. Most visitors will spend a lot of time when visiting Bangkok, There are over 38 main malls I hope this will act as a guide to some visited.t1) The Terminal 21-Listed as my favorite - direct access from both Asoke BTS Skytrain Station and Sukhumvit MRT Subway Station. Each floor features a World area and decorates to that area. Beatiful statures from Angels too many areas from London, Paris, San Francisco, Hollywood, Tokyo, and Istanbul, all very good taste. Food court in Thai Food is impressive with each area featured in a theme. Many International restaurants abound. All concocted to its impressive 36 meter long escalator which connects together all the continents. Even the toilets are upscale with temperature self programming features and restrooms are exceptional. Over 600 shops World Class Mall.2) Siam Paragon-Access by BTS Sky Train to Siam Station. It’s one of the biggest shopping centers in Asia offers all kinds of international fashion brands, 15 large movie screens; one of them has the biggest screen and seating capacity in Asia. Siam Ocean World - the largest aquarium in South East Asia, an exhibition hall, the Thai Art Gallery and an opera concert hall. 3) Gaysorn Plaza How to get there: Gaysorn Plaza is located on the corner of Phloen Chit Road and Ratchadamri Road (Chidlom BTS Station) Taxi / Bus no. 2, 25, 501, 508, 511, 513 Gaysorn Plaza is a premier luxury shopping mall offering brands like Armani, Gucci, Tiffany among many others. The top floors have a good selection of Thai handicrafts and antiques distinguished by their high quality and fairly high prices too.4) The Emporium-Sukhumvit Soi 24 (Phrom Phong BTS Station). The lower floors dedicated to brands like Louis Vuitton and Rolex, but it has more affordably priced goods on the upper levels. Many restaurants with the Greyhound Café, very good food at fair pricing. The top floor and you will find an amazing private library centered on design. You can get a free day pass if you bring your passport.5) Central Plaza Grand Rama 9-Directly linked with the Rama 9 MRT Subway Station’s exit.  Have cinemas, karaoke, and ice-skating. In addition, more choices for varied lifestyles are also offered from fitness centre, yoga studio, beauty clinics, salons, art and music schools, martial arts and language institutes. Good and enjoyable with many shops not found at the other malls.6) Central World Shopping Complex-BTS Sky Train to Chidlom Station. Separated into 6 different shopping Zones, each with unique design and ambiance

Would like to have a Muslim prayer room. Everything here will be a perfect place to hang out if there is a Muslim prayer room like the rest of the shopping malls in Bangkok. The toilets in each floor is unique on its own as it follows the theme of each floor, eg: - french, british, moroccan, japanese. Lots and lots of specialty stores. Would love to spend more time here if not because we need to rush back to hotel to pray.

Different. In my country, shopping malls all look the same and, worst of all, offer the same shops and products. With this in mind, I found Terminal 21 refreshingly innovative.As pointed out by other visitors, each floor is themed. While the theme thing could have been done better, it still makes the mall stand out compared to more traditional ones.Clothes are not exactly cheap but you can get good deals if you are willing to take your time. Prices are more affordable than what you would get in nearby Kuala Lumpur and Singapore for example. You have plenty of independent shops rather than the big brand ones (some like Esprit, Nike and Adidas do have a presence). Also Terminal 21, while being large enough to offer a wide range of shop choices, is still small enough to avoid the pitfalls of gigantic malls which exist in other parts of Bangkok. I was satisfied with my shopping there.Now where the mall becomes really great is its foodcourt, which spans two whole floors (the two top ones). I ate in the foodcourt only twice (KFC and a Thai restaurant, "Reflections") and on both occasions the food was very good and affordable. In my own country I don't usually eat at KFC which I find disgusting, but Thailand's KFC is different and offers a very distinctive meal of rice and chicken for just 75-80 baht. I spent eight nights in Bangkok and could have eaten out at the foodcourt every single of these nights without ever eating at the same place twice. Plus on the other floors you also get food choices, I ate a wrap at a Mexican snack and it was delicious.Little tip: at basement level, you have a grocery which sells all kinds of food. You can buy yourself a self-service salad for a very low price, and you even get to choose your salad dressing!

This is not a MBK. Some of the reviews made a comparison of T21 to MBK. I dun think its fair to comment as they are 2 different malls with completely 2 diff concepts. The key of this mall are 1) little shops selling their own niche largely local designs (there are a few intetnational brands), leather goods and shoes are cheaper than most developed cities. 2) not as crowded as platinum or mbk with big walking aisles. 3) probably one of the cheapest food court. Realize portions may not be as big as the foodcourts say in MBK. Sticky rice at mbk is 120b and t21 at 70b for comparative size. (but mbk still nicer). So it's a good foodcourt to try many foods. 4) lots of restaurants to choose from (probably one of the most of any malls- comparable to central world?)well, cons are its out of usual shopping belt but worth a visit for you to determine if you like this mall. I say it fits the young and trendy more. New mall- only a year old. With a few more mega malls opening at siam BTS soon... Competition will be keen and Bangkok is shaping up to be a major shopping paradise with clear niche shopping concepts!

Beautiful but too commercialised. Terminal 21 is one of the places in Bangkok where you should not expect to buy goods at low prices. It's really an attractive area, with different themes of countries for each level, and you have a great deal of restaurants at the top level. I love going to the hairdressing at one of the beauty salon and spa named 'Take Care', and my gf was satisfied with their pedicure service as well. Apart from the prices, it's actually quite a great place with great ambiance. Didn't really get to shop the entire area. However, I find it rather inconvenient for me as it was abit further out from the city area like Siam/Pratunam despite being connected by BTS. Furthermore, the goods are also sold at a higher price.

Great Mall with Great Food Choices. Multilevel shopping that put other malls to shame. Each floor is themed to a different country and the restroom attendants are dressed accordingly. Food court at Pier 21 offers varieties of delicious Thai dishes at reasonable local prices. We feasted on 7 entrees, 2 desserts and soft drinks for less than $10 U.S. It was such a great deal and great tasting food that we returned the next day for more food! Highly recommend if you've never been to an Asian mall.

Nice Mall. Great architecture. Each level has its own theme. Japan, Carribean, London, Hollywood, thailand, etc. Most of the themes are top destinations. It's like arriving to different country every level. Nice toilets too! I went into every floor just to take photos of it. Its automated and the designed/theme was taken seriously even inside the toilets. The shops are a bit pricey (considering, most stalls are not branded clothing). But the food at the food court are very cheap...(cheaper than platinum). You'll keep coming back to this mall because of its design :)
nice concept. conceptualised around cities with a great smattering of cuisines from around the world...a walk away from bts nana and ashok
Convenient shopping mall connected via BTS. Convenient shopping mall connected to asoke BTS. Good variety of dining choices, from ever popular MK hot pot to food court.

Puts MBK to shame. Trendy, clean and interesting. The floors are all designed according to a country, which provides many photography opportunities. Even the staff are dressed up to the theme. Do check out the toilets too. Shopping wise, the basement holds the only Taokaenoi store that I know of. Buy your seaweed snacks here! There's also a wide range of international brands, local brands and independent designers. You can buy 150 baht t-shirts and 500 baht polos here with trendy designs instead of the usual touristy 'Singha' or 'I love Bangkok' designs.There's a wide-range of eateries as well. Tried Reflections, which was passable Thai food.

Pier 2 food court. This is the cheapest food court you likely can find in Bangkok. It is cheaper than the streets that we normally would find. For only 25 baht, you can easily get a bowl of beef noodle. Great food, great price. What more can you ask for.

A relaxing place for mall crawling. A very well design mall. The goods sold there gave the mall a touch of class.
The design of the mall is good. Not too confusing.
Many restaurants to choose from and window shopping experience is good.
Definitely worth a visit.
Design!!. Each of the floor are designed under different concept, definitely you can captured a nice photos over there. Please go each of the floor toilet and take a look, nice~~

a nice shopping mall. a lot of photo-taking spots there. food court there is very nice too!
lots of shops available there as well, from low-end to high-end. travellers can get free wifi password at the conciege. however the supermarket there is not big and variety of choices are not wide.

shopping. A reasonaby new multi story shopping mall that perhaps does not need your spending dollars as it is an up market mall but is a must to experience. Every floor is themed a different country and shops are suited to the particular country, even the food malls on each floor have the food of the country represented. Easy to get there, just take the BTS to Asoke station and walk in the front door from the station concourse. A must see if time is available. The architects must have loved their job on this building.

Great shopping @ Terminal 21. The main reason to take the BTS and alight at Asoke station is the new mall at Terminal 21. A multi-levelled themed building with a huge range of stuff to buy. Never in my life have i ever actually bought more clothes than from my visit to the place. And in one building, in one day~. Awesome place to visit with electronic bidets (just like in japan) and halal food availability on the food court floor and selected signature feature of different countrys', makes this place one very exciting shopping mall.

Just another high-end mall. This is a new mall located next to the Asok BTS station. Consisting of many high end shops as well as smaller boutiques, this mall uses the airport as a concept theme. The layout and overall design structure mimics an airport terminal and every floor laid out as a different famous city of the world.Its a mall that i would visit at least once just to see a different concept at work.
airport in the middle of the city. I really like the theme of this mall. Very creative and the toilet are extra-extra clean. Though the shop inside are just mediocre.

Nice concept but ..... First time in Bangkok, this is the first shopping stop. After nice dinner at The Local, stop here. Unique concept as each floors represrnt a. Country. The shopss design, the decor, toilets and even the security personnrl are in that country's theme. Of course the brands of the country can be found at the particular floors but you can also find some local design and items. Overall, it a place to spend your hours shopping and eating here. Lots of reasonably price souviners here.

For the Yuppies & Trendy. Coveniently located at Sukhumvit, next to the BTS Asok station, Terminal 21 is probably more suited for young adults and fashionistas. You can easily find a good bargain here.

Unique mall. Unique mall with each floor designed like a country in Japan, UK etc. even the toilet is painted with matching concept. Love the food court, food are delicious wide choices n value for $. Wide varieties of cafe n restaurant too.
B1 supermarket has a pet corner sell pet food etc. Love the preserved dry fruits.

interesting mall concept, food court could be better. as with most of the BKK malls this one is right off of asoke station on the BTS skytrain - the airport concept mall theme here is interesting, but i found the food court here mostly mediocre. there are better food courts at the other mega-malls in BKK. TIP: try going one stop down on the BTS to phrom phong station and up to the emporium mall food hall on the 4th floor. the noodles, soups and other options there are really good, still affordable and much better overall. (plus there is a nicer view overlooking the park while you eat!)

Excellent place to shop dine and chill.. Just next to Asoke BTS or the other underground which I cannot remember the name.Not to take taxi cos the area is forever jammed. Strollers and wheelchairs on loan available.Nice place to shop if u are not into the main stream boutique shopping and it is much more fashionable for the youngsters. unless u are local for local thai crafts for gifts then this might not be the best place to shop at.best for youngsters as well as fashionable adults. even if u are not... but it is certainly worth a visit and u can dine there too. Many choices to choose from.

Around the world in 80 minutes. Each level is a themed on a different city. Great idea. I visited London, Paris, Rome, and a couple of others. Nice shops, but expensive. 4 out of 5 stars because it lacks easy navigation and information screens/maps.

Fantastic, value for money, food court.... This was my first visit to Thailand and Bangkok. Stayed in a great hotel near Terminal 21. Didn't need to eat at the hotel even once because the food court was so reasonable and food, delicious. And there are options for the foodie on all levels including the lower ground. Didn't really look at the other shops because I was too busy eating my way through the world without breaking the bank. All cuisines catered for. Much much better than anything in Singapore or Hong Kong.
Amazing. One of my favorite malls here in bangkok. The prices are a bit ridiculous but but expectable since its geard towards tourists.

Terminal 21. Terminal 21 is a new shopping mall and it's designed to look like an airport. All the floors are named after some big cities (Rome, Istanbul, Tokyo etc) and they all have different themes. It is expensive though, but anyway I would recommend to go there just to have a look :)The food court upstairs is very nice, I think the food there is tasty and cheap as well. Also check the restrooms, they are pretty funny and each of them are designed in an unique way!With a kid it was fun place just to walk around, there was many things that small kids can look and touch :) You can borrow strollers (and wheelchairs too) if you don't have your own with you.

A mall with a twist !. The concept is that the mall is itself an Airport Terminal. And everything works around it. The billboards, directions, escalators, boutique stores, everything !!! I had a haircut at a Salon here and the experience was Super !!! Not only did I have a stylish haircut but also felt the warmth of the city here.....Must visit this mall instead of the regular malls that we see everywhere else !!!!!

Ideal shopping, eating, and meeting place in Bangkok. This mall is simply enormous. Huge range of stores, interesting themed floors and a great meeting place especially for visitors coming off the Suvarnabhumi Airport Express. There's a very large food court on the top floor with very cheap local food, in addition to all the other restaurants throughout the complex. Impressively fast wi-fi.

Beautiful but expensive. A beautiful themed shopping centre. Each floor has a different theme representing a different country. I popped into a few shops and found that all is very expensive here. I entered the supermarket to buy a few Thai spices and curries before leaving for the airport for my journey home later that night. I was disappointed at the high prizes I had to pay.

TAKE A TOUR OF THE TERMINAL 21 TOILETS...IT'S FUN!. Terminal 21 Mall is a relatively new mall in Bangkok,located beside the Asok Station. Each level is designed and themed to look like a famous destination (Paris,London,Rome,Tokyo etc.) So if you're at the San Francisco level,you'll see the Golden gate Bridge and as you go to the Cinemas at the top level,you'll see a huge Oscar statue adorning the wall. The most fun we had though was taking a tour of the toilets! The interior of each restroom (both Male and Female) have been painstakingly decorated to reflect the city where it's supposed to be. Even the lady attendants were dressed in the costume of the city! The bonus for touring this place was that the price of food in the food court was cheaper than other malls.

Interesting visit!. As our hotel was nearby, we went here in search of some food.. Not only did we find amazing food options, we were quite amused with the concept of this mall.. Unique and interesting are the words that will describe it the best.. The entire mall is designed as an airport and the escalators land you in different countries! Each level is conceptualized and designed very well..If you're around this area, it's a must-visit!

Pier 21, Terminal 21. Great Mall as long as you are not looking for cheap fakes. The food at Pier 21 is amazing and sooooo cheap. You are honestly talking less than €1 a dish. I'd have happily eaten there everyday of the holiday. To pay for your meals, you need to first go to one of two counters for a Pier 21 card. I'd say 100-120 baht per person is enough (two dishes and a fruit shake). Go to the counter at the back as the front one is always busy.

Wonderful Concept, Awesome Toilets!. Need to take care of buisiness on Asok/ Sukumvit? Well when nature calls, come on in to Terminal 21 where all toilets are outfitted with bidets! Oh and the fact that every floor is themed from a different country is also pretty damn awesome. Gotta love the Golden Gate Bridge on the top two floors!

Mega Mall with a difference. Large mall near Asok Railway station. Each floor has a different theme based on different cities. Found it amusing that they have a man dressed as a captain whose job is to salute all visitors during the day. Really enjoyed Pier 21, the food court in the mall - which had a variety of food at great prices. Well worth a visit - just to see the interesting concept which the mall is based off.
Beautiful shopping mall. The food was cheap... I mean really cheap compared to other shopping mall. At first, I thought I looked at the price wrongly!!! Most food cost only 35 - 45 Bath.

Huge Mall. Every floor is a different country - there is a London floor where you will find covent garden, charing cross etc and great shops, they also have an istanbul floor, tokoyo floor, etc etc and each floor is huge with the most brilliant shops - well worth a visit.

A very well conceptualised and designed mall. A wonderfully designed mall which acts as a shopping as well as tourist destination. The country-themed floors (Paris, London, Tokyo) are impressive as the design and theme carries through to the lightings, the corridors and even the toilets! DO check out the differently themed toilets. Very cool. Food court is very reasonably priced and quality of food is good. Value for money. However, if you are looking for bargains best to check the markets or the wholesale emporiums.

Special Toilet and nice food court. It is a 7 levels shopping complex.Every level has its owned theme, caribbean, Rome, London, tokyo, paris, Istanbul, San francisco and Hollywood.In every "city" (level), have 2 toilets with different design.level 5 is a huge food court, in there we can get good lunch with dessert

GREAT PLACE TO SPEND TIME!. We went to this Mall to watch a movie at SF CINEMA but we did not know that the mall was so big and so very interesting! If you have time to spend in Bangkok and don't want to be out in the heat and sun then do come here. Lots and lots of places to eat and lots of shops to check out. The theme of an airport terminal is wonderful and it is fun to go through each floor which represents each city. If you are a lady then don't forget to check out their restrooms which have huge windows with great view of the area!The movie theater was not bad, especially their SOFA seats which is Bhat 1000 for two comfortable and big sofa! Felt just like home while watching the movie. A must visit if you have time. It is connected by the sky train ASOK and MRT station SUKHUMVIT.

Huge. The best part is the collection they have got. literally unlimited. from cloths to handicrafts, furniture, electronics. u name it u get it. they have this wonderful designs in each floor that makes you realize u are in different city every floor.

Good place for shopping and meeting. Last Friday I want here with my friends. We like this place because it is big for us to shopping and easy to get to because it is at BTS Asoka. Every floor has each own theme for that country especially the rest room that we love to take pictures in there ^^ .We can found shirts,suit and shoe for wearing to work which they are not expensive.The food selection is also good. Almost everything is cheap except drink. I like the noodle at Pier 21 Food court.

An attraction in its own right..?. Terminal 21 is a unique shopping mall. Each floor is modelled on a different city in the world, and a lot of work has been put in to the place. From paintings on the ceilings and statues, to giant sumo wrestlers to a big red London bus.. it's all here. The shops vary from expensive labels to local designers with some great bargains to be found. I'd recommend the place just to go have a look at all the different floors (yes, including the bathrooms).

Good and different approach to malls. Modelled on an airport with each floor being a destination and based around a particular theme. IE. San Francisco is food, Paris is female clothing. A weird comment, but it's worth checking out the toilets on one or two floors as even these follow the theme of the relevant floor! A good shopping experience overall and convenient for this end of the city, but Siam Paragon and Centralworld still rate as a higher shopping experience overall.

Solid shopping centre with a variety of shops and food.. Solid shopping mall. Although it doesn't have the big brands it has a wide range if boutique shops that are interesting and would have great value for money.The food selection is great. Both up stairs and down stairs options are good.Location is next to BTS so it easy to get to/from and move down to chitlom etc for further shopping ;)Overall I give it a 4/5. Very modern and if you stay at the Grande Centre Point it's right next door .. So very convenient.

Great place for eating and shopping. If you stay around Sukumvit 14 and Asok, this will be the great place for find things to eat. Foods at the food court are excellent and reasonable prices. You will have a great choices of lunch and dinner. You can repeat coming back and will not to have the same dishs. The best of all is the price, all dishs will be less than other shopping mall food court. Actually I got my breakfast (Chicken's Jok) at the morning market next to Terminal 21 is more expensive than at Terminal 21!!! In Terminal 21, there are many other good choices restaurant other than food court to chose, M.K, Fuji etc.

A nice mall but nothing spectacular. This is a mall which offers more in terms of photo opportunities than shopping experience. Each floor of the mall is built around a famous city and the whole mall resembles an airport terminal. There is a model of the Golden Gate bridge, a red London telephone booth, etc. Even the toilets are unique and follow the various themes and no two toilets are the same.Food wise, there is a foodcourt on the top floor, Pier 21 which offers a variety of Thai and other cuisines but my opinion is that the variety is lacking even though prices are cheap. There are also the usual chain restaurants doting the entire mall.Overall, a nice place to spend half a day strolling but go somewhere else for your shopping.

Loved the layout of the mall. As other people have stated, the mall has a theme on the different floors. The bottom levels are similar to a normal mall with the usual shops...then the upper floors are more like a market place with small shops. I really liked Istanbul which had homewares, jewlery and shoes, etc. There is also a good selection of restaurants. I wasn't looking for the cheap bargains so I found this mall quite nice as you could get the market feel but in a nice atmosphere. I also went to Central and a few other places that just made me feel like I could be at any mall as it just had the usual shops..Prada, Gucci, Zara,etc...this was a nice mix.

Shopping & Eating Heaven. Terminal 21 is based on an airport- & travel philosophy. The 7storey shopping complex (incl basement) is divided into themes such as e.g. San Francisco, Paris, London, Istanbul, Tokyo. Many goods can be found at shops. The choice of restaurants & food is huge. A nice shopping & food experience in Bangkok.

Shopping mall with free wifi service for travellers. When you visit the Terminal 21, you can get free wifi service. It is very simple to get the service. You just show you passport the customer service counter, the staff will register your information and give you an account and password that is valid for one year. So great.

Surprise with every floor theme. Every flood was decorated with different country theme :-) A shopping mall that can take many photos here.
Even toilet!
Cool mall. New mall that has themed floors. As a guy I didn't find much but my wife loved it. On the top floor is the food court which I liked a lot, good cheap food. Happy shopping!

Fun mall with excellent food court. I don't normally visit malls on holiday, but ended up in this one and found it was a fun place to visit as it's quite unique - every floor is themed around a different city (London, Paris, Rome, Istanbul, San Francisco and Tokyo I think) with an overall 'airport' theme. The detail in doing these themes was quite impressive! It seemed there was a good range of shops too. But what was really great was the food court - every kind of Thai food on offer, plus some Chinese/Japanese options too. I had a superb prawn Penang curry with rice for only 40 baht! It seemed to be very popular with young Thai people. Also, as others have said, the toilets were a bit of a novelty!

New and spacious. Opened last year and it is very populr, situated in Asok, above the Skystation. The theme is about an airport as the name has suggested. Each floor represents a country and it has about 6 floors, however many shops are selling similar stuff mainly clothes of above average quality. Top floor is food and a cinema. Also the basement is an open plan food hall with many stalls selling food stuff and cosmetic things. The hotel above it is very very good and modern. Worth staying and rates are good. The area Asok is good and you can spend a good day there without getting bored.

great shops and great food. sure, you can go there by public transportation. but when the taxi drive will take less than 30 minutes and you are minimum 2 persons, the taxi will be the cheaper way to go there :-) crazy thailand... in each floor there is a diferent topic. on the top there are a cinema and restaurants with realy excellent food. my favorite floor of shops was "london" with a lot of small shops. if you are interested in big brands, go to a different shopping mall. there are just a few well known brands inside.

Uber Cheap Food at Pier 21. Okay, everybody has already gave you the information about this mall and its details and also how cool the bathrooms are.When you get to this place, make sure to have a meal at Pier 21. This is by far is the cheapest place to eat (in context of foodcourt, and mall meals).The price for a plate of rice and peking duck is as low as THB 25, a plate of rice and some bulky meat is as low as THB 35. You wont find this in any other place!

Niceeeee washroom. Basically a typical shopping mall but the washroom amaze me .... Each washroom has different design.. This is the first time I saw many ppl posing and taking picture in the washroom.. Go check it out each washroom.. :)

Unique mall and definitely worth a visit but there are better malls to go to. First things first, if you are in Bangkok you have to visit Terminal 21. Simple as that. Its unique concept showcases each floor as a sort of loving tribute to a particular city like San Francisco, Tokyo, Paris etc. The entire mall is modeled like an airport and there are departure gates and arrival gates and the whole thing is done to a degree that you have to appreciate. Each floor has particularly memorable architecture in this regard such as the golden gate bridge, two giant sumo wrestlers, a lighthouse, a full size London double decker and many others which I won't spoil. Another area where Terminal 21 deserves the highest credit is an area which I never thought I would have to mention in any of these reviews - the bathrooms! I have to give credit to Trip Advisor for telling me about these in the first place but they are amazing. Each floor has uniquely designed bathroom areas which are fully integrated with the City setting and again show surprisingly huge amounts of attention to detail. But thats not it only. Each toilet is filled to the brim with electronic gadgetry, so don't be surprise when you see a bunch of buttons in the toilet. Again, I hope they can maintain all that in future as well, but it is hands down the best bathrooms I have seen in any mall.Having said all that good stuff, I have to get to the point - and the point is the mall isn't really that great when you take away all the gimmicky stuff(I loved it, but really only for the novelty effect). As a proper mall, Siam Paragon is still way better and includes not just a movie theater but one with an IMAX screen. In addition, I found very few shops which I am interested in, unlike Siam Paragon. The food court was good, but again can't compete with the mind boggling amount of food spots around the Paragon area.

Liked this mall. I enjoyed my visit to Terminal 21. The different themed floors were interesting and I particularly enjoyed the Istanbul floor which was very colorful. There are also a lot of reasonably priced eating places.

different style of shopping mall to visit. This is the shopping mall that you must visit when you are in bangkok. Once you enter each floor of the shopping mall, you feel like you are entering a new place as you will see the sign of departure/arrival when you take the escalator. There are 9 floors with 8 cities for you to visit. Do remember to visit toilet/rest room at each floor as it has different designs according to the city at that floor. How to reach? Just take train either from any bts station or subway station and get down at Asok bts station or Sukhumvit station.
Must Visit. Superb shopping mall in Bangkok. Good shopping, good food especially the food court. The shopping mall is clean. They got different theme on every floor and same goes to the washroom.

Best shopping mall in bangkok. This is for me the best Shopping mall in Bangkok! Really wonderfull new shopping mall with lot of different shops in different section! It is much bigger than you expect first! Nice restaurants also inside! And absolutely visit the toilets there - amazing!!

Nice Concept. Nice concept mall - Every floor has a theme (Japan, Rome, London etc..)
The small shops there cater to niche goods, and specialty items.
Clean place, not too crowded and worth spending more time exploring.

another non-sense place in bkk. one of the many non-places in the capital of thailand. Bangkok many times shows to be more a big number of people together than a cultural capital with this mall full of ugly and commercial shops, boring books and nothing more.

Great for one visit. The convenient location is a plus. The theme is novel and interesting but not too faithfully reproduced..The noise is too much however, and there were many closed shops. Shopping-wise is not great, while the food options are plentiful.Would not really go shopping there, Paragon and Emporium are certainly better, and the toilets (although fancy) should not be a reason to visit.
Excellent food court on the top floor. Any type of Thai or Asian food for a very small price - compared to the restaurants around. Lunch for 50 baht anyone?

Fantastic Shopping Mall!. This Mall is like an airport when you arrived it takes you on journey through international wellknown city world over. London, Paris, San Franciso, Tokyo, etc...all modelled along the respective city landmark. You can shop for lots of apparel, clothings with good bargains. At 5th floor where this Mall houses the most interesting part I find it- Thai street food with over 50 stalls all in this food-court like self service, where one needs to get a stored value pre-paid card at the counter then just use it at every stall cashless, they just deduct it as you purchase you food. Food is everything from popular Thai salad, Thai beef noodle, to dessert like mango with sticky rice, etc etc endless..I would return again and again to explore the hundreds of food items sold here.

NEW Shopping Mall !. Terminal 21 opened since Oct 2011. (Open from 10:00am-22:00pm)The shopping mall has two entrances at ground level (for people walking along Sukhumvit Road) and there are two walkways connecting the Asoke skytrain station with Terminal 21.Each floor are designed and named at different theme around the world : LG Floor-Carribbean, G Floor-Rome, M Floor-Paris, 1st Floor-Tokyo, 2 nd Floor-London, 3rd Floor-Istanbul, 4/5th Floor-San Francisco and 6th Floor-Hollywood Fashion outlets are the main feature here, with all kinds of international and local fashion label, and mostly Ladies’ boutique shops. Overall it’s still worth a visit to this beautiful and clean shopping mall !

Shopping Paradise!. Terminal 21, as its name implies, is an airport-themed lifestyle mall, with each of its nine floors having unique international and local tenant mix. It will take at least two days to explore eight of the nine floors of shops and F&B outlets, the top floor of the mall being occupied by a cinema chain. 8/F is anchored by the Pier 21 food court which offers Thai and Southeast Asian street food such as phad thai noodles, satays, chicken rice, nasi goreng and roast duck.Like the Siam Paragon food court, Pier21 operates on a prepaid card system, with any unused amount refunded upon surrender of the cash card.The extensive food hall and supermarket in the basement resembles the one in Siam Paragon, with a bewildering selection of fruits, vegetables, meat, seafood, snacks, cakes, breads, cookies, beverages, spices and other foodstuffs.The remaining five floors of T21, devoted to apparel, accessories, footwear, etc, are divided into different international shopping zones - London, Paris, Tokyo, Istanbul, with quirky overhead signage resembling those typically seen in airport terminals.Foreigners can apply for a tourist privilege card to enjoy discounts at selected stores and dining outlets in the mall. T21 is accessible by skytrain (Asok Station) or MRT (Sukhumvit Station), and there is always a rank of taxis waiting for passengers at the street level entrance.

Great Thai clothing design for the young. Terminal 21 is a very trendy mall on Sukhumvit. It caters mainly to the young and the prices are reasonable. I am a little old for the styles but I enjoyed seeing what up and coming young Thai designers are creating. I did manage to buy some great ballet flats at Ballet Shoes (Thai manufacture and great designs).

Very moden mall with a fantastic cinema. Terminal 21 is a very modern newly built Mall. Each of the malls levels is themed from a different city around the world for example in the 'london level' you have a double decker red bus , carnaby street like shops selling products thareflect the Uk. other chosen cities include Istanbul and America. One level has lots of International restaurants and a starbucks so it would be quite easy to find something to eat for children if they don't want to eat Thai food. We went to watch 'Skyfall' there as it has just come out that day and the cinema if fantastic with very comfortable seats including 'sofa seats' at the back.

Easily the Best Shopping Centre in Bangkok. Simply amazing Shopping Centre. Terminal 21 was perhaps the most modern Shopping Centre I had been to in Bangkok and certainly had the best design. The Centre was absolutely spotless and very easy to navigate around. The shops are a mixture of trendy cafes and clothing boutiques, with an assortment of other goods available. Each level has a theme, from renaissance France to the Caribbean, making the design and décor of the Centre quite interesting. A very good shopping complex and certainly worth a visit. Access is very easy, with the Asoke BTS station and Sukhumvit Metro Station right next door. The things on sale here are not cheap by Bangkok standards but overall this Shopping Centre beats every other Mall in Bangkok that I have been to for its concept, variety and overall shopping experience. Set aside a good 3-4 hours to shop here and bring lots of money!

One of the latest shopping malls in Bangkok. A unique mall with a travel theme where each floor represents a different country. The food court is the San Francisco area with its own tram decor and Fishermans Wharf while other floors include Istanbul, London, Paris, Tokyo themes. The public toilets are very clean and odor free, attended by 3 cleaners at any one time who are also dressed to match the "city" they work in. My wife reported that they also use heated toilet seats like Taiwan & Japan.The food court is inexpensive and has good variety, with a large seating area. There are lots of clothes and shoes with lots of hipsters seen reinforcing their wardrobes. If you have been to Chatujak weekend market or like Platinum mall, Terminal 21 will offer a similar shopping experience without the heat and crowds. Granted that it doesn't have the organized mess of Chatujak market or the wholesale rates of Platinum mall but its east to get to, lots to see and do and is located at the Asok BTS station exit 1.Now to get your retail therapy on!

I want this mall in Melbourne. So much fun to shop and explore. My personal fav was the Japan level with small Thai design and vintage stores. Pier 21 food court was amazing value, clean and delicious.

Groovy mall. We stayed at a hotel in Sukhumvit that is walking distance to this mall, which was connected to Asok sky train station. Each floor had a theme and the stalls sell mainly clothes, shoes, bags for the young crowd. There was a huge food court, some good, some not so good, but very cheap. There was also a lot of small restaurants to choose from. Grocery store in the basement, cinemas at the top floor along with a massage/ spa parlour. Convenient, very clean, not so crowded, with very good toilets.
