Modern shopping mall. Terminal 21 is a huge, modern shopping mall. Each level has a different them, Caribbean, Istanbul, Paris. Food court has a great selection of reasonably priced food. Amazing toilets, will keep you entertained.

Hip and Cool!. Love the clothes selection on the 2nd and 3rd floor, all local Thai designers showcasing the best of Bangkok trendy fashion.The newest addition to Bangkok's many malls, terminal 21 sets a new bar for the other established malls with it's trend setting and fashionably hip vibe.

A great shopping mall with interesting concept in differences level.. They had a different theme in every level by country! A very interesting way to separate how type of goods was sold according to the country each level represent! Great drain in the public toilet as well according to the country in that level.

A quiet mall in the afternoon. This mall was quiet in the weekdays afternoon. I bought a pair of shorts and a top at $1000+ baht each. Thought it was way too pricey although I liked the design very much. To avoid crowds, it would be good to visit this place in a weekday afternoon.

Market Price meets Luxury Hotel. Located near BTS Asok, this is one of the newest malls of BKK and is certainly one that you shouldn't miss. It's clean, well-organized and it will give you lots of good things to do. From the foodcourt in the basement, to the movie area at the very top, Terminal 21 gives you a relaxing break from the bustling area of Sukhumvit. The concept of Terminal 21 is unique because it is patterned to look like an airport, having each floor molded in a certain country. Shopping here is also a treat because it combines the price of the market, with the beauty of luxury malls. Some stores even give you discounts if you are their first customers. The stores offer what other bangkok malls do not --uniqueness. Some of the stores here are managed by the designers themselves, and they offer you items that are not found elsewhere. Unlike market stalls and MBK which offer the same items in almost all the stores, Terminal 21 has those one-of-a-kind stores that make you shop and shop. For the people that want items only a few people own, this is the place for you. Although it is quite small, you will find yourself exploring all the floors because of the way it is constructed. I did some of my shopping here, and I realized that I like this mall better than MBK and Siam Paragon.

A bit of west, in the east!. Modern, westernized, brand name featured shopping mall hosting a variety of companies selling items from clothing to a very cool small store featuring collectible air planes. I had some fantastic food here of all sorts and there are couple of floors of them. Most of the stores have VAT approved processing for tourists that you can claim upon leaving at the BKK airport on items considered luxury (over 3000 bahts).This mall also offers free WiFi but you need to go to the information desk to present identification and obtain a code to login as all internet traffic in Thailand is tracked. I was astounded when I heard this but that's a foreign country for you and you have to respect their laws and yes, this is law. I also found that for equivalent brand name items from the west, this mall offers the same products at slightly a better deal. Of course to top it off, you have the well renowned Starbucks for some decent coffee in BKK. This mall just opened recently in August 2012. Definitely worth checking out and all 6 floors of it.

Excellent shopping centre. We loved that this had the theme of going from country to country. Very cleverly done! Toilets were a hit with the kids with buttons you could push to squirt your toosh, temp controlled and air dried to finish off. Very fun! Plenty of restaurants on the upper levels. Food court is not super expensive which we were pleasantly surprised at. Best find was The Canton House with great dim sum and other authentic Cantonese cooked dishes. Tasty and very reasonably priced for BKK!

Pretty good shopping and eating. Different sections on each floor, i.e. women's on 3rd, men's 4th, shoes 5th in different country themes. Massive choice of food from fast food to Thai, Italian, International at good prices. Immaculate supermarket and other interesting food shops. Big but easy to navigate. Open until 10 pm for shopping and dining.

Cinema and food is great. I'm not a huge "fan" of mega-malls, but there was something quite charming about this place. Each floor is themed; based on different cities around the world and, in my opinion, is executed with style and polish. I visited the cinema on the top-floor and it was a very pleasant experience. I couldn’t count the number of eating options… ranging from supermarket and casual takeaway options in the basement, cafés throughout and more sitdown dining options on the upper levels.

Terminal 21 Bangkok Shopping Mall. Visited today, 19 October 2012, and I have to say it is a very big mall with no one shopping. There are more restaurants and eateries than stores/shops. Most of the shops think they are upscale/trendy, when they are just selling T-shirts and blue jeans. Food was good at Bar-B-Q Plaza. Each floor is supposed to be a city theme - Istanbul, Paris, Tokyo, London, San Francisco - but - aside from a few photos and statues, there is nothing else resembling the city themes. If you are looking for a good place to get out of the Bangkok sun and get some air conditioning and a bite to eat, I recommend it. For shopping, there are better and cheaper places to go.Aside from the two T-shirts my wife bought at 190 baht apiece, I didn't see anyone buy anything other than food in the 3 hours we were there.

Great Selection. Terminal 21 has great selection of cheap to expensive clothing in a variety of style from your normal north american jeans and tees to Lolita wear to evening gowns.This mall is also great for food! They have an excellent selection of restaurants with Thai food, Japanese, Korean, Tony Ramas etc. Also have a good selection at the food court for fast food.

excellent Shopping Mall. Modern and best Mall i had visited till now. I had been to Dubai Mall and Mall of emerates in Dubai. They may be bigger but this ones attention to detail and quality of spaces have impressed me a lot . the food court is large . neat and Value for money . I had eaten dishes from this food court at cheaper rates than from street side vendors in Asoke and Nana. Street Vendors try to rip you off while this food court have the same price for thais and tourist s. Thats a rare thing in thailand , if you had been to thailand you know what i am talking. A must Visit mall in bangkok

Very modern. Of all the malls I saw in Bangkok, Terminal 21 was perhaps the most modern and had the best design. Given its young age, the centre was absolutely spotless, looking like it had opened just yesterday. The shops are a mixture of trendy cafes and clothing boutiques, with an assortment of other goods available. Each level has a theme, from renaissance France to the Caribbean, making the design and décor of the centre quite interesting. A very good shopping complex and certainly worth a visit. Access is very easy, with the Asoke BTS station and Sukhumvit Metro Station right next door.

Great Mall. We visited Siam Paragon, MBK, and Terminal 21 malls while in Bangkok. This was by far my favorite. Each level is a different country and it has a airport theme. I couldn't get over the toilets. Call me a crazy tourist, but I thought they were hilarious. A fun destination stop.

Great new venue. Love this place, good local traders, who don't hassle you and toilets you just have to see, they shower your bottom and dry it automatically.. Great food court with great value.Worth a trip to see

Nicest shopping we've seen in Bangkok. A great theme "high end" mall. By high end I mean you could still find T-shirts for 100-150 Baht and we got a beautiful evening dress for 300 baht. Most shops are more expensive but still really cheap and much nicer place and good than malls like the syupis MBK. surprisingly not touristy at all...6 floors representing different cities in the world. Cute idea.Toilets are amazing with seat warmers, bidet and bottom dryer :)Many restaurants and a big food court that seemed very cheap.A great shopping experience

Coolest mall in Bangkok. Being an avid traveler myself, i love the concept of this new mall where every floor represents a different city/country. The bathrooms are really fun. The toilets are super cool. They have a built in seat warmer, bidet and even a dryer! Haha. The Pier 21 Food court is amazing. It's clean and new. It has a very cool theme. We compared the food courts in various malls we've been to and we think they have the cheapest prices. You can get a meal for 35 baht. It's also connected to the BTS station which makes it very convenient. We didn't check out the shopping as much because it seems a little bit pricier than Platinum Mall but they seem to have cooler clothes too.

One of the best shopping center!. I have travel to Bangkok many times, but now I found one of the best shopping mall in this city. Perfect designed - every floor in a special country theme. Italy, France, Arabic... You must see especially toilets! Japanese toilets are the best!!! You will know why if you see that! Also there is the best food court placed in a 5 floor for fantastic prices! Good shopping, food and fun - everything what you want!

New Mall. This is still a new mall in this area. It has a very different interior style and the staffs resemble the airport crews. The foods in the food court are affordable and cheap. Delicious to me.

Great for low budget tourists!. Since everyone already talked about how nice is the design of each floor of this great Mall, the location and the whole ETC, i will like point at the fact that is the perfect place for low budget tourist but not for shopping cloth but for eating!The street food (just judging by the look) looks cheap but the reality is that one single element (let's call element to for example a stick with three maximum four pieces of BBQ chicken) can cost an average of 20 Bahts but in the top floor of this shopping mall is possible to find a plate (not big but still a plate) of a well presented local dish for 30 Bahts (if you want to go for fancy stuff can cost an average of 45 bahts or if you like to eat Pork or Duck can cost an average of 75 Bahts). Is also important to notice that the variety of dishes offered is even bigger than in the street, the flavors are good and is served on a nice environment.

Great shopping mall complex. This is a fairly new mall in Bangkok and a great concept of having it like a airport terminal with each floor being a different world destination Paris, Tokyo, San Fran, Istanbul, London etc with shops imitating shopping in that country. Connected to the Asok skytrain station it easy to find and get to, would hughly reccomend

There is a New Shopping Experience in Bangkok. The new and the trendy and the well patronised are always an attraction for locals in Bangkok and equally for visiting tourists. So if you are in Sukhumvit (Wattana) or wisely using the Skytrain to travel around from elsewhere in the city, then head for Terminal 21 as both a shopping venue and a casual place to stay cool and to eat great Thai food.The shopping mall is multi-storied, attached to the Grande Centre Point Terminal 21 hotel, close to Nana and Asok stations, and well known to taxi and tuk-tuk drivers. it is clean, modern, security conscious, with good information desks and parking, and most essentially has good toilet facilities. Branded international stores and local Thai stores as well as having all manner of merchanise and a very good supermarket that is acceptably priced. There is an exceptionally good delicatessen section with quality fresh meat, fish, bread products and produce. It seemed clear the local 'expat' community shops there and yes there is plenty of Chang and Singha. NB decent wine is expensive here as it is through out Thailand.The designer stores and merchanise shopping is expensive in some respects on a Thailand scale but the choice is enormous and the sale prices were attractive in September. There are stalls down on Sukhumvit Road for the true bargains and copy products. Head to level 5 for the food hall throughout the day. It leaves other food outlets such as at the MBK and around Siam Square in its shadow; the locals' patronage confirm that this is great and cheap Thai food, with a huge variety of specialist vendors, and as hygenic as you would want. Payment is by a debit card system and they do refund unused baht. We found 200 - 300 baht went a long way. Go early for an evening meal as some places do run out of food and then close down reflecting popularity. However, you cannot buy beer with you meal.If you have just arrived in BKK, your hotel is nearby, you want to be both careful and eat at a modest price, and rather than eating at your hotel you came to BKK to enjoy some local "colour" and genuine courtesy in the service, then this is a good place to start your BKK experience and it may also be where you finish too. Enjoy the experience,

wery different shopping centre!!. terminal 21 was a great experince, so different to otheres.all the levels in the centre becomes "terminal 2 = level 2, quite funny, anyway we had a great coffie up at the top, in the rail way car, called "francisco rail way" great view too.all the levels= terminals had different themes, the underground uk, the bridge from san francisco ect.it had a massive escalator to the top.
Great. Food - The food court is cheap and the foods are great. love it.Much better food compare to MBK.Shopping - need to bargain otherwise paying a high price.

Great Mall!. Amazing mall and very huge escalator. Love the concept of this mall. We had so much pictorials on every side and floor of the mall. Nice toilet but dont know how to use. So many buttons. Funny!

Fly around the world whilst shopping!. This is such a fun shopping centre. I have never seen anywhere like it. Each floor is a different country, and so much detail has been put in to make it look so good. It's honestly worth seeing. London looks incredible, as does San Fran whereas Istanbul looks a little less Well thought out! The shops are very reasonably priced and the food court has something for everyone. It is not as up market as emporium, but it is a little more so than mbk! Go!

Pleasant & cheap prices. This is a great food court located on the sixth floor of Terminal 21 shopping mall on Sukhumvit. There are many stalls with a great variety of delicious Asian dishes. They have also a large variety of fruits and fruit juices. Prices are really low and this is worth to eat there.

Interesting Architecture. The design and architecture is great.Love the toilet as every floor have different design.Layout too very clean and not confusing.Very convenient for travellers as it connects with the train.Great shopping place too as the price range is not too expensive

Interesting shopping mall, with great food. Mid range shopping mall with little shops. Each level has different theme of the world. The decorations and restrooms are ties to the theme or each level. Food can be found at level 4 and 5 and cinema on level 6. Had Japanese food for dinner, thumbs up! You can spend few hours of shopping here.

Funnest mall I have ever been in!. My husband and I discovered this mall two days ago as we were exploring Bangkok on foot. If Disneyland built malls, this is the kind of mall they would build. We spent 5 hours covering it from top to bottom: eating, shopping, having a massage, The developers gave incredible attention to detail and quality. I wish that we had stayed in a hotel that was closer to this mall, as it was, we were in Thailand for two days and ate dinner there both nights. The grocery store is fantastic. I have never been in such a well-stocked grocery store anywhere else in South East Asia. We are trying to cut back on sweets and the gourmet donuts and cupcakes were sooo tempting. Did I mention the bathrooms?! They were themed just like the shops. Beautiful and immaculately kept.

Best shopping centre in Bangkok. Love the concept and boutiques here. The stuff here isn't cheap for bangkok standards but overall, this mall beats every other mall in Bangkok that I have been to (Central world, Platinum, MBK, Seacon, Siam) for its concept, variety and overall shopping experience.Set aside a good 3-4 hours to shop here and bring lots of money!
amazing new mall. love the many restaurants and the different floors (cities) and distinct shops. new mall and much more to see and buy than Siam Paragon and Central World

huge place, good variety. tons of shops here at good prices. interesting and refreshing concept of a themed shopping mall.easy to get here via ASOK BTS, and easy to take taxis waiting outside at the G floor.

Interesting concept. Interesting mall, designed on a airport concept, with each floor having a destination theme - london, paris etc. Interesting variety of shops, the usual ones as well as the unique. This mall is footsteps from Asok station, so worth a visit if you're in the vicinity. I was staying at the Sheraton across the road, so dropped in. Good to kill and hour or two.

Extremely convenient and it has one of the best food courts in BKK. You can get from the Asoke BTS exit to Terminal 21 in 30 seconds, as it is connected.The food court might be the best reason to go there. It is probably one of the most spacious in BKK, and very reasonably priced. However, don't expect any views from the windows (it faces the back, Ratchadaphisek Rd). The views from the Emporium food court are far better.However, there are also restaurants spread all over the 4th and 5th floor with varied cuisine. Also a supermarket on the ground-lower level.

Different mall , nice environment feeling... I chanced on this on the last day visit. Nice mall with different concept , focus a lot on interior and embinece. A different desitnation each level, and the shops are themed as per level. Shops sells a higher quality stuff as compared to MBK. worth a visit . It was having a dorameno event during the visit. Should bring camera along for photo session.... will visit again next visit. light at Asoke BTS.

Agreed. Best toilets in Bangkok.. We come to this mall a couple times a month to kill time before catching a van at Victory Monument. The shopping is very typical and the mall is touristy with every floor being a different major city. The toilets are not only free, but clean, have toilet paper, and there are sinks with soap AND paper towels. There is also free wi-fi which combined with the clean toilets means you never have to leave. The food is overpriced, but there are so many options that everyone will be happy. We generally get Japanese at Yoshinoya but my boyfriend was alarmed at finding a worm in his broccoli this afternoon-- so we will not be going there any longer! In spite of that Terminal 21 continues to be my favorite mall in Bangkok!

quirky shopping. Terminal 21 is a mid price shopping mall on sukhumvit road next to Asoke. It is full of quirky boutiques showcasing a lot of local designers and the prices are reasonable to mid price. the building is airy and lght . It's a much nicer and comfortable shopping experience than mbk; platinum fashion mall or chatuchak ( a lot of the chatuchak designers have a boutique at terminal 21) as it's less crowded, sweaty and frantic. There's 100's of unuausual little boutiques to explore on the various levels so i recomend that you visit several times exploring a different floor or space yourself for a longer visit as there's plenty of drinking and eating spots to have a rest and a refueling as well as the famous themed toilets on each floor. Personally i was staying in hotel 5 minutes walk away so i was popping in every day for a mooch of an hour or so, visiting a few boutiques at a time. If you like individual style and wear things nobody else will have at home; you will love this place. there's something for everybody from men's clothes, to accessories , jewellery , home decor, cosmetics, shoes etc.... Thai style is all about cute prints, bright colours and quirky details. The sizing is the only drawback for most westeners as the Asian sizing runs on the small side. it you are above size 12 for women it gets a bit difficult. But you can still find knitwear, teeshirt and accessories galore.

Great food. Nice boutique shops. Best toilets ever.. Top two floors are packed with great restaurants. Bottom floor has a great gourmet supermarket; they have a great salad bar and their pasta bar is delicious. The lasagne in particular was good. Each floor is themed after a different country and every bathroom has been designed differently each with their own theme. This shopping center is a must-visit!
Nice foodcourt. - large scale foodcourt- you can enjou thai cusine on 6th floor- inexpensive- fresh fruits, bevarages, thailand's sweets, etc.

Mid range mall with the best toilet in bangkok?. This shopping mall is connected to Asoke BTS and Sukumvit MRT station. There are many eateries in this mall, so much that you will be spoilt for choice. The shopping are mid-range(no luxury brand like in Siam Paragon).International fashion brands are in the lower level and local shops are located on the higher level. The toilet in this mall deserved a special mention, every floor toilet is designed differently with a theme that fits the level which you are in.

Very clever concept for a shopping mall. Finally a different shopping mall. As most people travel in Thailand, Hong Kong or Singapore you will find most malls have exactly the same shops inside and they get quite boring. Well finally Terminal 21 has done it. Great theme and many different shops and places to eat. Definitely check this out. The location is in Asoke and located by both the BTS and MRT stops. Worth the visit.

Something different. First time I've seen a mall with a different concept/theme on each floor. On the main floor is Paris, Ground floor - Rome, Lower Ground floor - Caribbean, 1st floor - Tokyo, 2nd floor - London, 3rd floor - Istanbul, 4th floor - City of San Francisco, 5th floor - San Francisco's Pier 21, 6th floor - Hollywood. The theme extends up to their toilets or restrooms on each floor. I particularly love the Tokyo restroom, the mirrors are in the shape of sunglasses and the faucets are hidden. So don't forget to bring your cameras when visiting this mall.My favorite thing about this mall is their food court on the 5th floor, Pier 21. There are a lot of choices but most of all, the food are the cheapest amongst all the food courts I've been to in the Bangkok area. When I was there in August 2012, I had Pad Thai for 30 baht, and I even saw Fish with rice and veggies platter for 25 baht.There are a lot of small stores, but what I enjoyed the most were the ladies fashion accessories shops on the Istanbul floor.To get to this mall, take the BTS Skytrain Sukhumvit line and get off on Asok station. Take exit 1 and you end up inside the mall. You can also take the MRT and public buses, but I personally prefer the BTS Skytrain.

The toilets were interesting. ;P. Although it didn't really feel like a terminal, it was quite a nice mall for food and shopping. Conveniently located at Asok BTS, Terminal 21 has lots of local and international brands. You can even catch a movie or get a massage if you like. The toilets were interesting and were consistent to the theme of the particular level. Unfortunately, I was too shy to whip out my camera while inside and on hindsight, it was good I didn't or I might just get arrested. Nothing outstanding but comfortable and spacious.
Food Court. This was excellent value for Money and the store is very nice too easy to get around user friendly. lovely toilets!!

Difference experience. This place is unique, one of a kind. Its like a thematic mall. We also grab a movie in this mall, it was great like paragon cinema as well.We also find a great macha cake in here. And the best part is the toilet is in automatic seats, and each floor serves different themes. It connected direct to BTS, which is very helpful
A well thought out mall. Each floor has a different theme. One floor has shops designed in the Istanbul way while the other has the London theme. A must visit for any tourist.

Modern and unique concept mall. This is one of the modern malls in Bangkok where each floor an areaAre themed into places around the world .. Good choice of shops for decent shopping and this mall is right next to Asok BTS stop.

Unique shopping experience. For a chic & unique shopping experience, different from the other very large expensive glitzy shiny malls, Terminal 21 located on Sukhumvit Rd, is quite a delightful shopping centre. It is very easy to get to - catch the SkyTrain [BTS] as the centre is directly off the Asok SkyTrain station. This centre is very appealing for those who want something different. The attraction of themed floors of world famous cities each with their own unique small boutique shops loaded with eclectic items make this a very pleasant shopping experience. The food courts, on two levels, provide a good variety that makes it difficult to choose. There are many Japanese food outlets. And make sure you visit the restrooms on each floor to really experience how the Thai’s carry out the themed floors to such detail!

A lot of effort has gone into this one. I'd heard a lot about the latest mall in Bangkok and it's really interesting. Ofcourse the shops are the same old, same old but every floor has been dressed up according to a city and the Japanese, French and American floors are nice but the Istanbul floor was my favorite. And the food in the food court is cheaper then any other I went to. This is possibly as a promotion and in no way did it mean that the food was better than other food courts like Central World or Siam.Ofcourse, like everyone else, I'm now going to rave about the bathrooms. They continue the style of the floors, have full french windows and the all-frills toilets. So, they're all a must go to.
great place to visit in Bangkok. this is new place in bangkok, is superb, and amazing place, easy to acces, and you can find good food also.

Include this in your street tour. This mall has an impressive design and includes a movie theater on the top floor. Many of the stores appear to cater to the teen crowd rather than older-wealthier clientelle. Unlike many other Thai malls this one offers free Wi-Fi and there are several good cafes where you can sit down and plug in.

Fun place to take pictures. Some might not like it, but I am a sucker for weirdly theme shopping mall. It might sound weird to some, but I love the unique theme wash-room in each floor. Do go if you have time to spare and looking for a weirdly trip visiting the wash-room... Also I like how Paris theme floor..

Spacious.. thats it!. This is just in front of Asoke BTS station. You will see themes on every floor i.e. Japanese ( luvd the rows of paper lanterns), British ( luvd the Charring Cross booth), Turkish ( luvd the Turkish dancers statues on the columns), American ( luvd the huge Oscar statue)... other than that there is nothing much to look forward too. As you walk thru the rows of shops, you get this feeling that you are in Chatuchak! just that this is a highly organized and priced mall ...As for the restaurants.. nah!! give it a miss!Go if you must, but don't expect anything out of the ordinary!!

Fun, Fashionable and great place for pictures to be taken. This is a fun little quirky mall with themed areas from around the world - hence a great photo opportunity. Great shops with good trendy clothes and a great place to wonder around well worth a visit.

Loud, tacky and unappaeling. Terminal 21 at the Asoke/Sukhumvit junction is bright, blaring and overpriced. The themes are forced and bear little resemblance to the areas they imitate. I found very little to recommend the place.

Unique shopping mall with valuable foods. We can access the mall directly from BTS station. So, if the rain comes, we still can go to this shopping mall easily.The mall is unique. Each floor has different theme.The food court has many many many valuable foods. Delicious taste and not expensive. The mall has comfort toilet and also clean.The price for any goods are reasonable.Many local boutiques in higher floors which offers beautiful designs.Nice shopping mall at Bangkok

A must see. Although it does not look very attractive from outside but then once you go in then the real drama starts. Each and every floor of the mall has been designed after a city like Istambul, London, Shanghai, etc. There are some shops here which offer good deals.
Shopping Mall with a different theme!!. Themed like an airport, with each floor depicting different cities/countries with lovely settings. A wide variety of restaurants and shops.

What a great mall. This is a lovely mall with each floor dedicated to a certain city. London had a London Bus and telephone boxes, San fran had a huge bridge. Was really nicely done - worth the look on its own. Can't comment on the shopping as didn't really do much however did visit the super cheap food court a few times. You can get dishes as little as 30 baht. Note for the food court, you need to get a food card and deposit money onto it and then you use the card to pay and which ever station you are at.

Wonderfully creative concept for a shopping mall. This is becoming one of my favorite shopping areas in Bangkok,,,each level of the mall is designated as a different country ,,bring your camera as its also fun for personal,,fun type photos with each counties llarger than life statues ,,the restrooms deserve a go see in themselfs ,,each done up to match the destination and theme of the floor you are on ,,so much artistic thought and work has went into the making of this mall ,,prices are moderate to reasonable ,,and a great selection of food choices are available ,,plus the food court is very reasonable and artfully set out if your on a budget ,,,let me not forget to mention the views from most restaurants ,,,fantastic you can get a good view of the city ,,from many restaurants there is even seating in the food court with an wonderfull view ,,,this place would make an enjoyable visit for any tourist ,,and it would be on my must see list ,,theatres are located at the top as well ,,a stroller service is on the street floor ,,too fun for the whole family must see creativity put into this place

Weird in the best possible way.. This place all will change the way you think about malls forever......why can't they all have differently themed floors, each representing a different world city, filled with cool boutique shops? Why can't they all have spotless toilets? Why can't they all be reached by super fast public transport? but most importantly, why don't all malls have great food courts with dishes made to order quickly and freshly, which you pay for with preloaded cash cards (the balance is returned when you leave). So, it's great.

My new favorite mall. The food court is excellent. Most of the food is made to order. The mall itself is really cool, with lots of little boutiques selling things that you can't find anywhere. The bathrooms are really nice too, with toto washlets on the toilets and design themes that change on each floor with the same city theme that extends to the rest of the mall. Very cool.

Best Location in the City, Best Toilets, Excellent Movie Theater, So-So Restaurants. Terminal 21 enjoys the premier location in Bangkok, at the nexus of the SkyTrain and Underground stations at Asoke and Sukhumvit. You can walk into the mall directly from the SkyTrain platform, which is very convenient. Movie times are displayed on a sign board right at the entrance. There are two ways to move around Terminal 21, by escalator and by elevator. If you want to purchase movie tickets before dining or shopping, proceed towards the back of the mall, straight as you walk in from the SkyTrain platform entrance, and the elevators are on the left hand side. You want the sixth floor. Very fast, convenient layout. Once you have your movie tickets sorted--and I do recommend that you spring for VIP seats with roomy two-person reclining couches--take an escalator down a floor and have a look at the restaurants. I will save you a ton of time and grief. There are basically two places worth patronizing in Terminal 21: Fuji, and Sunrise Taco. By all means, avoid the Tony Roma's unless you like tourist traps. I review all three restaurants elsewhere on this site. There are plenty of other restaurants, but none that are just outrageously excellent. The food court is very affordable, if you want local food at local prices. For tourists, this is a good thing to do, as it also is for travelers on a budget. You can eat cheap, and you can eat good, in the food court. As for other restaurants, the basic rule of thumb applies: if they are not crowded, you can assume that the provender is not that good. Fuji, of course, is Fuji. It is sushi and sashimi and it is consistently good and edible. Sunrise Taco.....is a crap-shoot. You simply do not know if you will have a superb Tex-Mex dining experience, or if you will be angry and disappointed. If you are accustomed to true Tex-Mex, as offered in San Antonio, or San Francisco, or any family restaurant run by immigrants in America, do not think that you will get food remotely comparable at Sunrise. For Bangkok, Sunrise can be decent. But it is not consistent. Sometimes it is good. Most of the time, it is not that good. Yes, these are bold statements. But patronize them, and see if you disagree. Terminal 21 is not a place to go for shopping. There are no name-brand outlets. Just a bizarre hodgepodge of small shops selling purses and earrings. Your womenfolk may enjoy exploring it, but I guarantee that the males of the species will loathe it. Release your women to go shop, and then go settle down with a pitcher of margaritas at Sunrise. Watch the girls go by. Just be advised that for some reason that I cannot fathom, this mall is not one of the premier girl-watching venues in the city. It does not compare to Esplanade shopping center, for example, or to Fortune IT Mall. I have no explanation for this. I merely report. The best feature of Terminal 21 has to be its toilets. Such a small thing, you think, but when you are out and about in a major metropolis like Bangkok, teeming with people, seething with bacteria, toilets, and their availability, can be a major factor in your ability to enjoy your day. There was a time when it was difficult to find a toilet at Asok junction. Not now. You can slide into the Black Swan British pub across the street from Terminal 21, you can duck into the small Italian deli and restaurant Pala Romana beneath the SkyTrain platform, next to Dunkin' Donuts, or you can waltz into Terminal 21 proper, and utilize the best toilets in the city. I highly recommend the Terminal 21 toilets. I mean, I make excuses to go to Terminal 21 if I even remotely feel the urge to utilize the facilities. By far the weakest aspect of Terminal 21 is the poor quality of its shopping and its restaurants. The entire mall is saved, and even distinguished, by its toilets. The object of so much adulation is a Japanese invention that replaces the quotidian toilet seat. It looks like a toilet seat, and to an extent, it functions like a toilet seat, but it is so much more. It has the capability to direct a sustained jet of warm water at your posterior, and the water jet can be minutely adjusted. It has a drying feature, where warm air chastely flows across your nether regions. It also features a bidet function, though its distinction from the butt washing feature escapes me. They both seem to do the same thing, and in the same general area. Perhaps it is a slight matter of water direction. As best that I can tell, such luxuries cost approximately $80 per copy when purchased at a home improvement superstore. I laud the management of Terminal 21 for making such a costly and decadent investment in their establishment. Despite bad shopping, and a lack of good restaurants, Terminal 21 is saved by its toilets. Considering its location at the heart of the city, Terminal 21 is the premier shopping destination in a city full of malls. If only all Bangkok malls would install those Japanese sanitary wonders. Hope that this helps! Enjoy.

What a shoppers dream. Nicely air conditioned to avoid the humidity outside, very spacious with plenty of variety. We particularly liked the themed floors and ate in New York but had Thai and fantastic ice creams afterwards

Thé best toilet in Bangkok!. Thé shopping Mall is very clean & well organized, however, it is overpriced and there are many other places that offer a much better selection of goods and prices. The absolutely best thing at Terminal 21? The amazing toilets!!! They are spotlessly clean & they offer à sélection Of toilet seat heating, shower spray, and à gentle warm dryer. À deluxe treat for your delicate nether parts!

Unbearably NOISY shopping mall. This could be a great shopping mall – interesting design concept with each floor a different country, interesting shops and convenient location by the skytrain. Unfortunately the shopping experience is seriously compromised by the LOUD blasting speakers from the event space downstairs (usually rented out… admittedly the acoustics don’t help). Since most of the cafes & restaurants have an 'outdoor' area (i.e. inside the mall), there’s no escaping the noise there either. As a result, most of my friends refuse to meet there.

Food Court is Cheap!. The food prices at the upper floor food court are very cheap and as cheap as street food on the Sukumvit 21. We go there only for food and cinema. There is not much thing for shopping.

One visit wonder. So much hype but it was the biggest let down. Too many little shops which don't all open at the official opening time of 10am. I appreciated the different themes on each floor with London having the best washrooms but Istanbul having the best decor! Other than that, it isn't worth much of a visit and certainly not for serious shoppers!

Awesome!. This place is brilliant for a mall. Each floor is themed like a famous city and they really go all out with the theming. Was great to just walk around all the floors rather than go shopping.

Eat here. So the idea of eating at this massive mall might seem silly, but check it out: the best food in Thailand is found at markets, and on the top floor of Terminal 21 is a large food court with stall after stall of delicious food. Make sure you don't order anything pre-made, as fresh is best, but if you're looking for great food at a great price, Terminal 21 is the place to go. The faux security check and the escalator from the SkyTrain level to the Istanbul level were great touches.
Consumer`s Palace. After visiting a lot of temples, museums and the Zoo we enjoyed shopping in Terminal 21 that was rather new in february 2012.Best of all the super toilets. Try and enjoy!!

Very creative shopping mall. A very nice shopping mall to go to, every level is is specially themed to a city of different countries around the world like London, Paris, Tokyo, Istanbul and It is design to the country culture and style. Location of the shoping mall is also very good as it is just right beside Asoke station. The shopping mall is big and spacious with lots of young designer apparel. Go with your family and you will have a day of enjoyable experience there.

Choose this mall instead of others. You should absolutely check this shopping mall out instead of places like Paragorn and Central World. I like the city theme inside, were each floor is designed like its own city. Really fancy. You do also find more "local" shops, wich I enjoy more, than this flagstores for all the famous brands. Also, when you are tired of following your GF while her busy shopping, go to the top floor and sit down, relax with Fifa on Playstation. 20 baht for 15 min or so.

Globe under one roof. Bangkok's Terminal 21 shopping complex is a unique experience. You find many cultures, many cities and many different shopping experiences at the same place - together. It has made a name for up market, branded shopping area and when it comes to food the choice is unlimited and truly reasonable. Most people come here to stroll and eat. On different floors- you find the stuff from different countries - you need at least half a day to walk around here. Want to by the latest designs or branded stuff.. then it is worth visiting this location. There's easy access from Asok BTS or Sukhumvit MRT.

You will love it. This shopping centre has an unbeatable location - strategically located right Next to Asok BTS and Sukhuvmit MRT. The selling point of Terminal 21 is the airport concept. The receptionists at the information counter/security guards dressed like air hostess/steward. Escalators decorated like the boarding gate. It was basically divided into 8 levels, each named after a city. The top level is a cinema and hence named Hollywood. The next 2 levels and the basement are restaurants serving international cuisine and a huge food court. The remaining floors are shops - Tokyo, Rome, Istanbul, London, each decorated with well-known icons/landmarks such as Japanese fortune cat, British Royal Guards, Roman fountain and fresco. There are chained stores as well as small business - hence the variety of goodies are quite diversified. Adequate sitting areas for kids and elderly to take a rest after shopping. Shopaholics would also be most pleased to ponder around. One interesting point to raise is the washrooms - the modern toilets with various automated functions and the magnificent view of Sukhuvmit outside the windows (ladies' toilets at higher level). Suitable for people at all ages who want to go shopping, dining or just seeking a shelter away from the heat of the sun or other overcrowded shopping centres at Silom and Siam. Highly recommended.

Great Shopping Centre. Great Theme.. Themed as a airport terminal with each level as a major city makes this place a very different and interesting shopping centre. Not overly large compared to Paragon and Central World but still worth a visit. The shops are different although not really themed with the level. I.e. the London floor doesn't have typically British shops.

Nice mall and great food court. Convenient to BTS, typical but classy Bangkok mall with movies.Unusual and creative themed floors from around the world. Pier 21 Food Court also very good and reasonably priced. Fun mall for adults and especially kids - more so than most malls in the Siam/Sukhumvit area.

Fun and special themed mall. Heard a lot about the mall. It is creative and fun as shoppers get a different feel on different levels. The levels are decorated according to cities and it's a lot of fun! There are pictures to take on every level and even the restrooms are decorated to the themes! Easy accessible as it is at the Asoke station.The items may look costly from outside the shops but certain shops do have things which are cheap and nice! Lots of food choices at the San Francisco level and food at the food court is great too!

Great new mall. I uses the new Fitness First which had just opened and went to the cinema. Very impressed with how this new shopping centre was designed just like a terminal! Makes a nice change from the overcrowded Paragon.

Unique theme. Visited Terminal 21 last week and it has a very unique theme. Every floor is named after some of the largest cities in the world (London, Rome etc). Even the toilet is designed to fit into the theme. Wide selection of food including a food court. Very easy to find as it is linked to Asoke BTS.

A lot of fun!. This is one of the most creative and interesting shopping centres that I have been to. Each floor is themed with a different city- e.g. Rome, London, Istanbul. It is good fun to be in, though on passing it, we were convinced that it was a train station. Be prepared for your bag to be searched by security, but once you are in you really can spend hours wandering from shop to shop. The various clothes and stationary are not to pricey either, and in many shops you can barter till you have a price that you are happy with. Well worth a visit.
Shopping. Very interesting concept, Each level is name after city or places.Each level has different theme and sell different things.
Great new mall!. The toilets are excellent! Every floor has a different themed toilet. The clothes are fantastic as well. I love that it caters to the male shoppers as well!Awesome place!

Great Place To While Away An Afternoon. Love going to Terminal 21 when I am in Bangkok. Easy to get to from Asok BTS walkway. It is really a fun place with its country themed floors. The prices here are somewhat more than say at MBK, but there are some seriously funky clothes and accessories to be had here. We found the food court to be ok, cheap enough and good views from the window tables. Most food'we had was rather 'food court' the stand outs for us were the durian and sticky rice in coconut for around 60baht and also mango and sticky rice, we went back a few times just for this and washed it down with the excellent frozen fruit smoothies from the stand beside the sticky rice. Lots of cafes and restaurants here too, pretty much for every taste. This is a bit of a strange thing to say but the toilets here are worth a visit, many floors have amazing views from the toilet entry area and they are also themed and an army of cleaning ladies keep them in good nick.Mr Fayvan always complained that the Men's was always full of ladies with mops! We also went to the movies here, you can have a coffee while you wait for your movie to start in big comfy chairs and look at the skyline. Terminal 21 is a great place to browse,eat,and while away an afternoon out of the Bangkok heat.

Awesome. stepping into this shopping mall was like stepping in a another country.... each floor was named and decorated after a country capital... there was The Carribeans, Paris, Rome, Istanbul, Tokyo, San Francisco and London...and you get to see bits and pieces of the countries... for example Sumo fighters and a huge Maneki Neko cat in Tokyo, statues of angels and all in Rome, The Golden Gate bridge in San Francisco, The London bus and telephone box in London etc..etc...and what amazed me further was the staff allocated on each floor had the respective individual country costume on too!!!Of course... the shops were pretty neat too.. inclusive of a gourmet supermarket where you can find almost everything you want imported from all over the world

Different.... Given that it's walkable from my condo I eventually decide to grace this place with my presence and was spectacularly indifferent about having done so; I'm more of an Emporium kind of person.It's large, clean and many will find the theme's interesting - I'm thinking that my 5 year old may like it and that it may serve as a useful distraction from his general hatred of shopping. Personally I found the themes whimsical, tacky and disjointed but got a rise of the attempt to try something different; it's hard to fault the ambition or bravado of the project. I did not get a rise out of the food offerings which are shockingly bad (low end chains) but fortunately I found a scaled down Seefah sub brand which while lacking in choice was excellent and good value...If you do decide to go I earnestly suggest the skytrain, the exit is level with the entrance and couldn't be much closer. The MRT is also a pretty good option but make sure you get the right exit or you'll feel like an extra in the old classic frogger video game. Asoke interchange is one of the busiest in Bangkok so it's a traffic nightmare, that said if you're driving you can pretty much park on the floor you want to go too!!Hope this helps!

Terminal 21 Shopping Mall and Food Court. In the heart of Sukhumvit (take skywalk at Asoke BTS/MRT) the food court(Pier 21) on the 5th floor offers a great range of styles and tastes at reasonable prices and the best i've visited so far. Very busy at peak times and popular with Locals and Tourists alike! A new shopping mall with different themes on each floor. Definitely worth a look although the shops are more boutique/brand name style with prices to match and staff who are forever grooming themselves in front of strategically placed mirrors. MBK center would still be a much better choice.(take Skytrain to Siam, then National Stadium)

Stunningly weak. Given the excellence of Siam paragon this place which has an airports feel is hokey. Granted the food court is good but the by the country theme per area is ticky tacky and annoying. Place can be stunningly noisy at the front, and the stores are the bog standard mall stores that are in all the major malls. It seems cheaper in finishes than its competitors and while location is good at Asok on BRT and sukhumvit at MRT it just doesn't pull it off. If elevators are your thing they have him here in every direction all suggestive of idiocy like going from London to Paris etc. yet the merchandising doesn't reflect this leap. This more than anything else seems like real estate play and an effort to move some of the tourist mall income away from Phloen Chit and Siam areas.

Best shopping centre ever visited!. This has to rival any shopping centre anywhere in the world... it is creative, imaginative, interesting and even provides plenty of photo opportunities as u each level transports shoppers to a different location around the world. Great fun - even my boyfriend loved it!

An airport experience with a difference. Hey this shopping centre is truly amazing. From the moment you enter the ground floor there is an airport feel. Escalators are arrival and departure points representing many capital cities. Prices are reasonable and staff are helpful. You are not hassled into buying anything but they are fixed price.

Stunning idea bad execution. Was excited to visit the venue, the interior look impressive but shopping wise is not worth it. Siam Paragon looks much better and feasible. Very confusing lay out and the theme they intended to be wasn't deliver greatly. Items sold there is more street goodies with more prices, silom street ofer better.
If you are hungry, go to this place. Great and large choice of restaureants. The food court is my favorite.

Die die must visit mall when you are in BKK. Great shopping mall, many local designer boutique with affordable price for designer cloth & accesaries.Foodcort is cheap with roadside thai food inspired. Toilet on each floor has different theme which worth to explore.Tip: just prepare your cash for the shopping as many of those local designer shop does not accept credit card.

Great Mall!. After living in BKK for 2 years, i have to say Terminal 21 is one of my favs! when i have friends come and visit it is always on my list of 'must see' malls. the food court is one of the best, and the movie theater is really great. it is also very easy to get to via BTS and MRT. if you dont eat at the food court there are only a few other non-thai options (pari pari Portuguese chicken, and a lot japanese food). be sure to take your camera because there are tons of photo ops!!

Cheap for Meals. First day we took more photos of the decor than actually shopping. Even had to take photos of the restrooms on each floor. Restrooms were very clean. There weren't a lot of childrens shops. Can be a bit pricey some of ladies boutiques. About the same price as back home.Loved the food hall on the 5th floor called Pier 21. Dishes cost approx 30-60 baht. Keep in mind for the westerner you may need 3 dishes. My 6 year old could eat 2 dishes. But still quite cheap. You need to buy coupon first before ordering food. It was very hard to get a table around lunch time for family and that was around 1pm. Dinner was easier, but food stalls might have very limited food and that was around 8pm.What amazed me was that people would put something of their's on the table to say it's taken and go off and order their food like a book, bag, ID tag etc, so when others were going to sit down, they realised table was already taken, they would just walk off. Back home no one would care and you'd probably find your belongings gone.

Great shopping-mall. At the moment this is my favorite shopping-mall in BKK.This mall is themed as an airport and the details are great.The people who work here have nice airport-themed clothes like stewardesses and there are other items that refer to airports.The shops are divers and everything is grouped together.My favorite foodcourt is situated at the topfloor.Good food for a good price and good quality.The toilets are awsome! They are all different and the service is great.

Great New Shoping Mall. Another Amazing shopping Mall in Bangkok....Each floor is a different City/country,different concept for a shopping centre,but its kool...the food court is good with lots of choice,but like most of the food courts seating can be a problem at peak times...Well worth a visit,it right at Asok Bts station,so no walking in the heat or rain....
Nice shopping mall. Easy to go there by BTS or MRT . Nice decoration with different style. can take a photo inside. Don't forget to use a toilet in this department store ...
Brilliant. Great shops, good food and cinema. One stop day out with the kids. Loved it!

Quality place & good cinema hall. Quality wears, various types of food joints and many cinema halls to watch latest movies. It is interesting place that each floor is named after popular cities such as Paris, London, San Francisco, etc. These floors exhibits the city they represent. Also, 1st floor has touch screen display where anyone can use to look what is available on floor.

Very Interesting!. It is just like the airport terminal,every floor presents a different country,even the toilet also has a different theme on each floor.The whole shopping mall is very very interesting,many people take pictures everywhere,even the toilet......(-_-!!!)On the 1st and 2nd top floor,there are many restaurants serving cuisines from different country.In basement,there is food court.Many choices for dinner!Don't miss it!

Good for clothes shopping. I get all my clothes from here and I think it is great. I especially like the funky tee-shirts in the London themed section. Only drawback is not much for the kids to do here.

Don't miss visiting this shopping centre!. This is a shopping centre like no other you've ever been in: every floor is themed to a country (New York, London, etc), and decorated accordingly - so (for example) the London floor has a big red bus on it, and the Tokyo floor has enormous Sumo wrestlers (statues) trying to push one of the supporting columns down - lots of interesting decor to the theme on every floor - I saw that even the doorman at one of the back doors on the London floor was dressed like a Beefeater! Also great restaurants and lots of variety in the types of shops. And absolutley do not miss visiting the Gourmet Food Market in the basement - I discovered Peanut Butter Chocolate Brownies there, to die for! Not a "flea market/same-same cheap tourist junk" stall in sight; albeit some side alleys (as it were) with good quality but inexpensive shops. Very interesting escalator at the front door, that takes you directly up 3 floors (and there are also the normal 1-floor-at-a-time escalators and lifts too). A strange thing we noticed in many shopping centres in Bangkok though, was that escalators are not installed so that you sort of turn from one to the next going up (or down) i.e. you always have to walk all the way round to the other side, to get the next one up/down - absolute hell on hurting tourist feet! :-) And do not forget to go to the toilets in Terminal 21 - really! Because the ground floor and front entrance is themed as if arriving at an airport (and then you "travel", by escalator etc to a foreign country on the various floors) .... and the toilet is themed too! No kidding - there is, as in an aeroplane, a sort of "control panel" next to the toilet seat (wash bum, dry bum, etc :-) ) - so cool! Terminal 21 is linked by a sky bridge to the MRT station, so incredibly easy to get to. In fact, we spent f-a-r too much time in Terminal 21; when we probably should have been exploring authentic Bangkok more .... but Terminal 21 is quite addictive!

Spectacular mall !. I've seen big mall before, but Terminal 21 is HUGE !Each level tells a story and a theme. We got lost when we went there, but happily lost because we got the chance to explore it more ..I loved the sections, the food court, the supermarket and the various items it contains. Also, I adored that soup corner in the hypermarket,, it was fantastic.Luckily, the mall was in the corner as we stayed in the Asok area.. Would like to go there every time I visit Bangkok.This should be one of the main venues to visit in Bangkok :D

Huge. This is a relatively new shopping complex with heaps of floors, it's so clean, neat & tidy inside. The bottom level - food court is cool, it's like a market inside a shop. The very top level has all the restaurants, sooo many to choose from, the second top level has an American theme and all the restaurants are from America. Each floor in the complex is named after a famous city eg. London, Rome, Paris etc and you literally find everything you'd get from over there ... here! The prices arent' as cheap as you'd think, you can probably get them for the same back home, we wanted sunnies and they were actually more expensive. But it's great to get out of the heat and into a really hip shopping complex.

Great Mall with a fantastic food court. The Terminal 21 Mall is beside the Asok BTS Skytrain station and is a unique mall in the sense that each floor is dedicated to a city complete with the sign posts and lamp posts and unique artefacts and carvings. The floors are named after the cities of Rome, London, Tokyo, Paris, and Sanfrancisco and even has a hanging Bridge on its top most floor. While shopping is expensive, there wasw good value at the Goumet market in the basement and at Watson and Boots stores, a few shops had sales but youd find them half the price outside the mall. What I liked was the food court with over 20 stall, all types of food, delicious and yet so cheap - starting from 15 Thb for drink to 25Thb for a main course ( nonveg), staying and the Kingston suites, we used to get dropped by the free took took and spent the 8 days that we were in bangkok having our lunch and dinner at the Food court..... great way to save money by not eating at your hotel or expensive restaurants.....
Ok. very ordinary. proberly better for the youger generation, alot of name brands so unless you have something you want to buy, you could give this a miss

Fun concept, well executed. Great little mall, with each floor being a different theme based on cities of the world....paris, rome, tokyo, london...And you can get some great bargains and some interesting designs. A lot of local thai designers and brands are available here

Something different. Due to time constraint, we had to chose from one of the numerous malls in Bangkok and zeroed in on Terminal21 based on recommendations from our BnB owner. It is located right next to Asok BTS station. The mall is based on the theme of an airport and all the floors are designed as per international cities like Tokyo, Carribean, San Fransciso, London etc. The ground floor has all the eating joints along with a super market. There are more resturants on the San Fransico Floor.The items on sale seemed expensive - such as the numerous dresses in Tokyo floor did not seem priced to the material/quality. Much of the brands were unknown and the prices were written by hand.Overall, it is a good place to spend some 3 hours or so - the themes are very well done and you would enjoy taking many photos.

Certainly one of favs now in Bangkok. T21 is certainly refreshing and love the concepts. Great local stores which the normal folks like me can afford with better quality stuff compared to MBK or Platinum. Location is great as it's connection to the Asok BTS.

Prepare for a long day in transit!. This airport style shopping mall has lots of wow factor!It is a bit of a maze with so much choice. True Bangkok style. But if you have time and a are a keen shopper there are great treasures to be found. My favorite was the women's "Tokyo" floor for awesome local designs and vintage finds.

Amazing toilets. Other than its themed floors and toilets i would say this is a very normal shopping mall. Good that the business owner decided to make it something different. they also have the coolest touch screen information board. Link to the BTS it's definitely a great location to come on a rainy day! i didn't try the cinemas here but was told it's the best so far

Interesting Shopping Centre. Quite an interesting variety of small shops / boutiques selling decent quality goods. Not to be confused with some of the tat that is sold at MBK.Each floor level has a theme. Eg London, Paris, etc so you'll see plenty of people with their cameras out.

Excellent shops. Lots of Thai designs, but a bit pricey, we bought a 1000 Baht pair of shoes and saw the same one at Chatuchak for 700 Baht !!! Oh well, that's part of shopping experience. Food pricey as well but good experience to do some malling.

Great Shopping & Food. Terminal 21 is amazing, It is very well designed and planned out with a cinema on the top floor. We had lunch in the massive food court then went and shared a sundae at Swensens - delicious!The shopping was great, similar prices to that in Australia. The strangest thing about this place is the toilets, they are themed depending on the floor you're on. On the London floor the toilets are a tube station complete with maps and bumpy tiles. The toilets themselves are the heated bidet style you find in Japan - a first for me, very interesting experience!!!!

Well designed interesting mall. The mall is relatively new and has interesting design based on an airport type theme with different floors representing different destinations. The Japan floor is very interesting. There are all sorts of miniature replicas of landmark things from different countries, I.e. golden gate bridge in San Francisco, double decker bus in London, etc. Interesting store selections. Everything looks new clean and nice still. A couple different food halls with some good options. Did see a roach on the counter of one of the frozen treat stands/stalls in the pastry dessert type section of one of the floors. But the food courts overall looked cleaner and nicer than the one we visited at MBK per lonely planet guide book recommendation. The thai food court offered cheap tasty options at several different stalls - a plate on average wad ~35 baht! So cheap! And everything we tried was delicious.

Great to hangout and pick up some unusual gifts. Lots of nice restaurants to chose from. And some great shopping. If your looking to buy something unusual, this is the place to go. It has lots of little boutiques with jewelery and other interesting items. A refeshing change from the rest of bangkok. There is also the occasional clothing sale. Great atmosphere.

Different and worth the visit!. As one of the newer malls in Bangkok I like how they have designed this. Each level is a "destination" with plenty of shops on each level. food courts are at the top levels. May not have designer boutiques like Siam malls but still worth a visit. Can get free wifi for a year when you register. Linked to the skytrain too which is a bonus.

Unique in its orientation. Terminal 21 is the newest addition to the malls on the Sukhumvit road and as the name suggests, it is built on the theme of an airport terminal. The best feature of this mall is that each floor takes the flavor of a different city from around the world and I liked the London floor best. You will find the usual shops here which you will encounter at other places too but the themes of different floors make this mall unique. They also have some fine restaurants on the top floor which you can try.

21st Century Shopping. This beautiful shopping centre which has direct link to sky train is set on about 6 floors, with each floor representing different cultures and cities. London, Paris, San Francisco with clothing, shoes and accessories to suit every need. The 2 floors of suburb food markets which also cater to every taste, and then the movie houses with the most affordable movies, this is a fantastic place to shop

Very good food hall. Very good food hall on the 6th floor. Good selection of shops and cinema with 3D facilities. To access wifi you need to register at main counter with ID, then available everywhere for free.
A classy fun new Mall. Great small shops, nice layout, great overviews and a excellent food stall... Worth a visit if you want to shop in Bangkok

Something a little different from the others. Terminal 21 is a bit of fresh air when it comes to shopping in Bangkok. Apart from MBK, most shopping malls are very much the same with the same brands and outlets.Terminal 21 is not totally void of brand names but it is primarily home to small, privately owned stalls selling fashion items and memorabilia. And it's not all junk like you find in places like Platinum Fashion Mall or Bobae market.A lot of the shops sell decent quality goods and the clothing is of an above average quality and style but this is reflected in the prices being charged. A small toddler t-shirt was 280 baht !!, something that would have cost 50 Baht a few years ago and could probably be bought for 100 baht in the Patpong or Sukhumvit road markets.However, you can't find these type of t-shirts in those places and so you either cough up or move along.The suggestion that this resembles an airport terminal is pretty thin although a "departures" board and some signs to "Gates 1- 10" etc try to bring that theme home.The food sections occupy 2 whole floors. One floor for the food hall where you order your dish at a small booth and then take your food to a communal seating area and another food area where you can choose from a selection of restaurants.We were lucky enough to go during working hours and so it was quiet with kids at school and everyone else working. However, when lunchtime came around, the escalators were packed with people heading to the food floors and any hope of getting something to eat was dashed for a couple of hours.Terminal 21 makes for a great alternative to Siam Paragon, Central World and The Emporium but it's aimed more towards teenagers and young adults.We might go again next time we are in town but MBK is still our favourite.You can read more about Terminal 21 at http://thebangkokshoppingguide.com/terminal-21

NEVER Go to NOBITA Japanese BBQ @ B1. There was a piece of pubic hair in the complimentary fermented vegetables (Kimchi). But the staff seemed okay with it. They even laughed when they saw it, and just changed another plate for it. Just imagine the pubic hair got fermented together with all vegetables...What's the point to change another plate of kimchi? It was so gross that I threw up all the meal. NOBITA BBQ totally ruined my good mood and memories in Bangkok.

Trendy and quality stuff... If you want to find some good quality stuff but yet not very expensive, go to terminal 21. There are small shops with a wide range of trendy clothing and accessories for women and every shop was offering discounts on a selected range of items which were good to select from. They also have small trial enclosures which are necessary (unlike platinum mall and mbk mall where there is no trial option)
Good shops and great food. Great choice of restaurants and very cheap food (but tasty) Thai food in the food hall. Good shopping but not as good choice as the Paragon or Central World mega malls...

Fabulous Place is this. This is a new unit and only opened a little over a year ago, it was a big hit from the day it first opened. I don't know who the architect is but he did a great job. It's themed throughout the world and has lots of little boutique shops and above all some great food outlets. I stay close by and always make a beeline for Terminal 21

LOVE The Concept & The Restaurants. This Mall was the first one I have ever been when I arrived to Bangkok; it is located right next to the MTR & BTS Asok.It offers a wide range of small & larger boutiques as well as delightful restaurants on different themes:LG – CaribbeanG – RomeM – Paris1 – Tokyo2 – London3 – Istanbul4 & 5 – San Francisco 6 – HollywoodA must see!

Excellent totally new experience in Bangkok !!. The Idea is to think you're at an airport and travelling through out the world, and they really did a a great job to make you feel that, starting from the information staff dressed as flight stewardess, to the cities schemes for each floor, its totally amazing, specially San Francisco restaurants totally awesome. I totally recommend to visit this mall during your stay in Bangkok

I LOVE T21. I LOVE TERMINAL 21!This shopping centre has the coolest theme I've ever seen a shopping centre have. Each floor is inspired by another country. The top level is cinemas and food court (which is large, diverse and all fresh/clean). You can then be teleported to another country via the escalators because each level of the shopping centre has its own theme.The shop products all vary from level to level and all presented boutique style. Store owners are all very friendly and definitely a shopping experience to add to the list of 'to dos" in Bangkok.
Excellent. Excellent theme shopping mall. I like the different floor decorate with different country style and food court.

Unless you like trendy youth fashion and franchise food forget it!. A shopping mall with great location connected to both Asoke BTS and MRT. Unless you like youth oriented trendy fashion and same same food franchises there is really nothing of interest in this mall. The airport and city theme floor novelty again appeal to a demographic that loves taking photos of themselves in front of fake cultural recreations. The one positive is that they provide a nice showcase for independent Thai fashion designers.

Different shopping with nice food.. Nice change for a mall to be intersting ! Themed levels,the doormen dressed like pilots salute as you walk through the metal detector. Concierge girls are dressed like old days flight attendants.Best part was the food area on the top level called Pier 21.They have a great selection of food,and you buy a 'coupon' , like a debit card and put the amount you want to spend on food on it, we put 120 baht on it,had lunch and drinks with money left. You can then redeem the card for any money left on it.Even have tables with a view!Easy to spend a couple of hours here in nice air con.

Terminal 21, the latest shopping mall in Bangkok. Terminal 21 mall is the latest shopping center in Bangkok boasting of 9 stories of shopping heaven.What’s so special about this mall, is how each storey is named after a different city and promises a unique shopping experience for all who check in. Once inside the mall, you’ll feel like you’ve stepped into the airport departure hall where each escalator leads you to a different destination at the next level’s arrival gate. These are the themes on each level.Lower ground: Caribbean (Supermarket, convenient stores, services and restaurants)Ground: Rome (International brands)M Floor: Paris (International and Thai Designers)1 Floor: Tokyo (Ladies wear)2 Floor: London (Men's wear)3 Floor: Istanbul (Shoes, bags ad accessories)4, 5 Floor: San Francisco ( Dining)6 Floor: Hollywood (Cinema and IT products)Each level is dressed to it's theme and makes for nice photograph opportunity. Bargaining is acceptable at the mall, but prices here are more expensive than places like Platinum Mall. There are plenty of dining options from restaurants to cafes and even a food court for more affordable options. Don't miss the toilets as there are also different themes on each level. Overall, the mall offers an interesting concept and it’s worthwhile for a visit. To get there, you can take the BTS to Asoke or the MRT to Sukhumvit station.For more photos, you can read the review of the mall on my blog: http://ajugglingmom.com/2012/05/terminal-21-the-latest-shopping-mall-in-bangkok/

Eye catching and expensive. Has city themed floors (San Francisco, Paris, etc) and each floor is designed/decorated accordingly. Shops on these floors are themed as well. Most are up scale. Fun to browse the floors.

Makes you travel while you travel, but don't plan to do cheap shopping. I loved it. It was really nice to walk there. It's build like an airport. Every floor has its destination (Paris, London, Istanbul..) , its decoration is inspired by the destination. Really nice to look at. Even the toilets deserve a look! I loved the toilets from Paris.Stores are big universal brands, but there is several original stores. Fashion there is awesome. Prices are high for Bangkok, but still cheaper than in Montreal. Don't forget to keep your receipt for VAT refund if you are a tourist. There is A LOT of food places so you'll be in heaven if you're hungry!We really enjoyed walking around, there's plenty of things to look at, specially the decoration. We took around 200 pictures there!
A shopping centre with great theme. Things can be more expensive compare to other places, but it is near to Health Land Spa Asoke.

It is huge and great themes. We went to Terminal 21 from Asoke sky train station, walkways connect them. First we thought that it was up market shopping, I.e. brand names and high costs, but we're pleasantly surprised that it was a midway mall, not as cheap as Chinatown or MBK, but a variety in a good environment. Recommend to drop in if near by.

Well-themed shopping centre at Sukhumvit Soi 21. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall. Now normally, I wouldn't bother reviewing a shopping mall, but to be fair, it's the best-decorated one I've seen for a while. Each floor is decorated to look like a major world city. The "London" floor has ... men's bathrooms that look like a London tube station, amongst many other things. The "Tokyo" floor actually has Japanese design features that are reasonably authentic, and they even wrote the Japanese place names on the posters above the shops correctly.Personally, there wasn't much for me actual shopping-wise, I think it's geared to a younger demographic, but it's worth a look if you're nearby just to see how a nicely-designed shopping mall could be done. Plus the bathrooms are clean and (dare I say it?) fun if you want a place to stop off briefly.
Huge mall. Lots of shopping and restaurants, very clean restrooms! Prices were high. Watched a live concert by the U.S. Navy Band there.

Fun shopping experience. I like this place more for the food and the experience than the shops. Each floor is a different destination. Gourmet food hall on the ground floor but lots of other good restaurants too

You must visit this shopping centre. Not all shopping centres are created equally and this will impress the biggest skeptics. The floors are themed and have some fantastic boutiques which are really reasonable. There are also some great restaurants and eateries.

A Mall which takes you places..... Recently i hadd been to Terminal 21 in Asoke BTS station in bangkok for dinner with a close friend. Had heard of this mall & its unique theme where in each floor has representing various cities like London, istanbul. I was impressed by such a novel concept. The replica of London was aswesomeThe food is decently priced with adequate quantity; unlike the hotels in most malls.I would definitely make this mall a must visit

Great Mall With A Theme. This is a mall with a theme...travel. You know your in for something different when you are greeted by the doorman in a pilots uniform and the customer service ladies are in flight attendants uniforms. Each level has its own worldly location theme. Enjoy.
Huge Shopping Mall. A must visit Mall, lots of varieties for fashion. Eat at the food court very good food n cheap too

Place tohave lunch/dinner in Bangkok. Terminal 21 in Asoke BTS station in bangkok is a good place where you can have lunch/dinner. Evry floor has its theme and many returants available in each floor. The food court in the 5th floor has a lot of Thai food. The price of food also very reasonable and it is a good place to have lunch/dinner while you shopping in Bangkok

another great mall. its mostly for thais but the little fashon shops are just fab shame they didnt do western mens sizes for the shirts to and the dim sum reastraunt was brilliant at rear of the food court

The best mall in Thailand. Terminal 21 has the standard brands and many stores that sell products that you wont find anywhere else. It has a nice option of restaurants and snackbars. Every floor has a theme.Here are some videos of how it really looks:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tzJbdQxbWAMhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pS-mKQhvJhwhttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EOHINI6ovkghttp://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nnVpoOrNeP4

New Concept Shopping Mall Fun. Terminal 21 is a shopping mall that just opened in 2011. It is designed to be a pretend airport terminal and each floor represents a famous city around the world: Rome, Tokyo, Paris, Istanbul, London, San Franciso. Each fun floor continues it's theme into the state of the art washrooms even. The Rome level reminds me of Caesar's Palace in Vegas, with white statutes, ceiling frescoes, Paris is so very Parisienne, Tokyo is pretty in pink in spring, London is very masculine with guy stores, and British symbols like street cars, San Francisco has an iconic Golden Gate Bridge that spans across the top of the building and has little cars on it even, Istanbul has colourful lights hanging from the ceilings and you feel as if you are in a middle eastern shopping bazaare. The top two levels have food courts and wonderful array of restaurants to choose from that are inexpensive. The mall is beautifully designed, spacious, fun to visit. Terminal 21 is easy to get to as the Asok Skytrain station feeds right into the mall.

Fun new mall. interesting concept, with each floor decorated as a different city. Easy access with the BTS. Good if you are looking for local thai brands and not the big international brands.There is an awesome thai spa called Urban Retreat just across the BTS station. Great escape after a whole day of shopping!

Shop, Eat, Enjoy. Terminal21 is certainly a "must do" in Bangkok. The shopping is so easy as each floor is designated to whatever you are looking to buy. The country themed toilets on each level are so interesting and just wish I'd taken more photos. It's not a massive complex, but the shops are small so there is a multitude of them. The food hall is amazing and because each floor is themed and access is so easy (covered entry from Asok sky train station) I would recommend it for anyone with children as there is something to keep them interested everywhere.* easy access from Skytrain* great for families* excellent food

Very new mall near everything. We were able to walk to this mall which is also easily accessible by SkyTrain. Every shop you could want and you can still batgain for all sorts of goods. Wide variety of good restaurants with varying prices as well.
