Shopping experience. Terminal 21 has a theme on each floor (Eg, Istanbul, London, Rome...etc) and the toilets on each floor are styled according to the theme. It was really interesting to go to each floor to visit the toilet. A lot people were taking photos of the toilets as well. My favourite was Rome's. Shopping wise, a lot of little shops selling interesting fashion and accessories, furniture and some big brand names as well. Enjoyed just walking around the place. Got to try the Macha green tea from Kamu (small kisok), the best i ever had, only 45baht (without pearls). I would love to go back to walk around again and spend one whole day there...

Terminal 21, Asoke. More fun than Siam Paragon. Airport theme. Some good restaurants, particularly 'Zeed' on the 4th floor. Ate there about 11 times. 'Zeed' hard to read on the front. At the top of the escalator on the 4th floor look left for a place advertising 'Steak Lao'.

Nice concept shopping centre but still not as good as Paragon or MBK. I read a bit about Terminal 21 before my recent trip to Bangkok and thought I needed to visit it to see what the fuss was all about. The world cities theme certainly makes this place stands out from your typical shopping centre in Bangkok. I loved the scaled model of the Golden Gate Bridge on Level 5 where the foodcourt and restaurants were. This floor was admittedly the most popular and crowded level on the day I visited. The other floors, while filled with iconic signage (ie. Parisian street lights) and 3D sculptures (ie. Double-decker London bus and Japanese sumo wrestlers) worthy of happy snaps, the shops didn't have the same appeal as those found in MBK. It's a mix of pricey foreign brands shops and local designers stalls. The location is definitely very handy as it's connected to one of the BTS (Skytrain) stations in a popular tourist area.Is it a must-see place? Yes.Would I return next time? Probably not. I still prefer my usual spots of MBK, Siam Square and Paragon. I did find Seacon Square to be pretty good, especially if you have young kids. The only problem with SS is it's nowhere near public transport so you have to cab it.

Unique shopping experience. Loved our day at terminal 21. Unique concept for a shopping mall that is well executed. Good food options and lots of different shops to look through. Had a very reasonably priced hair cut compared to Australia or UK. The bathrooms on each floor are a must just to see the different country inspired designs.

Food court on level 5 - great food at cheap prices!. You must try the mango sticky rice and beef noodles - out of this world! The former costs only USD1 and the latter only USD1.50. I could even get a (fresh) berry smoothie for USD1. Lots of choices at reasonable prices.
nothing much. Same pricey stuff. nothing stands out. Shops are from the higher end of the goods and if you like high class shopping, this is the place for you.

Are you in an Airport?. The experience is well worth it. Welcoming you at the doorstep was a metal detector beeper.Worth the visit as each floor design is different and especially the washrooms...Lots of shopping for all whims and fancies. If you fancy Thai food, top floor has the local Thai food and its sweet delicacies. Mouth watering & yummy...
Fun shopping mall. This mall makes shopping fun! Definitely worth a visit and the food court is very good - one of the few food courts I've found in Bangkok that serve Khao Soy.

Lots to see and do. Great shopping centre with all sorts of things to purchase not just clothes. Interesting way its been set up so each floor a diifferent theme eg Paris, Rome, Japan etc So comfortable to shop or browse, there are cinemas and heaps of restaurants too. You can find all sorts of cuisine here. Air conditioned, lots of places to sit and rest, free entertainment on central stage. Plenty of clean toilets too. Free wifi available, just get a username and password from the information desk on level M.

Worth the visit to escape the Bangkok heat. High end shopping malls are not my idea of shopping in Bangkok, give me M B K and Jatujak weekend market anytime but it air conditioned and just what you need to escape the Bangkok heat.The food court on the lower ground is certainly worth a visit selling cupcakes to Korean chicken!!
Very cool. Very cool mall in Bangkok. There are all kind of stores. A lot of good food. The way the mall is made it is really cool

Internationally-themed Mall, the coolest!. Have you ever seen the Golden Gate bridge... inside a mall? A shopping mall in Bangkok which has its levels/floors to have designs of famous cities such as Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco and Hollywood. You have to bring you camera and start to take pictures of almost every corner of the mall as its amazing! Best of all, a world class public toilet.A must to visit here in BKK.

A new era in shopping. Terminal 21 brings the dream of traveling the world to downtown Bangkok, with its cutting-edge concept that places several world-famous cities under one roof. You will find yourself wandering around a maze of shops in Tokyo, strolling down London’s Carnaby Street, bagging a bargain in an Istanbul zouk, or shopping for something to fill your growling stomach at the Fisherman’s Wharf in San Francisco. The food court on the top floor is so well laid out and offers everything for the hungry shopper, I had a meal of rice shredded salad and a mountain of succulent port for less than the price of a pint of lager in the U/K.The whole experience was mind blowing and the cleanliness and service was beyond comprehension, it took shopping to an entirely new level. Would I go back, certainly. Would I reccomend the experience, yes yes yes.......
nice place for coffee...... not too packed at this moment and lovely place to hve coffee or just walk ard in the mall......
Good shopping. Called here for a break from the heat and sat in Hagan Daas having an ice cream people watching. Good facilities and great shops

Best mall in Bangkok. This is a great mall, just seeing all the mock up trains/bridges/buses was fun but there are also some really good shops and food. Eating at Pier 21 was an experience too. Lots of fun costume jewelry at Tom, Dick and Harrys.Best was the public toilets!!! They are Toshiba with heated seats, wash and dry cycle!!! Got to do it! Never seen these in a public facility before for free. Just amazing!

Who doesn't love terminal 21!!!. Terminal 21 is one if not the best malls we have ever been to.Its fantastic! For window shopping :) yes you might not get the best price and local designers which is nice for a change, but its worth coming simply to look around! Nothing like Siam Paragon which simply is another same same mall... Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco and Hollywood all in 1 mall with unique design on each floor.. Crowds come here simply to spend the day take plenty of photos.. There must be a choice of over 50 restaurants and cafes spread over 3 floors to eat in.. And the bathrooms are simply incredible with high tech lavatories! All staff wear country relevant uniforms and theres nothing like this anywhere else in Bangkok.. Must see!If you bring your passport you will get a free wifi code to use anywhere in the mall..

Retail Therapy Central. New multi storey shopping mall. Each level is themed to a different international city. Pier 21 top floor for a fantastic food complex. Cheap eats with quality. Buy a food card which is swiped as you select your meal from the various outlets, or eat in one of the many select eateries. Shop till you drop. Catch the BTS to Asok and enter the complex from the upper level platform. Great place.

Yes another Bangkok shopping mall but with a difference!. Bangkok is the best city i know to shop in worldwide!So does it need another shopping mall!?...in this case yes!!it has the usual western brand shops so thats just fine...but what it also has are floors of independent Thai outlets. Some really great small shops. stunning jewellery, clothes, whatever designed by the owners or certainly sourced from a much more "local" point.it has some great eateries as well...yes its a shopping mall but the quality is very very good!Women's treatments abound...pedicure, manicure hair or make-up...its all taken care of.Another plus is its right outside of the Asoke BTS and MRT stations so access is sooooo easy.Give it a try, you will not be disappointed!

Local designers in an upscale setting. If you like shopping for items by local designers, but don't fancy haggling and don't fancy shopping in hot crowded street markets like Siam Square and Chatuchak, Terminal 21 is the place for you. It provides a very pleasant shopping environment in airconditioned comfort, with clean bathrooms and many restaurants to choose from. That said, you will probably not get the cheapest prices here. Even the supermarket is more highend and you can get a better deal at Tops Supermarket at Robinson shopping centre just across the street. The location next to Asoke BTS/Sukhumvit underground makes this a very convenient spot.

Fun TRAVEL-themed mall - with NO VAT refund facility.. Fun, groovy shopping mall. Each floor features a famous city including London, Rome and Paris. Do NOT expect high-end designer stuff here - it's the myriad smaller designers that make this mall interesting. What I like is that there was some shops that sold stuff that's not *THAT* cheap it falls apart after one washing (cheap does not = good)Even my husband, who steps into a mall on average once a year (and only when I threaten to leave him) enjoyed himself. He even bought, gasp, a pair of casual loafers. One huge irony: For a TRAVEL-themed mall, Terminal 21 does NOT provide VAT refund. The information counter confirmed this when we did a big shop there. So, in case if it's something you can find elsewhere that might get you some of your travel money back (major department stores usually do), buy it elsewhere. Otherwise, it's a interesting shopping stop in Bangkok.
Great themed mall. Terminal 21 provides an interesting respite from the heat. Great food choices and movie theater. Best bathrooms in Thailand!

A bit pretentious. The newest shopping mall situated in the key Asoke intersection, one of the busiest part of the city, is the latest attraction in town. You may think, does Bangkok really need another mall to clog up the traffic, but no, there are more coming up in the same street soon. The mall is more of a theme park with many ‘photo spots’ all over the building: the Oscar, a Sumo Wrestler, the Golden Gate Bridge, to name a few. Each floor has a famous city it represent: Tokyo, Rome, London, San Francisco, etc. And since it is located at the exchange of the subway and the BTS, it can be overcrowded round the clock. Mostly, it is a destination of meeting spot, a meal and a photo op. Shopping is more or less patterned to the highly successful Platinum Mall, in terms of the small hip and chic shops of shoes, clothes and accessories. The prices of merchandise are quite high and seemingly picked out and selected, very up to date. There are still the regular store chain at the ground floor, to attract the brand conscious buyers. At the top floors are restaurants and cafes and a cinema. The rest rooms are great, each designed with a theme, visitors are even taking pictures inside but I won’t go to a mall because of it. Parking is difficult and traffic around the area is atrocious, so consider taking the train. It’s worth a look-see but I guess after the novelty wears down, shoppers will be back to the old dependable places.

Cool mall with nice views on top floor. It's a cool concept styled after airports and you can "travel" to a different country on each floor. Not so sure about the quality of the shops but the few I went into seemed liked western imitations and weren't particularly striking to me. I understand now why there are so many malls in Bangkok--because it's so hot all the time!Pros: Directly connected to Asok Skytrain stop so it's very easy to get to. Free wifi connection once you register at the ground floor information booth. Not all malls have this!Top floor restaurants have nice views although they are much pricier than the standard mall food court. But why not do it once for the ambiance?

Great shopping in local shops (no international chains). I think this is one of my favorite Bangkok shopping malls: there are hardly any international chain shops, mostly just local boutiques and small shops. The quality of most good here is pretty good as well.Oh, make sure you use their restrooms - great Japanese style toilets ;-)

Shopping Mall amongst the many in Bangkok. As malls go this one may be a bit more high tech with the usual designer merchandise,but the food hall is incredible.The variety,freshness and good value of the food available,makes it very popular with locals.There is so much to choose from including vegetarian and halal .We ate hearty,delicious meals for less than 100Baht each.I recommend the fresh mango and sticky rice dessert.....10 out of 10.

Amazed at the size of this shopping center!. I visited here for the first time at the end of January and just the other day, both times with a friend. I was very amazed at the sheer "width" of the interior of this center. It doesn't really look all that big from the outside, but once you go in, it's got escalators up the ying yang! They just keep going up and up and up! The center really does have a very large range of outlets inside from clothing stores like Quicksilver, to a bakery (my favorite and of which was originally only found in Singapore but am very excited that they have one now in Thailand), named Breadtalk. Then, there are a huge range of eateries on two of the upper floors to choose from. All in all, it really is a nice place to visit and is actually convenient for me to stop by since it's right at a junction to which I have to pass by each day for work anyways.

Another new amazing mall in town. This is one of Bangkok latest shopping mall. It is located at Asoke / Sukhumvit at the interchange between MRT (underground line) and BTS (Skytrain). The concept is new. It works as an airport terminal - hence its name. There are departure and arrival escalators to its featured destinations: the Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Istanbul, Beijing,London, Tokyo and San Francisco. An original concept with landmarks such as the Golden Gate Bridge, Frisco cable car, a British double decker or a London tube car. There is a huge food court at San Francisco Pier, as well a vast array of restaurants, cafés or ice-cream parlors. All the famous brand names will of course please serious shoppers. Another great place to be in town!

Brilliant. IntroductionThis is a brand new mall in Bangkok. It's much more happening than Siam Discovery, Center and Paragon and also Central World. Recent travel magazines have been covering Terminal 21 a lot, and it did not disappoint me at all. LocationIt's literally next to BTS Asok station. You should set aside 4-5 hours if you want to cover all floors plus eat lunch/dinner there. Bring a camera and spare battery!Selling pointEach floor has a theme based on a popular tourist destination - London, Japan, Italy, etc. Then there is the overall airport theme which ties it all together - e.g. now departing London going to Japan. The mall map is a booklet designed to look like a passport - but its been so popular that it's out of stock! I can't imagine how much money went into renovating this mall - all the decor and renovations are quite good quality and not tacky - refer to photos I've attached. I know it sounds silly but don't forget to visit the toilets on each floor - each toilet is renovated differently according to the theme country (actually even toilet 1 and toilet 2 on any given floor would be slightly different).There are lots of great photo spots scattered throughout the mall including:London - double decker bus, telephone booth, postboxJapan - Sumo wrestlers, lucky catItaly - Mouth of truth, roman pillarsSan Franciso - Golden Gate bridgeDepending on your luck there may be a small 'queue' at each photo spot but it's bearable. everyone is being silly and having fun striking poses.ShopsIn terms of shops there are both the chain retail stores and also small stores selling local brands - according to my travel book, some of the stores are from chatuchak and Suan Lum Night Bazaar. The top 2 floors are mainly restaurants - you will find a good selection there. In the basement there is fastfood, Watsons, supermarket.Overall Definitely visit this mall especially if you like taking photos. Then on another day visit Siam for the aquarium and Madam Tussauds. P.S. When you're all done, Urban Retreat spa directly opposite the street is excellent and reasonably priced.

Immense. Huge and good access from skytrain. Take a couple of hours to walk around. Could do with some electrical stores selling computers. Some great food outlets and the express lifts are a good idea. The restrooms are modern and clean.
Thematic Shopping mall. This is a very interesting mall.Worth to see, great local designers and awesome food.Every floor has a theme (a famous city) so the decoration is pretty cool.

Great place. It's one of the best shopping malls I've ever seen. It's designed as the terminal of an airport and each floor is a different location: London, Rome, Istanbul etc Excellent design and great attention to details - there are also small cars on the San Francisco's bridge suspended at the 5th floor! Even the restrooms are modern and high tech!The restaurants are really good and cheap. The internet is free but you must register at the information desk in order to get the connection details.

An excellent shopping centre. A beautifully laid out shopping centre with direct access to the BTS & MRT systems. This is one of the better shopping centres around with no cheap knock off's available. It has an airport theme with each level themed on a different city. We were there every day at some point as we stayed accross the road at the beautiful Grand Millennium Hotel. One of the many jewels in Bangkok's crown.

Must go when you are in Bangkok. Terminal 21 has numerous good restaurants and shops, kinda a 1-stop-shop that you can spend a whole day at and this travel theme related shopping mall really put in great efforts to play up the projected image; the departure/arrival announcement board & gate, each floor is decorated after a country eg, San Francisco, Paris, London, Tokyo, Istanbul etc. Even the toilets (2 on each floor) are inline with the same concept! We had a great time just visiting each toilet to look at the design. Things sold may not be as cheap as platinum fashion mall but shopping at Terminal 21 is extremely enjoyable.
The best Shopping Center I have been to!. Great shopping, specially the small local designer shops located on the 2nd floor.Check "Tiger Seven + Mini Mani" - great shop!!

Thai designer brands!. After scouring the fantastic malls of Bangkok you begin to think why mall after mall carries the same international brands you can get at home. I was so happy when I came across Terminal 21, which is connected to the Skywalk off BTS Asoke. Corny in some ways with the themed floors, the building itself is well designed and feels really new and fresh. The real highlight though is the Thai designer floor where you can find unique clothing and some handicraft.Highly recommended!

Great good court. Well worthwhile visiting as this mall is unique in its airport style concept. Decor and design is fantastic. Amazing food choices and an excellent food court where you can get really good cheap food. You buy a card from the cashier and use this to make your purchases at each food stall. Card is valid for 30 days and extra amounts can be downloaded.MBK probably has better prices but this mall is worth seeing.Andrew

New shopping Mall in Bangkok - Just what is needed. Newly opened and as other travellers mentioned each floor has themes - London, San Francisco. Very well done. You can access it through BTS Asoke. Shops are mainly for young 30 year olds. Food is reasonable but mainly restaurants. Also cinemas but I think the movies are in Thai. There is also a food court but did not eat in the food court. We ate in one of the restaurants and the food was reasonable. Very new, clean and glittzy. A must see whilst in Bangkok. It is worth it just for the air conditioning. The toilets are free as most other shopping malls charge 2 baht (which is nothing). It is just a pain to have small change on you when we come from a country where you do not pay to go to the toilet.

Great restaurant. Quite a new building, just opened last November. Just off Asoke station you can go right in. There is an each floor symbolizes like London, Tokyo, San Francisco and Hollywood. I don' think the shops come from that country, they just name the stories. I never see in Bangkok so many choices of Japanese food in one place. There is Fuji (Japanese), Sukiyaki, Japanese curry, Ramen(noodles), Beef bowl and so on. If you love Japanese food this is the place to go. However, most shops are aimed for women, teenager thru 30's. So a quite boring for guys.
Off the hook.. This place is amazing. So many stores. So mUch variety with food. Best place to get out of the heat in Bangkok.

THIS IS AN AWSOME EXPERIENCE. Yes this is certainly an awsome shopping experience. I would go as far as to say, its the best shoping mall in Bangkok.It has variety and there is something for everyone. The whole terminal is around the theme of airports from all parts of the world. As I'm a Brit, I thought the theme on London was fantastic. You could have imagined your self right in the heart of London. The same goes for the other countries represented here. Easy to reach by Skytrain getting off at Asok. A refreshing sight is plenty of toilet facilities and unlike many others, its free.We spent an enjoyable time there and hopefully, we shall go again when we return in mid February 2012. Dr. Ronald Elliott
Interesting concept (theme shopping mall) but costly. Clothes are Costly, though the interior of the shopping mall is cool

Spectacular shopping. T21 is definitely a must-see for visitors to Bangkok. Adjacent to the BTS Asok, it's airport theme is one-of-a-kind. Each floor carries a particular theme of a destination, so there's Paris, Istanbul, San Francisco etc. There's a wide variety of stores, from established high fashion boutiques to ones selling knick-knacks. There's also a splendid cinema, and a gourmet grocery store. And not forgetting a huge food court with very cheap F&B prices.

Splendid shopping experience. Other than going for mbk or platinum fashion mall, terminal 21 is a must visit simply for the decor, the abundant space and most of all, a great shopping experience. Things may not be as lowly priced as mbk and platinum but hey, it's the whole shopping experience and not just the low prices right?
Excellent mall in Bangkok. My wife and I enjoyed terminal 21. Very clean and good outlets. Liked the gourmet market and the restaurant outlets as well. The cinemas were awesome and very clean.

Wow - what an amazing shopping centre!. My last day in Bangkok & needed/wanted to do some last minute shopping.The conceirge @ my hotel advised Siam & since I was staying in Sukhumvit I said I wanted somewhere closeby. The conceirge pointed at a building & said Terminal 21. I was off expecting a standard Westfield arrangement. Upon entering I soon realised I was somewhere special. A unique airport themed, gleaming shopping extravanganza. Toilets are electronic & heated & shower your behind in various ways. Very memorable & beats the usual toilet standards by a million miles.Each floor is a different country city theme. London had a huge double decker bus with shops inside.Istanbul had huge lanterns hanging from the ceiling.The clothes & goods for sale were competitive in price & very funky, trendy etc. Sizes were probably a little tight for my six foot tall 85kg frame which is by no means huge but a little bigger than your average asian man.An essential Bangkok shopping stop off has been added.In summary, an awesome place to check out if only for the toilets!

Interesting new shopping edition worth a look around. You can take a "trip" to the different themed countries and is nice and cool out of the Bangkok heat. Not a great shopper myself but themed floors including London does add some interest. Near Asoke Skytrain/ Sukhumvit MRT and this whole area is a "happening" place for eating, small street stalls and evening nightlife. As an option fro a trip alonside other shopping areas such as central/siam.

Unique!. Previous reviewers have described the set-up and decor of this shopping centre so I will only add that visiting this place is a must while in Bangkok. As regular visitors to this fabulous city, we thought we had seen it all when it came to shopping centers. The designers of Terminal 21 have worked hard to create something different and it really works. The designer stores are great, prices are reasonable and there are plenty of choices when it is time to eat. The food court upstairs provides great food and you can eat for just a couple of dollars each in a pleasant atmosphere. What more could you want? Do visit Terminal 21 when you are next in Bangkok. I am confident you won't be disappointed.

great Mall with different country theme. The mall have different country theme for different flood and every floor toilet is also specially design according to the country them. The food court Pier 21 at 5th flood serve a big variety of local food and very food price. there are many small little shop selling unique and speciality item instead of usual big chain store . I skip going to MBK and siam square since I can get almost everything here and the mall is well connected by MRT and BTS station

Worth A Visit. This is a great place to find some more "upscale" goods with reasonable prices. Each floor is organized according to supposed country-specific goods. But for men, I strongly suggest you head on to the British floor for some decent goods. For women, the Moroccan/Middle-Eastern floor is pretty cool. Upstairs, you can find some good food to sustain you during your day of shopping.

Arriving at Terminal 21. I have seen the future and it departs from Terminal 21.This is the latest of big shopping centres opened in Bangkok and it is themed on airports and cities. The spacious concourse can be accessed at Asoke (even side number on Sukhumvit) and if you have reached Asoke by the BTS skytrain, there is access provided on the mezzanine. Follow exit 4 and bear left to see the signage leading to the entrance at this level. There are nine floors inside and the crescent shaped reception counter is attended by staff wearing hostess uniforms inclusive of hats. A display above the counter provides basic information as to which floor corresponds to which city.As you step on the first escalator a sign above your head will read “Departure for level 1” and just before you arrive another sign above your head will read “Arriving at level 1”I am not sufficiently knowledgeable to say how long a themed centre like Terminal 21 will last but what I can share with you is that there are enough brand name shops and little boutiques to engage your interest for a few hours of your day here. In case you cannot wait, I will tell you that currently the following locations are featured; Caribbean, Rome, Paris, Tokyo, London, Istanbul, San Francisco and Hollywood.What made the owners and designers chose these cities over others remains a mystery, which perhaps another poster may clarify.On the fifth floor, you will find Pier 21, an excellent food court, where the food is freshly prepared and attractively presented and where the price policy is in competition with the street vendors so much so that sticky rice and mango is sold for 60 baht in nearby soi 11 but will sell at only 35 baht here. Bottled water is 10 baht and a coke and ice even cheaper at 7 baht. The top floor is overlooked by a giant reproduction of the Oscar statuette and aptly names Hollywood. I will be on a mission to check out their cinema theatre on my next visit. I visited last December on day two of my sojourn in Thailand and then again on my penultimate day and I already noticed that there were many additions in less than three weeks. Ah, and the toilet on each floor also follow the city themes with the cubicles inclusive of a “surprise”!!I intend to revisit it again when I go back in February to find out what else is new. Siam Paragon remains my favourite shopping place closely followed by Central World but it seems that Terminal 21 is a new entry at number three. If you have been, please feel free to comment.Giorgio Federico

Great Ambience and Food Court!. 3 good reasons why it's worth coming here: (1) the great ambience - each floor is decorated with a theme (e.g. London, Tokyo, Paris, Istanbul, San Francisco etc). The shops are nothing much, similar to any other shopping mall(2) the Food Court - food here is unbelievably cheap! A plate of fried rice is Baht 40, chicken rice is Baht 35 (but portions are small - buy 2 portions), mango sticky rice is Baht 35! Hard to get seats during peak meal times so go before noon or after 1 p.m.(3) SF Movie theatre on the 6th fl - Wednesday is movie day and tickets for non 3-D movies are only Baht 80 each.

Very nice new mall with convenient access to MRT and Sky Train. I enjoyed walking through this brand new mall located on the busy intersection of Sukhumvit and Asoke. The food court is excellent and there are several other great restaurants sprinkled throughout the top two floors including MOS Burger, Coco Curry, MK Restaurant and Mo Mo Paradise. The long express escalator is so cool and gives you a great view of everything going on in this mall. What a fantastic design.

Unique Concept for a Shopping Centre. This is a new shopping centre - conveniently situated just outside of BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit stations. It is unique as every floor is decorated according to the country it represents e.g. London, Tokyo, Istanbul, Japan, San Francisco. The shops, pillars, wall decorations, toilets and even the cleaning crew are all dressed according to the country for that level. My family had a fun and enjoyable time exploring the shopping centre. Will definitely re-visit the next time we are in Bangkok!

Not your usual mall. Just when you thought the last thing Bangkok needed was yet another mall, Terminal 1 opened and to my great surprise it wasn't just another copy of the regular malls.Every floor has a theme and the mall is conceived like an airport terminal. Lots of nice little shops and restaurants. The big chains and other usual suspects a la MK seem rather absent or at least not as in-your-face a in every other shopping centre.It's easy to wander around for a few hours, buy some clothes or gifts and have a nice meal in one of the many restaurants.Easy access from the Asoke BTS Skytrain station and MRT subway.

Just what was needed afterall!. Nobody would have thought this area of Bangkok needed another shopping mall. we all were wrong. well worth a visit, or a few visits. they really put some thought into the place trying to make it not just another shopping mall.

Just opened. This mall just opened 2 months ago and therefore is very busy this christmas season. Each floor has its own "theme" like Istanbul, Hollywood, Paris, etc... The restaurants are good prices and tasty. The movie theater is huge. The metro and the sky train service the mall. It's good to explore of you're in the area.

Eye Wonder at every floor!. We dropped by Terminal 21 on our back to our hotel and was surprised that this new shopping complex has alot to offer in terms of shopping. It is designed to look like an airport terminal and each floor offers a concept of famous cities, e.g. the first and second floors resemble Rome and Paris that offer international brands but the what makes it stand out compared to other shopping complexes are the floors further up (i.e London, Tokyo themed) as these floors offer local budding designer works from T-shirts, shoes and accesories. There are some shops selling pre-loved stuffs too. The reason I love the shops here is that the stuffs are being sold here are home grown and better quality (at least to the ones is MBK and Platinum) and reasonable priced too. Further up one floor (San Francisco) are restaurants, local and international.As the previous advisor mentioned, do make a trip to the toilets on each floor as it is designed according to the theme. I only managed to visit the toilets with Crabs-on-net (on San Francisco floor) and Tube Station based toilets (on London floor). Not your typical shopping mall, I truly enjoyed the shopping and also the design of this mall so much so, I made my second visit on my 5-days trip to Bangkok. It is not at the Siam Paragon-Central World vicinity, but this mall is definitely worth a visit. Stop at BTS Asoke and look for the sign Terminal 21 and you charmed by this mall!

Newest Shopping Mall in Bangkok. It is located in Asoke, junction between Sukhumvit Rd and Ratchadaphisek Rd. Accessible comfortably by bridge direct from Asoke BTS station. Designed with Airport theme, you'll be arrive in Departure Hall airport like lobby, complete with flight time table signboard. They give you different theme for every floors, eg San Fransisco, London, Tokyo, Rome etc etc. Our favorite so far is London with its Double Decker red bus and Tokyo with it's giant sumo wrestler figurine and Tori, japanese red gates and Lampions everywhere. Oh don't forget to check out toilets in every floors since it's designed following the floor theme accordingly and could be cute in executions.A nice design touch to differ in a tight shopping malls competition around Bangkok :)

Fantastic. We visited this new shopping centre with no pre concieved ideas on what to expect & all i can say is it is amazing!!From the lower ground floor which is mainly the food court to the 7th floor which is the entertainment floor (movie theater etc) we constantly had our mouths open in awe, the staff that work in here are friendly & helpfull at ALL times, in total we went here approx 10 times in 6 days!!!Theres plenty to do & lots to see, highly recomend the "Tutt" shop, amazing gifts for everybody.
